0.description: This was the pawn shop in The Blues Brothers where Jake & Elwood met Ray Charlesbluesbrotherscentral.com…

28.description: I'm greatful that this shop is within walking distance of my office. I normally eat the 1/2 of sandwich and cup of soup. The price can't be beat.They always have 3-4 soups to choose from and they are fresh, hot, and hearty. When I'm watching my wieght I will have a salad because I get the toppings I like and I can switch it up. Lately I have become a fan of their brownies.Call ahead because they do get busy.

1.description: I went in at noon and was politely served. I had the 8oz  shrimp and corn chowder soup. The soup was favorable, not a lot of shrimp but that's cool because it was good. I will definitely return to try something else on the menu..

9.description: This place has great soups!! The sandwiches are good as well!! However the lemonades are awesome a little extra sweet though!! I recommend this place!! I would have given 5 stars but the brown skinned lady who works behind the counter is rude rude rude. I think she is the owner too. I have always seen how she never smiles. Heck she just isn't that pleasant. The short dark skinned women is always very nice. I only ordered a large lemonade and the owner took FOREVER to make my beverage. The short dark skinned women was going to make it but she told her to do something else. The owner took a phone order, started wiping down  the area around the lemonade container and went in the back to do something. I understand she has things to do but it only takes 2 mins to put lemonade in a cup. Fixing a customers extremely small order should be priority!! Especially when she stopped the other lady from making my lemonade! She took sooooo long the short dark skinned women noticed and made it for me. It seemed like she was trying to make me wait on purpose. I just had to rant!! Alas, great soup, good sandwiches and Excellent lemonades!!

29.description: I enjoy their Ham & Swiss Panini.  There is always a lot of meat and the food is fresh.

23.description: I love this place!  You get to design your own sandwiches and salads.  They have a wide variety of ingredients and they are always fresh.  It's a great healthy alternative.

5.description: I seen some previous reviews regarding the restaurant and some weren't good. I'm glad I went to see for myself instead  I liked the build your own salads idea and the offer sandwiches and wraps as well.  I personally purchased a corn beef sandwich with a side of tomato bisque soup. All of it was great! A good size sandwich and it also came with a pickle and chips.  I will definitely l be returning there soon.

25.description: I recently moved to the Bronzeville neighborhood and was really excited when I saw SImply Soup and Salad restaurant.I decided that I would support this new business and try to leave my house a little earlier for coffee before work. I felt guilty going to Starbucks, McDonalds or Cafe Bacci downtown when I can spend my dollars with a Black owned fledgling business instead.Yesterday, I was under the weather and decided to go to the restaurant for a sandwich and some soup. I walked in the restaurant 15 minutes before closing and gave the server my order. She told me that they turn off the panini press 15 minutes before closing and that the bread would not be toasted.I told her that would be fine and go ahead and prepare the sandwich. Two women were standing behind the counter with her and they were visibly upset when the server agreed to take my order. She turned and asked one of them to make the sandwich and they both looked at each other as if to say "Huh, I know she is not talking to me!".The older lady looked at me in such a mean way, turned around while shaking her head in disgust because my prescence made it inconvenient for her to go home on time. She walked slowly to the kitchen still shaking her head and doing this infront of their children that were in the restaurant.I told the server that I didn't want the sandwich because the lady didn't want to make it. I was so upset I turned and left while the server asked me to wait. I felt like I was asking them for a favor instead of purchasing food from a restaurant. There is never a welcoming feeling when you enter that place. You are not greeted with a smile or assisted with the menu. I would be so happy to serve my customers that i would go all out to make them feel welcomed.I would not recommend this place for lunch because you are made to feel like an outsider. The customer service is poor and I would be surprised if they were around in five years. I told other people about my experience and they vowed not to give them a chance. All hope is not lost because their are other great establishments in the area that are friendly. I guess I will be going to McDonalds on Cottage Grove for my coffee in the morning instead of this dreary place.

12.description: I love the food! They just close sooo early... I never get a chance to order for dinner!

21.description: As much as I am in the area, I had yet to try out Simply Soups until Friday 4/26. I went in around 1:30 and there were a few people already inside dining and a few waiting in line. The menu here is not expansive, but its more about the options you have for building your own sandwich or salad. I got a lunch combo (there are 3 choices) of 1/2 sandwich and cup of soup for $5.50. The soup was AMAZING, chicken and poblano (spicy but not too spicy).  I was also impressed at the choices for salad and sandwich toppings. I got basil pesto on a turkey sandwich. YUM! I will be back, especially since the place is up the street from my office. Next time, I will remember to take pics before I devour the food. Also, considering that I was very overwhelmed by what to order, I looked around and asked some of the patrons what they liked. Many of them take advantage of the "build your own" option, but the owner recommended the soup that is GREAT! She said it was one of her top sellers.That same afternoon, I came back in for a pomegranate lemonade, and that too was great. Simply Soups has a fan in me!!

16.description: Awesome place to enjoy salad made to order with your choice of toppings. All the soups ive had are great i really like the poblano pepper.  The last time i was there i had great conversation while waiting for my food.

17.description: I really, really want to support this place of business but they cannot seem to get my order right. I've ordered salads on numerous occasions and have been disappointed to have an incomplete order with some of the ingredients missing. They obviously do not pay attention. I am going to give them one more chance.

10.description: Surprised my niece by bringing her to this awesome sandwich shop!!! Although the ONLY Sandwich I've had is the "Grilled Salmon Panini" (it's really that good = same sandwich on 3 or 4 visits SMH)... YES!!! Everything I've tasted has been Delightfully Delicious.... Soups, Desserts/Cookies, & that juicy Carribean Ice Tea #YUM = All 5

11.description: The best kept secret around here!!!! I have been eating at this place since day one!! The salads are awesome, every sandwich on the menu was satisfying to my taste. The tea is off the chain.....I just love it!!! The best part of it all. You can create you very own!

26.description: I must say the food is GREAT.  From the breakfast turkey sausage sandwich to the delicious soups and salads at lunch, I can't complain. BUT....the OWNER is not friendly or deserving of my money.  I have been there many times and have tried to make conversation but the owner still has a stale attitude.  There are a couple of negative incidents with the OWNER I can recall...1. I didn't realize she had placed guidelines on her debit card machine. Keep in mind I had placed the same order many times before then and was never told anything about a specific amount of money I HAD to spend.  What ever I ordered didn't meet the guidelines. She told me I needed cash. I explained to her I normally don't carry cash. She stares at me like 'so'. I ask her if I can get my food anyway, she says No unless I order something over the allotted guideline. WOW!2. The cafe stops serving breakfast at i think 10am. I walk in at 10am. I am waiting for a couple of people to get done ordering. The OWNER takes my order and I proceed to order a breakfast sandwich. She stops me and explains that it is after 10. I'm looking confused because it's like 2 minutes passed 10am and I have been waiting in line for a couple of minutes. She says again that they do not do breakfast after 10. THEN SHE LET'S ME WALK OUT THE DOOR. 3. I am using my debit card and I give her my out of state ID. She asked if I had an IL ID, I tell her no. She says, well next time you need an IL ID if you want to buy food from here. Just to name a few. I don't think the OWNER should be anything other than happy, bubbly and excited for our business.  A small local business in which a lot of business comes from referrals should not treat their customers this way if they expect to survive.

27.description: I must be slipping in my old age, I thought I had reviewed this place before. I could go on about how friendly they are, how clean the place is, or whatever it is my wife gets there and likes but I can't think of anything other than how damn good their grown-up, adult, or whatever they call it, grilled cheese is. Seriously, mouthwatering, mmmm....I wonder if they're open right now...

0.description: My cousin convinced me to stop and it was more than I expected. I don't like Subway or Jimmy Johns but my Corned beef sandwich was delicious. The bread was slightly buttered and grilled to perfection. My provolone was warm and gooey. The corned beef was cut just right and you can't forget about the pickle.  That just completed the meal.  I also love avocado and I assumed it would be on the side when I ordered it. But it was oh so good how they had it on the sandwich. Didn't like the spinach and feta soup and I didn't eat my turkey chilli.  But I LOVED THE SANDWICH! I will definitely go there again for a tasty n light option

20.description: After hearing such great compliments about this place I decided to try them out... Great salads I was truly impressed. You get any five toppings you want and just 50 cents for each extra ingredient. They have a slew of toppings but no croutons bummer for that. I have been here several times, had breakfast sandwich and they too are very good for the price $2! By all means check them out you won't be disappointed!!!!

19.description: I'm greatful that this shop is within walking distance of my office. I normally eat the 1/2 of sandwich and cup of soup. The price can't be beat.They always have 3-4 soups to choose from and they are fresh, hot, and hearty. When I'm watching my wieght I will have a salad because I get the toppings I like and I can switch it up. Lately I have become a fan of their brownies.Call ahead because they do get busy.

2.description: I stopped going here because of the total rude and ignorant service of the staff. I mentioned my displeasure with the owner over a year ago and after visiting today recognize that nothing has changed. The menu is large and the food is decent but the staff that works there is pretty rude and nasty with customers. Never a friendly smile or even a thank you. I gave them another chance today and had several questions since the menu has changed. The woman with the tattoos covering her arms and body moaned out loud as I asked questions about the menu which is very confusing. She asked me why did I get in line if I wasn't ready to order?? LOL..Sorry to bother you before placing a $20 order. While waiting for my orders, I witnessed  Ms.Tattoo and the older woman in the front eating openly behind the front counter while serving food and touching money in front of customers and the owner. I attempted to discuss with the owner, but she blew me off. Either way, this establishment appears to care little about customer service or sanitation. Decent food but poor management, customer service and fairly pricey.

18.description: Yea for another delicious, healthy, family-friendly and clean restaurant in the area.  I'm so glad I finally took the time to stop in.  The unassuming store front won't likely draw in passers-by who live in the neighborhood, let alone those who aren't from the area.  Oh well.  Thank goodness for Yelp! and the positive reviews.  It's a nice no-frills economical option to spendy Z&H just down the street.

13.description: Me and my wife went here for late lunch after a meeting at the University of Chicago's Hospital. We had a taste for a good salad, so we went to the Yelp App to find a restaurant and we decided on this place. We shared a delicious and tasty bowl on Shrimp & Corn Chowder...gotta try it! My wife had the Salmon Panini but was not as satisfying because of the sauce that soaked thru the bread. But this place redeemed itself with some of the BEST salads we had EVER tasted...hard to beat! They have a great amount of fresh choices of toppings for you to create the best salad at a great price! Young ladies were courteous and one of them had a lovely voice in which she sing so softly. I personally love when ppl sing at work...as long as it is not over bearing...thanks!

4.description: This is the 2nd chance that I give this place and yet again they messed up. I am allergic to onions and specifically asked for NO ONIONS and they put them on my sandwich that I had to throw away because even the onion juice makes me sick! READING IS FUNDAMENTAL especially when you are getting paid to do this!

24.description: I've lived in the neighborhood for five years now and try to spend money in the community. I've been to many of the eateries around here and Simply Soups is one of my favorites. The opportunity to create my own salad is great because I'm a picky eater. The beef chili and the sandwiches are four stars also.  I 've recommended this place to my neighbors and co workers.

6.description: Sitting at #SSaS with my Aunty Char! Just introduced her to my favorite soup and sandwich shop in Chicago, hands down! Love the staff! They know my name, my mom, and now Aunt! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu

22.description: Stopped in for lunch on one of my few off days and it was well worth it had the turkey club and some chicken dumpling soup both were very good and the sandwich was huge too much for one sitting saved half for my lady....oh yes it scored me some points..lol

15.description: Awesome place to eat lunch! I had the Loaded Baked Potato soup with an Italian Panini. They gave us samples of their soup and drinks that were also delicious. Ask to try the suicide drink which they combine a couple of their teas. They were friendly and fast! Hope to get back here fast!

7.description: First time indulger the best soup and sandwich ever the soup was to die for had the tortilla soup delicious had a turkey panini with romaine lettuce sun dried tomatoes onion avocado mmmmm mmmmmmmm the sandwich was toasted perfectly with the garlic butter my only concern was it need more of those creamy avocados pure deliciousness can't wait to try again A+

8.description: If you want a good salad that you can pick your own toppings for that you don't mind paying between $8-10 for depending on what all you get, then this place is worth trying! ! The salad was phenomenal!! The ingredients were fresh, and they give you a nice quantity of them (they're not skimpy on the ingredients). And the chicken breast is even seasoned, it's not bland! Plus the hot bacon vinegarette dressing is ridiculous! ! Has real bacon pieces in it! I don't like to spend a lot on salads, but from time to time this one will definitely be worth it. Oh FYI I did wait about 20 minutes for it, however if you call the order in you may not have as long of a wait.

30.description: Great place right near the school in which I teach.  Everything is so, so fresh.  You have the option of choosing off their menu or creating your own deli sandwich or panini.  Their soups are truly good, and its clean and friendly inside.

3.description: Ordered from this place yesterday & today. Yesterday they messed up my delivery order THREE times but as a result, I got two free meals. I had a chicken panini with pesto & cheddar cheese. & A 2010 Club. & As a result of their error, I also had the pleasure of trying the Big Boss. Their food is AMAZING & a great price.

14.description: After hearing such great compliments about this place I decided to try them out... Great salads I was truly impressed. You get any five toppings you want and just 50 cents for each extra ingredient. They have a slew of toppings but no croutons bummer for that. I have been here several times, had breakfast sandwich and they too are very good for the price $2! By all means check them out you won't be disappointed!!!!

3.description: I just received a lovely arrangement from these guys courtesy of my boyfriend.  Generally speaking, that is enough of a good thing to post a review here on Yelp.  What makes these guys particularly spectacular is their customer service.   I had a question about the ferns that came with my flowers and they gave me the best answer!!  I am so thankful for my lovely irises and their customer service!

1.description: I was referred to this flower shop by a friend to order flowers for a funeral. I was told to speak with June; however June was not there when I arrived. I was assisted by Russell who discussed prices and allowed me to review books of arrangements. I placed my order and was guaranteed I would have my arrangements on my desired date which was 3 days away. Later in the day I received a call from June who reviewed my order and pricing. The next day my family decided they needed flowers for the wake which was a day away and June provided flower arrangement for it and delivered them to my home. The arrangements were also delivered to my church the morning of the funeral. I had the best experience from this flower shop during a difficult time. They can work with any kind of budget and also assist you if you are unsure of what you want. This will forever be my go to flower shop. Thank you June & Russell!

2.description: Thank you Blossoms of Hawaii for saving my butt!I was working in the area and was trying to think of a good place to buy flowers for my one month wedding anniversary to cheer my wife up on such a gloomy day...well after visiting Hawaii for our honeymoon I was delighted to find this place near the loop that had Hawaiian flowers!They set me up with a nice bouquet of flowers for $25 bucks including some Hawaiian flowers! The wife loved them!Friendly staff too!

0.description: So amazed that I found Russell at the last minute. I am getting married today and I reached out to him yesterday in regards to my bouquet. The arrangement is very nice and compliments are wedding colors greatly. So excited for my day. Thank you again for everything.

56.description: Love the paninis and the garbage salad with poppyseed dressing!!!!

29.description: Delicious sandwiches, smoothies and shakes! Also very nice people who own the place and work there. Would definitely go back!

42.description: Great food. They have so much to choose from. The smoothies are good too. I introduced some friend of mine to this place and they are still going here. The service is excellent. Everyone is friendly and nice.

23.description: Had da Steve it was great 30MIN WAIT I wish they had two lines one for call-in an one to place order. They need to hire a little more help the order taker has to many jobs answering the phone,filling order,filling water jug in lobby cleaning tables. JUST TOOOOO MUCH.

47.description: the food here is wonderful!  It is locally owned and operated - what could be better?! The staff are helpful and they have a great menu.Bethany H

8.description: I made my first visit this afternoon. I'm very impressed! I experienced great hospitality and the food was even better! I'll be returning to support this business quite frequently.

31.description: Came in on a Saturday afternoon and ordered the Jerk Chicken Wrap on Tomato Basil Wrap, after initially being unable to decide from a surprisingly broad menu of items. I also ordered a "mixer", which is basically a blended smoothie with fruit juice & raspberry sorbet. Everything comes out fresh and well-prepared; the entire meal was delicious. The ambience is cool and definitely feels like a local, neighborhood spot--which is a big reason why you would come here. Dine-in service was good and prompt. A jewel in the Bronzeville community. My lone tip for the owner: expand your business hours. Hard to believe this place opens late at 10a each day (11a on Saturdays) and closes very early at 6p! This makes it difficult for many who work in the city (like myself) to make it here during the week as a take-out dinner option.

34.description: Awesome fresh sandwiches, The Steve (sandwich) hits the spot every time. I love the Tomato spinach bisque. Good customer service.The restroom is sparking clean.

16.description: I'm so glad I found Ain't She Sweet Cafe! I am pregnant, and my baby was not in the mood for anything from my usual Bronzeville lunch spots. I jumped on yelp and found Ain't She Sweet. This place is fantastic. They have a wide selection of sandwiches, wraps, soups, and baked goods. The woman in front of me ordered a smoothie which sounded fabulous. I ordered the Jerk Chicken Wrap which I believe is one of their top sellers. I asked the woman behind the counter for an estimated wait time, and she informed me that everything was 5 minutes. Even though it was just before noon, the short weight time was accurate. I just inhaled my wrap, and my baby is very  happy. The ingredients were super fresh, flavorful, and I didn't feel guilty or feel like I was about to slip into a food coma. The interior is lovely. Cafe style tables and chairs. Tasteful wall art, and a television. Cucumber water while you wait was a nice touch. As I leaving, I was chatting with one of the workers.I told her I worked up the street at Phillips High School, and she informed me that on Mondays educators get $2 off sandwiches. Hooray! Another reason to return.

13.description: This review is based on takeout. I always order the jerk chicken wrap on spinach. My God it kept me coming back for more. Delicious.

11.description: This is a great little place to eat located in Bronzeville! The food is GREAT...the jerk Chicken Wrap is my absolute favorite! They have smoothies, ice cream, salads, sandwiches, you name it!

39.description: Ok. So I gave this place another try, and boy am I glad I did!Their jerk wrap is bangin'!! Really, it's really that good.My only complaint. The cooks seems to yell from their stations asking what you would like to order, and I was not sure about the different varieties of bread you could receive with your wrap, so when the cook asked me "What were you having?", I said " I would like the jerk wrap," and she's like "And on what?". Ok..First you never assume a customer has been here before, and I also think that orders should just be left for the cashier to handle.But other than that I have been back numerous of times for that jerk wrap!

37.description: My sister brung home a chicken salad sandwich on a croissant ! Oooh Wee, Delicious, A defiant must try!

0.description: Jamaican jerk chicken with coconut rice bowl is out of this world. Staff is all SUPER friendly and loving - it feels like walking into your family's kitchen/living room. By far my favorite lunch spot in the area.

38.description: This place is a sweet gem on the South Side. Free parking is readily available right out front. I love that they have a lot of turkey options. The staff was really nice and the food was amazing!! I recommend calling ahead to place your order. It cuts down on the wait time, although I still stood in the long line before I could pay for my food--A bit of an inconvenience as I was in a hurry. I haven't dined in yet. It seems most people grab and go. The tables are always full because of the amount of people waiting. (Again, call ahead). The fruit smoothies are a must try!

51.description: Fresh and delicious!!! Every time I go I get the jerk chicken wrap and tomato bisque soup it's So scrumptious . I really want to try something else but it's difficult to deviate from a sandwich that's SO tasty!!

27.description: This is a very small but quaint restaurant. Food is very good. The people are very friendly. it has the feel of going into a family member's home for lunch. African artwork is throughout the entire restaurant. I love the decor. It is definitely a place in Bronzeville that you should have lunch.

32.description: August 10 2013 - post the Bud Billken Parade!- Da Steve is what I ordered.  It was good.- $:  7.60 + .72 tax = $8.32

54.description: I can't get enough if this place. Such a little jewel in the bronzeville neighborhood. Fresh ingredients and very high quality. My favorite is the chicken Caesar salad, Da Steve sandwich...and the oh so delicious tomato and spinach bisque soup. I swear if they sold that soup in bulk...I would buy it all! The only downside is the place is very pricey for the amount you get. I almost feel like the owner continues to increase her prices.

48.description: Great Bronzeville neighborhood restaurant. This is my 2nd visit here and each time the for was quite enjoyable. Had the Fiesta Salad this time and the strawberries, pineapples, and blueberries were quite fresh but they did forget to put the glazed walnuts in the salad. This is not a sit down restaurant but be prepared to wait for your food. The menu basically consists of sandwiches, wraps, salads, and smoothies. The price is very fair for the quality of the food received.

24.description: Good and fast for sandwiches! I got the jerk chicken and it was tasty and a bit spicy. Also they make delicious smoothies. Their sandwiches range between $7-$10. The smoothies are $3.95 for small and $4-something for large.It is a small cafe inside with a TV and friendly workers.

7.description: This place is a sweet gem on the South Side. Free parking is readily available right out front. I love that they have a lot of turkey options. The staff was really nice and the food was amazing!! I recommend calling ahead to place your order. It cuts down on the wait time, although I still stood in the long line before I could pay for my food--A bit of an inconvenience as I was in a hurry. I haven't dined in yet. It seems most people grab and go. The tables are always full because of the amount of people waiting. (Again, call ahead). The fruit smoothies are a must try!

49.description: Delicious tomato basil soup and jerk chicken! Very cute place glad I recently discovered it!

40.description: Wow.  Service was great and polite. But the food was that much better. I order the jerk chicken salad sandwich and it was DELICIOUS!!!  The jerk had the just right seasoning/spice and the chicken was juice. I would definitely come back next time I'm in Chicago, just for this sandwich

53.description: The food is really good. Came here on a Saturday looking to try it out. My girlfriend recommended the jerk chicken wrap since I was in the mood for jerk chicken. Her recommendation was correct. The wrap was very delicious. I can definitely say that I'll be back. It was so good that I had to get one to go. I do wish the prices were a little cheaper but I don't mind paying for good food.

30.description: Came in on Thanksgiving looking for an apple pie. The older woman behind the counter (maybe the owner)  said she had no apple pie and tried to sell me a huge chocolate cake instead. When I declined on her cake she tried to sell me everything else and was pretty pushy. I felt a bit pressured to buy so I told her I'll take some cupcakes but only needed 3 and these were not your average size cupcakes. She then said she can only sell them by the dozen and I declined. Finally, I told her that I'd take the chocolate cake. When I handed her my credit card she ran it but I forgot my PIN number so I told her I needed to go back to my car and get another debit card. When I returned to my car my husband was impatiently pissed and said we didn't need a cake and to forget the purchase, so we left. The following day as I was checking my bank acct I realized that bitch charged me and kept her cake. I called my bank to dispute the charge and had them handle her. I live in the neighborhood and unfortunately will have to take my business somewhere else. I'm giving one star only because this is the only bakery in  the hood.

46.description: My favorites are: jerk chicken wrap, muscle-up smoothie and the soups. It's just down the street from my job. When I want to treat myself (or just because), this is my spot. Enjoy!

1.description: Ain't She Sweet is one of my favorite spots for lunch! I went her today for the Jerk Chicken Bowl and I was not disappointed. My favorite part about this little cafe is the fact that they serve desserts and have WIFI. This is definitely a place for you to check out! Of course, the food can take a bit so please don't go if you don't have a lot of time. Good for: Lunch Meetings, Chicken/Fish Lovers  Follow Me: @pattydrive on Twitter/Instagram/Snapchat/Facebook

55.description: Biked down the lakefront and needed something for lunch before we headed back up to Lincoln Park. Absolutely loved the woman that served us. I actually managed to spill my cucumber water within minutes of sitting down and they came over to help clean up without even the slightest fuss. This place isn't fancy, but yes they had cucumbers in the free water cooler :)Best panini ever. I would definitely go again.

9.description: First i want to start by saying hello to Margo, who is the owner of this restaurant and a very highly intelligent WOMAN- who was also once my physical therapist a few years back. Now about the restaurant that is Awesome and in a good location to park, i ordered the Chicken Caesar Salad that is really good the atmosphere was was cozy & comfortable, and OMGOODNESS the cucumber water is sooooo delicious - YUMMY!! I recommend this restaurant because the food is good, the staff is polite, professional, and friendly. Oh and the wall decor is GREAT!!!  Sororities & Fraternities lets Support this Restaurant for all REASONS- SGRHO signing off; Love u Margo, keep up the good work and thanks for a caring, helpful staff because nowadays that's becoming hard to find. My first time there but it definitely will not be my last- next time the jerk wrap.

26.description: Met a group here for Slow Roll Chicago and decided to grab something to eat before the ride.The jerk chicken wrap was awesome and the staff was very friendly.I can't recommend this place enough and I will definitely be returning.

25.description: I'm so glad I found Ain't She Sweet Cafe! I am pregnant, and my baby was not in the mood for anything from my usual Bronzeville lunch spots. I jumped on yelp and found Ain't She Sweet. This place is fantastic. They have a wide selection of sandwiches, wraps, soups, and baked goods. The woman in front of me ordered a smoothie which sounded fabulous. I ordered the Jerk Chicken Wrap which I believe is one of their top sellers. I asked the woman behind the counter for an estimated wait time, and she informed me that everything was 5 minutes. Even though it was just before noon, the short weight time was accurate. I just inhaled my wrap, and my baby is very  happy. The ingredients were super fresh, flavorful, and I didn't feel guilty or feel like I was about to slip into a food coma. The interior is lovely. Cafe style tables and chairs. Tasteful wall art, and a television. Cucumber water while you wait was a nice touch. As I leaving, I was chatting with one of the workers.I told her I worked up the street at Phillips High School, and she informed me that on Mondays educators get $2 off sandwiches. Hooray! Another reason to return.

12.description: Having just moved to Chicago, This is my first review!!!Seems to be a local fav. Went during lunch hour on a Thursday and even with the city road work right outside along the whole storefront's street, it was bustling and the line grew quite quickly (glad i got there sooner rather than later).favorite seems to be the Jerk chicken in many forms (sandwiches, wraps, salads, etc). Theres a case of desserts too (Brownies and sweet potato pie/cake), and I also saw soups of the day on menu. The Tomato Basil was delicious! Brownies were decadent, almost as if it was fudge in the middle (def not the bread kind!).There's Wi-Fi, but too bad it wasnt clear if there was parking, there's a grassy area next to the store, but it was filled with cars and if you get stuck behind another car you coudlnt get out. Best to park in the neighborhood streets behind the store, esp with the construction. FYI - no coffee on menu i think.

59.description: I had a free Belly Bite for this cute little cafe and decided to give it a try.I got the Veggie Delight sandwich but as a spinach wrap instead. Service was fast and friendly and the wrap was yummy! This is a cute little place with tons of free street parking right in front of the cafe.  Adorable inside as well and tons of seating!

21.description: Buffalo chicken wrap and snapple for $10. The wrap was really good and was a perfect level of lunch-spicy.

17.description: Nice little mom and pop shop that is pretty hidden if you don't know what you are looking for. Pretty standard cafe with sandwiches, wraps, and salads, but everything is pretty well done. I have had a couple of the wraps such as the Chipotle Chicken and the Caribbean Jerk which were moist. The soup (tomato basil spinach bisque) was better than expected as well. Probably would have gave this place a solid four stars if they weren't so slow. Not sure if it's an issue with workflow or me coming in at the wrong times, but I have waited between 30-45 minutes for my food each time.

10.description: One of my girlfriends took me here for lunch and I've made it my new go-to spot as a result.  The Jamaican Jerk Chicken Wrap, Tomato Basil Bisque and the Jerk Chicken Bowl are slammin'!  I love the freshness of the veggies and the savory flavor of the food.  Glad to see places like this in the community.  It's a true gem.

5.description: I just tried this place this morning, I've passed by it before and finally decided to try it. This is a great hidden gem in a neighborhood that could use more cafes and other businesses in the area I hope more things come around! It's really nice on the inside too. I got a Jerk Chicken wrap and a Tropical Breeze smoothie, they were delicious! And all for $11 I will definitely be coming back here again!

3.description: YES SHE IS!!!!... I was VERY pleased!! I've been there TWICE. BOTH times I had a Sweet Dreams smoothie made from Orange Sherbert & Vanilla Ice Cream. OH YESSS!!!... I also had a Jerk Chicken Wrap...Very delicious and light!!!... I also had "da Steve" that was SOOO yummy....  a slice of Sweet Potato Pound Cake, and a slice of Sweet Potato Pie....('scuse me for a moment of silence...) OK, I'm back.  BOTH were THAT good!!!! OMG!!! It's not often that I hand out 5 stars...and I still won't. NOT because of anything THEY did. They can't help that they have lines!!!... I mean the food IS ...GREAT...Maybe, I'll call in my order in the future. Other than that..... YES!!!!

35.description: I loooove the jerk chicken wrap so that alone gets 5 stars from me! It is also a treat to have such a great cafe in Bronzeville. Sometimes the service leaves something to be desired...you don't always get a warm greeting and the one time I tried to call ahead I was on hold for 8 minutes before giving up. Despite the sometimes lack of friendly service I didn't knock them down a star because the food is that good and the prices are reasonable.

19.description: Had the buffalo chicken rap it was tasty and spicy at the same time. Chicken was tender veggies were fresh. Place is nice and chill yet can handle it's crowd. Let it be known the Carmel Cake which they have made is AMAZING!! I will be back!!!

28.description: The best jerk wrap i have ever had!! I loved my pina colada smoothie as well, i will be back!!! Forever

45.description: My visit was at 5:20pm in 8/13/14I try my best to support black businesses, but I will NOT be returning here again. On the evening that I came here to eat and grab something really fast. I was disappointed to encounter a woman by the name of Robin who was terribly rude to me and I had to remind her of customer service. Robin stated Customer Service, I am giving you Customer Service. My experience at "Ain't She Sweet" wasn't so sweet, so I won't be coming back and I'll be supporting another business who'll treat me right - the first time.Only positive thing I can add is my food was prepared quick, but my food was wrong. I didn't want to encounter Robin again so I didn't comeback in.. Shrug... Lost one...

33.description: This is great place for lunch. The food is very good and consistently fresh. The staff is generally friendly and the atmosphere is pleasant. I would advise the owners to improve the ventilation. I went to pick-up lunch and smell like I have been working an 8 hour shift in the kitchen. In addition, they could be a bit more friendly to customers. They are not rude, per se, but not overly friendly.Update: I come here like once per week for lunch. The owner "Margo" is very unfriendly....that takes this place down notch.

43.description: I like the food here that is what keeps me coming back but the customer service needs some work. I stood at the register waiting for someone to take my order while she was on the phone. I think it was the owner or manager. Customers come first in my opinion...she should have had them hold on...IJS

2.description: The jerk chicken wrap is the best thing on the menu.  A few of my friends are always satisfied when they order "The Steve".I would definitely try to figure out why the lines are so long.  The ordering process can be upwards of 25 minutes.  This isn't good especially for people that have 30 min or even an hour lunch break.Overall, its a nice mom & pop shop.  People are generally nice if you catch them on a good day.  Let me be clear that they are't "RUDE" but they aren't that nice either.  You have to really lay on the charm for them sometimes to be met with a smile.I also think the prices are a little too high considering the area and what is being offered.  I normally pay a similar price at Jason's Deli for a better overall dining experience.I also don't like that they are closed on Sundays!  Huge bummer.

18.description: Met a group here for Slow Roll Chicago and decided to grab something to eat before the ride.The jerk chicken wrap was awesome and the staff was very friendly.I can't recommend this place enough and I will definitely be returning.

41.description: Nice little mom and pop shop that is pretty hidden if you don't know what you are looking for. Pretty standard cafe with sandwiches, wraps, and salads, but everything is pretty well done. I have had a couple of the wraps such as the Chipotle Chicken and the Caribbean Jerk which were moist. The soup (tomato basil spinach bisque) was better than expected as well. Probably would have gave this place a solid four stars if they weren't so slow. Not sure if it's an issue with workflow or me coming in at the wrong times, but I have waited between 30-45 minutes for my food each time.

52.description: Best soup & sandwiches in bronzville! So many healthy choices on the menu! I would recommend the tomato & spinach bisque soup & jerk chicken wrap on spinach! I also love the fact they server cucumber water everyday!

50.description: We went here today for lunch.  This was a recommendation from Facebook.First impressions are always best.  This is  a really cool spot that is very cozy. The decor was eclectic and hip.  Actually a very relaxed atmosphere.   We were greeted with a smiles.  The menu had a variety of options. From sandwiches, wraps, soups, and smoothies.  I picked the Caribbean Jerk Chicken Spinach wrap.  We sat and within a very short time.  Our wraps were out. Presentation was on point. The wrap was nice and hot.  The flavor had my tongue dancing. I'm a huge fan of spices. We were so very pleased with ambiance, service and the food.  We also had a chance to meet & chat with the owner (Margo).Extremely nice and friendly.  I noticed she greeted everyone and had small talk with them.  A very special touch.   Then a small piece of Carmel Cake was calling me. Very lite & moist. This foodie was indeed satisfied!Looking forward to the next time!

4.description: What a gem. Ain't She Sweet is nestled right in the heart of Bronzeville on a super small strip of businesses on 43rd. I was staying right around the corner and my host told me that if I needed a quick and relatively inexpensive bite, I should go there to grab a wrap. I wanted to do my research on the place before I forked out the cash and 90% of the reviews are either good or great so I had to try the place. According to most reviews, the Caribbean jerk is the meal to get so that is what I did.Along with the Caribbean jerk wrap (with the spinach tortilla) I received a bag of Lays, and I ordered a slice of the lemon pound cake. The wrap was light, fresh, made to order, and full of flavor. The jerk sauce gave the wrap a nice kick but the cheese softened most of that spice almost instantly. The onions and tomatoes were perfect sized pieces.The pound cake was somewhat of a let down. It tasted very old, and the texture was nowhere near the density of a pound cake. For that, I deduct 1 star.What I loved is that all of the workers and the owner(s) , are black.

6.description: Good and fast for sandwiches! I got the jerk chicken and it was tasty and a bit spicy. Also they make delicious smoothies. Their sandwiches range between $7-$10. The smoothies are $3.95 for small and $4-something for large.It is a small cafe inside with a TV and friendly workers.

22.description: No coffee here but it's right next door. The best cupcake I ever had (coconut) a small gem is correct. Everything had been said the shit is good.

15.description: What a hidden gem. This establishment offers smoothies, wraps, salads, subs, and so on. The smoothie was by far on of my favorites. I order the tropical breeze which was refreshing on this hot summer day. I will be returning to this cafe in the near future. The service was fast. Although I would recommend caloric data next to the menu items.

57.description: I had a free Belly Bite for this cafe and decided to give it a try. I like what I had so I came back  to tried multiple things. I had the Jerk Chicken wrap which was Great! I also had the tomato soup. it's a nice place where you can enjoyed it by yourself or with someone.

20.description: What a gem. Ain't She Sweet is nestled right in the heart of Bronzeville on a super small strip of businesses on 43rd. I was staying right around the corner and my host told me that if I needed a quick and relatively inexpensive bite, I should go there to grab a wrap. I wanted to do my research on the place before I forked out the cash and 90% of the reviews are either good or great so I had to try the place. According to most reviews, the Caribbean jerk is the meal to get so that is what I did.Along with the Caribbean jerk wrap (with the spinach tortilla) I received a bag of Lays, and I ordered a slice of the lemon pound cake. The wrap was light, fresh, made to order, and full of flavor. The jerk sauce gave the wrap a nice kick but the cheese softened most of that spice almost instantly. The onions and tomatoes were perfect sized pieces.The pound cake was somewhat of a let down. It tasted very old, and the texture was nowhere near the density of a pound cake. For that, I deduct 1 star.What I loved is that all of the workers and the owner(s) , are black.

36.description: Nice neighborhood cafe. The owner is usually in house. Tasty sandwiches with their own trademark. She has lots of turkey options(ham, bacon, etc). She also has a vegetarian sandwich and salads. The salads remind me of old fashioned diner style salads. Complimentary cucumber water while you wait.The décor is that of local artists whose work is for sale. There are several tables for seating if you plan to eat in.

14.description: My family is consistently very happy with this cafe. The shakes are all delicious (and run the gamut from healthy to very indulgent), and all of the many sweet potato desserts are great too. Most dishes have meat in them, but the vegetable panini is a good vegetarian option. Service is prompt and good, and when we go, there's always somewhere to sit.

1.description: She NEVER called me back either. Zero stars. Business ethics like she's still in Africa.  In America we expect some professionalism.  I did however make an appt at Clems hair braiding in Uptown for myself and daughter the next day. This is my usual go to shop for any braid style.  We are very pleased as always with the outcome.  The only reason why I wanted to try Eva was bc of the location- within walking distance from my place & she had good reviews. In my neighborhood or not she will NEVER get any of my money.  Very BAD business for a new customer.

9.description: So I've been getting braids for over 10 years from different areas (FL, VA, NY, ...). I know the ins and outs of braidings, surprise charges, and anything you can think of.  Since I'm new to the area I tried Eva out because of the good reviews on yelp. Here are brief reasons of all the things that went wrong (this is really brief there is more detail to it) :1. She canceled my appointment that I made 5 days in advance the day before. And she did not call me to tell me. I called her to confirm. She agreed I was still good for Sunday. She called me back later and said can I change for next week. So I had to were my hair out for a week. 2. She quoted me $180 for small individual braids that reach the bra strap. I was very specific with her about what I wanted because I hate surprise charges when you get there. Sure enough that's what happened.The lady said it was $200 and up for what I wanted. I told her no Eva said $180 and never have I paid more than $180 for them. I called Eva and she did not answer. To avoid the hassle, I agreed to the 200. 3. They did not have the  hair color I wanted. I asked Eva what type of hair she uses and if she had the color I wanted. If she didn't have it, it wouldn't have been a problem I would have just bought my own. She didn't know what type of hair she used but was sure she had plenty of dark brown. I get there they only had black and light brown. They lady says they never order dark brown. 4. The braids were not done correctly. the lady doing the back of my hair kept doing it wrong. She was making them big. so the braid would start off fat and then skinny on down. Also, she started the braid off in plaits, so if you wanted to do a ponytail you couldn't make one. The parts were huge, so they can rush through it. 5. They kept talking about my hair and the whole price situation in their language. since it was of french dialect I understood a lot of it. They also said to do it bigger since I was only paying $200. 6. My scalp was itching for about 2-3 weeks. I have no idea why. 7. They left small pieces of my hair out. In different areas, also. 8. After 4 weeks, my hair is untangling, frizzy at the end, and a mess. I'm trying to make it to six weeks.  Seriously, since the day I got it done I've been keeping it in french braid because it did not look good out. Positives: the place is clean. I WILL NOT GO BACK. NOT WORTH IT. I wanted to keep this review short but that was impossible. Sorry.

23.description: I really really really liked Eva's.With a lot of hair braiding places, it's dirty, they're late, and unprofessional.  I didn't experience ANY of that at Eva's.  Her salon is easy to find, super clean, and set up very professionally.  Above all, she does an excellent job, my braids lasted over 3 months!  Her prices were pretty decent too.  It was average for microbraids (about $200).  You can find some places that are cheaper, but remember that you get what you pay for.  If I have to pay an extra $20 or $40 for a clean professional hair braiding experience, I think it's totally worth it.  You're sitting there for over 8 hours!  You should at least be comfortable.She really does deserve a 5 star review.  She is very sweet, and all that the other reviewers had to say is true.   I'm going to continue going to her as long as I have braids and live in the area.  I've finally found my "place" and that's Eva's.

5.description: I'm convinced that every positive review on here someone has been paid to write for Eva. Or Eva herself wrote it. This is how my experience at Eva's went :I made a call to Eva 7/25/14 to come in for a take down of my braids plus a re-braid. She said she would call me 7/27 to confirm . She did not call I called her the day of my appointment 7/28 to confirm. She asked I come in 30 minutes later than our scheduled appointment. I get to the appointment and we are ready to cute the extensions off of my hair so the un-braiding can begin. She cuts my headphones in the process. Instead of offering to buy me new ones she hands me some black headphones that are not apple quality and do not fit in my ears.  I gave them back . I don't complain I sit back in the chair to finish my appointment The girls working on my hair complains that it is taking too long and begins cutting my hair shorter." HOLD ON?? YOU ARE CUTTING MY REAL HAIR!!" I TELL HER. I tell her multiple times to stop cutting because that is where my real hair is. I even show her AND EVA a pic of my real hair before I got braids. SHE CONTINUES TO CUT ANYWAYS.   Now I have VERY LARGE chunks of hair missing from my natural hair style. DO NOT GO HERE!!!Then after all of my hair has been taken down, Eva tells me " You have to come back tomorrow to finish because you want small braids."........ We made an appointment for me to get them done today? So now I have to waist a whole day back in here tomorrow?OKAY? So I go back the next day. Eva is not there when I arrive. The ladies doing my hair do not do the first braid correctly. They argue with me about the braids I want. I'm paying them. Do not do my hair the way I don't want it. So she redoes the one braid, and then shows it to me. it is the correct width. DO YOU KNOW THAT IS THE ONLY BRAID SHE DID CORRECTLY? ALL THE OTHERS ARE THE SIZE SHE WANTED THEM TO BE.This woman tricked me by doing one braid the size I wanted so I would agree. Needless to say, my hair is not the length, width or style I want it to be. And Eva charged me  $270. I paid her because I know business. Everyone else says I shouldn't of paid her and I should've walked out. This isn't a rant, it is an awareness message for ANYONE wanting professional haircare. Eva is rude and NOT a professional. DO NOT GO HERE. I have to now pay more money for a legitimate shop to take my braids out and give me exactly what I want.

25.description: Eva is WONDERFUL!  I contacted Eva after reading the reviewis on Yelp and she was so nice.  She even let me come by her shop prior to making my appointment so I could discuss styles and hair types.  I was nervous about getting braids again since I have had so many bad experiences, but Eva was very professional, her shop was clean and she was patient.  I was running late on Saturday morning, but Eva understood and she waited. My hair looks great!  Eva picked out the perfect color and she took her time.I'm definitely going back and my search for a braider is over.  Thanks Eva!

12.description: At the risk of  them becoming even more busy by giving Miss Eva and Fatou a rating of excellence...I must. I must tell you how wonderful they are there. Very professional, clean and not a lot of riff-raff hanging around like there is in the typical Uptown/ Broadway St. braiding salons. Without saying too much...and believe me I can go on and on how wonderful Eva's is....if you want your hair to look good, last, and have a wonderful time dis be da place mon!  ...now I hope I can still get in when I need my hair pulled!

21.description: Eva's braids are amazing! I have straight, silky hair, and her braids stayed in for 2 months. Eva is professional, friendly, and was fun to chat with for the 7 hours I was there. She fulfilled my request of not getting extensions and found a solution that would ensure that the braids stayed for a long time, which they did. Her prices are reasonable as well.I would highly recommend getting natural braids at Eva's!

16.description: I've gone to EVA only twice now over the last 2 yrs after finding her on yelp (see profile pic-- these braides were atleast 2 months old here).1st experience: The shop is clean, and the staff is friendly. She listened to what  I wanted and ensured I had a good experience. She engaged me in conversation and allowed me to watch TV. Eva did my braids her self, but it took much longer than I would have liked. She charged me $180 for senegalese braids, and did them long (which I liked at first). After a few weeks I thought there were a little too long for me, and especially heavy on my neck. I knew the next time I went I would get them a "natural" length that will make it easier for washing and general upkeep. Also, she had a credit card machine which made it much more convenient. Positives: neat, meticulous, clean shop, decent pricing, credit card machine, braids lasted for about 5monthsNegatives: took over 7 hrs, braids were too long, I had to curl the ends myself. 2nd experience: Over the phone I was told that the same braids would be $200 now since they do them long, when I asked about adding color, she said she had the color I wanted. Since I didnt want them long, I asked if it would be less, she said yes. Upon getting there, and reminding her about the color, she brought out a auburn color, and not a burgundy red like I initially asked for! I didnt even know what the color was until they started towards the front of my head (my mistake) so I went with it anyway. At the end of the day it turned out nice, but I still wished it was a little darker. This time she also called in someone to help (thank God!) so that was a plus. She asked me the length and i said (like yours) at the time her braids were shoulder length. Not paying any attention, I noticed that they kept adding hair. She also told me the price would still be $200! WHAT! ok so now you are doing them long and I asked for shoulder lenght, and you are still charging me more.. hmmm!When it was all said and done, she curled them this time. Ok cool. when it came time to pay, I handed her my check card. She looked at me like I was crazy and said "we dont take that anymore, you can go to the atm across the street." Umm no, Im not paying a fee to take money out when you never told me you dont take cc until now! so I found an atm from my bank about a mile away and told her I wuold be back. She then asked me if it was ok if her helper would ride with me (ok what so now you think im not coming back, I would have left collateral). Fine! So I go to get the money and came back and gave it to the girl and dropped her off. WHAT AN INCONVENIENCE. Positives: Same service as before but faster, braids lasted about 4 months, clean shop/ bathroom. Negatives: braids were STILL too long. All and all Eva's still provides a great service, you just have to be VERY specific and VERY assuring of what you want and are getting. Suggestions are good, but dont do what you want when the customer did not ask for that! I'll go back, but with clearer and more SPECIFIC specifications next time! :-)

17.description: Eva is WONDERFUL!  I contacted Eva after reading the reviewis on Yelp and she was so nice.  She even let me come by her shop prior to making my appointment so I could discuss styles and hair types.  I was nervous about getting braids again since I have had so many bad experiences, but Eva was very professional, her shop was clean and she was patient.  I was running late on Saturday morning, but Eva understood and she waited. My hair looks great!  Eva picked out the perfect color and she took her time.I'm definitely going back and my search for a braider is over.  Thanks Eva!

10.description: Its taken me a while to write this but  Eva and her Sister and their Cousin and whomever else they have working there to help out are Fabulous!! I took my daughter in for hair braiding because she swims daily at summer camp. These ladies were Super nice and as I waited, I felt very comfortable talking about Life with them. the laughing and chatting along with their super fast hands helped the time pass by. They were all very professional. Their salon area was a decent size and it wasn't overcrowded. I can only imagine the cramping their fingers must have at the end of the day and it appears that some people forget to Tip.. Come on.. Tip someone who's giving you a great deal and great service. I will return ... I think I spent about $160.. but $175 for a tip  . total

11.description: The first time I went here to refresh a few of my Senegalese Twists was fine, I thought Eva was nice and that the price was fair and that she did a decent job. So I made an apt to see Eva again to refresh the front and back twists and it was weird from the get go. She said I was early even though I was only five minutes early and she left and said shed be back because she needed to buy some hair. Ok. She didnt come back quickly and instead a coworker came and said Eva told her to come see me, this was about twenty five minutes after my scheduled appt. I was hesitant because I only knew Eva was good, which was why I made an appt to see her, but let her coworker proceed to just make things easier. The woman seemed nice but took all the twists out that she was redoing at once which meant she would have no way of comparing the size of the originals with the new ones. When Eva finally came back she first ate dinner and then joined in (but left after maybe an hour and let the other woman finish the job). I wasnt uncomfortable as they were twisting and wasnt sitting in front of a mirror so I just trusted that they were doing a good job. It also took long enough for me to assume that they werent skimping and making the twists bigger than the originals to save time. Boy was I wrong! When they were finally done and I Iooked in the mirror I saw the new twists were noticeably bigger than the old. Awesome. I was told that this was done so that my natural hair wouldnt come undone like had been happening with the old twists. Since there was nothing I could do but try to make more of the hair match I asked if I could come back and have them touch up more for a better look. I was told thatd be fine but when I called I never got a call back. Funny thing is the twists they just did are already unraveling and I also now have tiny white bumps around the front of my scalp. This is why I never leave a review after going somewhere only once or twice, especially a hair salon. You never know what youre getting until youve experienced consistency, and clearly this isnt the place for that.

26.description: I went to Eva about a month ago to fix the ends of a bob that I had done two weeks earlier by someone else. Eva was absolutely amazing!! She was very, very meticulous and my hair came out looking completely different. It looked professionally done and clean!! She is indeed very talented, fast and has a nice and clean shop. I am definitely going back to Eva for my hair braiding needs!

22.description: I am beyond pleased with my results and will be going back again!If you are in search of a friendly braider who is on time and inside of a clean place then go to Eva's

0.description: Eva's hair braiding was such a great environment. I was more than please with my Senegalese twist. I defiantly would recommend going to Eva's. She also was really nice about squeezing me into the schedule last minute. (thumbs up)

20.description: I got my hair done at eve's last weekend and I must say, I LOVE IT!!! Eva did my braids and the process was the fastest and best results I have ever had. My hair has that wonderful look I have been craving. I requested a better quality of human hair and she provided it with no problem. Her shop is pleasant and other than the music selection (80/90's soft rock) it was a great time.

19.description: Eva and her crew did an exceptionally fantastic microbraiding job on my long and thick hair. The staff is professional and very nice. They also offer more than braids (twists, weaves, etc.) I highly recommend if you want a professional, nice, and clean experience to go to Eva's.

2.description: I had been going to Eva once sometimes two times a year for the summer time for a couple of years. At first I had a very good experience. They had reasonable prices, a clean work space, and different styles. They were usually late but their service made up for that and I just began to arrive later. Last year I began my journey to healthy hair after a lot of heat damage and  did twist out styles mainly. About a month ago i decided it was time for my big chop and wanted to do protective styles for a while so my hair could grow more. The day after I cut 70% of my hair off I go to Eva. When I got there, We would always discuss a little before on the length I wanted. Then some other lady, who is not as skilled as Eva, started on my hair. She didn't ask me what length I wanted (I also forgot to tell her so its a fault on both sides) so about 1/5 of the way through I remember and say that I want the braids bra length. She then had an attitude (rightfully so). My mother and I offered to help take them out so she could start again but she just kept doing the waist length and ignoring all of our requests.Finally she finished my hair and it looked awful. The ends were terrible, they had little knots on the end (which i've never seen them do before), they were still a little longer than i liked but I didn't want to complain anymore. Right when I was about to leave, Eva walks into the store and I tell her about the incident. She tells me that if they unravel I can come back and she'll redo them no cost. Of course the next day they unravel, and I have to go back two days later. When I go back they redo the front and back and did it very roughly. The hair still didn't look good when they redid it because they braided it halfway down and the other half was straight because they wanted to save time. I ended wearing it in a bun for about a month and a couple weeks. I am not going back! I would recommend Amen's.

18.description: I went to get cornrows braided into a Mohawk! She did an amazing job, and at a very great price!! I'm going to be a returning customer!! They are all very professional!! 5 stars for you all!!

13.description: I got my hair done back in January and even when I'd gotten it done, I knew there were a lot of things done wrong when the person was actually braiding my hair. The person who was supposed to do my hair arrived late, which I would have been fine with if my hair had been done well. I repeatedly said that I didn't want my hair braided too tightly because I had experienced  SIGNIFICANT hair loss in the past from braids that were done too tightly. I said this repeatedly and I had indicated that I wanted the hair to go just slightly past my shoulders. None of this was heeded and, as a previous reviewer mentioned, the braids aren't done evenly. They're made to be fat at the beginning and skinny towards the end. Maybe this is a style and the stylist didn't know what I meant when I said that I'd wanted box braids that were a little less then a pencil in diameter. I used to get my hair braided back in the 90s before some of the newer styles came in and I'm not familiar with all the things they do these days, so I really tried to give the hair dresser the benefit of the doubt.When I mentioned  the uneven size of the braids to the person doing my hair, the lady at first tried to deny it but then added more hair to the length as she went on. So by the end of the sitting I just wanted to be done and out. She trimmed off the stray hair (which wouldn't have been necessary if the hair length had been uniform) and she went about it very vigorously so I was terrified that she had cut some of my natural hair. At this point, I really was just tired and wanted to get out so I paid 200 even though I was quoted 180 and just got out of there. So now, here I am 3 months later (I've been busy with work so I couldn't take it out sooner) and low and I'm finding cut out bits of my curly hair mixed in with the braids. I'm kind of really upset but it's too late at this point to do anything. I just wanted to share this with you all so you could be aware of what can happen.

4.description: I went to Eva's two weeks ago to get micro braids.  I was there on time, but they got started a little late, about 40 minutes.  My braider was pretty fast.  It took about 8.5 hours.  They came out beautiful.  They are super easy and make life easier.   I would recommend Eva's.  I like how they are conveniently located.  Eva did not do my haor but she was there and very friendly.

24.description: I've had micros done before at numerous other shops and they were always just okay....until now. Eva's shop is very clean (HUGE PLUS) and comfy. My hair looks great and she's very friendly and an excellent braider. I have had my braids in for 3 days and have gotten tons of compliments. She even "created" a custom color blend for my braids. She's also very meticulous.....even after 13 and a half long hours of braiding my hair (did I mention that I have a LOT of hair.lol) she didnt do like a lot of other braiders at the end and try to make bigger braids or try to skip the finishing touches on my head. My hair looks excellent and I have definitely found a braider for as long as Im in chicago.Thanks again Eva. I'll be back in a few months . :)

6.description: I'm in the military so I've been all over to get braided. Eva's by far is the best. They put up with my shenanigans this morning I was running late I had to move my car charge my phone and iPad and even had to wash my hair. Very professional, very patient, and very sweet people. They did an amazing job and it was not normal for me to get up from my chair after six hours! And it was not so tight that I couldn't think! I DEF WILL BE GOING BACK!

15.description: I've gone back at least a few times and seen improvement. I wasn't charged extra for thick hair or long hair the last time I went, so that's a plus and my braids have lasted longer than they used to. However, I think I'm allergic to the hair that's supplied because my scalp was itchy for 2 weeks following. I may bring my own hair in the future but I do recommend Eva's to my friends.

7.description: So I went to Eva's again to get my twist done.  This was a pretty bad experience compared to the previous visits.  I had two women do my hair neither of which I have seen before.  One was okay, one was bad. She was too heavy-handed, kind of rude to me, and made slick remarks ( I studied french for 3 years so I picked up on bits of what she said.)  My twist also are not that well done.  Some of the twist are way to thin at the end which means she was too lazy to add hair as she braided down to ensure the twist were off an even size.  Overall not too happy this time.  I am not sure if I will go back.  If go back I will make sure to request Eva herself or Aisha the others so far have not been that great at braiding nor that friendly.To top it off I was over charged.  I got my twist twice the size as last time, I actually have 1/2 as many twist but paid the same price.. go figure.

8.description: My first time getting my hair braided in over 10 years and I called Eva to hook me up due to her great reviews. She did just that!!!! I loved the atmosphere from the moment I walked in she was warm and inviting. She wwas concerned with what I wanted and not what she wanted me to have. I love it!!!! She laid my hair out!!! My individual braids look wonderful and she was not super expensive. I was in at 930 and out at 230pm that was one of the reasons why I was a little hesistant about getting my hair braided because I really didnt want to sit there but it didnt even seem like that long. She and another young lady braided so fast it was crazy. I am so super impressed that I cant even wait to get my hair done again!!! I look super fab! Eva thank you so much I am definitely going to be passing your info around!!!!!!!!!!

3.description: Excellent! This is my second time trusting Eva with my daughter! Great job both times! First time she got Senegalese twist, which lasted almost 3 months. This time, box braids. I am pleased. I love great service, especially if my money is being spent!

14.description: I really really really liked Eva's.With a lot of hair braiding places, it's dirty, they're late, and unprofessional.  I didn't experience ANY of that at Eva's.  Her salon is easy to find, super clean, and set up very professionally.  Above all, she does an excellent job, my braids lasted over 3 months!  Her prices were pretty decent too.  It was average for microbraids (about $200).  You can find some places that are cheaper, but remember that you get what you pay for.  If I have to pay an extra $20 or $40 for a clean professional hair braiding experience, I think it's totally worth it.  You're sitting there for over 8 hours!  You should at least be comfortable.She really does deserve a 5 star review.  She is very sweet, and all that the other reviewers had to say is true.   I'm going to continue going to her as long as I have braids and live in the area.  I've finally found my "place" and that's Eva's.

1.description: A great salon.

2.description: Amour Salon is a cute, no-frills salon where maintaining healthy hair is valued above anything else.  The prices are more reasonable than downtown or Hyde Park, but the stylists still use top-shelf products.  Make sure you ask for Sherry; she does an awesome job.

0.description: Great, friendly service. Age appropriate, creative and styllish braiding for children.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Curly Hair, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

12.description: I've purchased a few pieces from Bronzeville Boutique and have loved and enjoyed everything (haven't worn the denim jumper yet, but it's summer!) The staff and customer service is some of the best I've experienced. They care about their customers and work hard to make sure they are satisfied. I'm not a skinny girl, but that's no problem here. They make all sizes and shapes feel welcome and special. I hope they will be around for a long time!!!

3.description: Reasonable pricing on most items. Not a fan of pleather, but the pieces were cute. I prefer to shop without distractions. If I need assistance, trust and believe I WILL ask!

1.description: I agree with Brigett...this store is over priced and a total hot mess. The dressing room Omg a no go. The floor people are too aggressive they never give you a chance to just look at the items before their all in your face ugh...2013 and it is still the same Brigett

2.description: Excellent customer service and style. Dropped n for a quick outfit and left a new person. Will definitely return time and again.

9.description: Bronzeville Boutique is great find in the Bronzeville Community. I read over the other reviews and was disappointed that someone rated them at a one... (Brigitte W.) I know that we all have our opinions but a one.. really. What bugs me about the review is that the person has not been into the store in almost two years and decided to write a nasty review now when there at their peak. Every time I go into the store I am bombarded with hellos from all of the staff when they buzz me in.. They always help me find the perfect outfit. Recently I bought a dress custom made from Australia for about 200 bucks for an industry event I attended. I know that this particular dress would have cost way more at Nordstroms or Bebe. I've actually seen some of the other boutiques try to order the pieces long after BB had them in store. I've actually been visiting the boutique alot more because of the atmosphere ( the staff, cool music +free sandwiches :) ) A few of my friends and I were even in there commerical for I Am You Are She is Lady Mocha campaign. If your not one who spends a lot for clothing I promise they have have something there for everyone. I've even shopped their clearance rack and found dresses and shirts for $20 that I know where maybe $80 or $90 a couple of months prior. . I stongly encourage anyone to go you will not be disappointed. P.S. Where else do you know that you can watch a photoshoot taking place! Heck, they might even pick you to be in a shoot like the girls who work in the store.

10.description: The best accessories.

4.description: I really....really.....really want to love Bronzeville Boutique ("BB"). The concept is exactly what young women in the neighborhood want and need. However, I will agree with Brigitte, the markup is pretty frustrating, and the quality of the clothing has become insulting. To distract you from all of this, the place isn't very well lit. And, as others mentioned, the "dressing room" is the corner of the main floor with a curtain around it. You're so busy ensuring your rear isn't sticking out, you're not noticing that the zipper is catching the dress in its teeth; or that rhinestones and buckles are committing suicide by jumping off garments to their death. My most recent purchases (most of which I haven't even worn yet) are literally unraveling before my eyes. (Like...suddenly....why have these hems come undone? Why is this rosette falling off? Who knew hanging in a garment bag in a dark closet was so stressful.) With BB's very restrictive exchange policy, customers are left with no recourse....but, of course, to never shop there again. I really hope your experiences are better if you choose to go, because I'd like Lady Mocha to succeed in spite of my personal disappointment. Perhaps if she switches suppliers all would be much better. If she doesn't, make sure you thoroughly inspect every piece you buy, and take a friend with you to confirm the staff's nodding while they say "that's HOT girl".....as they will happily sell you trash.

6.description: I have waited a very long time to give a review on this store! I lived in the Bronzeville Area during the time that the store opened. Being fashion forward, i was always intrigued by the beautiful items in the window. I must admit this boutique has beautiful clothing and accessories, however the service i received, was unacceptable. When shopping at a boutique, i expect to find one of a kind clothing that will not be reordered. I purchased a jumpsuit last year for $150. The jumpsuit was absolutely beautiful and it was the last one on the mannequin. I was urged to purchase it because it was the last of its kind. Well, a month later i came into the store and there was the same jumpsuit in 3 different colors with what seemed like endless inventory. My issue with that is, when spending that kind of money on an item, I would not expect for a store to reorder the item especially at that capacity. To top things off, I found two other boutiques who were selling the exact same item for $105. I do expect for companies to make a profit.... that is completely understandable, but after doing my research, I found that the item was $42 per unit. (No wonder they decided to reorder a bus load with such a large profit margin.) I also purchased a bracelet for $60 the same day i purchase the jumpsuit. Well... I went on Clark and Wilson and purchased the same (exact) bracelet for $8. This is not being profitable, but taking advantage. The mark up is outrageous in the store, but this is not what prompted me to stop shopping there. It seemed as though every time i came into the store, It would be one extreme or the next in the way i was treated. Either i would be completely ignored (if i wasn't "dressed" for the day) or i was attacked and aggressively followed around the store as if i was the only customer they had that day. I explained that i wasn't big on rhinestones, however they kept trying to force the tacky rhinestoned shirts and sweaters on me. The sales people were aggressive to the point where it was a turn off. After an experience that i had about an exchange (for a larger size, after a nearly $500 purchase- story too long to tell) I vowed that i would never shop at a place who didn't appreciate my support again. I also haze my friends when they mention the store. They all know how passionate i am about business, professionalism, and customer service and i was not at all impressed. So when the email was sent to do a review on Yelp, 3 of my friends forwarded it to me, and i am gladly sharing my experience. *Disclaimer* I have not stepped foot into this store in over a year and a half, so maybe, just maybe, the service and prices have changed.

0.description: What I Love: the e-flyers and videos - the art. the fashion. the creativity. the pieces are smartly priced and the customer service is definitely above average. I appreciate the nail tech discounts. Most of the clothes I work in when freelancing doing nails either in a salon or a photo shoot comes from Bronzeville Boutique. What I don't Love: lack of space and privacy in the dressings room, I'm very uncomfortable with curtains and I'm not a fan of changing in a rest room-- I'm funny like that. But I am and will continue to support haute/trendy fashions at an affordable price!

5.description: Wandered in here seeking something to wear for my friend's 30th and I was immediately greeted with a high level of enthusiasm (granted, there were three staff members and I was the only shopper, but they could have busied themselves doing other things). After informing them of what I needed, they guessed my size perfectly and proceeded to select several items that I never would've picked for myself but that flattered my frame. I was impressed.After choosing my dress, I was shown several accessory items to compliment my outfit based on the direction I wanted to take.Pleasant shopping experience, but I wasn't too keen on their prices (especially when I saw a few of their accessories elsewhere for less than half of what BB was charging).

13.description: I live in the Northern burbs (Gurnee) and luvs to stop in at the boutique. BB has some trendy pieces. I always find some great finds for a GREAT price. The ladies are very attentive and honest fashionista they really know what looks goods on me. This boutique has the BEST accessories. I've found some great fashionable pieces that are transformable with my day to night wear.  I can't wait till my next visit!!

11.description: I love this place. Prices are decent and the people that work there are great.

8.description: I must say that I LOOOOOOVE, LOVE, LOVE this store. EVERYTHING and I do mean E-VER-RE-THING, I've purchased at the boutique has been a huge success with my friends. This place is the bomb. The price points are great and the fashion is off the chain. I'm an accessory whore so all of the pieces they sell are unique and so eye catching and off the chain gorgeous.
