Each time I go in there I easily spend about 2 to 300 dollars on jewelry (I know...thats sad). But its so hard to put them back. I always tell the ladies (Especially Z...she's awesome) that I have a limit on spending and I always go over it. lol... The entire staff at the boutique is just wonderful. If something looks good on you they say "it looks good" but if its not for you, they will let you know that too. Which I love...cause just because I think it looks good doesn't always mean it does. They play great music and are just like family when you go in the shop. The clothes.....I don't even know what to say except..... WOW!!!!! Everything is unique and you won't see every person in the club or at the bar or the family picnic with your outfit on cause you bought it at MACY'S. Yeah I'm hating on MACY'S. It feels so good to have a black boutique on the south side of Chicago that sells really cute and fun cloths that don't look CHEAP AS HELL. That's what keeps me coming back every time. Keep up the good work ladies (and William - he da bomb too).Tonya P.

14.description: The ladies at BB are great! I received warm customer service and fair pricing. They have the cutest clothes and accessories. They dressed me for my 34th birthday and I went back to them for that all important 35th!!!  I was directed to the boutique shopper who will be contacting me about some pieces specifically for me.  Thanks Ladies!!

7.description: I agree with Kenya....the quality of the clothing could be a lot better. A lot of the pieces are boutique priced with Dots craftsmanship. The store is teeny weeny and the makeshift dressing room (curtain over a corner) doesnt seem reliable to me.The upside is that the staff is extremely helpful and live up to their motto of  "dressing people." I'm pretty fashion forward and dont require much help, but if you are in need of their services, they will hook you up from head to toe. You can also be sure that you wont see everyone rocking what you have on...well except for that time that I saw a girl in Atlanta with my "exclusive" earrings. And I agree with one of the yelpers below...they do have some pretty haute accessories.Overall, you should definitely stop in and see what you can find....but be sure to carefully survey all stitching, buttons, zippers, etc.

1.description: This is my favorite shop. They have vision and just overall good vibes and energy that lead to beyond amazing styles. They keep my hair healthy and as a result it's growing like crazy. The styles are so amazing that people stop me in the streets all the time and ask me where I get my hair done. The decor of the shop is superb and there is a kitchen in the back. Another great thing is that they are flexible. I tell Chris I have a job interview and what type of company and he comes up with the most beautiful but appropriate hair style for each interview.

9.description: My fiancee is getting ready for medical school, and wanted a place to maintain his locks and help them to start looking more "professional". Ive looked up maybe 10 different salons trying to find the perfect place for him to go. Our first time here was great other than his appointment being scheduled for 11 and not being seen until 12, we live in carol stream and after and hour trip waiting an hour to see a stylist is somewhat upsetting. Other than that we ate a great breakfast in the restaurant in the back, everybody is very professional, and the salon has a nice atmosphere. We'll be back for sure.

23.description: Okay okay I really like this salon :) So, Christian Fields called me at my office because he found out about the debaucle that happened last weekend. He made a special color for me and Larenzo gave me the most beautiful color oh my goodness. Nia washed my hair and curled it she was very sweet and funny. Christian Fields as an owner and Larenzo as a colorist are artists. Larenzo explained each step to me and literally painted the highlights and gradient color onto my hair LITERALLY. I got five star treatment and I loved it. I didn't realize this but they also have a shop downstairs that sells shea butter and frangrance oil as well as a delicious smelling cafe of sorts on the main floor that sells made to order turkey burgers and jerk chicken.I am fasting so I didn't taste the chicken but it smelled wonderful. I did buy some shea butter and incense from downstairs and I they are wonderful.

5.description: I love this place and my new hair cut! After my first big chop I was worried about styles but I've been here twice for a wash & style. Leaving with fabulous twist and coils  in my natural hair. Thanks M. J, my stylist & friend !!!

25.description: I no longer go to this salon since my stylist is at a new location and i didn't notice other stylists doing non-lock styles. If you have locks, it definitely seems like the place to be.  It's a clean, well kept salon.

12.description: Go check out my boy Lorenzo. He cool peoples n he does a phenomenal wash n retwist. Shoutout to Byron for the style

21.description: It is often said not to mix business with pleasure. At Christian Fields natural hair salon the opposite philosophy is practiced. Christian Fields Style Bar believes in giving you the best Salon experience. Clients are treated like family at the Cottage Grove salon. Christian wanted to choose an ordinary neighborhood to do extraordinary things. By bringing a richness to the Cottage Grove neighborhood in entreprenuership and quality service, Christian has maintained a wonderful rapport within the Southside community as a hardworker and dedicated owner of Christian Fields Style Bar Salon. Christian Fields is a cornucopia for new naturally intended folk, specializing in all styles of natural hair from locks, bantu knots, fades, tapers, strawsets, coils, relaxed styles and colors. The juicebar and style lounge is a nice space for lounging and grabbing a quick meal before your appointment.

16.description: Okay okay I really like this salon :) So, Christian Fields called me at my office because he found out about the debaucle that happened last weekend. He made a special color for me and Larenzo gave me the most beautiful color oh my goodness. Nia washed my hair and curled it she was very sweet and funny. Christian Fields as an owner and Larenzo as a colorist are artists. Larenzo explained each step to me and literally painted the highlights and gradient color onto my hair LITERALLY. I got five star treatment and I loved it. I didn't realize this but they also have a shop downstairs that sells shea butter and frangrance oil as well as a delicious smelling cafe of sorts on the main floor that sells made to order turkey burgers and jerk chicken.I am fasting so I didn't taste the chicken but it smelled wonderful. I did buy some shea butter and incense from downstairs and I they are wonderful.

17.description: They take good care of me here! Love the atmosphere, the stylists are really chill and the chef is good in the kitchen!

10.description: I always leave here feeling great!, thanks to my natural hair styling gene Chris Fields

11.description: I had my locs colored and styled last week... and my style still looks good. I have received so many compliments on my new color and style! The Style Bar has such a warm feeling, staff members are friendly and professional chic! I would have never selected the style Christian did for me, however I trusted him and it came out great! I highly recommend the Style Bar... you get what you pay for!

26.description: This shop is great for hair designs.  That's how I came to the shop.   When I saw people with a nice design they would say Christian Fields.  The style bar is nice as well.  This is the end of the positives.The negatives are:  TIME.  I would be in there all day.  It did not matter whether I had a scheduled appt or walked in.  I would get bumped.  Even after scheduling to be the first client they ended up scheduling someone before me.  The amount of time is a big turn off.As well I was on a regular appt but had death in the family.  I tried calling 3 times...they went over to an automated system.  Noone called back.  I have also emailed them.  Noone has called back.Third they put this heavy guck in your hair made by Christian.  It's okay but just a little over the top.  It takes me several of days and sleeping on a towel for that stuff to wear off some.Last the changeover in staff.  I have had various people work on my head because they are all supposedly trained by Chris.  They come and go, get training and go do their own thing.  So it's hard to build a relationship with one person.Trendy it is but as far as customer service AWFUL.

27.description: After frequenting Christian Fields on several occasions, I must say...I am pleased.  I am always treated with respect by Christian and his stylists, my appointments start on time, it is a very relaxed environment, and the loc services are superior.  I wish the salon the best success for many years to come.

0.description: I took my fiancée in for a surprise appointment. This was her first visit to a hair Salon in almost ten years! (She does her own hair usually and a great job too). The shop seems to specialize in locs but they also do natural hair styles and weaves. When I called to set up the appointment for her, I was greeted with a friendly woman who walked me through setting up the appointment and the stylist. When we arrived we were greeted with a lively but comfortable atmosphere. No stylist were upstairs at the time and we were directed down stairs. The shop looks well maintained both up and downstairs. When we got downstairs we found out that the stylist who was suppose to do her hair was not there yet. However, all of the other stylist were friendly and one even went an extra step to contact the stylist and see where she was and when she would be there.After the stylist arrived (kinda late due to some miscommunication on both the shop and my end) she was pleasant and very apologetic. Although I did not stay, my fiancée said the experience was amazing and she would def come back. Michelle was the stylist she saw and I must say, she did an amazing job! I guess they just gained a new customer.

20.description: My husband and I both have locs and Dustin is our stylist.  My oldest daughter has natural hair and Candryce is her stylist.  We all have different needs.  My husband usually goes first thing is the morning in by 7am or 8am and he is back at work by 10am.  I on the other hand,  usually like my locs in intricate styles especially when I have formal events.  I am very particular about my Bantu Knots. LOL !!  Dustin does a great job and always gives me exactly what I want.My daughter is in highschool and is still learning how to take care of her natural hair. Candryce does a wonderful job interacting with her and gives her fun vibrant styles.All the stylist at the shop are well-traned and function as a team.  The food in the cafe is excellent and made fresh daily. I highly recommend Christian Fields Style Bar.  If you are on the fence about starting locs. Take the leap an head over to 65th and Cottage Grove.

19.description: Why have I waited so long to sing the praises of my stylist, the best locktician in Chicago?  Shahid has been doing my hair for about 6 years, and he has clearly spoiled me because I have yet to find a salon home in Atlanta.  Whenever I go home, he is one of the first people I see.Positives: 1. PROFESSIONALISM: When you have a 2pm appointment with Shahid, you are in the shampoo bowl at 2pm.  This is a man who knows how to respect your time!  He works quickly and efficiently.  Also, he is a gentleman.  Shop talk is always positive, and he is never distracted.  In all these years, never a personal call, drama, or even remotely inappropriate comment.2. Skills and products: Organic, simple recipes: no mystery products.3. Atmosphere: I've followed Shahid to a few locations, and Christian Fields is the best so far.  It is clean, well lit, and spacious.  Only one negative: No parking.

2.description: I don't often write Yelp reviews, but I felt particularly strongly about writing one regarding my experience with Christian Fields Style Bar.I've been trying, to no avail, to make an appointment for color for over a week. I just wanted information of whether or not I needed to give a deposit, or perhaps go through a consultation appointment, but I can't even reach anyone to advise me. I have been told that I need to speak with one specific person who hasn't returned my calls, and who has not called me back after leaving my information for her with reception. It's one of the most frustrating experiences I've had with a business in quite awhile. If I were on a tight timeline, I would have been completely out of luck.Not sure if I'll ever be able to truly weigh to verify the all of wonderfulness that people sing CF Style Bar's praises for, but I will say this - they must be doing very well, as it doesn't seem at all that they are interested in/in need of new business. Wish me luck on my journey to find a loc colorist! (I'll apparently need it!)

18.description: It is often said not to mix business with pleasure. At Christian Fields natural hair salon the opposite philosophy is practiced. Christian Fields Style Bar believes in giving you the best Salon experience. Clients are treated like family at the Cottage Grove salon. Christian wanted to choose an ordinary neighborhood to do extraordinary things. By bringing a richness to the Cottage Grove neighborhood in entreprenuership and quality service, Christian has maintained a wonderful rapport within the Southside community as a hardworker and dedicated owner of Christian Fields Style Bar Salon. Christian Fields is a cornucopia for new naturally intended folk, specializing in all styles of natural hair from locks, bantu knots, fades, tapers, strawsets, coils, relaxed styles and colors. The juicebar and style lounge is a nice space for lounging and grabbing a quick meal before your appointment.

13.description: I have been taking my daughter here off and on for around two years now.  Candryce always has her looking beautiful when I pick her up.  My son gets his hair cut there now and then.  My children are young, 8 and 10, so I'm picky about where I take them.  Barbershops especially can be rated X(tra).  I always feel great about having my children in such a diverse setting.  The people who work there and the patrons seem to be very positive.  The salon is beautiful and clean.  I love the kitchen idea, I've purchased food for my children there on occasion.  As far as professionalism I've always been treated with respect and received great customer service from the front desk.  I am about to transition out of relaxes hair and I can guarantee you I will go to Christian Fields to stay stylish while I transition.  I am about to book another appointment right now!

4.description: Nice salon.

24.description: Why have I waited so long to sing the praises of my stylist, the best locktician in Chicago?  Shahid has been doing my hair for about 6 years, and he has clearly spoiled me because I have yet to find a salon home in Atlanta.  Whenever I go home, he is one of the first people I see.Positives: 1. PROFESSIONALISM: When you have a 2pm appointment with Shahid, you are in the shampoo bowl at 2pm.  This is a man who knows how to respect your time!  He works quickly and efficiently.  Also, he is a gentleman.  Shop talk is always positive, and he is never distracted.  In all these years, never a personal call, drama, or even remotely inappropriate comment.2. Skills and products: Organic, simple recipes: no mystery products.3. Atmosphere: I've followed Shahid to a few locations, and Christian Fields is the best so far.  It is clean, well lit, and spacious.  Only one negative: No parking.

6.description: This place is awesome. The customer service is on point. I have been here a few times and each time the experience is pleasurable. I have been getting my hair done at natural hair salons for years in multiple states, and this is definitely an experience I have never had before. There are plenty of staff members around , providng all types of hair services, and they all work together well.

22.description: My last review of the Christian Fields Style Bar was pretty rough because the customer service was so bad. But then... the owner, Christian Fields, caught wind of my wife's experience and worked really hard to fix it. He offered to provide the services for free or pay for her to go somewhere else. This gesture proved to me that he does not support bad customer service and values his patrons. Which for me makes all of the difference. She went back and got the red carpet treatment and loved it. Mr. Fields you are all right with me :-)  Everyone makes mistakes... its all about how you fix them.

15.description: My husband and I both have locs and Dustin is our stylist.  My oldest daughter has natural hair and Candryce is her stylist.  We all have different needs.  My husband usually goes first thing is the morning in by 7am or 8am and he is back at work by 10am.  I on the other hand,  usually like my locs in intricate styles especially when I have formal events.  I am very particular about my Bantu Knots. LOL !!  Dustin does a great job and always gives me exactly what I want.My daughter is in highschool and is still learning how to take care of her natural hair. Candryce does a wonderful job interacting with her and gives her fun vibrant styles.All the stylist at the shop are well-traned and function as a team.  The food in the cafe is excellent and made fresh daily. I highly recommend Christian Fields Style Bar.  If you are on the fence about starting locs. Take the leap an head over to 65th and Cottage Grove.

7.description: Excellent experience. My first visit was a loc start with Kerry who appeared to be very professional, neat and knowledgeable. He made the process a breeze. The clean cozy environment provided a lot of comfort for me as well. Also, the young lady who washed my hair, Ronnie, was extremely sweet and open for discussion. Her touch was GREAT. I felt a great sense of teamwork amongst these representatives. I truly admire that. Based on the interaction I shared with these 2 and the results I saw from the loc start, I WILL be returning once a month.

8.description: I moved to Chicago about a year ago and was in need of a salon.  I was so use to my hair stylist in DC and was nervous to try anyone else. I asked around and was given two salons names and one of the names was: Christian Fields Salon. I went to the salon for a visit for the first time and spoke to a gentleman named Shaheed. He was very nice, polite, patient and answered all of my questions pertaining to my hair.  I left feeling as though I would give them a try soon but was still hesitant. I went back to the salon a few months later and spoke to the owner, Christian Fields.  Chris was very professional and was very knowledgeable about hair. I was impressed with his knowledge of hair from the start. He actually informed me that the last stylist that styled and maintained my locs had actually damaged them. I was shocked! I had been going to this stylist for over 5 years. He immediately explained to me how my hair was damaged, went through a step by step process of how he would rebuild and strengthen my hair back to my natural state. Almost one year later and I am still going to Chris for loc maintenance. Chris is the real deal! He has several hair licenses and certificates. He is God sent. Please try Christian Fields if you want healthy locs, fantastic styles, professional atmosphere, healthy meals and the Christian Fields experience. I have gotten so many compliments from strangers and have referred so many people to this salon. Please try them!

3.description: I will highly recommend this shop to anyone. Christian is very knowledge and his expertise of natural hair is top notch. I was blown away by the customer service the staff also provides.

14.description: My last review of the Christian Fields Style Bar was pretty rough because the customer service was so bad. But then... the owner, Christian Fields, caught wind of my wife's experience and worked really hard to fix it. He offered to provide the services for free or pay for her to go somewhere else. This gesture proved to me that he does not support bad customer service and values his patrons. Which for me makes all of the difference. She went back and got the red carpet treatment and loved it. Mr. Fields you are all right with me :-)  Everyone makes mistakes... its all about how you fix them.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Curly Hair, Extensions, Coloring

1.description: This is a good quality inexpensive fast food restaurant.  The food is generally tasty and is a nice option for take out.The menu is extensive and a little overwhelming at first.  The take out menu is 16 pages and covers salads, sandwiches, burgers, seafood, ribs, milkshakes, and mexican food.  A big highlight is the Turkey Chili, which is nicely spiced with a little kick.  It's a hearty meal that makes a cold day more manageable.  The place confusingly calls itself Food Express when they answer the phone and this is the name printed on the menus.  Not sure why.

2.description: I used to hear people rave about the ribs. I ordered ribs here and they were good.  The ribs were smoked and with good barbeque sauce. THEN, I decided to have a party catered.  They BOILED the rib tips instead of smoking them. Then they poured sauce over them. So, I stopped ordering from there.

0.description: 4 Stars for the Real Chicago Rib House 1 star for Food ExpressWhen this place was the Chicago Rib House they had THE BEST HOT LINKS in the city. Previous owner: If you happen to stumble upon this Yelp please tell me where you are! Why did you guys close? I haven't been able to find a decent hotlink since. (If my uncles who own a very popular rib restaurant chain saw this omg........ lol)FOOD XPRESS used to be located on 31st across from Dunbar but relocated. My BF is buddies w/the owner so I've been eating their food for years now. So it all tastes the same to me kinda like hospital food. Excellent service though. Owner said he will not be replacing the sign anytime soon. LOL....

58.description: Excellent service and food. I'm happy to see Peach's in the Bronzeville neighborhood. Black owned and employing young Black people. I'll be back.

56.description: Solid diner. Very cute. The fruit was fresh, duck bacon delicious, and service was both prompt and friendly. Prices were more than reasonable. Peach coffee was also very fun.

29.description: I love this place. The food, service, and atmosphere are all wonderful! I have eaten there several times on Sunday mornings and every experience has been great. The waffles are fantastic.

42.description: I was very excited that there was a new black own business in the community so I just had to give it try. I came here with my best friends was automatically greeted and seated the atmosphere was just amazing the customer service was five stars and the food was great this will be a go to a lease once a week thank God my job is right down the street.

23.description: This is usually my favorite place for breakfast but the food was not on point today.  The grits were watery and did not have its usual great taste.  The eggs were rubbery and full of oil.  I was in a hurry so I did not have time for the back and forth.  The toast  and coffee were about the best thing!  Very disappointed today!!!

47.description: I would love to give this place five stars for multiple reasons the service was good, this restaurant is black owned, it's close to where I live and the food is affordable. However, there is one thing I couldn't mention which is the most important thing when I visit a restaurant, the food. We go restaurants to have our taste buds satisfied but I did not experience that here. I ordered the Peach's special in which I chose French toast, grits, sausage with 2 eggs scrambled with cheese. The grits were way too salty, the French toast had no flavor, the eggs were hard and nearly too brown and the sausage was just regular. This place has very good rating on Yelp but it didn't live up to the hype. My BF had been here before and he said the food was delicious and the service was excellent but I can only agrees on the good service the food was horrible I was very disappointed and will not be returning anytime soon. P.S if you want some good coffee to take home get some from Peach's the coffee is really good and has an amazing peach taste that you will remember

8.description: So, I LOVE THIS PLACE! Whenever I am in Chicago, I have to go to Peach's. I just have to. Everything about this restaurant is great to me. The food is delicious, the people are great, and the prices are even better. My first time visiting I ordered the egg and bacon sandwich with potatoes. My friend ordered the catfish, grits, and greens; I regretted my decision once I tasted his food. Don't get me wrong, my sandwich was delicious and just what I wanted, but everything about his food was mouth-watering. The grits were cheesy and smooth, while the greens were super flavorful. So good!

31.description: We had a great meal!  My husband absolutely Loved the cheese grits with the salmon cakes.  The catfish, greens and grits were scrumptious too. In fact, the duck bacon and a biscuit with peach compote rounded out a nearly perfect meal.  The staff was courteous; service was a bit slow and spotty (plates weren't cleared regularly, and it took a while to receive our orders and water) but the manager and individual staff members were responsive when prompted.  I will definitely go back before I leave Chicago. Really great to see another new restaurant with nice ambiance and good food on the Southside.

34.description: Let me begin by saying the servers are really nice at this establishment HOWEVER.. The food is sub-par at best. We ordered one of the specials which was the Greek omelette. Well what I received was an egg white omelette. I ordered the omelette to be made with all egg whites as it was however I didn't think I was gonna receive only roughly 1 oz of gyro meat(approximately 5 little strips for an omelette that probably consisted of roughly 4-5 egg whites. The omelette had a few onions sparsely placed throughout the omelette and an overwhelming presence of Swiss cheese. I would have done better ordering and all egg white veggie omelette with cheese (it would have been cheaper). The best thing about the breakfast was the toast now I am not an advocate of carb eating however after this breakfast I was still slightly hungry. Nevertheless this was our first and LAST EXPERIENCE with peaches as we will never be back again. When we are in this area we typical frequent another breakfast establishment nearby however we decided to give peaches a chance after looking at the ERRONEOUS Yelp reviews. Well.. Sometimes change is not always good.

16.description: Outstanding food!  I'm not certain what took me so long to visit. I had heard great things about Peaches, but it took an out of town guest to visit. We ate there twice this weekend and enjoyed every bite. Pancakes were fluffy and moist. Shrimp and cheese grits was extremely tasty! Catfish, greens, & grits were yummy! Peach bourbon French toast were also amazing. I will be back!

13.description: My cousin and I got to try the 7up pancakes and I gotta say that although I couldn' taste the 7up as much as I hoped...the cream cheese glaze that they gave on the side really sealed the deal.The food was on par with what you would expect of a good diner. And everyone gave service with a warm smile...who woulda thought Chicago would be so cozy in the winter time? :)

11.description: The photo speaks for itself. Bad choice for an enjoyable breakfast.

39.description: Had a wonderful dining experience at Peach's on Sunday. The food, service and atmosphere were all wonderful.  The peach coffee was a first for me and I loved it. Also loved the peach waffle and creamy grits. The service was excellent. Really warm and inviting dining room. Will definitely go back and recommend it to others.

37.description: I promised the owner I'd write a review now I'm holding myself to it. OMGAWDTHISPLACEWASEVERYTHINGABROWNGIRLEVERWANTEDIN­ABLACKOWNEDBRUNCHSPOT!!!*breathes*1) I went with some of the most beautiful brown queer femmes I've come to know and it was just fantastic to laugh, and grieve and eat.2) Our waitress was phenomenal. Knew that menu like the back of her hand and kept the specials coming so we all had feels about what to eat. 3) Because the wait for our food was long, the kitchen staff came out to apologize for the wait, and gave every single person at the table a complimentary biscuit and peach glaze. Those biscuits are the size of a grown man's fists and are not to be eaten by the weak.4) Everything was just delicious. And being around so many brown and black people who just wanted to share in joy and love of food was everything a girl could ask for on a cloudy Sunday afternoon. 5) While the decor seemed to be a place of "oh my gawd this isn't inviting at all", I can say that it's about the feeling of a restaurant when you walk in that is the appeal. You had church folk, friends, lovers, families that came and just wanted to enjoy each others' company. I actually thought it was brilliant that it looked like old school black diners and the real presentation is in the food. This place is DEFINITELY worth the trip and I'm all the way in RPark so you know I mean business.

0.description: Brunch after churchI took my family to Peach's after church. It was my wife and two sons (3 and 1). So, it started that there were no booster seats for the chairs - not a good start, but that is the ONLY bad thing I can say about the experience. Let's start with our server Jerome. He was professional, nice, accommodating, made relevant and GOOD recommendations and moreover was attentive - ask for him when you go. We started off with Jerome's recommended Peach's coffee. My wife got the Gouda and spinach omelette which I would like to say was delicious but she inhaled it without even offering up a bite!I got the shrimp and grits, cheese grits that is. At first I was disappointed because even though the shrimp were big there was only three, but as I dug in there were two more large ones under the blanket of grits. Everything was in perfect balance, the cheesey grits, the large shrimps, the chunks of bacon. Three words: de lish ous!!!This is a great brunch spot, with great service and great food. I highly recommend you try it out and then, try it out again. See you there, Sunday, after church!

38.description: amazing food and great service from our server ms. ashli i love this place my new breakfast spot!

51.description: I was excited about a new breakfast spot on the South Side; however, I must say I was very disappointed with my carry out order.  I tried the Peach's Favorite (Salmon Croquettes and Cheese Grits).  Unfortunately, it was not my favorite!  The cheese grits were soupy and I was extremely dissatisfied with the taste, as well as, texture of the croquettes.  In addition, this dish is way overpriced.   For the price, it should at least come with a side of toast and/or eggs.  I really wanted to like this place...oh, well.

27.description: This has been a long process for this location to open. We have been anticipating the opening of Peach's for a while and I'm so excited to finally try it. This location has plenty of parking space throughout on King Drive on both sides of 47th street. The restaurant was open and bright and full of people this Saturday for brunch and there was only a less than Ifive minute wait to be seated. Looking around this is a great location for families or friends getting together for brunch and the staff was very friendly and the manager was walking around ready to answer any questions that customers may have had. The server that served us was really great wonderful personality and was able to explain some things on the menu in terms of what we can substitute and what we could not. When we placed our order it took a little while for order to come out in the first thing when we asked for was coffee which took over 5 minutes for her to come though the server did tell us that they were brewing a new fresh pot of coffee it still took longer for the coffee to get to us. The manager apologized and brought out a cup of coffee and also their special peach coffee  which was pleasantly surprising good. Once our food arrived which we ordered one scrambled egg, chicken and french toast, and cheesy grits the chicken had a weird taste. The manager came over and quickly asked if he could exchange it for something else so we got bacon. Overall the restaurant was nice but nothing special and the staff is trying to work things out. I won't probably return but a great place to probably just get a simple breakfast at an inexpensive price.

32.description: So, I LOVE THIS PLACE! Whenever I am in Chicago, I have to go to Peach's. I just have to. Everything about this restaurant is great to me. The food is delicious, the people are great, and the prices are even better. My first time visiting I ordered the egg and bacon sandwich with potatoes. My friend ordered the catfish, grits, and greens; I regretted my decision once I tasted his food. Don't get me wrong, my sandwich was delicious and just what I wanted, but everything about his food was mouth-watering. The grits were cheesy and smooth, while the greens were super flavorful. So good!

54.description: Fresh and fluffy omelettes. Delicious pancakes but the winner has to be the house potatoes!!! Plus they have peach coffee that was very tasty and on the stronger side. I'll be back for sure.

48.description: Nice diner style place that's good for breakfast or lunch.  The service can sometimes be slow or forgetful but we have noticed an improvement over time since they first opened.  That said, almost every trip there's some small hiccup.  Last time we asked for a coke and coffee refill.  The waitress brought the coffee but completely forgot about the coke so we needed to ask again.  The time before our food took forever to come.  When we asked it showed up instantly because it has been sitting ready for a while and the waitress just forgot about bringing it to us.  Minor annoyances that the good food makes up for, but you don't need to deal with this type of thing at most other restaurants.

44.description: Unfortunately the experience here was mediocre at best. The decor failed to invite and felt more empty than anything despite the moderate crowd. There was an unnecessary wait for the food which lacked and the signature Peaches coffee left me begging for the regular blend. I will not be returning but I'm happy to see the business erected in the rising Bronzeville community. Since food and these reviews are subjective, I encourage those in the area to support and more importantly, the business to step it up a bit and find a way to WOW their consumers.

24.description: Coming this place is a hit or miss. The first time I visited was for an early brunch. I ordered the catfish special, with grits and greens. My meal was pretty good. However, given my good experience during my first visit I decided to try out breakfast...I was not satisfied at all. I ordered pancakes, eggs, and bacon. My food was definitely not cooked to order. The food tasted as though it was previously cooked and reheated.

7.description: BLACK OWNED BUSINESS I love the decor and had heard great things about this restaurant.  Sadly my Catfish Poboy disappointed me.It was kinda fishy and dry. For $8 I expected a better sandwich and it only came with chips.My friend had the Philly Omelette which was good. I'll give them another try and order that next time.

49.description: So so so so GOOD! I've been here 3 times and the experiences gets better and better. Their servers are phenomenal (shout out to Jerome!!!) and the food is ALWAYS fresh. I am so glad this restaurant is in Bronzeville. Continue provide excellent service and I will continue to return!Oh, and the Peach Blend Coffee and the DJ.... AMAZING!!!

40.description: If you haven't tried this place yet where have you been? This is my new breakfast spot! The food and service was amazing. I ordered the salmon and cheese grits. The salmon was seasoned well and the grits were outstanding. Our waiter Jermaine was on point he checked on us often and made sure we were ok. Oh I forgot to mention the coffee was better than Starbucks, it was a little strong but was very tasty. I will defiantly be back!

53.description: I hate that I didn't have the option to give this place less than 1 star. My first mistake was telling my mother that no one could screw up breakfast. It was HORRIBLE! All of the workers with the exception the manager looked like they had just rolled right out of bed after a long night on the town. No one wore hair nets despite the long weaves and shoulder length braids and cornrows that dangled from every waiter and waitresses head and into the plates of diners. AND then the food came! Uuuugh. Their idea of an omelet; four leaves of spinach between 2 to 3 eggs that were cooked to hell and sprinkled w/ the cheapest cheese. Well you should just forget about the seasoning.The pancakes were raw in the middle. My mom requested crisp bacon. However, when her bacon arrived it was still flopping on the plate. So when we made mention to the waitress she had my mom remove the bacon from her plate onto another plate. The waitress then whisked the bacon off to the kitchen. She then came back with the SAME pieces of bacon that had been nuked for 2 additional seconds and brought to the table, now, only half way flopping on the plate. It took us exactly 25 minutes to receive our food-- not counting the time we sat waiting to be acknowledged or given water. Ooooh, after all of this I almost forgot to mention, the food was cold. I spoke with the manager Cynthia who was nice and seemed to be receptive to feedback. She never communicated that she would be taking a portion off of our bill. She just delivered the bill and I guess we were supposed to be grateful that she took off a portion of the bill. We certainly did not expect her to comp a portion of the bill as we had fully planned on paying. We still gave our waitress a tip for okay service and bad food. I will say that Abby our initial waitress was good but 2 other random workers/waitresses actually delivered our food. Umm where did they come from???? I was excited to try this place and was looking forward to having a place to dine as it is located right in my neighborhood. I don't think I will ever be back. I'm chuckling because they had the nerve to be costly. Ooooooh there is soooo much more I can say but I will leave it at this  . . . . ..  a major disappointment! I hope that they can make some adjustments and improve on the quality of their workers and food. Hoping they can turn it around.

30.description: Yummy!  Went here for the first time with my LSs and the food was excellent!!!  Had the philly omelette and chocolate pancakes. I'll be working out for awhile (; but the food was great!

46.description: I absolutely love the food. Coming all the way from Atlanta I was excited to try the food. It came highly recommended and they definitely lived up to their great reputation. My husband and I tried the Peaches special with the duck bacon, and my son the waffle and turkey bacon. Very healthy meal with egg whites and good coffee. I've never tried duck bacon before and I must say it was yummy delicious. On top of going with some friends that frequent the place we had a great time and will definitely be back.

1.description: Finally made it to Peach's.  Walked in and it was a pretty long wait (25-30 mins) but with my desire to want to try this place out AND starvation from skipping breakfast, I decided to just buckle up and wait it out and see what's the hype about.And it was about nothing! First, when you have a long line of people waiting to sit down, it's probably a good idea to clean the tables to accommodate those waiting to sit down.  This wasn't the case.  We sat and watched tables go 5-6 minutes with empty plates and trash from the people who previously sat there.  It may seem picky but there were more than enough staff walking around that someone could've cleaned up an area and allowed to others to eat and keep the line moving.  We finally got a seat and menu and the selections looked pretty impressive.  Our waitress was attentive, professional and knew the menu and gave us a good breakdown of the choices.  One positive is substituting foods.  Almost every entree you can choose from 5-6 different things to substitute as sides.  I ordered the Philly Omelette and it was overcooked.  And little bit of salsa they give you doesn't help it all.   The upside is I chose the waffle as a side and that was pretty good.  As was the house potatoes that came with it.  But the side order of chicken wings we received were severely overcooked.   And my guest ordered shrimp and grits and the grits looked like a soup and only had a few shrimp in them.   Wasn't impressed with the food at all.Price wise I thought it was pretty fair.  It's a pretty decent portion size and if the food was cooked better, it would've been well worth.  Place is a little small but with a few touches here and there, it could be much better.

55.description: Good clean, new diner in Bronzeville. Solid faire for what I have tasted. Eggs cooked to order, and the duck bacon...real good. Their potatoes taste just average, but they aren't greasy...so I am betting they are healthy, they got a small kids Menu too...my wife is still raving about the cheese grits...

9.description: The 2 stars are for the grits. The service was so bad, I'll probably never return. After waiting close to 40-45minutes for three meals, my duck bowl was prepared with a big piece of plastic cooked in it. I ordered my egg over easy and my daughter ordered over medium but they both came well done with the entire yoked cooked. We waited 20 minutes for lemons for our water and had to ask for flatware and napkins once we were finally served. Our server didn't check on us at all, the runner had to correct everything that was wrong with our order so I left my tip for him. When the bill came we were charged full price for everything. Go figure! The cheese grits were great and the duck bacon was good.

26.description: A neighborhood delight I was here on Saturday and enjoyed the chicken philly omelette which was very good. The potatoes were excellent seasoned and cooked to perfection. I will be back for the biscuits. Great service, nice atmosphere, great location!!

25.description: This is a great restaurant with an awesome menu, great service and space. I particularly enjoyed the southern omelette with home style potatoes and the duck bacon. The service was professional, timely and genuinely warm so much so I can't imagine why I'm just now trying. This is a bronzeville gem!! I've not had a chance to sample the lunch menu but I'm definitely looking forward to visiting again real soon!

12.description: It was a good wholesome breakfast.  The customer service and peach coffee was good. Nothing really stuck out on this visit except the coffe.

59.description: I love breakfast and I'm in love with Peaches!!! Love the salmon croquettes and the cheese grits. The BLT is also great as is the peach coffee. Lovely spot!!! A must for brunch and breakfast lovers.

21.description: If you love grits this is the place.  If you do not then this is not.  The people with me love grits and are happy.  I do not like grits and my omelette is okay to bland.  The potatoes are well seasoned.  My food came out warm.

17.description: A neighborhood delight I was here on Saturday and enjoyed the chicken philly omelette which was very good. The potatoes were excellent seasoned and cooked to perfection. I will be back for the biscuits. Great service, nice atmosphere, great location!!

10.description: First time there, was told it would be 5 mins to be seated at a table. 20 mins later, they offered us a spot at the lunch bar. 15 more mins just for our order to be taken, another 20-25 until food was delivered to us. 10-15 waiting for the check, 5 for our change lol all for mediocre food  everything was just ok, not enthused on returning anytime soon.

5.description: The food was good. It was my first time trying duck bacon. I think more options on the menu would be good. The service was good as well. The prices are reasonable. All together, I spent under 20 bucks. Con: Their signature drink (peach tea) is served in a small cup and you have to pay full price for a refill.

3.description: The space is large and airy with simplistic but homey decor. The wait was pleasant enough (five minutes longer than expected but short considering they were busy). We noticed right away that the employees were scattered, doing multiple tasks. For example, the hostess was seating guests, taking to-go orders, answering the phones, in the kitchen preparing to-go orders, cleaning tables, and mopping. The waiters and waitresses were also seen doing several jobs. They also were waiting on tables across the entire restaurant instead of a designated section which made them scattered. Our waiter was pleasant but not as attentive as we would've liked. When the food came out SEVERAL items were missing and when we inquired he asked us what was missing. If you see two omlettes that you know come with some form of bread, how does the waiter not recognize that those otems are missing? The food *sigh* it was just OK. Between three people we had the lamb omlette, spinach omlette, pancakes, peach bourbon french toast, duck bacon, potatoes, and grits. The omlettes were bland and overcooked. The pancakes weren't fluffy and reminded me of frozen ones. The other items were not bad but just ok. Not sure if I will return. I MAY try one more time. I would give them 2.5 stars if I could.

35.description: Awesome little Brunch restaurant located on the corner or 47th & King Drive. Went there on friday with girlfriends for breakfast, the service was great and food even better. I am definitely happy and welcome new business to the community.

19.description: Ordered two eggs scrambled with cheese as a side order to a special. Here's how they rang it up. Eggs X  2:     3.90Cheese X 2:  1.50That's right folks. Two eggs scrambled w some American cheese is $5.40 at Peaches. Do they know how many eggs I can get for $5.40???I could see if there was some culinary interpretation, fancy garnish or artistic presentation.  But no,  this was two eggs w American cheese as served at every diner, dive and greasy spoon found anywhere in the country. Plain as plain can get. I'm calling shenanigans.

28.description: Incredible restaurant with A+ service. The Greek Omelet is my favorite. It's incredibly tasty and the tzatki sauce is better than most Greek restaurants I've been to in Chicago. We usually have Jerome as our waiter and he is one of the friendliest, professional waiters I've had. The good news is that even when we've had other servers, they've been wonderful too.

45.description: I love this place. However, they have to receive 1 star for the horrible experience my wife and I had today. Apparently, they were short staffed today, which is never a problem, if the establishment (I.e. Management) knows how to strategically place everyone. We should have known to turn around from the door once we entered. The wait was very short, about 5 minutes, if we wanted a table. We requested a booth but noticed that several tables and booths were available yet dirty. We inquired about the available booths and were told they would be ready soon. About 10 minutes later we were finally seated. Ok. A little rough start.Things took a turn for the worst when we sat for about 15 mins before someone came over to give us water. When the person brought the water, they did not greet us. They just sat the water down and left. We started to think: Ok, maybe this wasn't the best idea but the food is great. Let's just stay. As we sat there, we noticed that the servers were just aimlessly walking around: some going to the same tables over and over, some just gazing off and others conversing with each other. At this point, my wife and I are frustrated. We angrily stare and try to flag down several servers to come take our orders. Finally, one server (who was already carrying almost the whole restaurant) came and said I'll get your server. 5 minutes later, she came by the table again, saw we had not been served and took our orders. She was very apologetic and explained how understaffed they were today. She became our saving grace for the rest of the time there. My wife called for the manager. Christopher C., the manager at the time of our service, came over to inquire about what was happening for us. When my wife explained about the lack in service we had been receiving, he gave us this half assed excuse about how he too has been "shocked" at the service today. Sir, how can you be shocked at the service if you are the one coordinating it? He continued to fumble through his excuses and gave us some apologies. He then offered to give us a free drink for our Inconvenience. Yeah. That surely makes up for our inconvenience in the service you are coordinating today *sarcastic voice*. While this is happening for us, other customers around us are beginning to notice the lack in service as well. They all are being treated in the Same manner as us. Some have complained to Christopher as well or have decided to leave. After about 45 minutes from the beginning of this whole fiasco, our food finally comes. My wife's food was fine. However, my eggs were undercooked and had a weird taste. I stopped eating them and had my wife taste them. She agreed that they tasted funny. We called for Christopher again. At this point I have lost whatever appetite I had left. He comes back over and we explain to him the issue. AGAIN, he tries to explain away the situation stating "the server should have asked you if you wanted scrambled eggs soft, hard, etc." He then expresses how over the last 4 years he has worked at different establishments and this is the first time this has ever happened under his watch and how shocked he was that this is happening. Good sir, my wife and I ordered the same thing and neither of us specified, beyond just wanting scrambled eggs, how we wanted them. As my wife pointed out, it's not the servers fault for not asking us, it's the cook for not being consistent and management for not properly training the servers. After we made a complaint about the food, several tables around us starting complaining very loudly. The manager is giving all of them the same excuses. We all united in a storm of complaints. He offered us 50% off of our Bill. He then tried to tend to all the other complaints. The server came back one more time to apologize. At this point, My wife and I lost our appetites and just pushed the food away. When the sever brought us our bill and Christopher (the manager) didn't do anything to the bill, we called him back over again. He again gave more excuses with apologies and then finally said he would cover the meal 100%. We gave him some insight as to how we would have liked this experience to have happened and then we left. We will give them another try as this is the first time we have received this kind of poor service, but we won't be returning for a while. Hopefully, a new system will be in place by the time we return.

33.description: I am very disappointed with this place. I had been hearing good things abt this place and our experience wasn't a good. We normally go CCW down the street (sometimes crowded but always have more than enough food). Decided to try "Peaches." We ordered 2 greek omelettes and we were only given 2 smalls strips of lamb( approx 1 oz) served with an egg white omelette with peppers. So I basically paid $25 for 2 egg white omelettes. We wont be back. I only gave it 2 stars bc the service was great and the place is clean.

43.description: Great place for breakfast with a down home feel.The food is great and the service feels personal.I have been there a few times and my service was great and food was ummm ummm good!Angie

2.description: Since there are no real family restaurants or sit down spots in Bronzeville, I was EXTREMELY excited for Peach's to open up. No words to describe my excitement. And because I am a mild H-Dog fan, I just KNEW Chef Rome wouldn't disappoint. Wrong. Wrong. Wrong. Because I try not to give up so easily on Black business, I went here on 3 different occasions. They EACH left MUCH to be desired. 1) The prices are too high. And for prices you pay, the portions are very underwhelming. Very. My "grits" were disgusting. Maybe it was some sort of grits soup that my uncultured ass just doesn't know about, but... No. Wasn't feeling them. The pancakes were not done in the middle. And the bacon was cold and unimpressive. When I told the manager, he was very nonchalant about it. 2) I'm a coffee drinker and if for no other reason, I would visit for the peach coffee. Absolutely amazing. I love it. 3) I had a server named Talilah who was SO awesome that it was a mild distraction from the unimpressive menu. I requested her the times I returned. There was another woman hosting who was amazing as well. Don't know her name though. All that to say... Customer service here (from the staff) is actually awesome. Overall, it's nothing to get excited about. If you live or work in the area, it's a cool lil spot to meet up for Saturday morning coffee or whatever, but other than that? Nah, bruh. Don't go in here starving expecting to leave satisfied. If imma leave broke, I don't wanna leave hungry. If imma leave hungry, I don't wanna leave broke. I left both. Lol! One star for customer service. One star for the amazing coffee.

18.description: I promised the owner I'd write a review now I'm holding myself to it. OMGAWDTHISPLACEWASEVERYTHINGABROWNGIRLEVERWANTEDIN­ABLACKOWNEDBRUNCHSPOT!!!*breathes*1) I went with some of the most beautiful brown queer femmes I've come to know and it was just fantastic to laugh, and grieve and eat.2) Our waitress was phenomenal. Knew that menu like the back of her hand and kept the specials coming so we all had feels about what to eat. 3) Because the wait for our food was long, the kitchen staff came out to apologize for the wait, and gave every single person at the table a complimentary biscuit and peach glaze. Those biscuits are the size of a grown man's fists and are not to be eaten by the weak.4) Everything was just delicious. And being around so many brown and black people who just wanted to share in joy and love of food was everything a girl could ask for on a cloudy Sunday afternoon. 5) While the decor seemed to be a place of "oh my gawd this isn't inviting at all", I can say that it's about the feeling of a restaurant when you walk in that is the appeal. You had church folk, friends, lovers, families that came and just wanted to enjoy each others' company. I actually thought it was brilliant that it looked like old school black diners and the real presentation is in the food. This place is DEFINITELY worth the trip and I'm all the way in RPark so you know I mean business.

41.description: I was in chicago and brought my mom, sister in law, and cousin. We got there 15 minutes before they closed and they had every menu option available.The Peach's coffee was so strong yet so good. The service was very attentive and generous. I got the 4 wings and french toast with strawberries for about $12. The chicken was well seasoned and the french toast was buttery and amazing.My mom had the turkey sausage with eggs, grits, and the home made biscuit. My cousin and sister in law had the grits, salmon, and pancakes.Everyone loves the grits and the biscuits were soft and flaky.We all were full and the bill for 4 people came to about $55. We will definitely be back.

52.description: 1st time here once seated we were bought menu's & water but the wait for our server was at least 10 min. Server was pleasant and knowledgable about menu. Nice soft jazz played through the speakers - provides a nice background sound track. Once we ordered chicken gumbo, salmon croquettes, veggie omelet. Wifee went with fried cat fish greens, and grits. In a word the food was great. The gem in the heart of Bronzeville is a must visit spot for good eats. They just need to tighten up the service. That's why the get a 4 & not a 5 rating. Food &  atmosphere are excellent !

50.description: I had the peaches special  eggs, pancakes & diced potatoes with duck bacon($1.50 upcharge) & peach flavored coffee. I asked for a side of the bourbon peach compote for my pancakes. Breakfast was average the potatoes was good it was cooked hard enough not mushy and great flavor with whatever seasoning they added to it. I never had duck bacon it wasn't fatty more lean and good they gave 3 or 4 pieces don't remember. I enjoyed it more then turkey bacon & it will be my go to for now on in my home i need to google to find where to buy. The pancakes were average w/the peach compote it reminded me of a peach cobbler not too sweet w/nutmeg. I'll return menu wasn't extensive

4.description: Wow!This was such a let down. The environment & the staff appeared open & friendly. The food itself was a disaster. The salmon, bacon, & pancakes were all sent back b/c they were served to our table undercooked. The pancakes literally had wet dough in the center. The pork bacon was still pink as was the salmon. The food was sent back initially for being cold not room temperature but literally cold. Like how long was this sitting on a table with no heat light cold. When all of the food was placed on our table we knew exactly why it had taken so long to get our food! We had 1 order for the shrimp & grits which was piping hot (obviously was just cooked) but everything else was cold. SMHThere was a numerous amount of apologies but I'm sorry there is no excuse for a restaurant to send out cold food then replace it with undercooked food.

6.description: Very nice place,shrimp and grits was delicious and signature peach coffee would definitely recommend this. Wait staff very good and attentive. Clean restrooms.

22.description: BLACK OWNED BUSINESS I love the decor and had heard great things about this restaurant.  Sadly my Catfish Poboy disappointed me.It was kinda fishy and dry. For $8 I expected a better sandwich and it only came with chips.My friend had the Philly Omelette which was good. I'll give them another try and order that next time.

15.description: Went to Peach's yesterday for the first time and had the cheddar grits and croquettes. While the aroma of the food didn't mesh as well as I would like, the food definitely tasted well together. I will definitely go back to Peach's for breakfast sometime. Next time I plan to try the French Toast and the Duck Bacon! Follow me and my adventures : @pattydrive

57.description: I wanted to like this place. I really did. I try my best to support black owned and small businesses. The food was amazing (salmon croquettes and cheese grits) but I will not be back to support this location. Me and 3 of my friends met here at around 12:30 for lunch. The waitress took 15 minutes to take our order. She kept walking past but never stopped to ask if we were ready to order. Once the order was taken we waited an HOUR for our food to arrive. People who sat down after us left before we did. I sought out a man in a suit who I assumed was the manager. His name is Wendell. He said that he would check on our food and that they were in the middle of a shift change which is why our drinks had not been refreshed. After, he came to our table to explain that our waitresses orders had not been going back in to the kitchen. So he said, "before I put in the order, what do you all want to do?"  Umm...we want to be eat. We've been here for an hour. Bad customer service. Why should I have to seek someone out when you realize that your patrons have been waiting way too long?He gave us 20% off our bill. Thanks? A bill we had to wait 10 more minutes for. Came to our table once to check on us. The hostess was more apologetic than he was. Wendell should not be running this establishment with his nonchalant and unapologetic attitude.

20.description: My first experience at Peaches in Bronzeville was very  pleasant and satisfactory. The waiter, Tarvis, was exceptional and the chef went above and beyond in providing a hearty vegan breakfast that wasn't on the menu. Clean,  with quirky decor, I will be returning.

36.description: I was here yesterday with my best friend and I loved it my food was delicious I order the steak & eggs with pancakes and grits the steak was delicious tender and juicy this was my first visit and I must say I will be back on my birthday on the 29th my whole meal was delicious service was OK overall great place just wished they were open a little later

14.description: Delicious food, delightful service, charming atmosphere. Forward-thinking soul food, and even the veggie sides are great -- especially the greens and cheese grits.

0.description: I get my hair cut here by frank's guy. I like the quality of the cut and have been coming here for a year now. They also have all the stuff for women to get there hair done here, by both the men and women that work here. This part of 47th street was recently redone (streets, signs, and lampposts for the jazz theme) I am hoping more businesses will open up in the area soon!

58.description: my first time going was a nice experience. I went around breakfast going in to the  lunch buffet. breakfast was good, but I'd rather go for lunch, much better. The only thing I didn't like was, the space was a little small, and the waitresses could have been more friendlier.

56.description: My boyfriend LOVES buffets so when I came across this restaurant ,I knew we had to go!We went on weekday early afternoon  , waited for 10 minutes and was seated . Our waitress explained we had the option to go the buffet or get something off the menu. We of course went to the buffet,they were still having breakfast and lunch was being offered also. We ate waffles with eggs sausage and potatoes and it was yummy! The only thing it took the waitress like 10 minutes to give my boyfriend his syrup, mind you it was not busy AT ALL. But this man who I'm guessing is the owner , must have saw the frustration on my face b/c he came over and asked how everything was going . And like that we got our Syrup..lol We also got to try some of the Soul Food from the buffet . We tried the Fried chicken ,Turkey , Dressing and the Delicious Macaroni. Overall out experience was fair . The next time I go I want to try food off the menu.

29.description: The food is great...this review is based on the service. The waiters are great...the hostess are great...however the manager (white guy) is horrible. Rude...condescending.....and has totally made me never want to come here again. He treats his customers like they are doing you a favor when you dine. Not good business.

42.description: The food is soooo good!!!! And might I add fulfilling as well!! The atmosphere is also good every time I go! Oh and the biscuits are Definitely would recommend Pearls Place to anyone who wants to know a good breakfast/brunch spot.

23.description: We arrived on a Sunday and they had about a 30 minute wait.  We deemed this was pretty reasonable for a soul food cafe and the after-church crowd that was gathering.  We were seated within 30 minutes and had a choice of the buffet or entree.  The buffet line was long, so we decided to order.  The buffet had a price of about $20-25 which again is reasonable and you were asked to finish one plate before going back and getting another one.  We went with the entrees and ordered ox tails and neck bones and potatoes.  I've had a taste for neckbones but it's not something my kids eat, so this was perfect.  We also ordered the vegetable sampler for $10 - which is really a sides sampler.  We wanted to sample a few different things.  We had mac and cheese, yams, greens and corn bread dressing.  The mac and cheese and yams were on point!  The greens and corn bread were great once we added hot sauce and gravy, respectively.  However, I like how the waitress put it: this didn't come out of your kitchen so it won't be seasoned to your likings.  We have to make it so it appeals to the vast majority.  We were so stuffed we couldn't order dessert.  Of course, we didn't finish everything we ordered.  We'd definitely go back.

47.description: Not to be confused with Pearl's Southern Comfort located on the North Side, Pearl's Place is a hidden gem that "adventurous" Foodies must try!  I've passed by this place numerous times over the past 10 YEARS and in my "Bourgeoise" attitude, I cast this place as an anchor for a low-budget hotel.  I almost changed my mind about the low-budget Motel thing after I was served my scrumptious food!!I was here today celebrating the 22nd Anniversary Birthday of my BFF and College Roommate and we were not disappointed.  I wanted to pick a spot for Brunch that she could select from Breakfast Special to Lunch Savory and I hit it.  I'm not sure how this place stays in business!  She had the Country Fried Steak w/ Grits, Eggs, AND Pancakes, and I wanted breakfast so I chose the Buffet Option.First of all, I didn't realize that if you get the BUFFET, you can select from a personally made omelette, waffles, and pancakes [with the normal sides of grits, homemade potatoes, or rice], AND select from the "Soul Food" selection!!!!  I'm in Heaven!!  I got a omelette with veggies, mini-waffles, and CHICKEN from the soul food section!  B'day girl went for her fav - Country Fried Stead without gravy.  When her food arrived [and after my lingering conversation] she was able to cut that meat with little effort with a spoon!!  Long story short, don't let the ambiance discourage you, this place is IT!!!!

8.description: After an disappointing experience at Priscilla's in Hillside, I recalled my encounter with Pearl's Place in the Grand Boulevard neighborhood back in July 2013.  At that time I didn't officially join Yelp.  You know what?  I want to do Pearl's Place an honor this time because I want to recommend this place to my fellow yelpers.  If you want some southern food that can bless your body, mind, and soul in the city, my pick would be the Pearl's Place on Michigan and Pershing.  After parking our vehicle at the Amber Inn (a partner business) parking lot, our journey to the best soul food in the city began.  The entire place ran like a well-oiled machine.  We were taken care by Ms. Liz, who was one of the most professional, easy-going, and systematic servers we have ever met.  We forwent the lunch buffet ($13/person) and ordered a la carte instead.  My shrimp and cheesy grits with bacons and green onions was soul-fulfilling!  I've been craving for shrimp and grits (one of my favorite southern-food specialities) for quite some time.  The shrimps were cleaned thoroughly and de-tailed; there was a balanced amount of "melt ability" between cheese and grits.  I was so glad that I satiated my crave this afternoon.  Hubby also had a quality catfish sandwich.  Liz kindly informed him that the Brussels sprouts weren't available, yet he could have a choice of another side.  Hubby then received a cup of rice with gravy.  By the way, their coleslaw and gravy were quite delicious as well.  The adjacent patrons went with the lunch buffet option.  I would say it's worth the price if you come hungry.  One of the unique features at Pearl's Place is that the chefs behind the buffet bar serve each plate for you.  Trust me, every plate is filled to its full-capacity and will make you "incapacitate" (hopefully in a good way) after several plates from the buffet bar.  I know some reviewers have mentioned the surroundings and the neighborhood itself.  Yes, it's a "bare-looking" neighborhood, but I feel fine walking on the streets from and to the train station (CTA Indiana Green line station is in a very close proximity) during day-time.  Nevertheless, free parking is more than sufficient at the Amber Inn lot.  Come as you are!  Overall, we spent $20 (not including tax and tip) and our stomaches were "soul-ly" happy.  Give Pearl's a try, and let me know what you think.

31.description: Disgusting food and even more disgusting service. Food had a dead bug in it. Called and spoke to owner who hung up on me. I will NEVER go back there. Find somewhere else to eat!!

34.description: I ate here one Sunday afternoon with a group of 12 because my father in law swore by this place. We didn't make reservations so being we had so many in our party, we had an hour long wait ahead of us. Was slightly frustrating, but it was VERY crowded so I kinda overlooked that. Once we were seated, the waitress was very attentive, informative, and personable without being an annoyance. The food was on point, and the ambiance of the joint paid homage to the great jazz and blues artists of the 40s, 50s, and 60s. Did i mention the parking was free? Which is a growing rarity in Chicago for restaurants. The cornbread had actual corn in it and was quite delicious I must say, and they serve breakfast all day which always gets extra points in my book. Location wasn't bad either, being about 2 blocks off the expressway.My only real gripe was I felt the buffet was a little overpriced. $19 for all you can eat when the portions for the entrees that were off the menu were generous enough to fill you up anyway. For $18, I got an entree AND a dessert and walked outta there stuffed!!The crowd and the wait was a bit annoying and long so I would suggest that you don't go there with small children or if you're in a rush, or if you're so hungry you have to eat immediately. Great spot to catch a bite with old friends or even for a first date.

16.description: The husband and I have been here twice during the week for a late breakfast. We arrived in time for the changeover to the buffet from the breakfast seating.Pearl's Place has very good grits, good biscuits, good soft scrambled eggs, an egg white option, very good coffee, and very good sweet potato pie with a somewhat tougher crust than my mother made. When you are seated you are given a cute oval very good not too sweet pan cornbread to share. The food offerings appear to be basic own home would food. The buffet had two kinds of greens, omelettes made to order, but was a steeper price at $13 than we wanted to pay not including beverages or all of the wonderful southern dessert options. The husband, in general, is opposed to cafeteria style serving as am I given my experience as a server whilst in undergrad! Something about obviously made ahead food is less appealing to us.Jasmine G and Vonja give friendly, menu knowledgeable, customer-oriented service.  In general all staff are very helpful and hospitable.Pearl's Place is undergoing a remodel whilst still in business.  The decor reflects the history of jazz, Bronzeville, and is interestingly eclectic and obviously the items on the walls come from a collection accumulated through the years. I will enjoy seeing what the remodel update brings, but I hope it includes a more aesthetically pleasing display of the artifacts on the walls today with perhaps an expansion of the collection with labels telling the history of each item! I've taken the time to look at them and I like and enjoy them.Pearl's Place provides good comfort soul food and breakfast in a shabby environment with excellent customer service. I recommend it if you are in the neighborhood, but until after the remodel is complete, cannot suggest making a special trip to try.Free parking in lot shared with co-located hotel. No validation is required during the week.

13.description: This is one of the best kept secrets on the south side. The fried chicken wings are good but the biscuits and corn bread are the hot topic on this menu. The buffet is affordable and delicious. Breakfast is available all day! This is like a family place and the waig staff is attentive.

11.description: I ate here a few times last year. I ordered their chicken, cabbage, mac and cheese, red beans, and their greens and everything was delicious. I also tried their gumbo but was not pleased because it was so dark in color and very salty, I almost suffered from a stroke. I like supporting soul food based resturants and will continue doing so but I want to be that one of many people that will help businesses strive for excellence so my opinion is not to tear down but to provide constructive criticism for whatever it's worth. I believe that Pearl's Place possess so many tasteful recipes for soul food and will definitely be the most popular restaurant in Chicago that serves soul food. However, I feel that most of their dishes are precooked and then frozen for later. Pearl's Place, don't rob yourself of the gift that you have. Invest the money, time, and talent into serving fresh food to your customers. We love you and we want to see your business grow. The food is the reputation not the name or the history, or how long it's been standing.

39.description: Wow, this place had so many food options! The buffet was hot and tasty. I probably had too much food, but I couldn't help myself. All of the home cooked meals reminded me of being down South.

37.description: Worst experience I ever had at a restaurant. Waitress offered us a lunch Buffett at the price of $10 then we got to the register and they said it was $15. I spoke with the waitress and she had the worst attitude and said "you know it's $14 right?" And rolled her eyes. I could not believe how I was treated. Then I spoke with the manager who talked to me as if I was a child and did not care to resolve the issue as well. He acted as if I was wrong for believing the price the waitress told me. The other manager made a joke of the whole thing while the staff laughed in our faces at the register. They don't care about customer service at all. I will never go to the place again. The food was bland and the meat was dry. Definitely not worth the trip. Chicago home of chicken and waffles is way better and has excellent customer service.

0.description: Delicious food, cheap prices, amazing staff. *Full disclosure, your homemade mac n cheese is probably better than theirs but you couldn't make it for anywhere near the price. I will be back for sure!

38.description: Today my my best girlfriend and I went to Pearls place for lunch and we had a great experience. We were greeted immediately, the host that seated us was polite, our waitress was very pleasant and attentive without hovering. The food was DELICIOUS! I had the smothered chicken with Mac n cheese, cornbread dressing and collard greens. My friend had the seafood platter with perch, HUGE shrimp, a salmon croquet patty, mac n cheese and collard greens. The complimentary biscuits and cornbread were also tasty. I definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who want some delicious soul food with good service. The portions were not skimpy either.

51.description: My boyfriend and I had a great experience at Pearl's.  The area is definitely sketchy but do not be discouraged. I was initially hesitant after reading the reviews, I went in expecting bad attitudes and a long wait at the omelette station but it was everything but ! Our server was pleasant and kept the water coming. We went on a Friday morning and opted for the breakfast buffet which was $10 and well worth it. My boyfriend was a fan of the biscuits, he ate them with no butter or jelly so it was that good! We will definitely return.

27.description: I think of myself as sort of an expert when it comes to soul food.  This place is for real.  Somebody in there has to be from South Carolina or Georgia or something.  This will definitely be a stop for me when I return to Chicago!

32.description: Cornbread: greatDirty rice: spectacular Greens: amazingCabbage: absolutely wonderful Catfish nuggets: pretty much perfect!Jerk ribs: mine were a little dry, but sauce was tasty!Candied Yams: scrumptious Mac & cheese: TO DIE FOR!!!!! I cannot WAIT to get back!

54.description: The food is excellent, but the phone service no so... I call to place an order for delivery and the man who answer was very rude and said they are not taking any orders,, what kind of business that don't take orders. I had a very big order, seems like a business would want "money" .  This was a first.

48.description: Nice place for a home cooked meal and relaxed atmosphere!  Reminds me of lunch at the 5 and Dine with my grandma!  First time I stopped here but won't be my last!  Being from North Dakota this is my first true southern style buffet and I loved it......Selection was huge.

44.description: Food is decent, love the special on Wednesday where the children eat free. Plus the different deals that they offered on Groupon which brought me to the location. Is a great place to take your guess who are visiting Chicago. Nice atmosphere.

24.description: Quick take: a very solid southern style brunch, will  return. Pearls offers lots of yummy foods like biscuits, fluffy pancakes and waffles, and crispy bacon. But the fried chicken is a clear winner - we went back to the breakfast buffet for 5 rounds and left a little chicken graveyard at the table. Also, I don't know if comments pertaining to poor service are still relevant (at least for brunch). We've been twice and had great, courteous service both times!

7.description: The Smothered Pork Chops Are To Die For, seasoned well and so tender they melt in you mouth. The macaroni and cheese is awesome and the yams are delish. I eat here often and they cater my annual Christmas party for my 55 associates and THEY LOVE IT !!!
