49.description: Took an out of town guest and my brother to the restaurant.  It was Murphy's Law in action.  We decided to order from the menu as opposed to ordering from the buffet.  First mistake.  Our waiter after taking order stated that he would bring cornbread to the table.  After waiting approximately 10 plus minutes he returned and stated that the oven was not working and that was the reason for the delay.  We waited approximately 35-40 minutes for our meal.  During this time the manager came over and asked all was okay - we would complain of long wait and say he would check on the food - and come back and state it was coming.  Nothing ever offered for inconvenience.  By the way, during the wait, after about 15 minutes the waiter came back to the table and stated that the restaurant no longer had what my brother ordered.  he then changed his order.  When the orders came, both my order and my brother's order were not correct.  However, I must admit that the food was good - once it came.  After paying the bill and about to exit the premise, the waiter stated that he had given us the wrong bill - because my brother had to change the order (6 additional dollars) - and gave us the correct bill.  I paid the difference.  (You would think with all the problems we had the manager who was there with the waiter would have waived the difference).  instead, after we paid (the correct bill) he gave each of his his business card and asked us to come back again.  We all laughed as we walked out of the door.  Moral of the story - call in order for pick-up, but do not dine at restaurant.

40.description: What better way to start your day than breakfast at Pearls. The breakfast buffett is amazing with southern homestyle cooking in every bite.

53.description: Yep this place is the bomb you hear a must try. Plenty of food, a bit pricey but well worth it if you can take all that fried catfish, greens etc

30.description: I went to Pearl's on yesterday.  I had the Fried Chicken, which is never a disappointment; the collards, which were okay; the cabbage, which was great, and the candied sweet potatoes for my first plate.   Then I went back for the smothered pork chops, which were cooked to perfection.  The gravy made the pork chops were succulent and tender.  The cornbread dressing was okay.  I had the red velvet cake was moist.  I love the flavor and texture.  It was good.  I, always, have the buffet and have never been disappointed.

46.description: We are from Florida and really enjoy Southern Food when we can catch it. We went to Bill Winston's church which was awesome and made reservations for lunch, although I am not sure reservations were needed. If you make reservations they charge your card a $50 non-refundable deposit....so please show up. The exterior and neighborhood was not as bad as we thought from the reviews. When we arrived everyone was very friendly and showed us to our reserved table. Mark greeted us and had been in the restaurant business for 40 years. He was very attentive to our needs and kept our glasses full of water, although he did forget to get my tartar sauce for my cat fish nuggets. But when I reminded him, he was quick to accommodate.  We chose the buffet instead of the menu . Being from the south we really enjoyed the fried chicken. We were all dissapointed by the dressing as it seemed that either pickles or vinegar was spilled in it. The catfish nuggets were ok, the yams were very good. The cornbread with butter were great texture, even displaying real corn kernels, but there was something missing..probably a little salt, because it did not taste like cornbread. The jerk chicken was good and seasoned well. The collard greens did not taste like greens of the South but they were good. The corn was excellent! The turkey loaf was ok...something a as missing.For desert we got the chocolate cake with chocolate frosting, peach cobbler, sweet potato pie and the caramel cake. Thumbs up on the chocolate cake and the sweet potato pie (which was not too rich). The caramel cake was not moist and was very granular and hard. The peach cobbler had an overwhelming almond taste. Mark did replace the caramel cake and cobbler with sweet potato. Overall, we loved the service, everyone was very attentive. Mark was very nice and provided good service. The food was half and half, some good, some not so good.

1.description: YAY to biscuits. Neh to the buffett. All you can eat, but there is only a handful of items and you get tired pretty quick. You are better off ordering from the menu and getting one thing you like. The buffet has these things and that is it.Omelette stationWafflesGritsGreensSausage patties/linkshotlinksfried catfish nuggettschicken wingsrice and beanscorn beef hashhome fries

55.description: The breakfast buffet is delicious. I came here with a friend while staying at the amber inn and found the buffet style food to be truly comforting. I had an omelette which was made fresh for me on the spot along with some potatoes bacon ham waffles chicken and cornbread. For twelve dollars I was not dissapointed and would recommend this to anybody that needs a nice hardy southern style breakfast. Items that were delicious: the chicken and the waffles. Together, I felt joy.

9.description: The food is any soul food lovers dream. My spouse and I ended up at this restaurant by chance as another establishment we'd chosen had a wait time of 45mins for a party of 2. Again the food was GREAT as well as our server (her name escapes me); not to mention the rest of our time there. It was so great, I began to reconsider the venue for a dinner I'd host the next weekend for my grandmothers 80th birthday. Our current reservations were for an upscale restaurant in Tinley Park for a party of 15, however after my time here I felt my grandmother would appreciate the food here as a soul food connoisseur; most definitely a further drive from Three Oaks, MI but well worth it or so I thought. This place would not receive 5 stars from me with their current reservation policy. I've patronized an extensive amount of restaurants nationally and internationally as a travel agent. To be told by the restaurant mgr. that we'd have to pay everything up front for reservations without a private setting to say the least was absolutely absurd! I've managed 3 restaurants (all 3 stars and above) and what IS customary is to have the table prepped 30-45mins before group arrival and then to release the seats with group absence 30 minutes after no arrival. I neglected to inform him that I was also a restaurant manager but being argumentative wouldn't have changed either mind at this point. I will say however, to not tell a client what you believe is customary with opinions of unvalidated grandeur because "we have to be considerate of all of our guests", as he stated. To ask for nonrefundable money upfront sounds like the pitch at a burger joint, NOT at what I wanted to consider a 4 star place in a sketchy neighborhood; a hidden gem. I WILL be back but as a small party of 2-4. If my math serves me right, this establishment will miss out on an easy $325-350. Revisit your operations plan please. I'm sure I'm not the only prospective client to find your policies ridiculous.

25.description: This review isn't on the food. The food was great. Amazing buffet style. But the service is sub-par. The atmosphere/vibe in the restaurant is very negative. THE WHOLE STAFF has an attitude. & They play favorites. As my table was leaving.. The hostess asked us Loudly, did we tip our waitress? .... No.

12.description: We really enjoyed ourselves. The good was pretty good. Compared to McArthers I would go here for a more authentic try at soul food. (Not saying I won't go back to MA).The service was good. Our waiter had some good one liners that were very appropriate and made the experience more personalized.!

59.description: Hands down one of the must visited restaurants in Chicago ! All the food is mouth watering ! The staff is amazing and very helpful. The place had lots of tables. They even have a buffet if you want to pay for it. There prices are moderate and affordable. They have great dessert as well and even have whole cakes and pies that you can buy ! My favorite dish is their  liver and grilled onion dinner which is about $11 and worth every penny. Best soul food in the city !

21.description: Went there for breakfast.  The food was great (I had pancakes, eggs, sausage and potatoes).  It was seasoned well and very tasty.  The service was mediocre, it could have been better but maybe the server was having a bad day.  Will go again.

17.description: Nice place for a home cooked meal and relaxed atmosphere!  Reminds me of lunch at the 5 and Dine with my grandma!  First time I stopped here but won't be my last!  Being from North Dakota this is my first true southern style buffet and I loved it......Selection was huge.

10.description: After Thanksgiving food cravings led me to Pearls! I am so happy to have found this place esp. since it's a short commute from Hyde Park! Pros: Food, location, staffCons: no parking, currently doesn't sell alcoholic beverages but apparently that's changing soon, also the Jumbo Wings were huge but I steer away from chemically modified meat as I don't think quantity should supersede quality   Overall I would def. return

5.description: Do not even waste your time. I ate here about a year ago and the food was good, but tonight the food was cold, awkwardly seasoned, and mostly unavailable.  The buffet was without key soul food dishes when we arrived (no macaroni and cheese, fried chicken, jerk rib tips, black eyed peas etc). Also, there was only one woman who was serving food at the buffet (which is actually not a buffet, but an all-you-can eat cafeteria style station with slow service and old looking food). I had to ask the manager to send another person to assist with the serving because there was a line of 8 of us waiting for food without anyone to help us. After making several special requests with management and our waiter for the buffet to be restocked, the fried chicken was cold, the macaroni was watery with overlooked noodles, and the jerk rib tips were mushy and poorly seasoned. The server was polite and apologetic, however I suggest going down the street to Chicago's Home of Chicken and Waffles for consistent, fresh soul food.

3.description: Really great and attentive service from the entire staff. They're tech savvy, too, texting you when you're table is ready. My friend and I wanted to try their Southern lunch and we both left liking the food and loving the staff. You can either do their $14 buffet or order off their menu. My appetite in the morning is usually not as beastly as it is later in the day so I opted to just order my grub. I ordered the ham & egg sandwich & added some cheese for $8. It came on wheat bread and totally loaded with both ham and egg! So much protein was packed in, it was all falling out and made for a little side breakfast dish. Flavor was all good and the side portion of potatoes was yummy, too. For people who like peppers, it had chunks of red & green throughout with some onion, too. Peppers and onions are two of my least favorite foods so for me, the taste was too overpowering. Those biscuits though! Pearl's Place starts everyone out with a couple of fresh, warm and delicious biscuits that you can smother butter or jam on. Oh yessssssh. Those were some tasty buns.

35.description: Dress code posted on the door says no plain white t-shirt.  Didn't know and was turned away.  I am happy to know that the rules apply to everyone- I applaud management for the way they approached me and for being consistent and fair with their polices...I will be back in different clothes!

19.description: Cornbread: greatDirty rice: spectacular Greens: amazingCabbage: absolutely wonderful Catfish nuggets: pretty much perfect!Jerk ribs: mine were a little dry, but sauce was tasty!Candied Yams: scrumptious Mac & cheese: TO DIE FOR!!!!! I cannot WAIT to get back!

28.description: What can I not say about Pearl's?!? The biscuits -amazing. Do yourself a favor and get the shrimp and grits (they'll put the bacon on the side if you're not a pork eater). Cheese eggs, French toast that needs NO SYRUP because it's simply delicious the way it comes out to the table. If I lived near here I'd be huge because the food is that good. Run, don't walk to Pearl's!

45.description: I tried Pearls Place twice and so far I'm not a fan. They are ridiculously expensive, but I could get past that, if the food was good. They give you dry dressing (ask for gravy) and it is not good at all. Had it both times I went. I never thought I would hear myself say this but it was too much cheese in the mac n cheese. I found myself looking for more macaroni. Lol. The smothered pork chops, roasted turkey, and corn bread wasn't bad. To give you an idea about pricing - I ordered smothered pork chops, mac n cheese, greens with side of dressing $22. Second order was roasted turkey, dressing, greens, mac n cheese with side of candied yams $26. I'm not cheap by no means but really. I've had better at a reasonable price.

33.description: I discovered Pearl's Place recently based on a recommendation, and while I have lived on the south side for decades, I never knew about this restaurant which seems to be quite an institution.We went for the Sunday buffet, which was priced at $19!  I guess that's because they charge dinner buffet prices starting at 11:30 am.  So the $19 is something you may be able to get a better deal on by going on another day, but I thought the food was very good and still worth it, though obviously $19 is a little steep.I am a sucker for decent ribs at an all you can eat place and I am a sucker for good greens anytime, and Pearl's has both.  The greens were very nice and I loved the ribs, which were the "fall off the bone" type with a decent amount of sauce, and a very pleasant sauce I would say.I was a real fan of the way they seasoned the food in general, which I would say was "not overseasoned." I find that way too many restaurants out there nowadays are trying to "wow" you with obvious andoften annoying flavors that I would call overseasoned, or maybe just over-done is a better word.Pearl's is not like this and the food is simple and very good, and the flavors are delicious and succulent, but also unsurprising - and not in a bad way. Like eating a great home-cooked meal, which can have incredible flavor but is not "overdone."Most items on the buffet were *not* spicy, which is refreshing since nowadays it seems every restaurant is trying to blow your doors off with heat too!  That's not to say there weren't any spicy items but this time I didn't try any of those and I was perfectly happy and felt I had a lot to choose from.One alert is that they have a no-waste policy, so that if you take food you are expected to eat it!  I've never heard of an all you can eat place telling you this, but I thought this was excellent, as one of the reasons *not* to go to an all you can eat place is the kind of gross, gorging on food you see, and the massive waste, and I think this policy of Pearl's helps with that, because though it was all you can eat, the environment remained decent and tasteful.  So these things are all great, but as to things that were a little off the ideal mark, I thought the sweet potatoes were just OK as they seemed to have sugar heavily added. These were like eating candy instead of food. In general I don't like a ton of sugar *in* my food.  Slightly related to sugar in food, there was one issue I had that came to light when I was getting my ribs:  they told me that when you go up to the counter to get food everything you get needs to be on one plate, and frankly that's fine but I don't like things with a strong sauce, like ribs, mixing with other food items. So the employees had to cheat to give me a small separate bowl for the ribs when I asked. Had they followed the rules, it would have made life harder for me as I would have had to make two visits to the counter to get the ribs on a separate plate.  And mind you I was only asking for a small amount of ribs. I was not trying to get massive quantities of food; I just wanted a little separation for the ribs. Note the buffet counter has servers and there was usually a small line. So this kind of thing could be annoying, and while in general I understand and even like such a rule, I would say maybe they can make a small exception for foods that involve liquids and a very distinct sauce like ribs, or maybe they just always allow you to get something in one small bowl that is placed onto the plate.  That seems still in keeping with the rule.One final mention I'd like to give was the rice, which I thought stood out and had a great and somewhat complex flavor and was really, really good.  I didn't expect the rice to be as good as it was here and this was another demonstration that someone very competent is in the kitchen.On the staff, they were all extremely considerate, and I don't think any thing more needs to be said there.  They were great.So overall I was very happy to find this gem on the south side and next time I want to see if the lunch buffet is a little better on value, so I hope to update this review soon...

43.description: The waiter's and service staff were incredibly nice and courteous they exhibited some of the best customer service I have experienced in a long time. The decor was a bit to be desired though, but the food was surprisingly good.

2.description: I went with a friend to their New Year's Day Buffet after reading everyone's positive reviews. Sadly, everything that we ate at the buffet was either over seasoned, salty, or sweet.  Perhaps the food from the buffet is different then when you order from the menu?  Polite and exceptional service from our waitress and buffet staff.

18.description: Awesome low-key comfort food. We had the breakfast buffet, well worth the $11. The chef and waitress were genuinely friendly and gave excellent service. The manager helped the chef out when the orders piled up and also went around to each table asking how everyone's breakfast was. The biscuits were the best part!!

41.description: Where to begin. My first time visiting this place the food was great, however it has gone down hill since. I really do like the staff upfront. They are great, however the food is not consistent. My second visit, the dressing was over cooked and very salty. The Mac and cheese tasted like it was days old. Third visit, the green did not taste seasons at all. The only food that remains the same every time is the caramel pound cake, which is absolutely delicious. I have been told ,it depends on what day of the week you visit, and what time of day you go. I believe food should be consistent at all times, and not vary too much.

52.description: Good news first the chicken meal is out of this world delicious! Yams perfect, greens awesome, Mac n cheese - done right! The banana pudding however missed the mark by a mile. They claim it is home made but it tasted like store bought pre made pudding with lemon extract to cover the taste; more lemon than banana flavor. So thumbs up for the meal and thumbs down for the pudding.

50.description: This is my first time eating here since the dining room renovation. The dining room is still under construction such as the bar area,  but it appears it will be smaller than what it was prior to the renovation. On to the next,  my wait time was no longer than 20 minutes on a Saturday morning which was not bad for dining for two. I opted not to do the breakfast buffet and order from the menu. I ordered the veggie omelet, grits and pancakes. The food was very basic, nothing out the ordinary at all. I was not impressed with the pancakes. They were very flat and dime sized, smaller than the size of a saucer. My grits were a little bit stiff and clumpy and I had to add quite a bit of salt to them for a decent taste. My omelet was loaded with veggies which I like and American cheese. I rate the food three stars but I up'd it one star because the service was good.

4.description: WOW this place is amazing.  Don't let the sketchy neighborhood scare you off-- and don't worry if you aren't black.  Just come hungry.  Everything we had was soooo good!  Pearl's serves breakfast until 2pm, so if you go for lunch, you can actually have breakfast also.  The buffet is all you can eat, $14 for adults, less for kids.  There is absolutely no way you could leave in any condition other than STUFFED.  Standouts: fried chicken, yams, mac and cheese, rib tips, egg dishes which are made-to-order.  They also have pies for sale, the sweet potato is awesome.  We can't wait to go back!  But I think we need to hit the gym a few times before we return to Pearl's (smile)

6.description: When we showed up we told them we had a large party.  The restaurant was empty and they set up the table.  Then the hostess informed us that she could not seat us until our party was complete.  The manager/owner, JR, smugly stepped in and said they could seat us right away, but if the rest of our party shows up and there is a wait, they will have to wait to be seated until everyone on the wait list has been seated regardless if we had available seats at our table.  His logic made no sense.  The simple fact that JR could have been nicer, and less smug/"rude polite" and just let the hostess do her job.  We were fine with waiting until our party was complete.  We like the food, but in the future we will be taking our family get togethers elsewhere.

22.description: Good Food. Great Vibe. Wonderful Breakfast Buffet. But if you plan on Going on a Sunday, you better arrive Early.

15.description: Quick take: a very solid southern style brunch, will  return. Pearls offers lots of yummy foods like biscuits, fluffy pancakes and waffles, and crispy bacon. But the fried chicken is a clear winner - we went back to the breakfast buffet for 5 rounds and left a little chicken graveyard at the table. Also, I don't know if comments pertaining to poor service are still relevant (at least for brunch). We've been twice and had great, courteous service both times!

57.description: I was visiting from out of town and this place was recommended.  I am very happy it was. THE FOOD WAS DELICIOUS AND THE DESSERTS WERE OFF THE CHAIN!!!I tried the sweet potato pie and Peach Cobbler and They were finger lickin good!  There is enough  variety to satisfy any palate at this Gem in the hood located near the Bronzeville Area.

20.description: This is one of the best kept secrets on the south side. The fried chicken wings are good but the biscuits and corn bread are the hot topic on this menu. The buffet is affordable and delicious. Breakfast is available all day! This is like a family place and the waig staff is attentive.

36.description: I ordered a simple meal. Grits without butter, scrambled eggs mixed with cheddar cheese and potatoes. The grits I liked. The potatoes were warm then cold. The eggs, well let's just say my taste buds are finicky and one bite was not an enjoyable swallow.  I believe this place does well with patrons who enjoy eating fried foods and fried chicken. I don't eat either so I would assume simplicity would be a no brainer. Moving on to customer service: I gave extra stars  for the server Vonja. She was pleasant and explained the process of ordering to me without hesitation or attitude. Would I come back, yes but only if I didn't feel like driving farther for a meal.

14.description: The food was good.  I personally wasn't blown away but it was A-OK.  I was impressed with the buffet set-up.  There are servers to fix your plate.  There is a nice germ shield glass that separates the public from the food.  You just tell them what you want and they pile it on. Now this is a buffet I can frequent!

3.description: this place has grown leaps and bounds. they have everything for every one there. after work sets hiphop contest and performances parties for different age groups. May 8th i think is supposed to be a really big event. some of the best names in chicago hip hop( yes there is a chicago hip hop scene) will be there in full effect. I cannot wait!!! go check it out any night of the week saturdays 2nd one of the month are off the chain!!

1.description: So I went here last night for the first time. Apparently they're trying to convert this place from a coffee cafe to nightclub. It was nice. There was a blues band playing and free food. Chicken, Spaghetti, mashed potatoes and gravy. Supposedly the event was sponsored by Ciroc Vodka although I didn't see that much paraphernalia. There were also comedians (although they weren't very good. lol) There were also poker and blackjack tables set up in the back. They gave you play money and they were offering prizes. I thought it was really cute. Next Thursday they are having Patron Casino night. I think it's definitely a nice spot to just relax and chill with friends and enjoy a nice atmosphere.

2.description: So I went here on a Tuesday night- their hip hop/poetry open mike and it was filled with 18-early 20 yr olds who are trying out their rhyming skills via rapping or freestyling.  I would recommend this place to any one who wants to try out their rapping skills to a crowd because the environment is friendly and plus- there is no way you could do any worse so no intimidation by any means!  otherwise, I wouldnt recommend the place on a Tuesday.  there's a $5 cover and free if a performer

0.description: my girls and i ventured out one cold saturday evening...we ended up at the spoken word cafe.  now from reading others reviews it sounds like things have changed...yes, errr its been a few years and a two year old daughter later.  when we went there was a little of this and a little of that....the house of twang (house band at the time) entertained the crowd inbetween sets (loved them, errr and the hot guitarist).  i walked out of their crowned ghetto queen for the night.  they sang me a song and i got to wear a ghetto fab street cone painted silver on my head, lol.  it was fun.sounds like their confused on what they want to provide the community.  i would suggest they figure out which route their going to go and stick with it.  me? i prefer it a local hot spot for open mic talent!

1.description: Ghetto ghetto ghetto ghetto. Went in brought an item got to car received wrong item.  Was told they wouldn't do anything about it. Even though they gave me the wrong it. There prices are more expensive them other liquor stores. Wanted to argue with me over 6 dollars. I never understand dumb business that lose customers over nothing. Said. Will go to liquor store on 55 th and state. Prices and service much better.

0.description: visited on 12/22/13. when inquired about why my personal information was being written down (ID # and birthdate and credit/debit card #). Do not use your credit or debit card at this location...they write down your credit or debit card number with your ID number off your state/drivers  ID card. They are credit/debit card THIEVES.The people behind the counter are VERY VERY RUDE to customers. when you ask for the number to store owners they wont give it to you and will tell you to go shop elsewhere. PLEASE DO NOT SHOP HERE

28.description: Decent food and prices. Unfortunately service

1.description: Came on a quiet afternoon for a late lunch.Pluses: Server was attentive and sweet Parking was easy(no city meters!)The restaurant albeit dark was neat and tastefully decorated.Minuses:More lounge feel than restaurant with TVs and music that can distract from conversation. My biggest criticism is the food taste and value-I'm picky about my Italian (as I am ItalIan heritage) and I was really excited to see what the interpretation of my familial cuisine would be.Unfortunately, I found the saltiness of the food offputting. But there was a zest to the diavolo which was good and familiar. The fried ravioli came just thrown on an overly large plate which presentation wise was a little sloppy. The ravioli came smooshed in a small bowl with marinara rather than the advertised vodka sauce. The ravioli were light and delicate but were a bit overwhelmed by the sauce. My companions food was similarly plated and he also noted that everything was a little too heavy on salt.The prices were quite high when you factor in that there is neither bread nor salad included with any entree which is quite unusual in the realm of a restaurant advertising itself as Italian. Nothing was awful, but nothing was memorable enough to warrant the higher end price point.Honestly I truly hate to write a negative review, and some of this may be due to a bad day in the back of the house, the front of the house did a good job and I wouldn't take that away from them. But Truth is required to receive my truthful review and I feel like the trajectory of this establishment leans more towards appetizer/bar food and social gathering place with an Italian twist rather than a stand alone Italian restaurant.

9.description: Went with a friend for dinner and, overall, I think this would be a good place to come for drinks and apps and watch the Bulls or Bears, but I wouldn't return for dinner.  On the plus side, there was prompt, friendly service, plenty of free street parking, nice bar area with plenty of comfortable stools.  The place is small and they have about 10 Tvs all on the same channel at a high volume so it's great to hear the game, but the TV, in combination with the music they also have going makes it challenging to have a conversation. So, that's a plus for the sports bar, downside for the restaurant vibe or romantic night out.  There are a variety of items on the menu, but when we were there, several items were not available due to some issue in the kitchen. This was disappointing, but can happen anywhere. The portion size is good, food well presented, and the price point fair.  I had the shrimp which was fabulous.  My friend had penne pasta which was just OK.  It seems they are trying to be both a sports bar and an Italian restaurant , but in such a small space, I don't think it works that well for the restaurant patrons.

29.description: Stopped by for dinner on a Friday recently and had the Calamari as my starter followed by the Sea Bass special and Lemon Poundcake for dessert. I also tried the house drink, Cognac Iced Tea and although  it was refreshing, I prefer a drink with a little more to it. However, my wife enjoyed it. All in all it was an enjoyable experience with good service and food along with a gracious host and owner, Peyton, that stopped by the table and even provided a tour of the soon to be outdoor patio area.  The Truth is a welcomed addition to the Bronzeville dining scene.

23.description: I visited this Establishment on Friday 08/28/2015 for a Birthday Dinner. I was very disappointed from the time I walked in the door to the time that I left. First Bad sign was that The Owner being Payton has no sense of being a Business owner or a Hostess. Her Bartender really needs to go back to bartending School because She did not have a clue as to how to make a Drink. Someone in our party asked for a Black Martini and She had to ask how to make it and then She asked the Person if they wanted it in a Martini Glass!!!!!                                        When She did finally make the Martini there was No Olives in there....Who does that???? Secondly the Service is Horrible. We waited 2 Plus hours for our Food without even a Piece of Bread for the Table and when She decided to bring My food out at the 11th hour,We asked about some Bread and We were told that the Cook did not make Any Bread because they were focusing on our food that still had not come out,by this time I decided to cancel My food, so then Twenty minutes later after I had canceled My food which was 2 plus hours later,The owner decides to come over and ask Me again if I still wanted my food because it was Plated and waiting on me.....NO I said. At that point She got mad and walked away without ANY Apoligizes and then a few minutes later came back and asked us to move so that She could sit a party of 4 because she wanted them to sit together and who had just walked in, mind you we had been there a few hours still spending Money on Beverages and still no food. It was a very nice Place but the Customer service is TERRIBLE and from My understanding the Food is NOT GOOD.I wouldn't know because I never got the chance to eat.I was told that the Calamari was Good. She might want to focus on being a Sports bar with Appetizers instead of Trying to be a ITALIAN RESTAURANT. In the end the Owner never tried to Apologize or at the least give any percentage off of the bills.BTW Our party had around 25 people in it. First and Last time visiting that Establishment...I hope that She get it together and Make it because I am All about Supporting Black Owned Business in My City of Chicago.....

5.description: Ooh weee I just love this spot great food drinks, service with lots of smiles. And the music is OMG I could just sit in there for hours grooving to the smooth tunes!! My Steak was delicious but the Pork Chops had me tip the Chef.. & mind u the owner. ..

31.description: Truth Italian resteraunt was a pleasant surprise.  The bruschetta is to die for. We were slightly disappointed with the calamari.  But the owner quickly satisfied our concerns. Nice music played in background as we dined. The pineapple long island was awesome. Will definitely come back.

25.description: My new favorite haunt!  Great neighborhood bar.  Chill atmosphere and good music.   Cheap drinks and a new patio opening soon.  This will be an even better place when the expansion is done!  Could be great for wedding receptions/catering too.  And the owner is incredibly wonderful.  Thanks to the whole staff.

12.description: I have tried several entrée and main courses each were superb. Unsurpassed atmosphere and their staff is very attentive with each patron. I have become a regular customer.

37.description: TRUTH ITALIAN CUISINE RESTAURANTI had the pleasure of attending a political fundraiser one day last week after work for the esteemed Judge Freddrenna M. Lyle (5th Sub-Circuit, Circuit Court of Cook County) at Truth Italian Cuisine located at 65 East Pershing Rd. in the Bronzeville community on the near south side of Chicago. This establishment has been opened approximately one month. Judge Lyle served a buffet. I asked to speak to the Head Chef who willingly came out and told me that the buffet was comprised of items from the menu. This is what was served: two trays of perfectly prepared not too al dente Penne Pasta, one with Marinara Sauce, and the other with Vodka Sauce--there were also trays of their scrumptious Meatballs and Italian Sausage, enabling you to create your own pasta dish; sautéed Tilapia prepared Lemon Piccata style with capers as I recall--fresh & flakey; and Chicken Scarpiello-- sautéed chicken breast served in a delectable white wine sauce. Guess what??? The food was OUTSTANDING!!!!! I noticed that they have an upstairs banquet/reception room, and a HUGE enclosed patio outside that is simply awaiting installation of the gates. Folks I am glowing on the food, and given that Bronzeville is an up and coming community rebounding to its glory days, stay tuned for more great things from this establishment!

21.description: Tonight was my second time going. The location is awesome and so is the parking. The decor is very nice. My first visit was for drinks after work and I had a pleasant experience, so when it was suggested to go for dinner I was open to it. (I didn't eat the first time, just mingled). Tonight there was some type of event happening and the majority of the crowd was there for it. Me and my friends were there for dinner and conversation. At one point the host of the event stated speaking to the entire room, so we were not able to talk to each other.  Since I was not a participant of their program it really ruined our girls night agenda. It would have been better if we were seated off to the side or told upon entering that the party was going to be loud so we could have decided if we wanted to stay. Since I was the last of my party to arrive, everyone had their water already. I asked the server three times for water before I finally got some. I ordered the penne with Italian sausage and diavolo sauce and the zucchini appetizer. Both dishes were mediocre at best. The zucchini was lacking salt/seasoning. The breading was crispy and a little oily and BLAND. The diavolo sauce tasted like prego. It wasn't nasty, but it did not start as fresh tomatoes and garlic and basil. It started in a can/jar. The dish was super basic as well as the plating. I got my food and was done eating before the rest of the food came for the table. When I asked for a to go box, I waited so long I just left the food on the table. Our server was bad. She walked by our table numerous times and had to be asked numerous times for things. I wanted to love this place. I really did. However, I did not. I will not be returning. The food was uber basic and not seasoned and the service was awful. The best thing about this place is the decor. I think if there is an overhaul, it would be worth trying because I would hate for it to close but I couldn't patronize this place without MAJOR changes.

16.description: The ambiance of the place is outstanding. Very welcoming. The food was great. I had the pasta with the spicy marinara sauce. I also added the turkey sausage on the side. Delicious!! The waitress was very kind and answered all questions. I would come again. They have big screen TVs, if you enjoy watching games. Very clean.

17.description: I was here on a Wednesday evening; so it was full but not busy. The bartender was very slow, but service was friendly and personable. I had fish tacos and they were pretty good. The music is nice and atmosphere is mature and relaxed. I wish this place had opened before I moved to the burbs. I would like to come back and try a few more food items, all in all its a nice place. I'm hoping that at some point very soon, they get an additional bartender and server. I love that the Bronzeville area has a great lounge like this, such a welcomed addition!

10.description: Great place the staffed friendly. Food is delicious. The HD TVs are great for watching the game. You can also rent the place for private events. Yelp will get 2 stars for making write a book about a place!!!

11.description: Let me start this review off by stating: I WANT TO SEE TRUTH WIN!!!I was quite disappointed with my evening at Truth. Instead of giving a play-by-play of events- I'd rather list pros and cons.Pros: 1) They have very reasonable prices. This is a good option if you're on a budget but still want to dine out.2) No parking issue. You should be able to find plenty of parking without having to bend the block numerous times. There's also plenty of parking on residential streets.Cons:1) Limited menu items: Often times when I dine in restaurants with a limited menu- the food is very good and quite memorable. Unfortunately none of the food we ordered was worth a return visit. Suggestion- create a good wine listing insert for your menu. Most Italian restaurants have great wine options to complement the cuisine. I would suggest a minimum of 12-15 strong options, w/ regions ranging from Chile to of course Italy. Also- some Italian dessert options would be great (I.e. gelato, tiramisu, various pastries) and coffee (I.e. cappuccino and espresso) is strongly advised.2) No order: I was very pleased to see a full house when I visited, but was disappointed that we had to stand in the doorway and wait to spot someone to seat us. The waitress they had on duty was not good. The owner of the establishment did a great job in assisting her server. Suggestion- please hire a hostess to meet and greet patrons upon their arrival, coat check if needed, and provide seating. I think 2 servers should be on hand to provide accurate and prompt service. I'd like to see the owner suited and booted, and out on the floor mingling and thanking patrons. Although a real boss has to be ready to roll up their sleeves at any given moment- it would've been nice to see the boss looking like an owner rather than a waitress. Also- don't bother taking reservations. I made an 8:30PM reservation, but it was not referenced when we were finally greeted. I didn't even see a reservation book on hand.3) It's a sports bar: The establishment is a sports bar that features Italian cuisine. If you're looking for fine Italian dining that offers traditional restaurant decor- this is not the place for you. We counted 8 flat screens TV's (one including a 65inch). The bar occupies the bulk of this small establishment. In fact- the first thing our waitress asked was "what would we like to drink?" We had to request water half way through our meal. I really hope Truth does well. Well enough to open a second location that is a traditional restaurant that offers more upscale Italian cuisine.

26.description: Truth was referred to me by a classmate from the Atgeld Garden Alum and I was very pleased with the food and ambience. Staff was friendly and pleasant. Timing can improve

27.description: Truth is a nice addition to Bronzeville. I drove past the place a few times and didn't realize it was a restaurant or even an Italian restaurant until a neighbor mentioned it. The signage out front is not particularly clear and I incorrectly assumed it was a hair salon. The atmosphere was lively and festive when we went. It had more of a lounge/bar feel than restaurant but I liked the vibe. It's a nice space that's well designed. The waitress and owner, who stopped by our table to say hello, were very friendly. It seemed like the waitress was new because she didn't do the small things a pro does like checking if there was anything else we wanted to order before walking away (we did and one person hadn't even ordered anything) and asking if we wanted another drink when finished with the first. No big deal but we needed to speak up. It wasn't awkward because she was friendly and nice. The food was good but not outstanding. I'm going to skip the calamari next time. It was a good meal and good experience overall so we will be back.

35.description: Great experience! Great food and great service. The staff was professional and they played great music.

8.description: I visited Truth with my boyfriend for an early dinner/late lunch on Sunday. We started with the calamari which was pretty good - no tentacles if you don't care for them. He ordered the chicken Alfredo which was amazing. It has a bit of spice and the sauce is not overpowering the noodles (served with penne rather than fettuccine which I thought worked great). I ordered the chicken scarpiello (Sp?). It was ok. Huge portion and I liked being able to substitute turkey sausage for Italian sausage. I would definitely comeBack and order the chicken alfredo!! Very nice addition to the area!!

0.description: Cute little spot! I live down the street and wanted to check them out so me and some of my Soror went after our chapter meeting. We ordered several appetizers that included: chicken wings, toasted ravioli, breaded zucchini, calamari, and seasoned kale w/ bread chips. All of those were great.  For my entree I got the Chicken Alfredo with spinach. It was delicious. It has a little heat to it but it wasn't too much. Someone else ordered the Chicken Parmesan which looked good and the another person order the chicken house salad which was huge. They said both of those were good. Another guest had a different pasta dish which they enjoyed too. They also have a daily $5 drink special when you order a entree.                   My only suggestion for this place is better outside signage. I had to explain to my Sorors exactly where it was because the sign wasn't as clear nor was it lit up on the night we came. The windows are tinted and the writing on the window is very small that you can't read it from your car. I think this is a great little gem for the Bronzeville neighborhood and I will definitely be back and will  tell my friends.

38.description: Great place the staffed friendly. Food is delicious. The HD TVs are great for watching the game. You can also rent the place for private events. Yelp will get 2 stars for making write a book about a place!!!

20.description: I have tried several entrée and main courses each were superb. Unsurpassed atmosphere and their staff is very attentive with each patron. I have become a regular customer.

19.description: The Atmosphere was very pleasant, and the food was Amazing. My party had Calamari, Salmon, party wings and Chicken Penne Pasta. Owner and waitress were very welcoming. Will be returning soon.

33.description: The food and drinks were amazing. The customer service was awesome and I definitely will be making this my girls night hang out and date night for me and my hubby!!

2.description: I visited Truth last night for the first time. I live only a few blocks from the restaurant, was happy to see it open and had been excited to try it out. The restaurant is pretty small, but cozy and nicely decorated. The bar is very inviting and there are plenty of tvs if you're interested in watching a game. I ordered the chopped salad, as I'm trying to eat a little more healthy. This may actually be the first time I've ever ordered a salad for dinner at a restaurant (I don't really care for them). Luckily this salad was great. It tasted fresh, had a lot of flavor with the chicken and feta, and the texture was good. I'm looking forward to going back to try more menu items. I'd definitely recommend this restaurant to neighborhood residents. If we support new businesses, more will come.

34.description: Definitely not my idea of an Italian restaurant. The service was good but the food was mediocre. As for their drinks, my girlfriend and I were served their "special iced cognac tea" and the "tea" was a complete fail! Neither of us were able to taste the tea nor the alcohol. Unfortunately, good service isn't enough to keep my business.

32.description: I LOVE this restaurant! The antipasto vegetables were fresh and crisp! I couldn't get enough of the spinach bufala cheese ravioli...O.M.G. Every time I have come here,  the service has been phenomenal--the food and drinks exquisite. This spot is a definite for a night out with that special someone. The owner, Peytyn, is an absolute delight. This restaurant is truly a gem of the 3rd Ward!

18.description: The food was great, however it took too long to receive  items such as bread, and ended up eating and paying before receiving what we asked for. Not too fond of the owner massaging myself and my man during the table visit either. There are ways to make guests feel welcomed without invading personal space and unwanted or requested touching. They need a drink menu and or dessert menu available or just a note saying it is available upon request. This is more of a bar that sells good Italian food, rather than a Italian eatery.

13.description: Truth is a nice addition to Bronzeville. I drove past the place a few times and didn't realize it was a restaurant or even an Italian restaurant until a neighbor mentioned it. The signage out front is not particularly clear and I incorrectly assumed it was a hair salon. The atmosphere was lively and festive when we went. It had more of a lounge/bar feel than restaurant but I liked the vibe. It's a nice space that's well designed. The waitress and owner, who stopped by our table to say hello, were very friendly. It seemed like the waitress was new because she didn't do the small things a pro does like checking if there was anything else we wanted to order before walking away (we did and one person hadn't even ordered anything) and asking if we wanted another drink when finished with the first. No big deal but we needed to speak up. It wasn't awkward because she was friendly and nice. The food was good but not outstanding. I'm going to skip the calamari next time. It was a good meal and good experience overall so we will be back.

4.description: I was sooooooo disappointed this place didn't deliver better for the Bronzeville area. The website is sexy, alluring, and speaks to all of your senses. However, overall, this place fell really flat on its face.Arrival: I walked in and had no clue of what to do (neither did my dining companion). We just sat down and hoped for the best.Decor: It has a very loungy feel with the bar being the focal part of the restaurant. If you were dining, your table was covered with white linens. So there was almost like alternating tables between those dining and those hanging out. Equally interesting was that music was playing, connected to someone's phone not put on silent. It rang no less than 4 times! Uhm... who does that?Service: Our waiter was a gem. She tried her best and provided recommendations and you can tell she knew the menu, cocktails, and other tips. Food: This also fell pretty flat. The calamari seemed to be the frozen kind. All rings and "canned" coating so to speak. Think of the chicken rings from White Castle. I ordered the salad with chicken, which was pretty average. I mean I expected something much different. This entree was something I'd get from a local deli, not an Italian restaurant. My friend had a dish that looked pretty sad as well. I can't recall the name, but I plate food better than that.The straw that broke the camel's back.. They turned on Empire on all TVs up pretty loud. I mean again is this a restaurant or a lounge? I guess maybe my expectations are too high... Ultimately, if this place was positioned as a lounge, then I'd be more forgiving, but it's not and therefore I cannot really say I'd go back for food.. I'm hesitant to go back for drinks. They seem to have a big patio.. so maybe I'll give it another try next summer.

24.description: Food is solid. Mushroom ravioli is one of the best dishes on menu. Carmel cake was outstanding. The spaghetti leaves a bit to be desired and the spinach was undercooked.Service was great! Owner very friendly. Great atmosphere and nice decor. I will definitely be back.

6.description: Music was sultry.Chicken Scapiello was Delish,Service was sweet! Ambiance here is grown n sexy,perfect for any night- ladies night,date night,after work relaxation

22.description: Hi, I meet with Peytyn W. Two weeks prior to see if she could accommodate a party of 30 for a birthday celebration.   I live in the neighborhood and was happy to hear that it was a black owned restaurant in the Bronzeville area!   Anyhow, Peyryn assured me that all 30 people could come in Friday August 28th at 7pm.   I called her the day before to confirm again my party of 30 guest, the owner Peytyn said it was good to go.  Me and the birthday person showed about about 6:30pm on Friday and none of the staff knew anything about my party of 30.  So I called Peytyn again to ask her if it was a go and informed her that none of her staff knew of the party of 30 and her reply was that they didn't need to know that she had it all under control.   Her manager (her daughter) started to put reserved signs on the available tables.  It's a small place and I never expected her to lose money or kick anyone out that had sat down before us because I didn't rent the place out, BUT WAS TOLD THAT WE WOULD BE ACCOMMODATED.  After the tables was set up, we were told that we wouldn't all get out food out at the same time.  I was fine with that at least some of my guest had food then it would be fine.  We ordered drinks and bread.  The bread NEVER came.   I hour had passed....we started asking the servers and Peytyn how much longer for our food or at least the bread...we were told that the owner felt that it was more important to just fix our food and had CANCELED the bread, the bread had to be cooked and cut!   Wow, nobody took time to inform us that we wasn't getting at least bread on the table with not ONE person had received a plate of food.  We are still buying drinks but no food.  No I think the drink tab would have been larger if people had food in their bellies but no food.   Peytyn keep coming around asking us we're we ok and people were saying NO they wanted the food.  THE BLAME was continently shifted to us by telling us we were a party of 30; a big party and they good was coming.   2 hours has past now, about 6 plates comes out.   Now mind you, other tables were receiving hot food, ate and left and we are still waiting on food.  The birthday girl was the last person to receive her  plate after I was totally irritated and told the owner that this was unacceptable.   She told me that she never knew it was her bday.   No The owner didn't REMEMBER.  I told her day one, I told the day before when I confirmed, I told her when she arrived additional there were 5 pink happy bday balloons on the table.  The only excuse that we keep getting was that we were a party of 30.  SMH, this owner never prepared for a party of 30...the cook didn't know, the servers didn't know and she obviously DID NOT CARE THAT WE SAT FOR almost 2 1/2 hours without food in her place.  It seems that 4 people could have gotten a plate then 4 more and so on... But that didn't happen.  It was a horrible experience!!  I saw that one of my guest also wrote a comment and the owner responded summing it up saying that we should have considered catering our party which was never offered!!!   If I was told the TRUTH that they could NOT accommodate a party of 30 we would have went somewhere else.  I guess she wanted our business but couldn't deliver a level of service that meet her decor!   It's pretty as hell in there but that's it!  I was so out done and disappointed.  Anybody that know me, know I'm a foodie!!  This was truly not the place to be.   I finally got the shrimp and apparatus that lack seasoning.  Yes they brought me a drink and yes the paid for the bday girls food.  But my entire party just hung in there because of the love we had for our bday party and we just wanted to support this black business.   She gave a lot of excuses and I really don't think she got it or received anything I said because we didn't talk before I left.   She's a sweetheart but I'm praying that she change some things up because she my friends will never be back.  I heard the salad and the eggplant was the bomb, bartender needs help, BEAUTIFUL BEAUTIFUL PLACE AND LOCATION.  COME ON PEYTYN lets work on bigger and better.   Don't let the spirit of offense offend you, just do better.

15.description: When I Say A MUST TRY .!!!!! I Mean That ! My Secret Hideout  Tonight I Visited Truth For The First Time & It Was AMAZING I Loved The Coziness Of This Place! It was a great vibe & had a very comfortable lounge feel to it. I tried  chicken scarpiello & wings ... I would not lie... It was like a party in my mouth .! Yum Yum! The bartender recommended the pasta and I Thank Her ! The wings were made with love, not just thrown together... I appreciate the meal can't wait to come back..! Peytyn (the owner) was nice & loving as well. It's Not Traditional, It's Modern, Tasty & Well Worth The Money Spent.! I Also Had The Long Island It Was Sooooo GOOD! & Strong .! Great Food, Music & Drinks What More Could You ask for? Very Proud Of This Place Simply Amazing

7.description: Tonight was my second time going. The location is awesome and so is the parking. The decor is very nice. My first visit was for drinks after work and I had a pleasant experience, so when it was suggested to go for dinner I was open to it. (I didn't eat the first time, just mingled). Tonight there was some type of event happening and the majority of the crowd was there for it. Me and my friends were there for dinner and conversation. At one point the host of the event stated speaking to the entire room, so we were not able to talk to each other.  Since I was not a participant of their program it really ruined our girls night agenda. It would have been better if we were seated off to the side or told upon entering that the party was going to be loud so we could have decided if we wanted to stay. Since I was the last of my party to arrive, everyone had their water already. I asked the server three times for water before I finally got some. I ordered the penne with Italian sausage and diavolo sauce and the zucchini appetizer. Both dishes were mediocre at best. The zucchini was lacking salt/seasoning. The breading was crispy and a little oily and BLAND. The diavolo sauce tasted like prego. It wasn't nasty, but it did not start as fresh tomatoes and garlic and basil. It started in a can/jar. The dish was super basic as well as the plating. I got my food and was done eating before the rest of the food came for the table. When I asked for a to go box, I waited so long I just left the food on the table. Our server was bad. She walked by our table numerous times and had to be asked numerous times for things. I wanted to love this place. I really did. However, I did not. I will not be returning. The food was uber basic and not seasoned and the service was awful. The best thing about this place is the decor. I think if there is an overhaul, it would be worth trying because I would hate for it to close but I couldn't patronize this place without MAJOR changes.

36.description: The service was mediocre and the food is below average. The food has poor presentation and does not come timely. This is not the place to come for dinner ...it serves the purpose if you're hungry but misses the mark of excellence. From a service perspective there is a lack of accountability.The space is beautiful and centrally located and that's the plus.

30.description: This place is horrible it took 30 minutes to recieve a 25 dollar plate of ramen noodles. I would give this place 0 stars if I could. The customer service was also horrible. I always love to support black owned businesses. I really hope they make some adjustments  so that the restaurant will be a success.

3.description: Truth had the potential to be a cool place. I think they should leave the Italian food alone and do bar bites or small plates.  All of the food I had was frozen or prepackaged.  I don't care for Olive Garden but Olive Garden is 3x's better than Truth. I was confused. We sat down and our server put a white table linen down, great that says fine dining. However all 10 Tv's are so now we are a sports bar. Then Eminem is Blasting so I'm in a club. The food comes and the best thing was the bread. I believe you can save bad food with great service. That didn't happen either.  I will go on Taylor for Italian food.  This is not your lane. This intimate space is best suited for quick bites and bar snacks.

14.description: The service was mediocre and the food is below average. The food has poor presentation and does not come timely. This is not the place to come for dinner ...it serves the purpose if you're hungry but misses the mark of excellence. From a service perspective there is a lack of accountability.The space is beautiful and centrally located and that's the plus.

28.description: Waaaaay too much sage used in the hot links for my taste. They're damn near green.

1.description: I just finished my meal and I can't say it was a good one.  First off it didn't take long to receive food. Now for review- the bbq was very tough and some pieces were crunchy which in my opinion means it was recooked probably from yesterday. The sauce wasn't bad but my fries were drowned in it. Thank god I only bought a mini-tip. I'm sure I won't be returning.

9.description: Good food. A bit pricey and less than desirable service. Try the rib tips with mild sauce. The chicken wings are good too.

29.description: I love the food. They gie you a lot of food in your servings. If you order a small tip, believe me it's enough for 2.

23.description: I visited this place on 11/16/12 arriving at 7:40 pm for a large order of tips with only 2 people ahead of me. low and behold i did not get my food until 8:21 pm and this was on a call-in order. that is just sad. The cashier was very rude. gangbangers hanging out in front of the entrance door. I felt completely un-safe! and the place was filthy (chicago city inspectors need to go there). i saw one of the cooks leave out and return without washing his hands to the food area. i will not be returning i dont care how good their food is, i care about the cleaniness and good customer service, if i am spending my hard earned money.

5.description: The best rib tips in Chicago!  I always order the mini-tip and it is just enough. If you don't eat much you could possibly have some for later.  The people aren't too friendly but they aren't too rude either. I go in, pay my money, and pick up my food.  There is a long wait of about 20 minutes but you can't rush greatness.  When that ask you what sauce, tell them mixed (hot & BBQ).

31.description: Laura J's review is right on.  Alice's has THE best bbq in Chicago.  Robinson's and Carson's dont measure up to Alice's one bit.The downside of Alice's is that you have to wait.  Ive called in orders many times and still had to wait 30-45 minutes.  Dont get me wrong--if you have the time its worth the wait, but when you don't you are better off going somewhere else.

25.description: One of my fav bbq joints in chicago. Call ahead for your order so you don't have to wait so long. Very good bbq tho.

12.description: I must say THAT THE SERVIES is VERY BAD!!!!!! Don't call in because most times they won't start your food until you get there, Also most of the times when you call you'll be put on hold sooooo long that you will hang up. The wait time is long also, BUT THE FOOD IS GREAT! OMG GREAT! It is worth the wait. The food is always hot and they give you a LOT! Alice sauce is very good. I may be reaching but it is one of Chicago's best!!!!

21.description: Alices Bbq is sooo good. Love the Hot sauce on side of the tips and the pizza puff. Shady looking guys but they don't bother the customers.

16.description: I just recently moved to the South Side and decided to give this place a try despite its sketchy surroundings. They really do have the best ribs that I've had in a long time! I was so glad I decided to try it out. I ordered the mini rib tips and the serving size was perfect.

17.description: 2nd tier BBQ... Better than Mississippi Rick's & Cap'n Curts, but not on the same level as Lem's & Smoque BBQ.  Sauce is similar to Kenny's.  Call ahead because they can take a while & it isn't the best neighborhood to lounge in. Cash only.

10.description: Horrible greasy and tough meat. Most of the people that said this barbecue is good haven't had real barbecue before. The rib tips were tough and the links were okay. I will never eat here again. Leon's and Famous Dave's is way better and cheaper.

11.description: The Food Is Very Very good...But The wait!!!!!  I have never waited so long for food in my life.  It's ridiculous. ..

26.description: *I never went here and never tried the food*I just wanted to inform people that this place does not accept restaurant.com certificates. I don't know if this is their bad or restaurant.com's bad for certificates to still be offered for them online, but just know this before you make the trek out there or are thinking of buying a certificate.

27.description: got a gift cert. but it turns out they dont take it so i was kinda upset. its a lil shack so nowhere to sit down, just a take out place. got some tips & wings & they were pretty good. i dont agree that they're the best in the chi, but was still pretty tasty.

0.description: This place is by far the best rib joint I've had in years. I always get a slab "naked" (no sauce). My husband loves their hot links. We have yet to get a bad order from here. You've tried the rest now try the best. Outside of making your own this is it for ME!

20.description: I used to eat here when I first moved to the Chi. After a couple of years I wasn't happy with the food. I recently decided to give them another shot. I made the right choice. The rib tips are on point. I'm very happy with the quality of the ribs and the mild sauce.  Alice gets 5 stars for the food and -1 for the service. If you call in an order you have to wait. I waited about 20minutes.  Usually, men are hanging around outside. But they don't bother anyone.

19.description: So if I call in an order, wait 30 minutes for you to cook/make the order why should I wait another 20 minutes for you to cut and bag my food? You only get 1 chance to mess with my time..2 times if I reeeeaaaallly love your food. Finding another BBQ spot soon.

2.description: TIP: CASH ONLY. The service is less than extraordinary. They're slow, talk over you, and calling in is hardly helpful in getting them to make your food faster. It's not the most aesthetically pleasing store front either HOWEVER the barbecue is delicious. I've had the ribs and the wings and both did not disappoint. They put the right amount of sauce all over everything (if you like your food slathered in sauce as I do). I recommend this place if you're looking for some home style BBQ.

32.description: Alice's is one of the best kept secrets in Chicago.  This is THE best bar-b-que in the city. People come from everywhere to get their ribs from here. The meat is smoked while grilling, and they pour water on the coals to bring out the smoky taste.  They are soft, tender, juicy, almost falling off the bone, but still with some resistance. The rib tips are the best! They put on the sauce after the meat is cooked. You can ask for mild or hot bar-b-que sauce, or a mix of the two. It's the best sauce I ever tasted, but be warned - the hot is HOT! I have been known to eat bowls of pickled jalapeo peppers, yet Alice's hot bar-b-que sauce is so hot it makes my eyes water. It's so painful, but yet so good. I can only handle this once in awhile when I'm in the mood. I usually ask for half and half. They will even put the sauce on your fries for you if you ask. As for the restaurant itself, it's carryout only. The place is really small, dingy, and is usually packed. As the grill in the window only holds so much meat, you sometimes will have to wait while a whole grill of meat is cooking from raw, at least 30-45 minutes or more. There's no place to sit. You will usually be offered socks or something else for sale, or will be asked for your spare change. The crowd in there is usually really entertaining, but it gets crazier the later it gets. Earlier in the evening the customers are good folk on their way home from work, late at night, keep an eye out. All in all, it's well worth the trouble. The food is really reasonably priced as bar-b-que goes.

18.description: Anyone who frequently patronizes this establishment knows,  most nights, you will have a lengthy wait for your food. It appears the wait time is now beyond what any sane person should endure. I went last night to get my favorite links. The waiting area was filled with customers griping about the cashier and the wait time. Twenty minutes turned  into forty. At that point, I had too much time invested to leave. One would think these individuals would have a system in place to get the customers out quickly.  I love the links, but I refuse to ever again wait that long for FAST FOOD.

13.description: This place is a hole-in-the-wall, the owner just simply refuses to re-invest into his own business but none of that matters with your first bite... I literally live up the street and around the corner (as the old folks say) and not one week passes where I don't eat something from Alice's.  The tips are TITS!! The links are TITS!! Get your fries seperate though, otherwise they'll be covered with meat and sauce and you'll wind up eating them last because they're buried under all that goodness. Friday and Saturday nights, as well as Sunday afternoons-you'll be waiting QUITE some time so don't say no one warned you. The afternoon crew makes everything too PERFECT, but the thing is I prefer the night crew because I like my tips a lil charred and they do it best. Weird, I know but I likes what I likes.

4.description: The sauce was tasty enough, but the rib tips were tough and the portion sizes were not comparable to prices which were to high. The homemade sides were delicious.

24.description: 2nd tier BBQ... Better than Mississippi Rick's & Cap'n Curts, but not on the same level as Lem's & Smoque BBQ.  Sauce is similar to Kenny's.  Call ahead because they can take a while & it isn't the best neighborhood to lounge in. Cash only.

6.description: Great BBQ but restaurant needs a facelift. The small combo is enough bro satisfy a hearty appetite

22.description: Torn between giving this two or three stars but in the end gave it 3. The taste definitely deserves a 3.. Maybe even 3.5. The problem is that even though the rib tips are delicious, they are very fatty and grisly. Most rib tibs have more meat. But what meat you do get is delicious. Also, underneath the tips are a pound of soggy, undercooked fries. If you are putting fries under the meat as a lot of places do, you have to make sure the fries are cooked a little more than you normally might cook them. If I go back, I'll try the ribs which I'm hoping have more meat.

15.description: Inconsistent, that's why only 2 stars. Alice's sauce always OK but sometimes the meat is tough & chewy. If ribs are needed when I'm heading home from downtown I'll try again.

7.description: I wish I wouldn't have gone to this NASTY PLACE..the customers service is HORRIBLE...WILL NEVER GO BACK...and next time when a person tell you NO BREAD ...PLEASE NO BREAD..more fat meat on the rib tips...and buy some paint..make your business look inviting..PLEASE DO GO TO THIS PLACE

8.description: I love this place! Everything is excellent minus the slow service but that's  only cuz the cooks are working all that magic on our food. The prices are reasonable and the bbq sauce is finger lickin good. Daaaang just thinking bout those ribs gives me a hard on. Although  this place is in the hood it sho is worth gettin a bullet to the head for those juicy scrumptious ribs. My only wish is to one day meet Alice and give her all the love back she's given me!

30.description: This place turns out some decent bar-be-que.  It's not life-changing or anything, but it'll do in a pinch.The hot sauce, as cautioned, does have some kick.  I noticed it most on my last rib, so the sauce itself may lack a little in consistency.  I'd probably go for mild if I were to try ribs from here again.

3.description: Worst fish sandwiches I ever had. The two sandwiches was prepared on two different buns.  I don't normally eat in grease pits. Only visited once never returned.

14.description: Living on the South Side, I have heard of real BBQ and we have to order from alot of BBQ joints who offer steak and lemonade deals.  Most often we are disappointed with the crap sauce that is slathered on bits of processed meat and sold as food. But hey, it's our fault for not being nearer to the quality BBQ places in Chicago. This place is home cooking.Coming from the beach we didn't want to be bothered with starting a fire and actually having to slave over a grill to get some good eats. This place was on the way home and we Yelped it. Favorable reviews despite the area. We went for it. As with anything that isn't hyped up in other affluent neighborhoods by transplants to the area because it is all they know, you should do well to explore the city for the genuine home cooked meal types of places that exemplify the exact diversity that is dually celebrated and despised in this great city.So, the menu isn't really that intuitive. But take the recommendations of other Yelpers and order mixed, or spicy sauce with your choice of the meat.  The fries are rather generic, but the sauces make them wonderful. The meat is so soft and tender that only the seared parts of it was semi-hard. My order of rib tips had a great woody,smokey flavor and it was topped with (I dunno why, someone explain this) two pieces of white bread. I'm thinking some heartier bread would complement the dish, but this is BBQ -- damn good BBQ at that.Other Yelpers are right, there are shady loiterers about, and not all of them are male. Kind of interesting experience. The innards of the place have an institutional feel to them with a thick piece of glass/plastic separating staff from customers. Might as well have brought a check to cash it  feels like one of those places. Service is good, a tad slow, and they do have quite a following streaming in constantly. Wanted to try the turkey legs, but there weren't any left. Prices are a bit more than I wanted to pay, but hey, this stuff takes time and effort to make, exactly what I didn't want to invest after a beautiful day out on the beach. Mind your p's and q's, raise your voice (it's not impolite here) to order across the little revolving door and enjoy your take out. There is no seating.Will definitely go back for some more.

1.description: I ordered the char siew and it was a lot oilier than expected. It feels like ive been given bad parts to eat. The ambience and service are not really good either.

2.description: Very good food always, very cheap price.

0.description: Very delicious and authentic Chinese Chashao pork! The price is really cheap.Also the oil duck is good.

3.description: Overall, it was a great experience. I called the night before and was able to come in the next day. Kevin (owner) and Terrell, the loctician were friendly and very professional. I enjoyed the music and there are good places to eat close by, if you get hungry. I do plan on returning.

1.description: The staff here is very very friendly. The shop is also easy to find. I got my hair done but the twists were just way too small and my hair was a little on the greasy side. It also took hours to do my hair which isn't expected for two strand twists. All in all, I would still recommend this establishment to people.

2.description: My first experience was a great experience.  I called on a late Friday afternoon hoping (fingers crossed) that I would be able to get an appointment the same evening.  The owner, Kevin, was determined to get me seen and worked his magic!  Twenty minutes later, I was at the salon asking for Will.  Will did a fantastic loc maintenance and style for me. His technique is amazing.  It was also a pleasure speaking with him during my service.  Nice spot.  I will definitely return!

0.description: So far so good on my first visit. I spoke to the owner who was extremely helpful and friendly to get me an appointment with the loctician of my choice. The salon is warm and inviting with good music playing... Plus there is parking!!!! 4  stars so far... I'll review again after my Locs get some much needed love!!!!

4.description: I get my locs professionally done by Will Williams. A lot of these experienced locticians are Christian fields alumi's.Nice music , nice amosphere. Your locs will be reborn once you let Will hook you up.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions

29.description: Catered food from this place. After coming returning from Suriname, Ive been cravings Caribbean food.  I bit into a plantain and had a flashback. It was amazing

42.description: The food isn't fast but worth the wait!

23.description: I think this restaurant has potential - if they fix a few things, this place can be a lot better. We wanted the phoulori for an appetizer, but they were out. We settled for the doubles, which was cold. The vegetarian plate was kind of boring and not super flavorful. It was supposed to come with fried plantains, but didn't come out with them. I asked our waitress about this, and she said they were out of plantains. Eventually, she brought me some when I had finished all of my other food, so I'm pretty sure they just forgot them. On a more positive note, my girlfriend thought her shrimp roti wrap was excellent. Overall, the food was pretty good. If they could just make the plate more satisfying, make sure they have stuff in stock / not forget it, they'll be golden.

8.description: Had two jerk chicken tacos they were great chicken was fresh an tacos were a great size most definitely will have again

31.description: I was a fan of Cafe Trinidad when they were located on 75th and St. Lawrence, so when I learned that they had not closed up shop, but were relocating to 47th, just west of Cottage Grove, I determined to make my way there! I had fond memories of the Macaroni Pie, Curried Salmon and Vegetables, and Peach Cobbler to sustain me while waiting for them to reopen. After a couple of false starts, and a blank trip, I finally made it yesterday. I have my fellow Yelpers, and previous experience, to thank for the wisdom to call ahead and verify their hours AND the availability of my desired culinary delights. I had the Boneless Jerk Chicken Roti (good curry flavor, though not so much Jerk), Macaroni Pie (a good sized serving of well-cheesed of noodles, only lacking a bit of salt & pepper), some of my friends plantains (perfectly crisp edges, soft centers, and ripe-plaintain goodness!), Sauteed Cabbage (tasty, not overcooked, with bonus carrots and peppers), and the Peach Cobbler (peaches, cinnamon, sugar, crust--what's not to like?) for dessert.As several others have mentioned,this space does leave a bit to be desired. Not nearly as spacious and gracious as the prior location (I HATE that they moved!), there is seating for about six (6) parties in the back, with a couple of high tables in the front waiting/order area. The Reggae/Caribbean music was creating a nice vibe, there was a small heater making sure we weren't cold, and all was well with my tummy!Welcome back, Cafe Trinidad!

34.description: From the moment I walked in, it was like I was transported right to the Islands.  While it's not a place where you talk about ambience and décor, the music - for a moment - helped me forget that there was snow on the ground and the biting, cold wind made it feel more like the Arctic than the Caribbean.  It's a cute, little restaurant nestled in a small lot off of 47th street.  The people there were friendly and explained the dishes very patiently.  I ordered the Roti Wrap and my husband ordered the curry chicken.  We both thought our choices were delicious and there was plenty of food for us to gorge on.  I've never had Trini food but I love Caribbean cuisines so this little gem of a find was delightful.  If I lived in Hyde Park, I'd be here all the time.

16.description: I was a fan of Cafe Trinidad when they were located on 75th and St. Lawrence, so when I learned that they had not closed up shop, but were relocating to 47th, just west of Cottage Grove, I determined to make my way there! I had fond memories of the Macaroni Pie, Curried Salmon and Vegetables, and Peach Cobbler to sustain me while waiting for them to reopen. After a couple of false starts, and a blank trip, I finally made it yesterday. I have my fellow Yelpers, and previous experience, to thank for the wisdom to call ahead and verify their hours AND the availability of my desired culinary delights.
