I had the Boneless Jerk Chicken Roti (good curry flavor, though not so much Jerk), Macaroni Pie (a good sized serving of well-cheesed of noodles, only lacking a bit of salt & pepper), some of my friends plantains (perfectly crisp edges, soft centers, and ripe-plaintain goodness!), Sauteed Cabbage (tasty, not overcooked, with bonus carrots and peppers), and the Peach Cobbler (peaches, cinnamon, sugar, crust--what's not to like?) for dessert.As several others have mentioned,this space does leave a bit to be desired. Not nearly as spacious and gracious as the prior location (I HATE that they moved!), there is seating for about six (6) parties in the back, with a couple of high tables in the front waiting/order area. The Reggae/Caribbean music was creating a nice vibe, there was a small heater making sure we weren't cold, and all was well with my tummy!Welcome back, Cafe Trinidad!

13.description: OMG I never knew what roti was til I happened to step in on a whim at 6:45 right before they closed at 7. Apparently roti is like a Caribbean pot pie or pasty in a wrap typically filled with a curried meat and potato. Once I saw they had goat I was SOLD. But coming in right before closing I was honestly expecting a lil attitude or slightly shittier service cuz everyone wants to go home. Naaah they hooked a brother up with no qualms and that roti was succulently delicious! Think I found my new post work treat! If only the goat roti was boneless, I had to find out the hard way after a big bite haha. But shit was too good to complain

11.description: The food at this place is good. The problem is that I asked for 3 different items that were either not available or not ready yet (Curry Crab, Dumplings & Callalloo, Bake & Fish, Phoulori). On top of that I called the order in, which I was told would take 25 minutes. I arrived about 25 minutes later and had to wait an additional 20 minutes. I tried curry, stew and jerk chicken, curry goat and the jerk chicken roti.I really enjoyed the stew and jerk chicken. Also the roti was huge.The food gets a 4. The customer service gets a 1

39.description: Being a Trini myself I have to say that the food was good but, missing something. I went to their original location on 75th some time ago and both times there, was also lacking something.  I came on a Friday afternoon and it seems that they need more seasoning to their food overall. My friend had the chicken roti wrap and I had the shrimp roti wrap. It seemed that they really didn't season the shrimp or chicken much and pretty much left it to the hot sauce for added taste - which definitely helped btw. I was really excited to have the pilouri and a lil bumbed that the "doubles" are only served on Saturdays. Our server, I forgot his name, was really friendly and brought our food to us and was very kind. Parking wasn't an issue at all. Overall this place is decent and I'd come back; especially on Saturday for the doubles.

37.description: Me and the wife were going nearby here for foster parent training, and discovered this place.  I never had Trinidadian food before and was blown away.   I am still jomnesing for the jerk chicken roti.  The steamed curry vegetables are to die for.   And I loved the ginger drink.  Wow.   I don't know anything about this cuisine, but if this is mediocre for experts, ten mediocre is awesome for me.  Go today.

0.description: Food was delicious even though it did take a couple more minutes than expected for a slow restaurant on a Saturday night.For a deal, I would go back just like I the way I came but not dying to get there anytime soon!

38.description: Very very disappointed with Cafe Trinidad. We drove an hour from the west side of Chicago where we were staying to eat some good Trini food and it wasn't up to par. The service was extremely slow and the portions were too small for the price. As you can see from my pictures that I posted. I was served doubles bread instead of the roti that I purchased and only given one small piece. To their credit they did provide another after I asked about it. I won't be returning.

27.description: The food was decent and there was a lot of it for a very low price, the area did have me on edge but that's because it's way outside of my comfort zone. Still, I'm glad I've tried it but probably won't come back!

32.description: Very bland!!!!!!Most flavor came  from the sage  they use to garnish the dish. The food is baked and is not authentic jerk or seasoning. All they need to do to turn things around is to actually grill it and add the real seasoning. Stop being cheap and do the things necessary to make this place.great!Sincerely, Concerned consumer!!

44.description: Omg! Authentic Trinidadian Food! Authentic Trinidadian Food!! Me and my mother stumbled upon this Gem while being hungry and driving down 47th Street, and Oh My! We got LUCKY! Our food was made to order, took about 30 minutes for my jerk salmon, but oh was it worth it! My salmon was HUGE, cabbage was fresh, and the curry chicken was the BOMB! Cost was about $35 for both of our meals, but it was definitely worth it! We will definitely be coming back!!

24.description: This is a small restaurant on the corner.  The food was a little bland and the atmosphere was nice. It appears clean and the portions are large.

7.description: I enjoy the goat tacos from this place. The only drawback is that they don't fully de-bone the goat and you can happen upon a shard or two of goat bone. This can be very dangerous if you are not careful. Therefore, I wouldn't suggest this item for children. The sauce that they offer with the taco is very tasty as well. Service is fast and cordial. The parking lot is tiny and street parking can be scarce depending on the time of day that you visit.

40.description: First let me say the guy taking our order with long locks was incredibly nice and patient and had excellent customer service skills.  He gets a 5.  The setting is small and tight.  So when we got there all tables were full.  One table opened up and we sat but it was some time before the table was cleaned of debris from former guest.  And the guy who takes your order also serves food and cleans table.  This is too much at lunch time but again he was great.  I ordered curry goat.  I realize I have had it from Jamaican restaurants and tried to be open and flexible to a new experience.  Let me say and this where this restaurant loses all it's points - it was TOUGH.  It's a good thing I have good teeth because I need them to tenderize the meet to swallow.  On the other hand my guest had the jerk chicken and I sampled it and it was much.  The sides were good but small.  The salad was served in a small bowl and the leafs were falling out/over.  I think this restaurant has great potential but they may want to work on the goat dish.

30.description: I have to say that it seems that they lost some of the "it factor" since they have moved. I imagine they moved out of some sort of necessity but I ain't feeling the new place at all. My orders are now takeout.  It's drafty and feels cramped. The bathroom leaves a whole lot to be desired. The staff is always pleasant and as long as the food doesn't go down in quality, I'll  still support them. It's all about the small businesses for me.

46.description: Decent food. The chicken curry roti is good but overpriced at $8. I also had the curry chicken lunch special which was just average. I found the curry chicken to have less flavor and is a smaller portion than its equivalent at Uncle Joe's. Service is ok and it seems like it is family run so that is a plus. Based on the price point, I probably won't visit very often.

1.description: Wish I could give 2.5 Went Saturday afternoon with a Groupon  was able to order only dinnersPro : ample street parking Food: Curry chicken jerk chicken moist Rice and beans decent , their version of jerk sauce is chicken gravy in oil No Champaign cola , no jerk sauce , no hard dough bread , plantain was dry , sorry will not be back ! The old lady waitress with the tats was good tho.....

9.description: To say I was disappointed with my meal today would be a huge understatement. I've been patronizing Cafe Trinidad for years, since they were in their old location on 75th street, so I thought I knew what to expect from this establishment. Good Lord was I wrong!My bad experience started when I opened the container to the Mac and cheese pie, and to my surprise, there was hardly half of a scoop for the serving size. Cmon yall........you charge almost 5 bucks for a side item like Mac and cheese, and you only give the customer 50 cents worth. I guess I wouldn't have been as upset if the Mac and cheese was any good, but alas it wasn't. The top was thoroughly burnt and overall there was no flavor, let alone cheese. I'm something of an expert on such things so I would rate this Mac and cheese a 3 out of 10. Next was the shrimp roti, which I've had several times from this location, and although it has never been able to hold a candle to something like Teddy's in Washington DC, it was always pretty decent and cheaper than airfare to the nation's capital. I don't know if this place changed owners, cooks, or what... The whole thing was just really subpar. Especially the shrimp! Oh my... They tasted freezer burnt and were the size of sea monkeys. I ended up picking all the shrimp out of the roti they were so bad. I guess what sucks the most is that for the $15 I spent today there are TONS of other options here in Chicago. Even on the south side! JJ Fish would've been a better bet. Geez, probably even McDonald's and I haven't eaten there in a decade. Hopefully a better Trinidadian place opens up soon or I'll just save my roti craving for when I'm on the east coast.

26.description: The boy loved his ginger beer. Holy hell the food was so good! Well worth the drive into the ghetto, it's cool there's parking upfront. We had the jerk chicken roti and the got chicken curry combo. It was all covering rice with beans or lentils it was BOMB! Tender as hell almost too tender but exceptionally delicious....highly recommended!

25.description: Simply authentic and amazing! Coming from someone who is a Cali native, I must say. I want to come back to Chicago specifically for this chicken curry roti!!Been miserable ever since I got back home. Just such bold and yummy flavors in everything that you cannot find on the west coast! Highly recommend!

12.description: It was just ok..called in with a Groupon...online the jerk chicken dinner is 10.50 got charged 12.00. The food was Luke warm like it had already been sitting there. Also ordered Trini tacos they were tasty but cold. Overall glad I had a Groupon cuz I would've been upset had I paid full price..I feel they overcharged me because I had a Groupon.

21.description: I visited this place on a Saturday. I asked for Chicken with brown rice, beans, and plantain. The food was promptly served and I was impressed for how delicious was, specially the chicken. The proportions are bigger than average but not that big that I could not finish it.

17.description: My daughter and I went there on last week, we tried to order the ox tail chicken combo meal but they were out of oxtails so we ordered the jerk chicken dinner, it didn't taste like jerk at all it tasted like a spicy baked chicken. The white meat was bone dry, the cabbages, rice and peas were tasty but had bits of bone through out them that we had to keep spitting out. We had the so called homemade lemonade which tasted like sugar water no lemon flavor at all! Overall the meal was horrible! The sever was nice!

10.description: Simply authentic and amazing! Coming from someone who is a Cali native, I must say. I want to come back to Chicago specifically for this chicken curry roti!!Been miserable ever since I got back home. Just such bold and yummy flavors in everything that you cannot find on the west coast! Highly recommend!

5.description: Nothing going on here but deliciousness! I love food from the islands and Cafe Trinidad did not disappoint.I've been here a couple of times...dining in and for pickup. The jerk chicken is really good and the jerk sauce is a little different from what I am used to. This version of the sauce was a little lighter in terms of color and is a little sweeter than the Jamaican version I am used to....really good though. All entrees come with your choice of rice (white or brown), peas, plantains and curry steamed vegetables which are really good especially when mixed in with the rice. I have also had the curry salmon and it is really good...the flavor is phenomenal and melts in you mouth. Portions are a really nice size FYI.The people that work here are really nice and always make sure you are satisfied with your meal.The place itself is small as I think they have about five tables for dining but they make it for the size with delicious food that you can get with carry-out/pickup. I love this place!

3.description: I love this place. I used to eat there all of the time when they were located on 75th and St.Lawrence.But no matter if it's the old spot or the new spot.... I always order the same thing....Curry Salmon Stir Fry.  It is the best yet!!

35.description: I bet your customers would find it helpful if you posted on your website that you were opening TWO HOURS LATER during the Winter months. The food had better be worth this aggravation.

19.description: The boy loved his ginger beer. Holy hell the food was so good! Well worth the drive into the ghetto, it's cool there's parking upfront. We had the jerk chicken roti and the got chicken curry combo. It was all covering rice with beans or lentils it was BOMB! Tender as hell almost too tender but exceptionally delicious....highly recommended!

28.description: Pretty good shrimp roti. Jerk chicken not good really. Bit of a wait. But overall ok. Decent service too.

45.description: A co-worker from out of town was excited to hunt down some Trinidadian food, and found this place and they even delivered. A bunch of us ordered and I didn't hear any complaints. I got the boneless chicken roti wrap and it was very good with a thick gravy and potatoes. And the habanero hot sauce that came with it put it over the top.Very pleased that they offered a boneless option and that the meat was very high quality... chicken or any meat can be dodgy at hole-in-the-wall ethnic places sometimes.

33.description: Having had some authentic Trini food, thanks to a great friend from Trinidad, I was curious to see how Cafe Trinidad would fare. It's unfair that I automatically fall in love with Caribbean food since I am Caribbean. But there is something to be said for authenticity.Curry chicken. Plantains. Rice and beans. Cabbage. Ginger beer.It may be my accent that caused my food to come out spicy. I am not one to complain about my food having a kick to it, but when I don't have to request that it come spicy and it does, I'm won over. The chicken was tender enough to eat with a plastic spoon. Yes, you read that correctly. Everything was a hit. I have to go back later to try some of the specials on the menu.

43.description: Some of the best carribean food around. Everytime I go to the southside, I try to make it by here. They are very nice and the food is always fresh!!!

2.description: PROS:1.  Free parking (although a bit sparse, narrow and awkwardly designed)2.  Clean, spacious restaurant  (loved jamming to the nice music)3.  Large portions and selectionsCONS:1.  Availability (don't display things which aren't there )2.  Inconsistency (both orders were wrong)3.  Quality  (ginger beer was flat)

18.description: This place is awesome!! Takes me all the way back to Trinidad. It's as authentic as they come. Only place in Chicago to get the true Trini flavor. Get Curry chicken roti, and an order of doubles. Doubles is a vegetarian concoction from curry and garbanzos they call chana. Order plenty spice with the magic habañero hot sauce so popular in the island!! Just ordered. My mouth is already watering!!

41.description: Very nice.  Traditional food from the carribean.  I spent a lot of time around that area and have eaten my share of "peas & rice.  Had the shrimp roti and it was fresh and because I requested "mild" it was just spicy enough.  Street parking no problem.  Quick service, small space, but a nice experience.

4.description: VERY GOOD FOOD.  Even though I can't vouch for it's Trinidadian Authenticity I have to say this is VERY delicious food.  This unassuming, intimate sized, casual dining location offers many dishes to treat and tentelize the discerning palate.  Food, ordered at the registered, is  brought to your table when ready and usually does not take a long time.  When I got done with my plate, they almost didn't have to wash it... yes it was that good.  The location is right on 47th street and is a short drive from either Lake Shore Drive or I94 (the Dan Ryan Expressway).  The staff and management are very friendly and checked to make sure everything was great.  I can't wait to go back.Personally speaking, parking can be a little tricky and I would LOVE for them to have longer opening hours, say until 9 PM at least.  Outside of that, you "must go" here for lunch or early dinner.

6.description: So I tried Cafe Trinidad for the first time tonight. My experience was more than underwhelming. I ordered curry chicken roti for myself and stew chicken dinner for my friend. The service was quick which I like.  But during the short time I waited there were 4 kids running around the dining area being very disruptive. I tried the stew chicken I bought my friend and it was extremely bland. No stew flavor what so ever. And my curry chicken was bland as well. These meals had no spice to them. Either they toned down the flavors to make them more American or someone in the kitchen doesn't know how to make traditional trini food.  I won't be going back.

22.description: this restaurant does not sell authentic Trinidadian food. They didn't even know what I was asking for. I was born and raised in Trinidad and moved here 2 years ago and have been looking around for restaurants that make good food from my country. Don't waste your money. Very overpriced and under flavored . I went on different occasions because I figured they would change the recipe or chef but that didn't help. When I get more money I will open an authentic Trinidadian restaurant and u can all come taste real Trinidad food. Just an FYI I would give them negative stars but not allowed to do that

15.description: This is a small restaurant on the corner.  The food was a little bland and the atmosphere was nice. It appears clean and the portions are large.

20.description: This is a great place to just grab a take out! It's ethnic Caribbean food! My favorite is the curried goat roti roll! Absolutely amazing because the country Trinidad and Tobago has an influence of Caribbean food and Indian cuisine ... Blend the two together and you have a marriage of heaven!!! Food was great! The Ambience is average as its a casual place and very small.

36.description: Perhaps Trinidadian food is bland, or I went on a bad night, but I was NOT impressed with Cafe Trinidad.  The curry chicken was some of the blandest curry chicken I've EVER had (and I love caribbean food!).  I didn't taste any curry or curry spices.  Also, guests have the option of eating in, however the restaurant is really not set up for eat-in.  We sat on a rickety table, ate off of styrofoam and were cold. Also, the restaurant closes at 7 pm.  Who closes at 7 pm??!!  We barely made it in time to have dinner. You may want to call ahead of time to see if they have what you want to order, especially if you go at the end of the night.  I really wanted to like this place and am disappointed!

14.description: Having had some authentic Trini food, thanks to a great friend from Trinidad, I was curious to see how Cafe Trinidad would fare. It's unfair that I automatically fall in love with Caribbean food since I am Caribbean. But there is something to be said for authenticity.Curry chicken. Plantains. Rice and beans. Cabbage. Ginger beer.It may be my accent that caused my food to come out spicy. I am not one to complain about my food having a kick to it, but when I don't have to request that it come spicy and it does, I'm won over. The chicken was tender enough to eat with a plastic spoon. Yes, you read that correctly. Everything was a hit. I have to go back later to try some of the specials on the menu.

12.description: Naming names this time: Kenneth, Steve, Chris,  and Yasmeen! Love these baristas! Trez has assembled a talented crew,  uses the most premium flavors and beans,  and you can't afford to miss the 5star rewards program.  Simply the best. The coffee for home tastes great,  but I'd have to be a magician to get it to taste as good as it does at Sip & Savor.

3.description: Yesterday I was at the Ain't She Sweet Cafe next to this place, and I saw this place and thought I should I try it because I've never seen it before. I'm so happy I did! I got a major sweet tooth and drove over since it's close. The atmosphere is so nice, clean and inviting. There's even a cool bar counter where you can sit and have your drink, that's something I don't see in many coffee places. I got a shake mocha and a chocolate chip muffin, they were delicious! I will definitely come back, this area needs more places like these!

1.description: They sent me a discount for my birthday that I signed up for and I was a bit angry. Why would someone as popular as they are think that getting half price on a single cup of coffee is a birthday discount-free would have been better, but half off of 2.00 dollars.....it was an insult....and believe it or not, I like this place.

2.description: My small Boston Terrier service dog and I entered this comfortable looking coffee shop, about 9 am today, February 17, 2016.  Even though i explained that it is a service dog, the owner yelled at me in front of all the customers and kicked us out of the place.  I tried to explain the law to him, saying i am a retired attorney.  He replied that he doesn't care about the law; and I could be president of the United States, I had to get out of his business.  He said I was trying to tell him how to run his business and that he was not going to argue with me.  I tried to look service animals up outside, where he forced me to go, but I couldn't see the screen in the sunlight.  I retrieved the dog's vest and returned.  The barista said the owner instructed her not to serve me  under any circumstances, vest or no vest.  I experienced extreme embarrassment and other emotions.The drinks are a tad better than mediocre.  I used to go there for comfortable environment and wifi.  I won't return.

9.description: I am surprised that this place has so few reviews, hopefully it will get more positive love on Yelp!  This by far is the best coffee shop in Bronzeville, way better than Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts, with baristas that care about their customers as much as they care about a perfect cup of coffee.  It is clean, it has lots of space for people to work or chat. The walls are well decorated and put together that creates a vibrant stress free space. People were here working, socializing or just having a moment of peace. There is also some really great art for sale on the walls, and their website makes it easy for artist to get in touch with managers about putting their art up. This is a real engaging third space that I think can only have positive impacts for the community. The first time I went I had their lemon black tea, it was good, and not so over-brewed that it needed sugar to sweeten it! I also went again to try their espresso, it was on par with the rest of the city. The only thing I personally don't like is that they don't have mugs for people drinking at the shop. I believe that coffee and especially espresso drinks are more luxurious in a mug, as well as less wasteful and more environmentally friendly. However, this is not a reason to pass this place, if you are in the area it is worthwhile to go to Sip and Savor for sure.

10.description: Delicious mocha latte and wonderful croissants. I don't order much else there, but the two things I do get are pretty great. Every time I go in there's only one person working so it's a little slow moving. Allow yourself 15 minutes to be waiting for your order if someone's already placed theirs. Overall, it's a good atmosphere and a fine coffee shop.

4.description: Absolutely  love this place... great vibe!Carmel latte is great. Quiet and great place to  read!!!!

6.description: Metaphorically speaking "death to Starbucks". This is one of my new fav's coffee houses within my area. The atmosphere is really relax. You will not experience the noisy traffic like you do at other coffee houses. I love the various artwork displayed throughout the shop. The drink menu is easy to follow and has a great layout. This establishment has a coffee bar. There were only a handful of desserts and pastries available. The barista was very nice and greeted me when I enter the establishment. This venue accepts credit cards. I also saw sitting out in the back. I ordered a medium raspberry white mocha with a extra shot which was delicious. Although I thought the drink was a little on the sweet side. Basically today I skip on my morning pastry. I think I will be returning to this establishment again in the near future.

15.description: Great atmosphere with beautiful artwork throughout the space. Very warm and welcoming. It's one of my favorite spots to work in Bronzeville.

0.description: Such a great place! It's small, but has lots of character. I recently went for a meeting and it was the perfect location. Free parking, excellent customer service, and i highly recommend the Obama Mocha. :)

5.description: The atmosphere is great, the people nice but I only give it 3 stars because the lattes and coffees are horrible. Every time the milk is scalded and not prepared properly at all. I've given it a few tries but it always falls short.

13.description: I went here today based off the positive reviews. Also, I have been looking for some coffee alternatives in the Bronzeville/Hyde Park area. Starbucks is expensive and out of the way (Also, Starbucks has been lacking in the area of creativity). Dunkin Donuts is good for those who like plain ole coffee and nothing else (not me). McDonalds taste more and more watered down. This is where Sip & Savor comes in to save the day! First off, the aura and environment is comfortable and sleek. The owner is a good man who cares about his customers and displayed exceptional professionalism. They have an exciting spin on their signature coffee selection by offering some flavors that sound delish. I was throughly impressed. The prices are reasonable. They also have a loyalty card program where you can earn awards and points for every dollar you spend. Support this wonderful business, I surely will!

11.description: Great local place for a cup of tea or coffee on the way to work in the morning or weekend.  Also great place to meet up. Owners are great and supportive if local community. Give it a try if you haven't already.

8.description: I enjoyed my danish and coffee and Steve was a cool barista. The place is nice. They do have seating and a restroom and they have a pretty good variety of teas as well as coffee drinks. They also have muffins, danishes and when I was there, carrot cake. It's good to see it in the area.

14.description: I'm a loyal starbucks customer, so I'm thrilled at the fact that i wrestled myself out of my normal habit to try out Sip & Savor and got rewarded by an awesomely hot cup of banana caramel soy latte that got DELIVERED to my table.   The service was great - shop run by one attentive guy when I was here.   Wifi works great.   Plenty of places to sit (unlike starbucks). It's a bit off the beaten path but I'll be one to help cut a swath to the doors by spreading the word.   only complaint is that it's a bit chilly in here on this cold day.  If the owner is reading this, please open up another spot somewhere between 31st and 35th St in Bronzeville.  oh - this delicious drink is CHEAPER than Starbuck! what?!

7.description: I stopped into Sip & Savor when I had some time to kill traveling between meetings in Hyde Park and the Loop.  It's a nice large space with plenty of seating and good wi-fi and I was able to get work done comfortably.  The Chai Latte was very good -  better than my go-to Starbucks.

12.description: It's good, fresh and hot. It's just way more expensive than the other ones located out west. A closer and cheaper Harold's should be your first choice.

3.description: Wasn't impressed - $10 for 6 wings and fries. Customer service was disappointing - first time ever at Uncle Remus - just wasn't impressed at all. Not sure what the fuss was about. Won't be going back to this one in Hyde Park!

1.description: Never going to give you a second chance, Uncle Remus...NEVER!!!!!!!  I ordered a Sunday family deal: 15 pieces of chicken with 2 sides for $25.  First of all, they screwed up my sides...ordered fries and okra, they gave me 2 orders of fries.  Second, I told them to put the hot sauce on the side...however, not a lick of hot sauce to be found.  Therefore, we were stuck eating some boring, bland fried chicken.  The person who I placed the order with recited the order correctly back to me.  There was just some kind of unfortunate mix-up.  We were so disappointed, but we forced ourselves to eat the poor excuse for friend chicken since we were hungry and hate wasting food.  GO TO POPEYES INSTEAD.  Lesson learned...

2.description: Heard good stuff about this place and that it's better than Harold's so I had to try this out. Comparing to Harold's, 1) customer service is so much faster (thank god!)2) chicken wings are so much crispier than Harold's (yum!!!!!)3) sauce is so much sweeter than Harold's so I prefer Harold's sauce better since it has more spice too4) they serve dinner rolls rather than white bread from Harold's (dinner rolls are good but bad for our health lol! )5) this is pricier than Harold's ($1.30 for each wing vs $0.90 each wing in Harold's)  but they have good daily deal everyday. If I have to go to this one or Harold's, I can't choose! Hahaha but it's too pricey here. I would just stick with Wednesday wings deal.   They have daily deal so check their menu daily.

9.description: Man this chicken is terrible im been waiting for an uncle remus to come to the southside for a little over a decade now so when i heard they opened up by my job i had to see what all the talk was about its better than harolds this and its the west side version of harolds that let me tell you as non biased as i possibly can this chicken tastes like browns chicken and then it also tastes like the chicken wings you get from the chinese restaurant no seasoning except fot the sauce they give you two dinner rolls and the smallest side of fries i have ever seen i will never be going back i was upset when i bit into it there is definitely the crispy texture of chicken because i ordered mine fried hard but there is no flavor other than the sauce and that is good but its sweet there is nothing mild about it and the 6 wing dinner i bought today was 10 dollars harolds nearby in hyde park is 6.75 after tax with more flavor and fries im sorry westside of chicago but you all can hold this L for that chicken of yalls lol harolds is way better

10.description: Chicken is very tasty. Not a fan of the sauce but it makes for a decent dip for the fries. Not that tasty. Service is good however orders can often be mismanaged causing longer waits.

4.description: Over cooked chicken cold fries and stale roles...not the uncle Remus I went to on the west side several years ago.

6.description: The customer service here is horrible! The chicken wasn't that good either! I called ahead for a daily special and when I got there I had to wait an additional 20 mins because the person who I thought took my order didn't! Then they accused me of calling the wrong place. Vanessa asked me several times what number did I call. I had to show her that I called the right place before she would believe me. I will not be going to this over priced place again!

0.description: The Chicken and sauce was very good. I had a 2 piece white with a side of okra and a roll.I can't wait to go back. It was better than Harold's or KFC.

5.description: Tht shit is over price knockoff Harold's please whteva u do dnt buy tht bulsht. Chicken dnt have no type of seasoning mild sauce weak as fck and they fries taste like sm shit u gt frm the polish stand. Man fck Uncle remus drunk ass!!

13.description: Good customer service, but the chicken was not seasoned.  I guess the sauce makes the chicken, but I got mine on the side. They give you that option free of charge, unlike Harold's who charge you for sauce on  the side  because they want to saturate  your chicken with  sauce to hide the fact that they are giving you old chicken. I will go back, because the chicken was fresh,  but I won't ask for sauce on the side. I am still looking for an alternative to Popeyes on 47 because they sold me old chicken, three old thighs that was probably cooked last Christmas, and Harold's on 53rd sold me old chicken.

11.description: Chicken stays crispy and the sauce is really good.

8.description: It the same sauce as out wet but that's about it!!!  The service is horrible and the prices will make you cry!!!!  The chicken on this visit was over cooked, and the air was out in the restaurant so I felt like I was being over cooked as well!  I would suggest making the trip out west for the original, it's worth it since they are overcharging at this location you will save 20 to 30 %.

14.description: The ambience is very modern, clean, available bathrooms, great customer service and good food! Fried catfish is delicious and chicken is scrumptious. The only reason it didn't get five stars is because they don't take call in orders, bathroom was low on toilet paper and no courtesy cups for water. The prices are already $$$$ for fried food. A courtesy cup won't break the bank. Also, they just need someone to regularly tidy up. The place is too nice to get it messed up so soon. However, we'll be back and will recommend it to friends!

7.description: Expensive....and you will be waiting while they go get the chicken from the farm...skin the chicken...and fry the chicken. Seriously it took 45 mins for 4 wings and 2 pieces of tilapia. Smh

3.description: The worst McDs ever!! Never had a good visit. Every visit is an epic fail. From the long lines to the lax service to the lack of preparedness. The register is always out of paper, nothing is ever stocked and this is just my drive thru experience.

1.description: Depressing. The most depressing mcdonalds I've ever visited. They don't have very high comprehension levels on average. It's tough to get food because they all move like mules and have poor communication skills. Just drive the extra mile or so to the next nearest mcdonalds. Being served here on 47th and cottage will painstakingly remind you EXACTLY why you want to move out of chicago. Good luck.

2.description: Hey, it's McDonalds! I wasn't expecting too much.  Unfortunately we missed the gospel music, which only plays on certain days at certain times.  So we ate.  The food is usual.  The employees were a bunch of rowdy teens.  I hate fast food places but the gospel would have made it cool.  :)

9.description: I went through the drive-thru.  They got my order wrong, made me wait over 10 minutes to get the order corrected.  I asked for free fries for a concession for my dis-satisfaction.  I asked to speak to the manager and she was very rude.  Her name was Darlene or something to that nature.  She told me to call the 1-800 number if I have an issue with service.  The 1-800 number documented my concern.

10.description: Terrible service at times. Took 6 minutes to get a cup of coffee from drive thru, even though there was no line and it was 5:00AM.

4.description: RUDE RUDE RUDE RUDE RUDEThis is the absolute worst McDonalds ever when it comes to service. To start, the person at the drive through acted as if I was bothering her when I said I needed a moment to decide what I wanted to order, then I guess I was really asking entirely too much when I asked the woman at the second window for ketchup to go with my fries. After slamming the drive thru window on me she practically threw 2 packets of ketchup at me. I would avoid this place.

6.description: Waited in the double drive thru for at least 4 minutes with no response to my "Hello's" then look over to someone who has pulled up after i did and get serviced so i assumed that the intercom was broken and pulled around the location to get in line at the other intercom and then i see someone else at the same intercom i was at but they are getting their order taken. I was visiting a frien on drexel which is only like 2 blocks away and i drove all the way over to the location on Lake park. I will never go back to this location!

12.description: Actually surprised at the good service and quality of food... Their prices are a bit inflated thou

5.description: Never. Ever. Leave this McDonalds without checking your order first. Completely disorganized, "customers" just standing around acting all confused like they've never been to a fast-food restaurant before. Staff completely incapable of understanding the word "hamburger" (I ordered 2 and was given 2 large fries instead.) They call this the "Gospel McDonalds" most likely because you need to pray that they get your order right. Also, they have this weird divider thing that prevents you from seeing the total or the screen of the little credit card swipey thing. Also VERY VERY slow. A lot of the regulars coming here are crackheads. Avoid this McD if at all possible.

11.description: $1.00 beverages need I say more. Always a crowd. Best to do drive-thru.

8.description: My worst dine in experience this decade. From the parking lot into the restaurant we were hit numerous times by the same guy for donations towards his bus ride home. Some people haven't any shame and some security guards are useless. Not until after the lot of us were milked did he get off his lazy butt ( from conversation with a lady) to kick this guy out of the restaurant. Inside there were more than enough employees working, making food and running around. However, there was only one cashier working the crowd and others standing behind him looking on to see what they could do. My order was recorded incorrectly and wasn't filled properly. That was the longest wait ever, standing in line took ten minutes and to get the food was another ten (Big mac combo with a coke and a medium diet coke). A friend of mine was three orders back and it took a full twenty minutes to get his order filled ( two chicken wraps ). Insane! You'd think we were at a sit down restaurant waiting so long and even after all that time, his order was incorrect. After placing orders customers stepped off to one side (or the other) while waiting, when one of the runners had the order in hand she would grunt because she would have to walk over to the side of the counter that the person was at. This lady was lean and tall and had no other obligations of work, if she was heavy and or handicapped perhaps yes we could go and retrieve the items from her. Lazy a.... The dining room was spotless, one of their employees had been cleaning the place mopping, sweeping and cleaning the restrooms all while we were there. I've never seen a McDonald's location so immaculate. At this location there is a lengthwise window of plexiglass separating customers from the employees. Maybe for deflection? We should've gone to JJ's Fish and Chicken. Having forty minutes of time to eat before hitting a comedy club we thought McDonald's would've been the easy and quick option.

0.description: This was a cross-cultural experience for us, visiting the "Gospel Music" McDonald's.Imagine four white 20somethings, who, upon finding that Sammy's Touch was closed and becoming frozen, were desperate for a bite to eat and a place to pee. Finally, McDonald's it was. This is the first time I've eaten anything from McDonald's in probably 6 or 7 years. But again, desperation set in.So we're the only white folks in the place, but I will say that service was just fine. I mean, what do you expect? And the food, well, it was edible. But even the best McDonald's in the world could only get 3 stars from me.

7.description: Its McDonalds, ok its the Gospel McDonalds. But either way in 5 years of going to this place they have almost always taken forever to get an order out. They've been better recently, but they still have a way to go to be a great micky D's.

3.description: Disgusting. Horrible N that's being nice. Worst Chinese food I've ever eaten. Don't waste you're money please. Fried rice was burned n nasty flavor

1.description: Terrible service for delivery. Don't trust the GubHub delivery estimates. GubHub gave me a time 1 hr and 10 min after I ordered. Try closer to 2 hrs for delivery!!! Totally unacceptable. When I complained to the delivery driver, he said he still had 8 more orders to deliver! And the food? Weak. Nothing impressive. Had to pick out gristle, and tendons and uneatable stuff from two of the three entrees I ordered. Never seen so many green peppers in an order in my life. To make up for a lack of meat, clearly. Stay Away!

2.description: I love this place. Only thing I get is delivery with the three entrée combo. Fantastic, unbeatable value for 7.95. Yes, delivery can be slow, but it's just something to know. Food is great, as long as you keep in mind you're ordering cheap Chinese delivery. I like all of their chicken and beef options, and their crab ragoons. My favorites have to be bourbon chicken, honey chicken and bbq rib tips.

5.description: This place has terrible customer service. My husband ordered at 6:02pm, the food arrived at 8:22pm. We called before the delivery man arrived and the owner was confused about the situation. Then he informed us that he will speak with the driver. We still didn't here from the owner until we called back. I told him we still haven't received our order. He said We are under staff and due to the weather he had some difficulties. He failed to mention that we can called about our order. He didn't give us our money  nor discount. My husband and I had to call and file a complainant to Grubhub. Overall we will never order from them again.  NEVER ORDER FROM THEM!!!!

6.description: This place does not look like much but the food is the best the best thing to get is orange chicken I've been here several times well at least three times a week for orange chicken let's be real.. tops in Chicago Check it out call first so it's ready for you when you go pick it up

7.description: There's a reason it's so cheap. I found a pig fetus head cooked in with my pork. Lost all my appetite.

8.description: Saw this place online and took a chance. So glad I did. Best takeout in Hyde Park! I had the egg foo young and Bourbon Chicken. I will be ordering from Dragon Express again.

9.description: Really great Chinese food at a very reasonable price!

0.description: Coming from New York I've had a hard time finding Chinese food of the same caliber in Chicago. Sure, I could go to Chinatown, but what I really want is cheap and tasty food from a hole in the wall kind of place. The Yelp reviews I read were unsettling but my roommates had ordered from here before and their food looked good so my friend and I got their lunch specials. I got Kung Pao Chicken, an eggroll, chicken fried rice (+0.50), and a soda for $5.50He got the same order except with Sesame Chicken. We also got Chow Mein (oddly GrubHub didn't have Lo Mein) and a bag of 12 fortune cookies ($1.15). We placed the order around 11:40 on a Thursday and the food came around 12:50, which was a long time, but within the time period they predicted. The food was really f*cking delicious. There was actually a lot more food included that you usually get with lunch specials. The fried rice was really tasty and there was a lot of it. The eggrolls were also amazing. My Kung Pao chicken was packed with celery (a little too much in my opinion) but there were also tons of peanuts and baby corns. The flavor was great - enough chili peppers that my mouth and lips were tingly but not overwhelmingly hot. The chicken was also good and I didn't have the problems with gristle or toughness that other reviewers did. My friend's sesame chicken came covered in sesame seeds but the flavor was really good and there was a lot of chicken - also all well cooked. We were so full that we didn't try the Chow Mein. Basically, the delivery is a little slow but the portions are generous, the prices are really good, and the food that we got was very tasty. We're definitely ordering from there again. We also ordered from GrubHub and the prices/some menu items on there were different from the restaurant's online menu (which you can also order from online). We just didn't want to use our credit cards on their site.

4.description: For Chinese delivery, it's pretty good. I've had a lot worse. They have a good selection and their kung pao chicken actually has peanuts and chilis in it and isn't dumbed-down American Chinese. I did feel that the shrimp in lobster sauce could have had more shrimp in it, and the pot stickers are too doughy. But overall, this is well above average for outside Chinatown.

58.description: Pretty sure if I lived in the South Loop I would be like 450 pounds by now and spots like Harold's would be the reason. I ordered the 3 piece fish (perch) with the 3 piece chicken (dark meat) and I loved every bite. Tons of food, all perfectly cooked. Great bang for your buck and a solid choice if you're in the mood for some deep fried goodness!The hot sauce, by the way, is super fine. Classic old school joint with framed pictures of Scottie Pippen and Kanye West on the walls.I will be back!

56.description: Regular chicken spot... not really sure what all the hype about it was. I guess Chicagoans have never gotten a chance to experience a local NYC hood chicken spot like Crown Fried Chicken. If you're interested in tasting the chicken from here, but you're from NYC don't bother going out of your way. It's nothing special to rave about.I did find it funny on the other hand that there was this one guy who was sweating a storm while eating his fried chicken. Yup he was seriously dripping sweat all over the place but just kept eating the chicken. I asked for some of the hot sauce after to try it out, and again I wasn't impressed with the spicyness but it was a funny sight to see. There was also a lot of annoying kids in here making a bunch of noise, so I made it my best to eat a wing or two then do the walk and eat to get out of there quickly.pass.

29.description: being from LA, i just didnt get the hype ... i wasnt a fan AT all . my chicken was drythe skin was thin & flaky [not in a good way]i think the fries were cooked in the same batter and i ate the chicken with the sauce STILL regular.

42.description: The food is good.  I will eat here again (if craving fried chicken and not willing to venture outside the south loop)With that being said, I'll also mention that the food was not "I need to tell everyone how good it is" or "Best southern style fried chicken".   I ordered the 2-piece chicken and 2-piece Perch fish meal with fries and sample of the coleslaw (a small ramekin hardly qualifies as a full side).  Chicken and fish were fried perfectly. Fries are meh and the coleslaw is good.Finally, the man working behind the counter was a nice guy so extra points for customer service.

23.description: I know three things. Pizza, cheeseburgers, and fried chicken. I've eaten at two Harold's now, and I don't get the positive reviews. Greasy chicken, slow service. Jewel has better chicken than this chain.

47.description: This Harold's is the bomb! I love their perch and I'm addicted to the batter dipped fries. I recently cheated on this Harold's with the one on Clark and Lake and that was a big mistake (to say the least). Now I can appreciate this location even more. My Favorite Harold's is 87 Dan Ryan, but this one holds the downtown title. Great job and keep up the good work!

8.description: The fried chicken is really good(on the bone), but it a little hit-or-miss, varying from alright to great

31.description: The wings were decent and the fries were mediocre. I would recommend stopping by for a low key, quick-ish dinner if you're in the area. But I would not recommend driving across the city because you heard this was a good fried chicken restaurant. And definitely don't come here needing to use the restroom. The worst thing about visiting Harold's is that I have a vision of the bathrooms stuck in my head forever.

34.description: Love Harold's fried chicken but the side choices aren't the best (you need greens with fried chicken) also wish they served up their chicken with white gravy or at least carried it. Wait time is ridiculous in store or delivery, been waiting an hour and 53 min for an order now. Called to confirm there was no issue and service was horrible....

16.description: I'm from NC. We know fried chicken. I've honestly had better fried chicken from a truck stop. Really bland and greasy. Also, it's a complete dump. Think black mold stains on the ceiling complimented by no restrooms. HOW DO I EAT CHICKEN IF I CANT WASH MY HANDS?

13.description: Get mild sauce on the side,  everything is drenched in sauce otherwise.We got a 30 piece bucket of chicken and 20 piece chicken nuggets with a side of fries, had the sauce been on the side, we would have enjoyed the food a lot more

11.description: I heard about Harold's Chicken Shack from watching an interview between Nardwuar and Common and if Common is plugging this place then it is a must try. I ordered the 5 piece wing dinner with hot sauce on the side. There was a slice of bread in my order which I am assuming they threw it in there to absorb the moisture so the chicken stays crispy. Overall the chicken was light and crispy and the hot sauce was above average. I recommend getting the sauce on the side so your chicken remains crispy.

39.description: Stopped by for a 2 piece and a soda.  First off the place is very dirty!  At 3:00 in the afternoon there were only a couple there with 5 employees and it took 15 min to get my food.  Chicken was cooked propper but nothing fancy at all!  It is regular friend chicken, nothing more. Had to edit my review.... the "plumber crack" from the guy cleaning tables was NOT a nice touch LOL

37.description: Not all Harold's are created equal. This particular location took an exceedingly long time to prepare the half-dark dinner. I ordered it with salt and pepper + mild sauce, but the chicken is outrageously bland and dangerously hot. What a cruel situation to make you hungry with a long wait and burning your tongue with grease. The mild sauce was sparsely tossed on and the fries were flavorless and bland (surprise surprise). Go to the Harold's in Hyde Park.

0.description: From 2007 to now, my very first Harold's Chicken Shack has acquired new brown vinyl seating and taken down their barn house red wooden booth dividers and yet the chicken is even better than my rose-colored recollection. Having learned from years of eating Harold's down in Hyde Park that dark meat is best, my friend and I ordered an 8-piece dark bucket and discovered that this Harold's uses smaller, but higher quality chickens than its Hyde Park cousin. The chicken came out very hot and very tasty and the wait time seemed shorter than expected. It's good to return to where my fried-chicken love began. PS - If you're looking for the magical, layered combination of white bread on top of sauced chicken on top of fries, then you should get one of the dinners instead of the bucket.

38.description: When i am hurry. Go eat chicken here. But the restaurant is little far from central downtown.

51.description: Save yourself five bucks and go to Popeyes instead. But for drunk 2 am food, I guess they enjoyed it.I had the shrimp 6 piece. I ate only the shrimp because the fries were flavorless and soggy.The atmosphere is kinda urban grungy cool at like 2 am.

27.description: Let me tell you this story so you can understand my rating.  I went to this location because it was in walking distance to the hotel where I stayed. I made my order and waited. The guy who ordered in front of me received his order. He opened the to go container and said "I don't want this bread!", picked it up and handed to the guy behind the counter. That guy behind the counter, in one fell swoop, put that same bread on top of my order of chicken. And that's why I'll NEVER set foot in this place again.

32.description: The chicken is dryer than the Sahara desert. The hot sauce was okay. There wasn't enough hot sauce on the fries and chicken. The coleslaw was probably the best part of the meal. The onion rings were crunchy and the batter to onion ratio was good but it was also dry. We came during lunch and the place was packed. It was good to try once but not worth a second visit.

54.description: Not impressed at all. How could this place be so famous? Seriously? I agree with someone else's comment. You can get better chicken at Popeyes or Church's. Not to mention the service wasn't the greatest. I'm from the south and maybe folks from up north just don't know any better. Save your money, go to someplace else. Limp, soggy fries, the actual chicken not seasoned. Not sure if the batter had any in it either. Def not worth the money. #letdown.

48.description: Very good friend chicken! Very crispy! I love the mild sauce... I wish they sold those and put it containers for people who travel so they can bring them back home! A part of me is hoping that my work sends me to Chicago soon just so i can have some food from here.....

44.description: We ordered lunch delivery for my coworkers birthday/to celebrate his baby being born last week Friday at 11:36am. We were starving by 12:30pm but gave them another 30 mins. At 1pm we called Harold's wondering where the order was and after waiting on hold for 10 minutes, were told they had no record of our order. So, the three of us decided to eat elsewhere separately, since it was already well past our lunch breaks. Which was a bummer since we wanted to eat together (it was a celebration after all). Fast forward to about 3pm and security at the front desk calls us to say that Harold's is there with our order?!? My coworker went downstairs to tell the delivery driver we didn't want the food. The driver was annoyed and told us that he couldn't issue a refund and we'd have to call. He motioned to the food and said "well do you want it or not?" My coworker took the food up to us and upon inspection we found that it was cold and we were missing 2 of the 8 pieces of chicken we ordered. The sides were correct, but that's all. After we finally stopped laughing and caught our collective breaths, we threw it in the microwave and brought it to a couple of the street musicians outside who were very happy to receive it. So at least some good came out of all this. Still, that is the last time we order from Harold's.

24.description: I ordered a popcorn chicken dinner. At every other Harold's, a small fry is mandatory for every chicken dinner. Except this fake ass white washed Harold's downtown. I got literally 18 French Fries with meal. Very dissatisfied & restaurant looks raunchy & has graffiti on the window. They even made the logo white & changed the name from Harold's Chicken King to Harold's Chicken Shack. This restaurant is very distasteful.

7.description: Ordered through yelp.  When the delivery did not come in the hour quoted, I called.  I was told that they quoted 2 hours to GrubHub(??? I ordered through yelp/eat24).   All around unhelpful service.

49.description: meh, skip it. Chicken was crispy but had no flavor. Fries were just ok. Grocery store fried chicken is better. You're in Chicago - you can do better!

40.description: OK Chicken....but NEVER, NEVER, NEVER give them your credit card! Two times in 3 years...my chase account has been stolen from ordering from this store. The people that work here are crooks.

53.description: Good staple. Always consistent but made to order so you will wait. We always get the 6 piece. It comes with 6 wings coleslaw white bread and fries. The mild sauce is delicious. We will always return when we visit Chicago.

30.description: I heard about Harold's Chicken Shack from watching an interview between Nardwuar and Common and if Common is plugging this place then it is a must try. I ordered the 5 piece wing dinner with hot sauce on the side. There was a slice of bread in my order which I am assuming they threw it in there to absorb the moisture so the chicken stays crispy. Overall the chicken was light and crispy and the hot sauce was above average. I recommend getting the sauce on the side so your chicken remains crispy.

46.description: You order at the counter, you get a number, and you wait for your order. I am country, so I ordered the chicken gizzards!!! They're hard to find in Phoenix! The gizzards were fantastic! I sat inside to eat. An asker of coins came in and made a beeline to my table. He inquired about my ability to spare coins so that he could get a bite to eat. I invited him to take half my order as I couldn't eat it all. He declined. Imagine that....Reasonably priced, pleasant staff, fast service.

1.description: Came in for something to eat fast when working around the corner. It's nice and clean inside. So much so that a local said this Harold's is like a 4 star hotel compared to the rest.Inside is clean and has a variety of tables avaliable.  In my opinion could have had a little more seating with the layout. Ordering food was pretty simple, chicken,  chicken and more chicken.  They do have shrimp and a variety of fish.  That's a good thing since most chickens places have well just chicken. There is also a good selection of side and sauces. Ordered my food and it felt like it took forever.  I'm a patient person but it was well over 10 mins for my order. The food wasn't bad. Had chicken strips.  Without sauce has a good flavor but lacks a little bite or spice. Definitely needs some type of sauce. Also the strips were huge. I got a 6 piece and couldn't finish it  each strip was almost have a chicken breast. Fries were good but nothing to rave about. In short I was hungry and needed some quick and easy. Harold's fit the bill but I probably won't be coming back. I'm from Florida and miss Guthrie's so maybe I'm spoiled a little

55.description: I just love Harolds - the wings are fried and boxed, and then you pick your sauce and add it, and the frying is just so good and I'm in love with their mild sauce.Cooked well, guy behind the counter was nice, and we were in and out quickly (especially for fresh-made food).

9.description: It's Harold's Chicken....need I say anymore! Chicken wings are their specialty.  It's easy to mess up fried chicken but they get it right every time.

26.description: Get mild sauce on the side,  everything is drenched in sauce otherwise.We got a 30 piece bucket of chicken and 20 piece chicken nuggets with a side of fries, had the sauce been on the side, we would have enjoyed the food a lot more

25.description: This place is like the Harold's Chicken used to be back in the day.  I prefer my sauce on the side.  To me that is the only way you can truly know how good the food is.  I only give 3 stars because of the service I get when the lady that is normally there is off or on her lunch break or something.  Whoever takes her place is very rude over the phone when I try to call ahead of time.  I use to go every Friday for lunch.  But since the last incident I go when I get the taste for it.

12.description: This is old school goodness.  This place is not fancy, just great food.  I got ours to go, it was fast, the people friendly, if you are in the neighborhood, stop by, simply amazing

59.description: Good fried chicken - and I love their fries. Though... if you're gonna charge for ranch, at least fill up the containers. Mine were barely half-filled.

21.description: We were seriously craving some fried chicken in the South Loop, so of course, we turned to Harold's. We called in the order and picked it up. There can be quite a long wait if you order in store. This location is nicer than some other locations, but it's still pretty no frills. We got the 1/2 dark chicken dinner with salt and pepper and mild sauce. The dinner came with 2 thighs and 2 legs, fries, and a piece of white bread. The chicken was moist and the crispy skin was awesome. I probably stick to dark meat, since it's less likely to be dry. The sauce was covering everything and was delicious. It did make the fries a little soggy, but they still tasted good. Overall, a great quick fix for your fried chicken craving.

17.description: Great deal and tasty food. We got the Two pieces fried chicken with onion rings for $6.99 & three pieces Cod Fish with fries for $5.99. The fried chicken with hot sauce...very tasty. The cod fish was not all the way cook but still really good.  Good choice for Fast, quick, and tasty!

10.description: You order at the counter, you get a number, and you wait for your order. I am country, so I ordered the chicken gizzards!!! They're hard to find in Phoenix! The gizzards were fantastic! I sat inside to eat. An asker of coins came in and made a beeline to my table. He inquired about my ability to spare coins so that he could get a bite to eat. I invited him to take half my order as I couldn't eat it all. He declined. Imagine that....Reasonably priced, pleasant staff, fast service.

5.description: No free refills first of all. Overpriced wings that is mostly made up of flour. Wings are nothing to brag about. Buffalo Wild Wings/ Wingstop is a million times better with way more options.

3.description: I love the food, but I refuse to eat at a place that houses cockroaches. After my girlfriend, and I had paid for our food she mentioned that I was about to step on a bug. Turns out it is a cockroach. It crawled under a crack in the counter and disappeared. This is absolutely disgusting and I lost all appetite for the food I ordered. I will never be returning to this establishment. I highly recommend eating at a more sanitary location.

35.description: found this place on groupon a while back, awesome spot!!have been back a few times since, always delicious

19.description: Not all Harold's are created equal. This particular location took an exceedingly long time to prepare the half-dark dinner. I ordered it with salt and pepper + mild sauce, but the chicken is outrageously bland and dangerously hot. What a cruel situation to make you hungry with a long wait and burning your tongue with grease. The mild sauce was sparsely tossed on and the fries were flavorless and bland (surprise surprise). Go to the Harold's in Hyde Park.

28.description: Conveniently located close to the Hilton Chicago, I walked to this Harold's location. The staff was very friendly.  I ordered their fried Perch dinner and calamari. Both dishes were cooked wonderfully. While eating there, I encountered every walk of life: students, working people, convention goers, city dwellers and tourists. Just minor complaints here. I did not care for one of their hot sauces as it was mainly ketchup based and there was a random slice of plain white bread in with either dish. Not sure what I was to use it for exactly as the two orders came with fries. Overall a good local experience.

45.description: Mediocre fried fish and small, bland wings. You can smell the grease from the corner. Ugh. It was a quick late night snack I could have done without. Nothing spectacular about this 'fast food' joint and worth the stop-in. Maybe some of the other locations are better.

33.description: Staff was rude, hair in the food, place is filthy, no bread or slaw with my order, took forever. Do not eat here.

43.description: What's the fuss? Really, Best Fried Chicken in America? Don't think so - maybe I was in the wrong branch - but there was nothing to-die-for with this fried chicken. It was just so-so.

2.description: Terrible. It was like punch to the gut. I had shrimp there and it was okay. I think the hot sauce did me in my insides felt bloated after I left.Strange ambiance and I couldnt help but notice the couple making out In the booth.... wow was that.ridiculous.The serving of cole slaw.was hilarious. It was served in a tartar sauce container but that turned out to be okay with me because it tasted horrible.

18.description: There's a chain in Houston called Frenchy's, where the only acceptable answer is to visit the O.G. in the third ward. Other franchises need not apply. However, if you do happen to stumble upon the originator, you're treated to some of the greatest fried chicken that walked the G's green earth.Chicago's finest, or at least most-well known, Harold's Chicken Shack, has been far more prolific than Frenchy's, but perhaps it falls under the same purview. I'm not even sure where the original Harold's sits, but it's most assuredly not this South Loop location (one of two in the Sloop, in fact).As such, the fried chicken at Harold's on Wabash is decidedly average. The chicken, particularly the thigh, runs on the small side, and the crisp decidedly lacks flavor. A chicken dinner comes standard with fries, seasoned decently, and a very delicious hot sauce. If taking to go, hot sauce is most definitely recommended on the side, as it quickly permeates the chicken skin and will render it soggy. A small side of cole slaw and some white bread recalls a fun visit to Raising Cane's.All in all, I just really miss Frenchy's. Or, y'know, maybe the Memphis mafia can bring me a Gus' Fried Chicken location in Chi-town. I mean, they opened one in Austin and all...

41.description: Returning home after a 700 mile trip all I could think about was ordering from Harold's Chicken Shack! I had raved to my family Christmas Eve day that our office had ordered food from Harold's and how delicious my chicken wing dinner was. Never before had I had a wing with so much meat!!! Needless to say I ordered the Bucket/3 sides and my husband & son now know what I was talking about!

52.description: I first tasted their chicken at this years taste of Chicago . Chicken was very crispy with a light breaded crust. The sauce was not spicy but was tangy. While downtown yesterday I brought my family who was visiting Chicago . We ordered chicken for 9 adults n 2 kids. Expecting the same the first of my experience was a young lady who took our order was very rude. She was agitated with all our questions. She didn't know any answers. She wouldn't look at me when I talking to her . Rolling her eyes ! I was shocked! Why is she the one to help customers ! I'm so glad we didn't eat there ! Although the chicken was good it was not the same we had at the taste of Chicago . The mild sauce is just ketchup. We ordered 20 pieces and only was given. 4 little cups with the order. Had to pay extra for more sauce. Not going back ! Won't recommend !

50.description: I ordered the three drum special, and husband ordered the catfish.  He enjoyed the catfish, though it was too hot to eat at first.  My chicken, on the other hand, was just OK:  a little on the dry-side with no distinct flavor or seasoning.

4.description: I am completely baffled by the negative reviews of Harold's. Being a true southerner now living in Chicago, I know chicken. I KNOW the chicken. Fried chicken is very easy to screw up. And being cognizant of that, I am super picky when it comes to trying new chicken joints. Harold's was recommended to me by all of my associates and so I finally tried. Usually I just resort to Popeye's and call it a night. This Saturday night I decided to finally test the grease at Harold's and boy I'm glad I did. The only reason why this review isn't 5 stars is because of the subpar team of workers. I ordered 5 wings and a piece of white fish. I had the hot sauce ordered on the side. I was so pleased with the made to order nature of the place! The chicken was piping hot when I sat down. The seasoning brought back so many memories growing up in the country of North Carolina. My wings were juicy and tangy/spicy from the hot sauce. The fries were on point too! What I could do without is the toast. Hello, we need biscuits! Not toast Harold!!!Other than that, I will definitely return.

6.description: WTH? That is what I left here asking myself. This place is SO overrated. In fact, I've never experienced a more overrated place in all of my life. First things first : the atmosphere was mad cafeteria at a school in the ghetto like. There were goons and homeless persons in every corner of the dining area. I stood at the counter debating about whether my curiosity about this so-called delicious chicken was worth my life. More goons entered as I stood there contemplating. I was surrounded. The tension in the air was mad thick as each goon visually inspected the other for any familiarity or past transgressions. I got the chills. I was steady debating and simultaneously shaking. I gave up and placed an order; life's too short and I'm the quintessential foodie. I ordered a 5 wings dinner and a bottled water. It came out  to about $8.65 +\-. I ordered the mild sauce everyone keeps posting about. People have raved about the sauce being this or that. Many have went on and on talking about "wonder what's in that secret sauce..."  Hey wise guy!! From what I can tell, that "secret sauce" was nothing more than ketchup with hot sauce in it. Wtf?! Worse: The wings were not fresh at all and were fried over and over and over again. The fries were average and nothing to get excited about. Overall, I left feeling tricked; hoodwinked; and just played. Never again! This place is BEYOND overrated and I will not be returning.

22.description: The place itself looks a little run down and old but the food is very redeeming.  There are some mispricings in the menu you can take advantage of, such as two orders of three wings being cheaper than one order of six wings (plus you get extra sides for ordering twice in addition to a cheaper unit price).  The fried chicken itself has crispy skin with surprisingly little oil and well-cooked, tender meat.  It also comes with a side of fries and a small cole slaw sample, both of which were pretty good.  The amount you get for your money and the quality of the chicken makes Harold's Chicken a better option than KFC or Popeye's.

15.description: Just finished my meal that was delivered to my hotel. It's the best chicken I've ever had!  It had wonderful flavor. The French fries we ordered had good flavor too!  They were seasoned. The price was reasonable ($12.95 for bucket of 8pc dark chicken). Delivery was fast considering the weather today. It was sleeting all day and the roads are bad. The delivery man was super friendly and apologized for the long wait but it really wasn't!  The only complaint I would have is that they were out of lemonade however they let me substitute with Snapple and they didn't offer mashed potatoes and gravy on the menu. Otherwise this is a great place that delivers if you're craving fried chicken!

57.description: In NYC, you know this as Kennedy Fried Chicken. Harold's serves every food item that you can imagine, but battered, drenched in grease and fried. Yum.Everything is fried to order, so I guess that's comforting, but somehow the place doesn't smell like fried foods, in fact, it doesn't smell like anything.We stuck with a basic order of 4 chicken wings. They were STEAMING HOT when we got them, so be careful, or you'll burn your face off. They were pretty good, reminded me of wings that we get at our local Chinese food joint, just way more oily. Nothing special. Rus seemed to really enjoy them. I was kind of amazed that people were actually ordering and eating fried livers. Didn't realize that was still a thing.Oh well, to each his fried own!

20.description: I am completely baffled by the negative reviews of Harold's. Being a true southerner now living in Chicago, I know chicken. I KNOW the chicken. Fried chicken is very easy to screw up. And being cognizant of that, I am super picky when it comes to trying new chicken joints. Harold's was recommended to me by all of my associates and so I finally tried. Usually I just resort to Popeye's and call it a night. This Saturday night I decided to finally test the grease at Harold's and boy I'm glad I did. The only reason why this review isn't 5 stars is because of the subpar team of workers. I ordered 5 wings and a piece of white fish. I had the hot sauce ordered on the side. I was so pleased with the made to order nature of the place! The chicken was piping hot when I sat down. The seasoning brought back so many memories growing up in the country of North Carolina. My wings were juicy and tangy/spicy from the hot sauce. The fries were on point too! What I could do without is the toast. Hello, we need biscuits! Not toast Harold!!!Other than that, I will definitely return.

36.description: I love going here for lunch, I work in the area and my staff and I love the chicken. I'm glad they finally realized the difference between mild sauce and barbeque sauce.

14.description: I have to say that the food by my house from Sharks is slightly better but I'm not knocking this place. The hot sauce from Harold's is amazing and I believe they sell it to go. Definitely recommended.

1.description: Consistently the slowest service.   Don't go there if you're in a hurry.   Or if you plan on getting anything else done all day.

0.description: I was getting same stuff dollar menu as always so I got a large coke fries and a small chicken sandwich I went home ate all the fries my moms ice-cream I ate and I saved the San witch for later it was as hard as a rock ewe

3.description: ok so after I managed to find myself at another adventure ( or misadventure) I saw this fish shack right by the green line station at 43rdI went right into this place and I thought it was one of those remittance places because everything was behind glass. so since I got myself lost already, what the heck might as well go for the goods. I was looking over the menu and the pictures that they have on the walls. everything here is fried heaven! fried catfish, fried shrimps, fried perch, fried chicken and more fried stuff! I went for the fried catfish nuggets for 7 bucks and headed back onto the train. in my seat, i opened up my bagged package of fried goodness! and the catfish nuggets were the most crispiest and flavorful catfish nuggets I have ever tried! and as a bonus, the fries were cooked to perfection. crisp on the outside, soft and real potaoey goodness inside! i wouldn't mind getting lost again one of these days for this kind of real  and straightforward food! btw, HUGE portions too! p.s don't complain about the ambience. it's ZERO :)

1.description: I decided to try this place since it was coveniently located close to where I am living currently. It is in a super sketch part of Bronzeville (the windows are bulletproof) so I was nervous the entire time I was inside the restaurant. Good thing I ordered ahead so I could just pay and leave. The transaction was quick and easy. I ordered 2 piece perch 3 piece chicken wing dinner with double fries and a piece of red velvet cake. HELLO CALORIES! :) But I have no regrets. The fish were perfectly seasoned and moist, tasted fresh too. The chicken was also perfectly seasoned and juicy. I love the lemon pepper they sprinkle on right before they serve it to you. Gives it a nice zing to the flavor. The fries were average. The toast was blah. They need a better roll instead of a piece of grilled white bread The red velvet cake was STELLAR!  I don't think J&J makes the cakes though. Whoever is the owner of Bess Cakes, you are wonderful! Dense, chocolatey, smooth with homemade icing. You could tell there were no box or cans used to prepare the cake. All in all a great experience. Some have complained about sub par "ghetto" service. Realize where you are and judge accordingly. Sorry, the harsh reality.

2.description: My "catfish" is shaped like a U-shaped sea urchin :-/ super dense & dry. Not the juicy lemon pepper sprinkled fish I was hoping for. Shan't be returning to this location.

0.description: Quick, tasty and easy! Ordered a $5 deal meal of 2 catfish fillets which came with fries and coleslaw. Generous portions and well priced. The other patrons were nice. Great way to buy local and fast fix for dinner.

4.description: The best chicken and shrimp combo on the south side! Now if they would take down the bulletproof glass, get rid of loitering, a coat of fresh paint and new floors it MIGHTbe inviting! LOL!!!!

12.description: I am new to Chicago and had horrible experiences with salons in the past...and then I found Binta! I have gotten microbraids and box braids multiple times...and I loooooove them (pictures coming soon). I even have a friend that traveled from Memphis and got her hair braided. She always accommodates my crazy schedule and prices are more than fair. If you are looking for a pleasant and professional experience...give her a call. You will not be disappointed.

7.description: These ladies were absolutely amazing and super fast! I contacted Binta two days earlier for saving on my hair and she was able to get me in. I laughed and talked the entire time. It is not often you feel at home when trying a new stylist. The attention to detail and atmosphere will have me coming back. Thanks again ladies!

3.description: Binta is so nice and so talented. She did my marley twists very quickly and they were still beautiful the day I took them down. I plan to go back very soon!

1.description: I really enjoyed getting my hair braided by Binta. Not only is she punctual, she is very friendly and personable. She listened to my requests and my braids are not excruciatingly tight - very comfortable and light, in fact - whilst leaving my edges intact! She moves very quickly and cleanly while tending to my tresses. I'm natural so this is critical for me. She gave me recommendations on how to care for the braids to extend its life and honestly I get complimented on my braids every day. I will be going back and highly recommend her.

2.description: Great service here! The staff is very kind and they work fast. I'm very satisfied with my hair. My small senegalese twists were finished in under 6 hours. Make sure you wash your hair before visiting. There's an additional fee for that.

9.description: My nine-year-old daughter has long, thick hair, and had been asking me about doing micro braids for a while. I found Binta's not too far from us & called, and at first Binta didn't think she could get us in same day, which was understandable...yet she said she'd call me back in 15 minutes, and she did and was able to. The stylist who was doing my daughter's hair wasn't there when we arrived and she was over an hour late, which we weren't happy about, but once she started, she was really fast!! After they realized just how thick my daughter's hair was they called for help, LOL, so she had two ladies working on her and it got done much faster. (3 1/2 hours instead of 5).
