The second lady was starting to do it like hers was (going straight back with no part), and I had to tell her that we wanted it with a part (I thought they should have asked instead of just assuming), but that was not a problem and they were able to do it how we wanted it.  Overall we are very pleased. These braids are not cheap, but they are well worth it. Binta is super nice, very professional, and we would definitely use her service again.

18.description: I have been getting my dreads done at Binta's for a little over 2 years now everytime is like the first time, the lady that does my hair does a great job with everything, The shop is clean and they make you feel like family. The lady who has been doing my hair is very professional and doesnt spend several hours like most shops I have been to in the past, I recommend Binta's to everyone.

10.description: After reading the reviews, I really wanted to like this place. However, my experience was less than delightful. I try to be fair with my feedback. Which is why I created a list of pros and cons:Pros:Very cleanStreet parkingPolite (at first)Flexible schedulingPrice commensurate with the competition (hair is included with the cost of service)Cons:VERY CHEAP QUALITY HAIRLack of focus on instruction when stylingInterns working on hairArgumentativeRude behavior (if you are not satisfied with their work)Scheduling the appointment was a very pleasant process. She was willing to discuss what I was looking for and provided suggestions.As mentioned above, the quality of hair is extremely cheap. I recommend buying your own hair instead of using the "free hair". I texted the owner twice Nd asked about the quality/brand of hair she uses. Each time, my question was ignored with no response. Ironically, any other question I had, she did not hesitate to answer.The installation of the braids I wanted was very professional. However, my satisfaction quickly turned into disgust when they could execute on the style after I showed them pictures before the appointment and three times during the appointment. Needless to say, I hated the outcome of my hair. The good news is, they offered to do it over for free. I did however, have to take the braids down myself; which was not a problem. When I came back to get my hair redone. I was greeted with attitude and cynicism from the owner and her workers. They had the nerve to be at me. I'm the one who had to sit for 6hrs for the first installation, take it down for  four hours, drive an hour back to the location, and sit there to get it done again another eight hours.  Overall,I would not recommend them if you have a moderate or high expectation for competency in understanding and providing exactly what the customer request.

13.description: Binta's place is great-- clean, friendly, customer oriented. They started on time and did a solid job.

16.description: I got hair done at Binta's today as always she did an awesome job. I love my hair and she's the only person that I allow to braid my hair. She is nice and professional and her shop is clean with a nice atmosphere. Thanks Binta.

17.description: Went to Binta about 2 weeks ago for the first time and I am still loving my box braids. She was very knowledgeable and accommodating.

15.description: I was looking for someone to do my Senegalese Twist and I found bintas hair braiding she is so wonderful and she made me very comfortable. I hadn't got my hair braided in a while because I had a bad experience at another shop so I did a bunch of research since my hair is natural I want someone to do my hair who knows how to manage my hair binta took her time and was very gentle. I am definitely going to go back to her. And my hair looks great

0.description: Binta was fantastic and very welcoming to this first timer.  She did my braids in prep for an MMA style event I have and it is perfect! She was quick and very reasonably priced. Thank you!

5.description: Visited for the first time today to get Senegalese twist and I will definitely be going back. They did a beautiful job. It's a little pricey but well worth it. The shop is clean and the women work so fast. And the chairs are comfy.

11.description: I have searched high and low for a CLEAN braid shop and Binta's is it!!! I was so pleased with Binta and her staffs professionalism. I called at the last minute so I didn't think i could get in, but Binta called me right back with an appointment that she was able to plug me in. Everyone was so kind and courteous. Binta welcomed me in with her warm smile. Right then I knew I was in the right place. I am so sorry that I don't recall the young ladies' names that did my hair. But they were awesome. I didn't realize my twist would be so tiny, but still, it only took them 5 1/2 - 6 hrs to do. Normally this style would be 10 hrs plus, easy. I am very pleased and definitely recommend to any one. Thank you again ladies! And the little cutie too!

8.description: Great experience! Binta and her sister twisted my hair this week.  My experience was really wonderful.  We started on time and the laides twisted my hair until we were done! No breaks.  Binta answered all of my questions and executed on my request. The shop is very clean with free street parking right in front. She never pressured me to write a review, but I wanted to share my positve experience.

4.description: Friendly, warm & professional staff; comfortable and inviting salon, conveniently located just off the Red line in a lovely neighborhood. Reasonable price, respectful of clients time. Beautiful work. Highly recommend!

14.description: Last minute calling to make an appt. Binta fit me in with no problem. It was an easy place to find, with free parking, and the person she had to work on me started immediately. I got cornrows and they look very nice.

6.description: Binta was the nicest, most personable, most accommodating hair stylist I've ever been to. She kept making sure I was comfortable and that I liked the style before she continued. Hands down the best Havana twists ever. Will be back again and again and AGAIN!!! And she has fast fingers!!! This woman/shop is legit!!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair

3.description: I have been a customer of success since day one formerly known as maxima salon. I would first like to point out that the staff is very professional and very courteous. the staff  is very accommodating to its clients.I'm especially impressed with the owner Andre who reaches out and meets and greets every customer.  Success is managed very professionally and it is family friendly atmosphere where everyone feels welcome .The barbers are very well skilled in their trade I have yet to see or hear of an unsatisfied customer. Sucess delivers on its mission statement providing prompt professional service with a smile.

1.description: The worst place.. I called them to ask about highlights.. And they say you have to come and talk. I told them that i just need the estimate. And they said thankyou and hang up! They do not respect their customers. I wouldn't ever suggest anybody to go here

2.description: I've been going to this barber salon for years (previously called Maxima) and couldn't  imagine going anywhere else. The atmosphere is very relaxed and respectful. I have had several barbers since I moved to Chicago in 2007, but Andre is by far the best. He listens to you and will ask questions to make sure he knows exactly what you want BEFORE he starts cutting your hair. Truthfully, every barber and hair stylist that I have met there is a professional and truly knows their craft. I can't imagine going anywhere else!!

0.description: Won't find a better barber shop!Max cuts my boys' hair (or will when AJ gets his new year (first) cut). He has hooked C4 up and this time was no different. The atmosphere inside is clean, inviting, fun and professional. The people are courteous, punctual and on point. Makes me wish I wasn't bald, but I can live vicariously through my boys. Check them out - just don't take my appointment slot!!!!

4.description: I've been going to Maxima for the past several years and have always been impressed by the quality of the cuts and quality of the people that work there. If you're looking for a place for great service from great people, Maxima's the place.

3.description: This Walgreens has come a long way! I've been coming here since 2008 and I can tell you its done a 360. The staff is much nicer and the store is kept clean. They now have produce, quick lunches like sandwiches, wraps, and sushi. Although the sushi isn't good. Cigarettes are actually cheaper here compared to some gas stations believe it or not.

1.description: Every time I come in here the midget security guard follows me around like I'm stealing or something so fucking annoying

2.description: Surprisingly decent. There are allot of young ppl that work here and usually young ppl are rude but here, they are actually  polite.

0.description: Hey, it's my neighborhood Walgreens. I have to give it 5 stars.I'm in here a lot and that's because this location is clean, well staffed and has the stuff I need. The staff is always friendly and the manager is on top of things. Very happy that the corporate office decided not to try and carry alcohol here again.

Nice place. So far I've got my hair lined up a few times. Now I'm bringing my son. Its always somewhere to park and you can relax and look at a movie playing and buy your self a snack until it's your turn. Its clean and no hair all over the floor the washroom is very nice and clean. And if you need a Mani & pedi the nail technician can take care of that

28.description: Oh man ... I want to give Abundance FOUR stars or more but can not.  I heard about the bakery during a CCOB meeting and thought I would support a local business.  Even though I was the only person in the store and it took the owner more than 7 minutes to come to the front to serve me - I gave it a shot.  I bought a sampling of stuff; 1 chocolate chip cookie, 2 brownies and the infamous carmel cupcake.  I brought it home and my husband and I sampled each ... although not bad ... the food tasted old, lard like and a bit stale.  Not sure if I stomach to try again ... boy oh boy ... I really wanted to LOVE it ...

1.description: I found this bakery on yelp. I would have never tried this bakery if it was not from the other reviews. The other reviews were accurate it is very small inside. There is a sign posted on counter for customers not be on their cell phone while placing orders. Of course I saw the sign and politely exited my phone call. However the clerk was on her phone with Peoplegas during the whole entire time. There is a $5 minimum to use your debit/credit card so I purchased two items. I purchased a apple fritter and a slice of caramel cake. The apple fritter was enormous and delicious. After two days I still have not finished the apple fritter. Maybe I should have a midnight snack. The caramel cake was soft and fluffy. The caramel is sweet with a soft creamy texture. I do not know what I was thinking when I was driving all the way to Angelica's Bakery. I would have given this bakery five stores but the cashier ruined that. Has she heard of blue tooth or the mute button?

9.description: The apple fritter is flat, large, and generously studded with apple chunks, pecans (both pieces and halves), and cinnamon. I typically am not a big fan of nuts, but I really enjoyed this fritter. I haven't tried the fritter at Old Fashioned Donuts yet, but I liked this one better than the apple fritter at Glazed & Infused. I arrived around 9:30am on a Saturday, and there was about half a tray of fritters remaining. I also saw cinnamon buns and some simple, old-style donut varieties for sale. The store is old, tiny, and there aren't any tables or counter space to eat in, but you just tear into this stuff in your car. There isn't anything noteworthy around this shop so you kinda just drive here for the fritters then head back. If I lived closer, I would probably stop in a couple times per year to get my fritter fix. Recommend!

29.description: To be clear I have never been in this bakery. What I am going to write about is the caramel cake that I had at a birthday party. It was soooooo good. All everyone was talking about was the cake. It was THE BEST piece of cake I have ever had. I kept looking at it and fantasizing about running my spoon along the base of the cake, picking up all that caramel that had dripped down the sides of the cake. I can not say enough about this cake!!

23.description: For my final bites of Chicago, the decision was made to exit the city in the same way I entered; a long morning run followed by a drive to the south side just as the sun was rising to visit a bakery, this time one called Abundance - a tiny storefront that even with my GPS I drove right past before realizing my error and a place that was surprisingly unheard of by every single one of my local epicurean friends despite its 20+ year history turning out baked goods, sandwiches, soups, and beverages six days a week.Originally pointed to Abundance by a blog while doing my research on Old Fashioned Donuts my arrival to the small shop would again find me in a less than ideal area but unlike my first destination this one was devoid of customers save for myself.  Entering the small shop to the familiar smell of baked goods a set of jingle bells on the door seemed to startle the elderly gentleman behind the counter who was arranging fresh baked donuts and with a big smile he introduced himself as Bill and welcomed me to 'his' store - something I would have figured out shortly as there we newspaper clippings featuring his face and his goods decorating the small amount of available wall space not consumed by the pastry cases.  A pleasant man who seemed quite interested in why I had a camera and more so how I'd heard about his store we spent a few minutes chatting before he asked me "so, what can I get ya?" and deferring to his recommendations plus a few personal favorites I emerged from the small shop with five items weighing well over a pound for less than $10.With each item save for one still hot from the oven my tasting would start with the two lightest choices in a pair of yeast raised donuts, one simply glazed and the other chocolate, and much like those from Old Fashioned these were exactly what you would expect from an old-school bakery with a good rise, sugary frosting, and yeasty notes punctuated by a bit of butter.  It isn't reinventing the when and it isn't trying to.Moving next to a dish heavily promoted by a few bloggers as well as by Bill himself, much like Old Fashioned Donuts, Abundance serves a pretty damned big Apple Fritter and while Bill wouldn't say it when I jokingly asked ("they're different") I'll tell you right now that I actually preferred the version at Abundance, a half-skateboard length oblong disc chock-full of soft apple chunks and teaming with cinnamon.  Served hot but with the lacquer of glaze well set over the golden pastry and heavy without being oily I'd be lying if I didn't admit that this was even a lot of sugar and fat for my gluttonous vacationing self, but with a nearly six hour drive home it was gone before I hit the Ohio border - and leading to a lovely sugar-crash induced nap perhaps thirty minutes after I walked through my door.Having mentioned five items, another warm indulgence that I ate half of while standing outside the bakery (saving the rest for a post-nap dinner) was the Walnut Apple Bread Pudding, a dense concoction that Bill told me is soaked for nearly 12 hours before being baked in the morning and falling somewhere between pound cake, bread pudding, and a sort of pull-apart quick bread I will simply note that while there was nothing 'designer' about this item it was quite perfect in a rustic way - the sort of bread pudding you could just as easily make at home but never do...and probably for the best as (if you're anything like me) you'd end up eating the whole pan within 48 hours.  With the first four selections sufficiently sweet and uniformly good-to-great, my final selection from Abundance very well may have been the most memorable take-out pastry of the trip; an item titled "Upside down Caramel Cupcake" that came in a plastic clamshell container with a spoon - and for good reason as this was most certainly not your average cupcake.  Beginning first with the upside down presentation, my best guess for this delivery was to prevent the cake from tipping over and to facilitate easy application of the glaze, a thick homemade melted caramel that was as buttery as it was sweet and just saline enough to keep it from being overwhelming.  Moving next to the cake itself, again atypical for a cupcake and all the better for it, imagine a dense pound cake with even more butter...or for those who've been to Maestro's Steakhouse simply imagine their buttercake served chilled with caramel instead of warm with ice cream - it was good enough that if you really wanted to call it a cupcake it would rank in my top five all time and when placed in the context of everything else at Abundance it really makes me wonder why the tiny shop doesn't get more attention because as a complete package inclusive of customer service, selection, price, and execution Abundance is an absolute diamond in the rough.

5.description: South-side bakeries know how to make an apple fritter.  What is in the water down there??  I can't explain why Abundance Bakery takes #2 on the apple fritter list right behind Old Fashioned Donuts, but whatever they are doing, they should keep it a secret!The Abundance apple fritter boasts every quality that you could want--plus nuts!  I think pecans but I'm not sure.  Anyway, this is really close to a perfect apple fritter--slightly crispy exterior, pillowy soft interior, the perfect level of sweetness, a generous sprinkling of cinnamon, and enough apple chunks to land in every bite.  Plus the one that I got on Saturday morning was still warm!  Triphena W. is right: "you just tear into this stuff in your car."  Mine was gone by the time I got home.It's a small shop, but they sell a lot of great doughnuts (in the cases) and many other baked goods (on the menu but not out for display when I was there).  Their yeast-raised glazed was wonderful, as was the chocolate-and-coconut-covered cake doughnut.  I thought that the icing on the yeast-raised chocolate-iced lacked chocolate flavor, but it was still a solid doughnut.And besides baking supremely tasty treats, the people are very nice.If you are ever making a Chicago Apple Fritter Tour (this is common, right?), Abundance absolutely MUST be a stop.

31.description: Fresh, amazing donuts with NO wait in line! I came here recently to grab a dozen for a morning get-together with friends and these babies were a HIT! I tried the glazed and the plain and let me tell you there was nothing plain about it. Dee-licious! I will be back!

25.description: Absolutely helpful and wonderful people as I made a last minute dash for a birthday cake. CARAMEL CAKE IS AMAZING.  I'm always happy to support local business but this place couldn't make it any easier.  To think I was going to run by Whole Foods instead...BLASPHEMY!

12.description: I had to take off 2 stars because sometimes the pastries taste old, like they were prepared maybe a day or two prior. I've had a few brownies that were hard and dry. When they are freshly prepared they are moist and chewy. I've also had a caramel cupcake that was dry, so the consistency isn't there with their food. Get it together you guys!

21.description: Stopped by this business on a whim because I remembered reading the great  reviews on yelp. This was definitely a good call! Headed to Ravinia I needed a dessert for my picnic. The Upside down caramel cupcake is RIDICULOUS! OMG, so moist on sight, I knew it would be a winner. Now this is a dessert! The customer service was great, the young girl behind the counter gave her insight on the best desserts and the owner was on site and suggested the cupcake. Very nice man, all were warm and engaging.They even offered free iced tea to the customers. A great experience for the area. Worth your quick run in during daylight hours...

16.description: DONUTS! That's Abundance's sweet spot. I love bringing a couple dozen of these donuts to work. I am immediately the most popular person in the office.  And they don't cost an arm and a leg like they would at some of the more trendy bakeries in Chicago. The glazed donut is my hands down favorite.  Have you ever been to the hipster-loving Peter Pan Bakery in Brooklyn? I have, and these donuts rival those.  Yea for Bronzeville!

17.description: 1. I ordered a cake yesterday day for pickup this afternoon. The man on the phone was so unorganized that I thought it best to travel to the store to pay for the cake instead of wasting ANOTHER 25 minutes on the phone. Get to the store and they cant find the ticket for my order that the man JUST wrote, so I had to start over.2. Went to pick up the cake at 11:27am (pick up time was 11:30am) and the lady tells me (without any apology) that it isn't ready. Finally get the cake 20 minutes later which made me late back to my office for the lunch in which I needed it for.3. Co-workers all gathered in the conference room. I go to cut into the cake and realize that its FROZEN!!! I broke a plastic cake knife trying to saw through it. 4. Finally get the woman back on the phone to tell her that my cake was FROZEN and she tells me that they typically bake the cake then throw it in the freezer to harden it up enough to decorate. Oh, and she should have told me that I needed to let it thaw before I ate it. I was clearly unhappy but she offered no resolution. She just had an "oh well" attitude. I admit that this place makes good pastries, for the most part, but the customer service is HORRIBLE and I will never ever give them any of my money again. At this point I'd rather go to jewel for a cake.

10.description: Sugar and butter capital. Do not attempt to walk into this bakery looking for a light pastry. Abundance is the correct title. The cinnamon roll was large and filling and wonderful. Most of the cakes or brownies are heavy. Full of deadly goodness. I personally enjoyed it especially for the price. The bakery itself looks a little funky but... the desserts are nice.

11.description: I am not a pastry/dessert person, but the caramel cupcake at abundance is excellent! Driving by you'll think it's closed, but it's worth it to stop in to be sure. Often time, the owner is the one working in the shop and he is very pleasant and happy to serve his customers. You can tell that his desserts are made with love each morning. If you're ever in the area, stop in and give them a try!

26.description: OMG -- Yes, you will be shouting when you taste any of the baked goods from this bakery. Believe me - you will be in love. Our family frequents this bakery for all special occasions (and we have lots of them). The owners and their family are true gems. We love them and they can predict our orders! I've recommended this bakery to a number of people and they've all become addicts. I brought one of the carmel cakes to a board meeting and only crumbs were left at the end. You won't be disappointed.

27.description: I like the caramel cupcakes so much I had to try some other items on the menu. Well, sorry to say, they didn't go over like the the cupcakes did. I bought banana pudding and bread pudding. The bread pudding tasted like a cinnamon bun. The banana pudding had the consistency of a gelatin  mold and while was not gag-worthy, it just wasn't a tasty delight.  The young man who served me was nice and handsome though-thus far I have never had  service issue here. This won't keep me away but  I certainly won't order those again. I think I'm just really spoiled by my mom and grandmom's cooking-IDK.

0.description: I found this bakery while looking for a place that would deliver a birthday cake to my friend. Some 1500 miles away, I was able to place the order over the telephone. The staff was very friendly and helped with a lot of my questions. They were even able to write a message on the cake with some decorating. They scheduled my delivery for the next day and my friend loved it! Hopefully next time I'm in town I can check out this amazing apple fritter!

20.description: Thank you for being so FAR away. Well, you are sortof close but not convenient for me to get to. If you were closer, I'd need to eventually be on The Biggest Loser. THE BEST, by  far, caramel cake I have ever put in my mouth is from this bakery. I have had huge caramel cake  cravings  the past week. I can't believe I found the best caramel cake in the city. At last.. Here, at Abundance Bakery.Go. Go. Go.Eat. Eat. Stuff your face.Don't feel guilty for it.And if you do, I am also a personal trainer.I'll help you take  the pounds off.And then we can celebrate by eating more caramel cakes at Abundance Bakery!

19.description: I bought my daughters birthday cake from this place and I will never go to this place again.....my daughter love strawberries so I ask for a full sheet cake with strawberries but I got pineapples I was upset. Not to mention the dryness of the cake OMG

33.description: This place has the BEST bread pudding I've ever had in my life. It's less than $3 a slice, and is far better than the bread pudding desserts I've had at fairly fancy restaurants like Ruth's Chris Steakhouse. Each slice is probably a thousand calories, but hey, that's why it tastes so amazing. All of their other wares are delicious too of course, but the bread pudding is a real standout.

2.description: And the chocolate donuts!  The crunch! Donuts with crunch.  So good. I was sad though that my Apple fritter didn't have the same crunch as the one from my first visit.  Consistency is key to getting that fifth star!

32.description: wow the caramel upside down cupcakes are awesome...ill never make pineapple upside down cake the same way again :)a lil bummed thou that they didnt have the 'taste' size portions when i stopped by their booth at the taste today

18.description: Thank you for being so FAR away. Well, you are sortof close but not convenient for me to get to. If you were closer, I'd need to eventually be on The Biggest Loser. THE BEST, by  far, caramel cake I have ever put in my mouth is from this bakery. I have had huge caramel cake  cravings  the past week. I can't believe I found the best caramel cake in the city. At last.. Here, at Abundance Bakery.Go. Go. Go.Eat. Eat. Stuff your face.Don't feel guilty for it.And if you do, I am also a personal trainer.I'll help you take  the pounds off.And then we can celebrate by eating more caramel cakes at Abundance Bakery!

13.description: I was introduced to this Bakery when the owner was handing out free samples in Hyde Park at Haper Court.  The food is very delicious and very fresh (just right- the way food should be) and I love that this is a locally owned and operated store.  We gotta support our local businesses.

4.description: This place is a old school favorite I would come to this place on the Green line train just for my Butter Cookies and a slice of Carmel Cake for my mom. This place was and will always be a neighborhood favorite.From the fresh baked goodies every day. And let's not forget the peach cobbler and sweet potato pie and bread pudding. And you could always get to this bakery fo a last minute party cake.This was the Place were I found out about a 3 layer white icing coconut cakeI was going to eat all the cake but I had to share with the other guess. Time has passed but with great memories of this place.Thank you for saying around for so many years.

24.description: If you think Krispy Kreme and Dunkin Donuts are "bakeries" Abundance Bakery will be a real education.  This is scratch baking, imaginative baking, hearty portions, and melt in your mouth sweet sensations.  I've been going to Abundance for years.  Start with his fresh from the oven glazed donuts and you will eschew KK forever.  This is a glazed donut as it was meant to be! That crunchy sugary coating that yields to melt in your mouth yeasty sweetness!  He also makes superlative bread pudding, starting with his left over danish it's studded with cheese, fruit, and pecans for a real delight!  I am not a fan of banana pudding, but he always runs out of it.  Last time I was there I spied a caramel pecan brownie, pure genius!  I have it on good authority that is is orgasmic, but since I have abstained from sweets for Lent, I will have to take their word.  Also highly recommend his caramel cake...Angelica is no match for his home made/scratch caramel icing.  It is all good!  Please check them out!!

6.description: Haven't gotten past the phone order yet. Expect to repeat yourself and speak very loud. Impatience and lack of C.S.R. training is immediately recognized. I would suggest taking some of the profits from their $3.49  caramel upside- down cupcake  ($29.+ per dozen if ordered a week in advance. ), to invest in an employee that can professionally answer the phone.

22.description: Loved it so  much that I went back the next day and bought a dozen for my coworkers. This saying a lot. I grew up on the legendary old fashion and have been faithful. I stopped here because I was late for work am now and forever a convert. Loved the owner and LOVED the food. XO

15.description: Please go try the upside down caramel cupcakes.  They are so yummy that I have been thinking about them since I first had them 1 week ago.  Beyond that the cookies were also amazing.  Everything is homemade and the staff is super sweet!

7.description: Ahhh!!!  Remember when doughnuts actually had a little weight?  Not Dunkin' Donuts which are all air.  Was treated to Abundance Bakery delights last February on Municipal Election Day 2015 by aldermanic candidate Tracy Bey.  Bey did not win--but her doughnuts did!

8.description: Abundance Bakery is hands down one of the best bakeries on the south side of Chicago. Their caramel cupcake is the best I've ever had (my husband used to stop there weekly on his way home from work to bring one home for me). The peach cobbler is also amazing! Everything I've tried has been fresh & homemade. Can't wait for a visit back home Chicago to stop by for some of their tasty treats. Support this local small businesses!!!! They're friendly, professional & have amazing goodies!

30.description: As a dessert lover, I must say i was very impressed with this place. I kept hearing about how great the carmel cupcakes were so i decided to try them. They were amazing as well as the chocolate chip cookes. The only thing i was not impressed with was the decor of the place. It could use a few improvments but overall the people who worked there were friendly.

3.description: I visited Abundance Bakery last year by research and recommendation. Thanks to yelp reviews I took the gamble and seven lucky dollars and headed to this location eager to taste. I was not disappointed.

14.description: A neighborhood staple, serving us delicious pastries longer than I have been on this planet. No better place for a delicious donut and a smile

12.description: 2 stars because it's clean and close to my home. However, items are priced higher at this Walmart than one I go to when in the suburbs. The check out lines are ridiculously long with only 2 open registers that had cashiers. All but 1 of the 4 self service lines were at a standstill with red lights flashing-but nobody around to fix the problems. After standing in line for 15 + minutes I put my items down and walked out, explaining to those around me that I couldn't tolerate being treated this way any longer. People around me were buying more necessary things than the few items I had-baby food and other items for kids-so they had to stay.  One man still had his construction clothes on, and he looked tired-but needed things for his family.  This was 6:30 pm on a week night. Come on wallmart-don't treat your customers, or your overworked employees this way!!! Is this racism-the store is on the south side of Chicago? Sure felt like it.

3.description: I typically avoid shopping at Walmarts (you know, standing on the moral high ground of not supporting their unfair employer practices and all). Unfortunately, it is literally two blocks from my house, so when I needed three grocery items in a pinch... figured how bad could it be? Well, while total shopping time took only 2 minutes, the check out time was over 27 minutes.  The checkout lines looked like a mad house, customers were livid (some shouting in frustration), the registers kept going down, and there were too few staff to address the problems. I will say, however, the staff genuinely looked like they were trying to resolve the issues and were courteous in spite of some less-than-nice comments from customers. My take is tonight wasn't an anomaly. The store has a glass front and I can often see long checkout lines when I drive by. To top it off, the parking lot battles for a spot are like scenes from Furious 7.

1.description: I think the Walmart and that whole development of shops and lofts are good for the neighborhood, and help make it look better and appear safer. I usually avoid Walmart if I can, but sometimes I have to pop in there to grab something quick. However this is one of the worst Walmarts I've been to and its sad. First of all its a mess, and the long lines and wait times are just unacceptable to me, the workers seem to just take their sweet old time ringing things up. And one time I was in the self checkout line which was being held up because a man decided to leave his two kids in the line while he sat on a bench and the kids held everyone up trying to decide what candy they want. So there needs to be some kind of change with how things are done at this Walmart. Customer service is not strong here.

2.description: It's not often that a Wal-Mart drastically improves the look and safety of a neighborhood, but this location at 47th and Cottage Grove served to do just that. Though still located on the dicey outskirts of Hyde Park, this location is a great option for Chicago southsiders in the area (as the Save-A-Lot was extremely limited in their product selection and is not really a viable option for students, and the Treasure Island remains extravagantly priced). The neighborhood still remains questionable in its safety, but at least the area prominently appears better with the presence of this Wal-Mart.

9.description: This the saddest & slowest Walmart I EVER BEEN TO. Ghetto hood rats who aren't trained properly or can't even act right. These chick's need to be popped. They smack their lips, move slow, roll their eyes, and just about everything that's not customer service savvy. This place need to teach their employees customer awareness. It's sad that they dont have it. Also PLEASE pick up the pace when checking out. Yes i know some days you are tired at work or had a long understandable but do your job. What makes even worse or more annoy is the security guard the black one who  ALWAYS  flirting with the workers. They need stop giggle and talking do your job that's why you work there.  All personal should not be  talked about on the floor. Not okay I don't wanna know what Kenya or shenquisha did at the club or what u can cook or not.  Please save that for the break room or a text. And Idk who told people that their whole grocery cart is okay at self checkout. I've never seen that before. Please keep a rule on that. Every where I go I know it 5 items or less. How can u guys let people do that? Because you dont wanna argue with them or do your job? Direct people with full carts to actual cashiers! Wasting time for customers who want to get in and out.  If there was better flow on the floors and respectful employees then this Walmart can strive. Please im begging you guys to reconsider your process near checkout and have at least 2 people near by ro help or something. Because thst is VERY ANNOYING. On a plus this a nice clean Walmart never seen nothing dirty or the floor.

10.description: This Wal-Mart is great for the Bronzeville area. It provides a healthier and better price point than other stores such as Save-A-Lot or Treasure Island. Everyone is not universally versed on "self-checkout." Thus, this creates slow dead heat lines full of folks who at times can be inpatient, rude, and frustrated. The store is well located, the parking lot is a mad house at "primetime" moments of the day (5pm-9pm). I suggest only going to this store in the early hours of the morning  (7am-10am), the shopping experience is pleasant, calm, and everything is usually fully stocked. Also, lines are short and patience seems to be more abundant. This store still has a ways to go like open up all in person registers at primetime, self-checkout only will be disaster central, improve overall customer service relations (the security guards are better at this than the employees! ;)), there must be a centralized line waiting system for online order pick ups separated from other customer service offerings (a woman verbally threatened me because she thought I was out of line (get a system where you get a ticket) and my online order was lost [I'm sure stolen due to the oversight because item was delivered, will never use for this location again], do a better job of restocking general items like juice, meats, breads, etc, and lastly, have managers visible at different points of the day to ask customers on their shopping experience thus far.

4.description: Like many others, I was hopeful that a better grocery store was coming to the area.  But it is not worth it... there is no such thing as popping into this store.  I go in for 3 items, take about 2 minutes to find and gather them.... and then 25 minutes to check out.  More than once I ahve put my items back and walked out in frustration.  Their self-check lanes are constantly not working, their live cashiers are disinterested and never in a hurry ( or even a moderate pace).  Why is there no limited item lane (enforced)?  i dread going to this store.

6.description: This is where dreams die. This is where you lose hope. This is where you will fail. This is your wake up call. If you shop here you have accepted that your life is over, you will go no further, and you are now on the decline.  I take a stand to not succumb to this manifestation of evil.  However close to my home. I will not look south on cottage grove, I will not be lured by reusable plastic bags. I refuse to look toward the emerald lights foretelling of the suffering inside those temporary walls of dry. My eyes will never be tempted to witness that which is so unholy. I must protect my spirit. I will never shop in this Walmart. I love myself too much.

15.description: I just moved in the Woodlawn area and so my son wanted to go to this Walmart to get a few items.  First impression when I walked in this store was "OMG, this store looks a mess, dirty, and dark".  The fruits/vegetables are the first thing you see when you walk in and they did not look fresh at all. The floors were noticeably dirty.  The store is not kept up. Stuff just seemed to be everywhere and unorganized. This is sad to be a new neighborhood store for the communities that surround it that have very little options for access to fresh produce, etc.  Even though I don't know how anyone could consider Walmart as the place to purchase fresh fruits/vegetables (that's just me). Next, the check-out lines (the few that were opened) were horrible and unacceptable.  Whether you waited in the self-check out or the line with a cashier, just long and slow.  In the self-check out line, it seem like every customer needed assistance to check out including the receipts not printing out after each purchase. Looking for assistance from an employee at the self-check out is a joke.  No one is station there to help you.  I have not been a fan of Walmart for a long time and trust me that I will never be back in this store again. The people have to want and expect more from the stores that open up in their communities.  No thank you Walmart. I will continue to make the trip to the stores out of my neighborhood because in the end for me and my household it will be well worth it in quality of food and service provided.

0.description: I like the neighborhood Walmart.  I'm able to go in and not feel overwhelmed by the crowds, long lines, etc.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  It's also very clean here and items are well stocked.

5.description: Generally speaking I'm not a fan of Walmart. I don't like their politics or the fact that they refuse to pay their employees a living wage. But occasionally I do find myself inside one of their establishments.I stopped in early one morning to grab a few things. I found the store to be neat, clean and well organized. I found everything I needed with relative ease and there were ample Walmart associates available for assistance if needed.This Walmart location carries basic everyday items (toothpaste, cleaning products) and food. Some prices are average but some are cheaper than say Jewel. Like Jewel carries Chunky Campbell's soup for $2.38. This Walmart had it was $1.50. Don't go there expecting to buy clothes or electronics though.Because I went so early in the morning there wasn't a line at checkout and parking was ample. During peak hours I can see that being a problem. The store is pretty small in comparison to the Walmart locations in the suburbs. But it serves it's purpose and is a fantastic addition to the neighborhood.There's an At&t flagship store and Subway next door. Burger King will soon be opening on the corner as well. As for the area, it's fine. People kill me with the whole 'it's a dangerous area' thing. Yes, it looks "dicey" but as they say, looks can be deceiving. The area is well lit and has an abundance of foot traffic. We're in the big city. Crime happens everywhere. Be alert but don't be scared because there's no reason for it.

13.description: This walmart serves its purpose. It's okay...they usually only have a few self checkout lanes open and most people don't know how to use them..if you're in a hurry go somewhere else.

11.description: Its an express Walmart. It serves a purpose but doesn't carry everything that you would need. No gloves or hats during winter? You would think the company would want to compete with Walgreens.The store offers a better selection of produce, meat, dairy, and shelf items than Save-A-Lot. However, price match as often as you can because the produce is ridiculously priced. The manager with locs seems to give me attitude when I ask for it. Per the website, customers do not need the competitor's ad to receive price match. I have been asked on two different occasions to present the ad, which I did. As far as the K.K's comment about the area...it's Chicago. In my opinion, people are more likely to get attacked on 53rd and Dorchester than 47th and Cottage Grove.

8.description: Avoid it!!!!!! Just don't do it! I was so excited when this location opened in my neighborhood because I thought it would be a good alternative to the local jewel osco. I WAS WRONG. This place is just frustrating.  The majority of the lines are self check out, there are 2 or 3 lanes where an actual cashier works but they're never open! The staff seems very annoyed when you ask them a question and they spend more time talking to each other than actually working to assist the customers.  I went here last week for lettuce and sour cream and spent 25 minutes in line....never again! I will go out of my way to avoid this awful place.

14.description: This store is TERRIBLE... I had such high hopes for this store as there aren't many in the area. Granted, it's a Walmart so expectations aren't off the charts but they can't even cover the basics. Their customer service is HORRIBLE... The employees smack their lips and roll their eyes more than they even smile or greet you and they never have enough checkout lanes open. They haven't been open long at all and their self checkout lanes are always broken and now none of them accept cash. I stood in line for thirty minutes just trying to buy toothpaste and lotion and everytime I went to a different machine to wait the security guard came with a cards only/no cash back sign. I just left the items and walked out of the store. Aside from their checkout issue their produce selection is unkept and lacks fresh choices; from their brown cabbage to the fragrant smell of rotting potatoes. I will not spend another dime in this excuse for a "neighborhood market" it's not like I could anyway, it's cards only.

7.description: Worst customer service in life.  If I could give no stars I would.  Cashier had a full blown conversation with another employee for 7 mins. She did not care about the customers waiting in line.  It took a full blown meditation session in order to keep my sanity while waiting line. These people definitely need more training.

36.description: I don't think I'd return here. The MC for the night was absolutely hysterical. However, the main comedian (whose name escapes me) was so out-of-line and offensive. I AM NOT an easily offended person, but this guy was just a plain a'hole. He lost most of the crowd with his set. The drink minimum was pretty ridiculous, too. It's expensive to go here, and you may not get a good show. If I could be guaranteed a show of just the MC, I MIGHT pay the money to get in. But I doubt it.

29.description: GREAT experience! Husband and I met another couple on a Saturday night to see Rob Stapleton.  With the exception of a very cold ten minute wait in the line to get in, the J&N was flawless.  The place is nice looking, classic comedy club feel--theater layout, stage at front with plenty of tables in the middle and booths on the side.  Staff was very organized even with a very large crowd.  Bought our tickets at the door, got great seats in the front booth.  Prompt friendly waitress, drinks were nice and potent.The comedy: as good as it gets!  The MC, Baldhead Philips, was hilarious!   he easily could have been the main performer. There were two warm up acts; can't remember names but the first was solid. The second guy didn't bomb but he didn't knock it out of the ball park like the rest of the folks on stage.  Then there was Rob Stapleton.  He has EASILY become one of my favorite comedians.  My only problem was that he had me laughing so hard that I was worried about ruining my make up cuz I was literally crying laughing and I was hitting the clubs afterwards.The night was smooth, well coordinated, professional and down to earth FUN.  And if you feel uncomfortable with the neighborhood, you are stuck up and don't belong at a club like this.

42.description: I have been to Jokes And Notes a few times and though the comedians are alright, the service sucks.  The two drink minimum is to be expected but they add an automatic 18% gratuity to your bill regardless of the size of your party.  Recently went and ordered a Bud Select and the guy brought me a Bud Light.  When I pointed it out, he retorted "Well you drunk some already".  I doubt I will return...at least not if I have to spend my own money

23.description: I went with my Girlfriends after purchasing a Groupon for them.  We had such a great time.  We laughed really hard and had strong drinks.  The place was not extremely designer, but it was cute enough and I liked the murals on the walls. Here are my Ups and Downs.Ups1. Drinks were strong so at least you got your drinks worth since they require a 2 drink minimum.2.  Great MC and 2 great comedians.Downs1.  There is a 2 drink minimum.  I hate places that do this.  I understand small businesses need the revenue, but come on.  Sometimes you don't want TWO drinks and I am not going to spend $4 on some sugary cranberry juice or Dasani Water.  I will tip and support much more if I am not required to HAVE to get 2 drinks.2. The seating was a bit awkward for our group of 5.  I feel that there is probably a better way to seat larger parties together. And lay out the seating that they do have.Ill go back and support and am all about supporting Black Owned Businesses.  So I recommend going and having a good time on a date or with a group.  You will truly laugh your butt off and need a DD to get you home. (or maybe Im just a light weight)

31.description: You ever find a spot that has the potential to be good but a few things like the service messes it us! This is one -- I have been here a hand full of times because the comedians are always funny -- The set up is cute and your not all crowded on top of each other -- However, they have a 2 drink minimum in the show room and here is where the problem comes in at -- While you are trying to watch the show, u have the waitresses coming up to you every 5 secs asking you if you want another drink -- (Like damn, Im going to get my other drink don't worry, can I pause between drinks though) -- Not only is it distracting when they come to your table but it's distracting when they are at others table -- they are either blocking your view or you can hear the sideline convo they are having with others. Here's a good suggestion Owner, at the beginning of the show everyone places a drink order, then have an intermission and everyone gets their second drink.I did have one bad experience here that had banded me for a while -- one of the serves gave me a incorrect bill and when I asked her to fix it she told me that was going to be a hassle and wanted to know if I could just keep that bill (huh, so you want me to pay for something I didnt order because you dont want to adjust the bill) We literally went back and forth for about 2 mins -- I missed the entire ending of the show, which pissed me off. My sister has to finally yell at her "JUST GO CHANGE THE DAMN BILL" before she decided to do it. This chick (which i later found out was the manager) had an attitude because I asked her to correct the mistake that she made..She is not the only rude waitress i have experienced there -- so it is a nice venue, but the service can be a litte iffy sometimes -- and betweent he $20 cover an the 2 drink minimum, you can end up spending a pretty penny on a comedy show.

34.description: This was one of my favorite places but over the years its lost its mojo. The last time I went was fine. The atmosphere is very grown-up, the waitress was friendly and the drinks were not watered-down. My only con is the two drink minimum policy. Sometimes you just want to see a show and move on.

16.description: This is really a cool spot for good laughs in a quaint setting.  I went here last night with friends. There are two sets on s Saturday. We caught the first set. The cover was $15 with a two drink minimum.  They also add 18% gratuity to the prices. A estimate of costs is $30 per person which is nice for an evening out. All the comedians sell their DVDs afterward. BO and BO.

11.description: I'm a hard critic when it comes to comedy, but I must admit, the show delivered and left me laughing aloud! I'll definitely return!

39.description: Jokes and Notes is located in a small building, and i do not like the neighborhood at all...There were crack heads surrounding the gas station nearby and it kinda scared me! (yeah im a suburbanite).    When my friend and I  pulled up to the door, valet charged us 8 dollars to park the car, and that was pretty cheap. All of a sudden we noticed that he parked the car 10 darn feet away!!!!!!!!!!  Unbelievable!!!! They took are money for nothing!!!!!!!  So i thought that was really bogus!The tickets were 20 dollars for a 2 hour show, and it wasn't worth the money. Time went by fast. There were about 4 comics, and only 2 were funny.  There was a 2 drink minimum, and they force you to buy drinks after paying 20 bucks to get in the door......... I ended up spending close to 40 bucks, and it wasn't worth it. I was hungry afterwards and ended up going to dinner and spent more money!   20 dollar tickets, 8 dollar valet parking, 15 dollar drinks, 18% gratitude fee....... 20 dollar dinner afterward= waste of money!  Never again!  This establishment is too money hungry!Sidenote= one month later, i saw the same comedians and the same routine at a local bar near my house!!!!!!!  No cover change :(

37.description: Stopped into this comedy club one evening to check out the lovely Kellye Howard and Vanessa Fraction duo comedy show. Kellye Howard is a Chicago comic which I had the pleasure of catching in a stand up comedy contest at the Comedy Sportz theater and again she was at this other show some may have heard of; which was advertised as the "Ha Ha Hot ladies of late night" comedy. Just happened that a few other funny comedians from ha ha ladies of late night show were also in attendance at this show and did a naughtier, lewd and rude routine which was very funny. (Strange how location of a club and demographic changes the content of the comedy, a little.) I loved every part of the show except for the customer participation part of it. And they have creative ways of getting people onto their stage; you can win prizes and some have a monetary value. It's an interesting show and at the end a few of the comedy clubs' usual comedians may come on stage and do a short stand up performance. The night we checked it out we got to see at least three different guys perform, one that stood out had a name like "Crazy Fool" He was indeed a crazy fool, his comedy was out there and it was riotous. Can't remember the details on cost; but if you check out the website and see details on the comedians and if they have websites you may be able to score a BOGO coupon somehow. All shows have a two drink minimum which is a constant at most comedy clubs. They have nightly alcohol specials which can be seen via the website but it's better to call in (Best to call on the night of a show or at night, I've tried calling during the day and gotten no response). Street parking is available around the club, but, I would suggest valet. Wouldn't suggest taking public transportation to the club unless you are truly street savvy or it's an early show. The neighborhood surrounding is not lively or populated and you can be approached by all kinds of characters you really wouldn't want to be caught in a situation with. I don't recall seeing an ATM in the club and the nearest ones are closer to the exits off LSD. Looks as though they recently updated their website, which was a much needed upgrade. When the show ends you have the opportunity to meet and greet with any one of the comedians and most are good about talking with you or taking photos, autographs, etc. I would suggest going with a group of people which can equal a great time and save you from having to participate. Another reviewer went into detail about costs. Any person that has checked out comedy anywhere in Chicago knows that all clubs carry costs. This club is no more expensive than say the Improv Chicago where ticket cost, food and alcohol can easily run a pair close to a Benjamin. You want to save money on ticket cost? Get your ass on-line and do your homework. Avoid cocktails and stick with house wine or beer; there are always specials. Ladies use them big-ass purses for some good and smuggle in airplane bottles. Sheesh! People that like BET comedy jams would dig the comedians here.

0.description: No place should ever have a MANDATORY drink minimum in MY opinion. If you want/need more money charge it in your price of admission. For that reason I took a star away.The comics were decent, especially the host and one female comedian 'That's Nesh'. The venue is tiny, that's good because every seat was a good seat, it's bad because everyone is right on top of each other and I hate that... But recall it was the same as the other comedy place I went to last week....So maybe that's just how it's supposed to be at comedy clubs.I did have 3 drinks, at $8.50 each (Lemon Drop, in a PLASTIC martini glass). They were well made as far as not tasting like pure alcohol, but after two drinks I had such a small buzz-- and I'm not a big drinker at all, I RARELY drink- that I felt the 3rd drink would get me to where I was trying to go. (And it did).EDIT: *I wouldn't have ordered any drinks PERIOD if there was not a MANDATORY requirement to do so... I was not sure if the $4 bottles of water counted as a drink... I should have asked. But I didn't want to go back and forth with the lady if it didn't count- so I just droned on like all the other patrons and got some drinks*They didn't have any snacks- peanuts/popcorn, or food options at all... Which I should deduct another star for, but I won't, because I don't feel like being PETTY tonight, but that would definitely improve the VALUE of the experience and also bolster more sales for these MANDATORY drinks they want you to buy...I would come back to see new talent...but the mandatory drinks are still a massive turn off.Ps. I was unaware of the automatic 18% gratuity(just read this in another review...)---had I noticed it I wouldn't have paid a cash tip in addition. I had places that force you to tip a certain amount. Here is a tip: if you provide more VALUE to your consumers you won't have to have mandatory drink minimums or automatic gratuities. If you have 2 people sitting at one table and they each get a separate check (which happened when I went and sat next to someone I didn't know)the server will get a 36% gratuity- plus the cash tips, as most people prob don't notice or read the automatic gratuity... WTF?! This fact, if it's still happening should have to be DISCLOSED up front. Hmmmm....

38.description: I'm not a fan of this place,the cost to get in varies but I don't understand a cover charge AND a two drink minimum.The drinks are watered down.More times than not the comedians are not funny.

27.description: Nice comedy show. @willielynch_Jr ,@bobbyjcomedy,@LilRel4 all did a great job I was crying cause I laughed so hard.

32.description: Clearly one does not come here for the neighborhood or the interior. But the program of this place is ambitious as they try to find new comedy talents and get them gigs on their stage. And that's why you come here, right?I would even say that especially the fact that the Jokes & Notes is in a rather less glamorous neighborhood makes it much more authentic than many other venues. Yes, it is small but very close to the artists, which I find great. You even have chance of getting to know them after the show!We came here for the HBO "Just for laughs" comdey festival June 2010 and we enjoyed seeing 5 young artists plus the host who obviously was a fixture in the comedy scene and did a good job.I especially liked the diversity in the program as it included a Puerto Rican as well as an Indian American comedian. Many new aspects and laughs!We had no real clue when we decided to go to this venue - but we were happy we did! We payed $20 for 2 persons plus the two drinks each (which were ok drinks). If you consider that at a big downtown venue you pay $65 for the cheapest seats for one person ... Of course there you get to see Ellen deGeneres or Seinfeld, ok.But they are on TV all the time, too.I think we got much more real "Chicago" out of our comedy show in Jokes & Notes which is great if you are only visiting.Summary: A very real place for real people who do not mind to support young comedy talents by buying some drinks.PS: We took the bus #3 there which runs directly from downtown on Michigan Ave and stops right in front of the place. Even though the neighborhood is obviously not shiny and great we had no trouble at all and noticed that the bus comes very frequently.

13.description: I have only been here once and every since I came I have wanted to go back!  The place was great!  I mean they had some real raw and new talent that had the entire table laughing!If you want to go out get some laughs, kick the BO Bo's then this place is the place for you!I'm sure you will want to come back again and again after you leave!

24.description: Ok. Went for the first time to see my friend Marilee ( @kissMsMonroe) perform this past Thursday. It was $5 at the door and a 2 drink minimum. Ok I get it, you guys need to stay in business. Most of the comics were funny except for a couple, who I believe we're just having a bad night. I did really enjoy the white comics as well and the white audience seemed comfortable. I'll definitely go back for midweek laughs.!

7.description: Good neighborhood spot for gathering friends or first dates to break the ice. The comedians have been good every time I went here but I heard weekends are better. There is a required 2 drink min which can b annoying for non-drinkers. Never had food from them but the drinks are not watered down.

40.description: I went on a Wednesday night and although they were a bit expensive,    $5 cover + 2 drink minimum per person + %18 gratuity; the comedy was awesome.  The host was hilarious and the crowd was great. The place is nice and comfortable as well. It was a great date night.

30.description: Dang! I hate that this place has lost its luster. I usually would go on the weekend, but since George Wilbourn is no longer the host it's not the same.  Despite the rebuilding efforts,  this is area is still in the hood. The club is small but I prefer it that way. This has been a great outlet for up & coming comedians to hone their craft, but unfortunately this club just doesn't draw enough attention. The promo team needs to get it together!

1.description: Great venue for comedy. Clean and friendly staff. Laugh out loud comedians! Go get your laugh on Chicago style!

9.description: Horrible!!! The owner is the biggest jerk ever! She sells fraudulent tickets on Goldstar & other site but refuses to honor them.

26.description: Love this place, just not the 2 drink minimum.The only thing I really don't like is the 2 drink minimum. It's a way to trap you to make you spend unnecessary money on $4 bottle of Fuji water, $5 red bull, $3.50 soda that's given to you in a glass full of ice which is definetly not a whole can of pop. coffee is $4 but get this, they charge you an extra $4 to have it served to you in a mug (REALLY??? Wtf?). And if dthey don't serve the coffee in a mug, what exactly do they serve in? And they also charge you 18% gratuity which I don't like. I like to decide how much I want to tip a waiter. With all these other extra money you have to pay they might as well just have the tickets be $35.The place is nice and cozy with a creative flare. The chairs get quite uncomfy towards the end of the show.I went to the Friday show with Willie Lynch Jr. As the headliner. He was really good and funny, and I laughed the whole time, all the different comedians were really funny and talked about a variety of different things and not just the typical topics that most comedians cover. The host bald head Phillips was really good as well.All in all me and my friends had a really good time, but honestlythey really need to get rid of that 2 drink minimum.

25.description: Went to this place on a whim and never heard of it until about a couple of weeks ago.  While reviewers comment on the interior and appearance...it's a comedy spot not a lounge.  Laugh and go home.  i enjoyed tonight's show and the host who knew how to carry the audience beginning, in between acts, and sending off.The 2 drink minimum  can be a deterrent but they let you know at the door as you buy a ticket.  But if it's a real issue then you probably shouldn't be going out.  I say it's reasonably priced to go $20 versus however much you pay downtown.  If you want a good laugh and aren't about glitz and glamour then this is it.Wish they had a lounge for after shows I'm sure they could make a killing.

12.description: If your looking for great laughs this is the place to be! It's the easiest way to just chill with your friends or celebrate a birthday. This place covers it all. The jokes are funny, the staff is nice, the drinks are good and the prices are reasonable. You should check this place out.

21.description: I love the interior design and I quickly got past the set up, though I'd originally thought it was shabby. Now, I had read all the reviews here before going and I was perfectly okay with the 2 drink minimun and the $15/per person cover. I work and my husband work, so we can certainly "afford" that. BUT, if you are going with a large group, look for the coupon that is supposedly on their website. On our way in, a woman walked in with a "coupon" that she had gotten from the website that I certainly wasn't aware of. She said that she paid $20.00 in advance and she and nine people could get in for free - they only had to honor the two drink minimum. Whoooah. So, they each paid $2.00 to get in! Get this, most of her party did not show up.  Now, my real issue is that the drinks were served in 4oz or less martini glasses and were $7.50 - $8.00 each. Now that was certainly a slap in the face. After spending $30.00 to get in the club and then being forced to buy two drinks, you would at least think the club would make it worth your while. 4 oz glasses...!!!  We could not believe the drinks were served in MINI drink glasses and they weren't great drinks. The martini glasses were the tiniest I'd ever seen. Then to add insult to injury, the lady sitting behind me had a "normal" size glass, I asked what she was drinking and she said she had ordered from the menu...duhh!? How could I have known that? That just doesn't seem like a fair business practice to me. Finally, I absolutely loved the host, the big bald dude ;-). He was hilarious. The headliner went way too long, and it wasn't until late in his performance that he actually warmed up and got funny. The other comedians who were hilarious weren't given ENOUGH time. At the end of the day, I would probably not return to this venue unless I got the coupon and paid $2.00 to get in and had nothing else to do. I do understand that the club has overhead, I get that...but if people feel like they are being gouged and not appreciated, they will stop coming and will write reviews like this.

17.description: All I can say is LMAO! I haven't laughed this hard in a while. I went with a friend on open mic night and most of the acts were hilarious. The MC was funny as well. I only wish that all of the good acts had 3 more minutes on stage. It was $5 to get on Wednesday. Not bad but my only issue with Jokes & Notes is the automatic 18% gratuity that is attached to the 2 drink minimum. 18%?! What if my server was a complete b#tch? Or messed up my drink order? Besides that, I have no problem coming back to Jokes & Notes as I love to laugh and have a good time. Oh, and I thought they were kidding but they have this little table set up in the lobby that they call their snack bar. I honestly believe that someone broke into a vending machine and brought their spoils back. Lol.

10.description: For all the bad reviews, I really enjoyed this place. It is a nice, intimate venue. There is some parking on the street but it fills up quickly. The owner was very nice and kind to us. There is a two drink minimum, but that's very common for comedy clubs. The comics were very good and I suggest checking it out.

5.description: 3.5!!! This was a good comedy club, that tailored to the sophisticated urban crowd . The comedy was really funny . My only two problems  is that  the seating arrangements are weird, which had me adjusting myself to see pass the big guy in front of me. Also, the two drink Minimum. They hound you ALL night about it, which gets annoying . Having to scarf down two drinks , made me want to use the bathroom, but I didn't want to go, because I would miss the comedy . So I was stuck laughing and holding my bladder for about the last 30 mins. Going here can easily run you about 40 dollars , but in the end, the comedy & atmosphere is worth it.

35.description: Went here on a wednesday night to watch a open mic.  One of the most funniest nights of my life.

19.description: The only reason I'm giving Jokes & Notes a 3-star review is because of the prices. Other than that it was an enjoyable experience. In fact, my expectations were exceeded because I honestly wasn't expecting much.I'd heard of Jokes and Notes but had never been primarily because of the location. Recently, I was on a date though and the guy suggested we go. He said he'd been there several times and that it was one of the best places to see comedy in the city. Coming from a guy who lives in Rogers Park and works in Oak Lawn I knew he had to be onto something to travel way out of his way just to see someone tell jokes.We get there and it's not crowded at all. (on a Saturday night) After I hear that it costs $20 to get in, I understand why. $20??? Yikes!! Anyway, we pay and go in. The club is nice on the inside, very clean and modestly upscale. You can tell that the business takes pride in his/her business despite the surrounding area.The waitress was friendly and attentive and we receive our 2 drink (each) minimum with no issues. The comedy was pretty good too and we both had a fabulous time. I would consider returning to Jokes and Notes but the $20 entry fee would definitely make me think twice about it. For that kind of money I can order something on demand and order  out. But if you've ever been and like a good comedy show give it a shot.

3.description: My wife and I went for the Valentine's day show featuring Ray Grady. His set was hilarious!  The opening act as well as the host were all great. The atmosphere is great, not too big so the performers connect better with audience. The owner walked around and greeted the guests as she helped seat them, the staff was attentive. No complaints here. Gem of a business locally owned and located on the South Side of Chicago

33.description: I love this comedy club ,open mic on Wed is hilarious the place is reasonable priced. I think $3 for a beer is cheap in chicago and $3.50 for imports. The mixed drinks are far from weak and the DJ is good and there is lots of variety. There is a 2 drink min but there are choices for non drinkers. The only thing that could make this place better is food but I like it as is. Marlin and Lil Rel are my favorite Mc's. The special events are always fun so if you can catch a roast or go on new years you won't be disappointed.

43.description: I went to Jokes & Notes for the first time on Saturday night. There were two shows, one at 8 and one at 10:30 PM. It was pretty funny, for the most part. There were three comedians, plus a host (who was the funniest). If you ever watch Comic View on BET you have seen most of these comedians on there. The host on Saturday night is George Wilborne who is hilarious. The guest comedians were funny, except for one. She had her moments, but some of her routine was pretty corny. There is a $20.00 admission charge and a two drink minimum.The place is kind of small, but it was clean. Overall, I had fun and I would go back.....

2.description: I must say I enjoyed myself. I especially enjoy what this club stands for. I went here for a fundraiser with my alumni association. It was Wednesday night--amateur night-- and local comedians come to try to get on the list to showcase what they have. It's great for comedians, and they even mentioned a few comedians from famous shows & competitions who got their breaks at the comedy club. That's great! Each comedian only received 3 minutes, a blessing & a curse so to speak. Some comedians were great and you wanted to hear more, others should have been cut off sooner, but that's the fun in it all. Not everyone was good, but heckling is not allowed. I personally love that, and it was honestly fun laughing at the awkwardness. It started to feel like one big family in the lounge. The owner was nice to me, but I can see how other yelpers could have had a hard time with her matter-of-fact personality. The two drink minimum I expected from reading other reviews. They DO make sure you order that second drink, but it wasn't overly-intrusive. The entire show was 2 hours for amateur night. Not every comedian who came that night was guaranteed a spot in the lineup. That's how many comedians came! I think that says something!

18.description: As the cool air turned crispy, a companion and I waited in line for the doors to open. As the line proceded to move forward, I noticed that they were a little disorganzied. It was confusion with the usher for standard tickets and VIP. However, we made our way into main floor and I was disappointed in the seating arrangement and how small the space was. As the night went on, I was wearing a smile than a frown. The comedian and host that night really eased my disappointment and I had a wonderful time. TK was the special presentation that evening; I never laughed so hard lol. Overall, I rated my experience 4stars bc I gotten what I paid for and the customer service was good. Side note: There is a 2 drink min for each person and it is 4 people to a table in most areas of the room.

41.description: This place is close to my house so I go often.  When I first started going about 2 years ago ther was never a sold out show and I was always winning a "party."I love the atmosphere and the drinks are good.  The 2 drink min. is a turn-off to some.  I go for the ambiance and the laughs.  Miss Mary, the owner is very nice and comedians are always friendly and mingle after the show.

4.description: I try so hard to support..... But...I'll be nice in this review and only give tips if you decide to come:Two drink minimum is OVERLY enforced. Don't speak at your table about anything... Regardless if you offer your friend to pay her tab or you're looking for your keys.Ten dollar credit card minimum. But yeah........Have fun.PS Make sure you recognize the owner as the owner. Her title is super

6.description: Final Note for your dead AZZ Jokes! I wasn't one of the comedians. I was there to patronize your venue. I stood in line outside in the cold which was very unnecessary. Again... Mary gave out a few numbers and hand picked the other contestants. RIGGED!!! And you are right I will NOT return to your venue. Put your energy into your venue instead of letting your future patrons know how unprofessional you really are. Good Luck.

22.description: This is really a cool spot for good laughs in a quaint setting.  I went here last night with friends. There are two sets on s Saturday. We caught the first set. The cover was $15 with a two drink minimum.  They also add 18% gratuity to the prices. A estimate of costs is $30 per person which is nice for an evening out. All the comedians sell their DVDs afterward. BO and BO.

15.description: Great venue - owner is especially personable.  Comedians were hilarious and the host kept it moving and funny!  Be prepared to drop some money for the 2 drink minimum and get there on time or you might not get a seat :-)  I'll be back!

20.description: I have only been here once and every since I came I have wanted to go back!  The place was great!  I mean they had some real raw and new talent that had the entire table laughing!If you want to go out get some laughs, kick the BO Bo's then this place is the place for you!I'm sure you will want to come back again and again after you leave!

8.description: Every time I go to jokes and notes, it's always a memorable experience. It is a great venue for someone who is just starting their career. I also appreciate the fact that it's black owned. The only issue I have with this location, is the two drink minimum. It already cost $20 for entrance, the two drink minimum is excessive. Their drink options are limited and somewhat expensive for the size/quantity. Overall, the comedians are funny and the location attracts known comedians. It's a great spot for a girls night out or date night.

14.description: THE STAFF AND OWNER ARE RUDE!!! I discovered the owner was a women and super excited to go back hoping to run into her. My excitement to meet the owner turned soar. We were the first few to get seated and she yelled at me for seating in the wrong seat. I couldn't believe her attitude saying to myself geez this is a comedy club. Our waitress was also rude when she serviced our drinks. I understand when your dealing with idiots or obnoxious customers but we were floored  at the treatment we were getting. the comedians were off the chain and worth the wait. Honestly I don't know if I'll return again. The service should be better. I'm paying money to have a good time and this is a place of comedy.  I shouldn't have to be yelled at like i'm a child or given an attitude about my drink order.

address: 4641 S Dr Martin L King Jr Dr

58.description: Nice atmosphere, good staff. Had the curry chicken and ox tails really tasty first time eating ox tails, will def. have them again.

56.description: We enjoyed the restaurant and the live band but we waited 50 mins for our food. Chicken and fish dishes should not take that long. The place was not even crowded. But the food was very good once it arrived.

29.description: I love the food at this establishment but terrible service when placing phone orders. You expect speedy service when you have called in an order however you will be mistaken. This place took 50 minutes to make my order and it was just chicken. The dining room was not packed either so I do not understand why the service was slllloooooowwww!

42.description: I would rate higher if the quality was more consistent. When they are on, it's close to a five. Other times, I've gotten dry chicken. And everyone doesn't make sure the order is right. (Rice instead of double cabbage). But very good jerk and awesome sauce!

23.description: I love Jamacian food and had a good time at this place about a month ago, but as of yesterday night June 25, 2015, I would not put any stars if I could. DO NOT EAT AT THIS RESTAURANT!As I ate my meal and had a conversation with my aunt i couldn't help but see a mouse. It came out into the floor...it was walking in an slow unusual way and then scurried back under a Booth. We lost our appetite and told the waiter. A Mouse!!!!! This means there are more because mice live in groups, which means they drop feces everywhere....So the manager comes out 30 minutes later and she told me...YES WE HAVE A MICE INFESTATION PROBLEM. We have had an exterminator come every Monday to deal with it.... OMG she is aware and still serving food and not closings the doors until it's under control. This is DISGUSTING, UNSANITARY, UNACCEPTABLE and putting people at RISK for ILLNESS.IF YOU CANNOT RUN A RESTAURANT UP TO CODE THEN YOU SHOULD BE SHUT DOWN.

47.description: Okay experience.  What made it great was the reggae band.  The singer had a great voice and likable factor... other than that that's it.  Service was super slow, took almost 30 minutes to be seated when there was 10 tables open and another 20 minutes to get back our credit card to pay.  Food was okay.   Cabbage was nice and the jerk chicken was good too.  The rice and gravy was not my favorite.  Honesty, if anyone knows the name of the band (3 ppl) that played Saturday night, I'd love to see them again.

8.description: The food was very tasty. But the curried goat was oxtail with a different sauce. I didn't want anything; just to bring it to their attention. I brought it up they insisted that it was not, and brought out the oxtail to show me the difference. The only difference was the gravy.
