31.description: This is like the 3rd review I've written so I'm done talking about the food. Service is the slowest ever. If you call ahead and they say it'll be ready in 30 mins, tack on another 15-20.Note to management: I understand it's Jamaican food, but when you open a restaurant in the U.S., we don't got time to be waiting around!

34.description: I like the atmosphere but can't seem to really enjoy my meals. I've had the jerk chicken and stew chicken dinners. To me, the flavors of each item on my plate taste the same. On one occasion my rice and beans was really good but just that one time. I highly recommend the jerk chicken. I prefer this location to the other because the space provides more of a dining experience but the food taste the same. The service is ok and food is ok.

16.description: I've had bad experiences with these people in the past but was too tired and hungry to drive all the way from Bronzeville to my favorite, most consistent spot , JERK CHOICE.So I decide to come here. I live 3 minutes away, call in my order which they tell me will take 35 minutes. I give them 45 minutes and start on my way because I know how black folks can be. Wouldn't you know it I get there and my order isn't done. I waited another 15 maybe 20 minutes.Prior to trying this location I hadn't been brave enough to try them in years and after getting my food i recalled why. The chicken was good but after waiting an hour for it-it was cold and needed to be placed in the microwave. The cabbage was outstanding.....the rice. What the heck is up with this rice and peas???? Who told y'all that sweet rice and peas was the thing to do? Whatever you're doing to this rice, abort. This dish is meant to be savory not sweet. My meal could have been so good without this sweet rice and peas.

13.description: Food is good, service is atrocious. I've been at this restaurant now for 1hr and I still don't have my food. My drink just came???? Yet another great restaurant run poorly. This place has so much potential. The band on Friday is good too. Don't go unless management takes it upon themselves to maintain a decent level of service.MM

11.description: Nice people, great food, and good music! Fun place to visit when in Chicago. Seating was a little slow but we did have 5-6 people in our party soo it was understandable. The caramel cake was the BEST thing on the menu SO GOOD and moist.

39.description: Food is good, but why the $@#% do they always run out of wings?!!  Service is below average. Food is good though.

37.description: Food. OK! Definitely had better. Let's first start off by saying the place is beautiful. It's a two-level dine in restaurant and I only dine in uncle Joe's. Next, customer service I give it one star. I came in and the waitresses and the cashier was all sitting down gossiping about the cooks. I had a phone in order I called at 715 I got there at 7:40 they told me 30 minutes and I didn't leave until 8:10. 1 hour wait basically.Ok so I ordered a jerk dinner and a jerk shrimp dinner. The jerk shrimp were literally the size of the shrimp that in shrimp fried rice at the Chinese resturant seriously the jerk dinner I mean you can't really go wrong with that. I did call to complain about the super small shrimp and they tell me they are always size. So I pay 1699 + tax for 6 shrimps.  End of story if you want some jerk go to Hyde Park jerk Uncle Joe's way better food way better customer service

0.description: I really love the quality of their food and I've visited all locations except on Vincennes.  The things I would take away is the wait.  Me and a friend just recently visited there on Saturday and it took them 45 minutes to bring us our food, this happens every time we dine-in.  Also they are always either out of jerk wings or you have to wait 20 mins.The live music on Friday and Saturday's are a plus!

38.description: Sweet, tasty, peppery, yummy! The address listed has no sign saying Uncle Joe's , but it's around the corner. I live in Lincoln Park, and I would definitely go out of my way to grab me some Jerk!Update & fast forward to 1/30/2016: I took away 3 stars. We just ordered a couple of chickens ahead of time, with a large order of sides. They stated it would take about 35 minutes. Knowing it could take a bit longer, we arrived a little after the given estimation. We ended up waiting for an hour. The girl at the counter called out to the kitchen "2 chickens," received our order. Fast forward, we arrive at a friend's place... In Lakeview.....after driving through a bunch of horrible Saturday night traffic..... and realized no one checked our order!!! What do we have? 2 containers of cabbage & 2 containers of Mac & Cheese and.... where's our chicken?! Apparently, the manager will call us back.Fast forward to 2/4/16... We were supposed to get a call by Tuesday..... Nothing yet....

51.description: I took my boyfriend here last Wednesday evening as it was his first time and my 3rd. As stated in other reviews, the decor is nice, spacious and the wait staff is friendly yet scarce. Maybe being it was a Wednesday evening it would be slow but, surprised to only find one server when after five minutes of being there it went from being 1 table occupied to about 6 tables. The jerk chicken my boyfriend had was excellent as he's a big fan. I had the curry goat and it was disappointing. This is my 2nd time ordering the curry goat and both times I got WAY more skin and bones than I actually did goat meat; literally about 3 pieces of actual meat -- no joke.  Also, all 3 times that I've been there, they're ALWAYS out of something!!! This is so aggravating when you're supposed to be a full service/dining establishment of caribbean food! Twice they didn't have beef patties -- what caribbean place doesn't have beef patties?!? Then they were either out of the certain cakes they displayed in their menus or didn't have a particular type of seafood that evening/day. Because of this, I was deterred to hold a party here although I was thinking that if planned ahead of time, it'd work out. In any case, the jerk is good but, I'd rather go to Jerk Villa despite no seating and a long wait.

27.description: The service is horrid. I feel for those waiters. They have their work cut out for them and they try to keep up but I don;t think they are trained right. The management I saw when I was there was terrible. The woman in charge was so rude it makes me not ever want to go back there.  The food was not good either. Too much salt and the ox tales were dry and just nasty. It's such a bbeautiful place that you think you would get good food too but it's not. The band that played that night was really good. I need to find out who they are so I can see them somewhere else. This place needs nicer mamagement. I will not go back until I see a sign "Under New Management" For real!

32.description: Save yourself the drama!! BF's iPhone was taken at this location. We called in an order for pick up. He walked in to pay and when he walked out, he realized he'd left his phone. In the time it took to walk back inside, the phone was gone. When we tried to speak to the lady behind the counter, she was abrasive and dismissive (cause for speculation, eh?). He returns to the car and I attempt to track his phone thru the iPhone finder app. When we go back into the restaurant to tell them the phone's location and ask to speak to a manager, the lady behind the desk says there is no manager and that she's the person in charge. She then walks away. As for the food, you can find the same taste elsewhere with way better service in much safer areas. And the carry-out boxes were so flimsy, the contents spilled out and soaked through the bags.

54.description: I went to Uncle Joe's Bronzeville for the first time.  The decor was great.  The Reggae band was good.  There seemed to be a thriving take-out business but, the dining-in business seemed meager.  I was very disappointed because I had to wait so long to get my order.  Once, I received my food, I was again disappointed.  The jerk chicken was so hot that I could barely eat it.  I know that there is better Jamaican food.  I think that I would recommend somewhere else to eat.

48.description: The food is pretty good here, however, I've had jerk at other places and it has been just as good and it was cheaper. The prices they charge are a bit high compared to other jerk restaurants. Also the service and management needs some major improvement. My company has ordered from them twice and each time they have messed up several orders. This business refused to compensate the company for their mistake and EVERYTIME you ask to speak to the manager they are NEVER available. This has happened on more than 3 occasions. Also when the weather is very cold they are not open but you can't find any notice on their website or outside of the building. I spoke with someone today in regards to this and they said sometimes they are closed for the weather, sometimes they are just not open, and sometimes they don't open on time.  Who runs a business like that? Also they are known for running out of food-I called today around lunch time and they did not have any sweet potatoes or plantains. Now I will say that the dinning in experience is better than the ordering experience you get more food when you dine in the restaurant. The only draw back is that it is very cold in the space.  Overall,  it seems like they have no commitment to quality service.

44.description: Just started a new job and since I am training in the area, I decided to try out uncle joe's while attempting to find Harold's chicken shack. That elusively delicious fried chicken will be mine, but Uncle Joe's did a solid job filling in. This is a two level restaurant and for patrons confused as to why you can enter a restaurant that is completely empty and dark on the first floor, it is because you do your ordering on the second floor.Now, I was pretty excited to try the food out here even though the yelp reviews here are quite underwhelming. A few coworkers told me to try the jerk chicken, and jerk chicken lunch special I did. It was about a quarter chicken, rice peas, and a side for near $9. pretty pricey for the amount of food I got but it was really tasty stuff. However, I asked them for cabbage as a side and the menu advertised that the lunches come with plantains. Instead I received no plantains, and mac & cheese instead (I can't complain too much about this swap though lol). There was also a piece of white bread in my container with a corner missing; I wondered if someone took a bite out of it.Good food here but a few too many mishaps with my order to warrant a four star review. I could see how people gave them 1 or 2 stars. You probably just have to catch this place on a good day.

24.description: The chicken is good but something has been up with the rice and peas. The last three times I've ordered they've been drenched in way toooooo much gravy to where it is inedible. The gravy is way too flavorful, in a bad way. They must've changed the recipe, which is really disappointing. This past time I asked for gravy on the side only. It came with less gravy on it-but it was still odd tasting. The rice and peas used to be the best part of the meal, and was comparable to my Jamaican mother-in-laws recipe-not anymore. Very disappointing!

7.description: I stopped by Uncle Joe's on 2/25/16 to pick up dinner and must say that they won me over.  This was my first time trying their jerk chicken [and rumor has it that it can be a long wait] so I braced myself for a long wait but I was in and out in 10 minutes.  I got the combo dinner with jerk chicken and brown stew chicken and it was good.  The jerk chicken had a nice smoky flavor with not too much heat, and the brown stew chicken was tender and flavorful.   Although the chicken was good - the show stopper was the slice of 3-layer caramel cake.  Ooo-Wee!!!  Baby it was the bomb!!The reason I gave Uncle Joe's only 3 stars was because of the jerk sauce, the macaroni and cheese, and the food knowledge of the staff.  First of all, I am NOT at all impressed with the jerk sauce, it was very thin almost watery and just hot - no flavor like my other fav jerk restaurant that I will not name in this review.  Also, skip the macaroni and cheese not good.  Stick with the chicken and rice and peas and you're good to go.  My last issue is why the staff was clueless when I asked do they have festival.  More sad than funny, but the person on the phone when I called in my order told me when I acquired about festival informed me that they have a band on Friday and Saturdays.  What THA What?  What AUTHENTIC jerk restaurant doesn't know about festival?  I had to remember that the person I was talking to was American not Jamaican and that she didn't have a clue that I was talking about the fried and slightly sweet cornmeal  fritters - sort of like hushpuppies but sweet.Shhhhhh (I'm whispering). . . for those who like festival you can pick up some at Bronzeville Jerk Shack on 51st and Prairie!!!  Yummy!!

49.description: The food is very good but for the prices they charge and the wait time, I expected a bit more food than I received. Service is...meh. I really don't care about the ambiance. I always order to-go.

40.description: I really like this place! I ordered take out twice and dined in twice. The jerk chicken, jerk wings, jerk catfish are all very tasty. Every time I have been satisfied with my food and the amount of time it took to receive it. If there is something that is going to take a while longer they communicate that. The service isn't very friendly overall (some are really nice others are more terse) but it's not rude or unpleasant. The prices are very reasonable and they give you a lot of food! I've been on Fridays and the live band is great (but loud). What I've found with most Jamaican food restaurants is that they frequently run out of items...it's not exclusive to Joe's. If you reaaaaaaally want something and only that then call ahead. Yes that is a pain but otherwise just be prepared to roll with the punches and try something new!

53.description: I enjoyed the bbq jerk chicken the most, curry chicken was good. It took us forever to get the food. We sat in to eat; the cabbage and rice was not memorable  I enjoyed the atmosphere and decor of the place.

30.description: Service is horrible! Ghetto, rude, slow and they lost my order! Every time I decide to give this place another try I find myself once again disappointed.

46.description: Visiting chi for the week I asked around for good island food so it's not that I wasn't warned bout joes shenanigans but also heard they had good food. My call in to go order started off wrong however , the girl couldn't hear, wasn't informed on what was on the menu and impatient. Told me to come pick up my order in 30-35 min & she had to go bc she had another customer there... Granted these folks are hella busy trying to keep up with the demand for that jerk but they take jerk to whole nother level. I was warned that if you want your order today, you should've place it Yesterday! So true, bc when I got there ol girl hollerin bout I got to go find ur order, what did u order? WHAT?! So Joe ain't start cooking my call in order until I got there to replace my order in person after making me wait 30-35 min to come pick up, and so nonchalant about it.  I saw some folks just leave in disgust after seeing so many wait hours. All in all, this behaviour is very typical of that culture and the whole experience was not a total bust because they did have a live band that was Incredible not to mention the cabbage calalloo n jerk chicken tastes amazing- although I thought it was a bit dry n tough but Good anyhow! Just call a day ahead if u want some unc joes jerk then give them a reminder call and bring something to do like a book magazine or bills and plan to chill still for about an hour and do not go hungry. Or maybe just eat in because they get preference I guess?? But it was also rather hot in there so drink water cuz u will be sweating it out. Must be nice to have good enough food they just don't even care about repeat business or the customer service experience. No foolin tho customer service does not exist anymore anyway

1.description: The food is great except the Mac and cheese. Do not order that, please! Service is decent at BEST. The lady at the counter is horrible. The first time here she messed up my order and this time she picked up the phone while greeting us then put US on hold. Stayed on the phone w another customer for like 10 mins while we stood there looking crazy. We eventually sat ourselves out of sheer and utter annoyance. She literally didn't even look at us again while she was on the phone. Crazy. I know for a fact the manager doesn't play that. She was regulating on her last time I was here which is why I came back but the lady at the front continues to clown. The food is FIRE! It's so good! But I swear you the service will make you not want to come back.

55.description: I love jerk chicken, so decided to try this place.It was ok, but I was not overly impressed at all.My friend and I wanted all white meat and they would not serve it to us. They said they were rationing it out. I said I will pay extra, whatever you want, as we will not eat the dark meat. Still--no all white meat!  This was on a Saturday night around 8:30 and there were ONLY 2-3 other tables of people eating. The only thing I could think of is 1) they were low on inventory or 2) they were low and a large chunk of their business is take out.  I mean really, how are you not able to sell someone all which chicken if they want to pay for it? Chicken is your specialty!!?? Especially, when you can see the place wasn't even busy! The meat itself was pretty good though.The cabbage was good, though I thought the portion was on the smaller side (smaller than Ja Grill in Lincoln Park) and the flavor wasn't balanced.  I got frequent "bursts" of hot flavor that at times was irritating.  For the food and atmosphere, I would rather make the trek up to Ja Grill on armitage. I heard the one in Hyde Park was better, so would give it another try at that location.

9.description: The food is very good. I do enjoy it. However, if I go to a restaurant, I expect a certain level of service. First, my girlfriend and I had to wait an hour for our food (the restaurant was not crowded). Second, our waiter did not check on us. For example, I had 1 glass of water over the course of the 2 hours I was there. Certain things like water and just checking in with the guests every now and then should be obvious. I will not be visiting this location anymore.

26.description: Please note that this review is not about the food, but about the service; in particular the store manager.  Today, I have to end a long standing relationship with one of my favorite food places.  After patronizing every location, a minimum of once per week over the last decade, I've experienced rude behavior on a number of occasions,  but today's event is where I draw the line.  I visited the 47th location to place a catering order for my teacher's, in honor if teacher appreciation week, only to be told by the manager that she would not honor my tax exemption letter because it's dated 2014.  I explained to her that as a Catholic entity,  our tax letters don't expire for several years (the 2019 expiration date is also listed in the letter). She accuses me of lying and refused to honor the letter; which is illegal.   I proceeded to show my business card, which identifies me as the principal of the school listed on the letter and even pulled up the original email sent directly from the Archdiocese last year that explained exactly what I said, with the same letter attached, only to be told "Joe says he will not honor this".  I wasted 40 minutes, only to have to walk out without an order for tomorrow.  As much as I will miss not eating here anymore,  I came to realize ignorance and rude behavior shouldn't cost me money. Was the fight over $20 worth losing $200? I guess so.  The bigger picture is that it wont be just $200, it will be $60,800 over the next ten years; which is roughly what I would have spent on weekly and catered meals here.  As a business owner, resident and high school principal in this community,  it breaks my heart to have to walk away from one of my long time favorites, but at some point,  you have to stand your ground.  I guess Pizza Capri will be our long term caterer moving forward.   Principal Jackson,  Hales Franciscan High School

25.description: I've had bad experiences with these people in the past but was too tired and hungry to drive all the way from Bronzeville to my favorite, most consistent spot , JERK CHOICE.So I decide to come here. I live 3 minutes away, call in my order which they tell me will take 35 minutes. I give them 45 minutes and start on my way because I know how black folks can be. Wouldn't you know it I get there and my order isn't done. I waited another 15 maybe 20 minutes.Prior to trying this location I hadn't been brave enough to try them in years and after getting my food i recalled why. The chicken was good but after waiting an hour for it-it was cold and needed to be placed in the microwave. The cabbage was outstanding.....the rice. What the heck is up with this rice and peas???? Who told y'all that sweet rice and peas was the thing to do? Whatever you're doing to this rice, abort. This dish is meant to be savory not sweet. My meal could have been so good without this sweet rice and peas.

12.description: Save yourself the drama!! BF's iPhone was taken at this location. We called in an order for pick up. He walked in to pay and when he walked out, he realized he'd left his phone. In the time it took to walk back inside, the phone was gone. When we tried to speak to the lady behind the counter, she was abrasive and dismissive (cause for speculation, eh?). He returns to the car and I attempt to track his phone thru the iPhone finder app. When we go back into the restaurant to tell them the phone's location and ask to speak to a manager, the lady behind the desk says there is no manager and that she's the person in charge. She then walks away. As for the food, you can find the same taste elsewhere with way better service in much safer areas. And the carry-out boxes were so flimsy, the contents spilled out and soaked through the bags.

59.description: I used to be a faithful once a week customer at the location on Cottage Grove. However, the wait was always soo long at that location, but the food was usually good.  I was excited after I moved to Bronzeville to have one in my neighborhood.  I have now been there 3 times and each time been disappointed with the service, food and restaurant in general.  The food - usually I order the Curry Goat or Jerk Chicken.  My last visits the curry goat is mostly bone and fat and the jerk chicken was mostly bones.  When I have sat down at the restaurant the service was mediocre.  My last visit was the last straw.  The restaurant rents out space for a meeting every Tuesday (do not go on Tuesdays).  Well the meeting is held right next to the seating area of the restaurant.  The people were loud, clapping, had music and they were often overflowing into the restaurant with discussions and kids running around.  It was hard to hear and enjoy your meal with all the noise.  This is just not good business, especially when the restaurant is 2 levels and they could have used the bottom level for the meeting and left the restaurant area clear for dining patrons to enjoy their meal in peace.  I'm disappointed, but there are a lot of other Jamaican restaurants and I will be finding another to go to.

21.description: I went to this joint on 7/26/2015.  My experience was horrible.  The power of the consumer is real and I am here to exercise my right to inform the public.  I came to this joint with my friend.  We had a great day at the Drake hotel for a shopping and pampering event.  Needless to say, we found a free parking space which made the trip to the Gold  Coast sweeter.  After the event we were hungry.  We had a million options to choose from in the area.  We wanted Jamaican food,  I wanted Mr.  Brown's Lounge.  But then we decided to patronize the "hood", Bronzeville to be exact.  When we get there, it's not crowded in the joint.  Our waiter is comes over and tells us what's not on the menu.  Luckily, I wanted the curry chicken because there were no oxtails. My friend got the jerk chicken.  But, hold on, we waited over an hour in a non crowded restaurant.  Our waiter gave us side salads in a chip bowl.  The side salad was nothing special.  Then he gave us 2 Pepsi's for our wait.  We were starving.  He told us 3 times that our food was on the way.  After all of that, cd that was playing over the restaurant started to make an annoying sound.  Our waiter came over to apologize for the noise but it was no way to turn it off because the system was locked in the office.  Oh yeah, when I finally get my food,  my side was suppose to be mac & cheese.  I received yams instead.  I hate yams and now yam juice is in my food.  The manager gave us 10% discount, but in my opinion the $24 bill should have been comp.  The waiter ask if he would see us again, I say, "I won't be back."There are plenty of Jamaican restaurants in this city.  Not a lot of dine in restaurants on the South Side.  The businesses that are on the South Side  should take better pride in their businesses.  The mighty dollar spends everywhere and word of mouth is the best advertisement and it's free.  So, I do not recommend this spot.  I should call Restaurant Takeover on them.

17.description: Just started a new job and since I am training in the area, I decided to try out uncle joe's while attempting to find Harold's chicken shack. That elusively delicious fried chicken will be mine, but Uncle Joe's did a solid job filling in. This is a two level restaurant and for patrons confused as to why you can enter a restaurant that is completely empty and dark on the first floor, it is because you do your ordering on the second floor.Now, I was pretty excited to try the food out here even though the yelp reviews here are quite underwhelming. A few coworkers told me to try the jerk chicken, and jerk chicken lunch special I did. It was about a quarter chicken, rice peas, and a side for near $9. pretty pricey for the amount of food I got but it was really tasty stuff. However, I asked them for cabbage as a side and the menu advertised that the lunches come with plantains. Instead I received no plantains, and mac & cheese instead (I can't complain too much about this swap though lol). There was also a piece of white bread in my container with a corner missing; I wondered if someone took a bite out of it.Good food here but a few too many mishaps with my order to warrant a four star review. I could see how people gave them 1 or 2 stars. You probably just have to catch this place on a good day.

10.description: This will be my last review for a while I called in an order of a whole chicken and half barbecue when I got there to pick it up it was ice cold the bag was ripped i didn't trip because they told me 35 min i came about an hour half later because it didn't want to wait i checked it like i always do it was burnt u could smell the burned i didn't ask for a refund just a replacement i excepted even though the chicken barely had any skin also ordered a small cabbage the seasoning was only in the little skin that was on some of the pieces of chicken the rest had no seasoning and it didn't have that smoked taste. tasted baked i had to get trimmings on my cabbage because they were flavorless I'm going to give myself a break from uncle joes no one has money to throw away like that the customer service is non existent no one acknowledges u or try to assist you only reason they got 1 star because danielle was helpful and pleasant as usual but the rest of the staff looks right thru u i guess he thinks having a staff full of young folk looks good but I would never dine in and i will not be getting any jerk for a while I'm tired of beating a dead horse

5.description: Food is consistently delicious and served nice and hot. Servers are inexperienced but nice. Food service is very slow but the meal is always worth the wait. It's always a crap shot as to what they will actually have on any given day, but if they have what you want, it will be great

3.description: The chicken taste like its baked the seasoning is sweet the bread is hard and the Mac and cheese is flavor less and to add the sauce is watery not a good dining experience

35.description: The food is good. But the $10/bottle corkage fee is a joke! You might as well order takeout.....

19.description: Food. OK! Definitely had better. Let's first start off by saying the place is beautiful. It's a two-level dine in restaurant and I only dine in uncle Joe's. Next, customer service I give it one star. I came in and the waitresses and the cashier was all sitting down gossiping about the cooks. I had a phone in order I called at 715 I got there at 7:40 they told me 30 minutes and I didn't leave until 8:10. 1 hour wait basically.Ok so I ordered a jerk dinner and a jerk shrimp dinner. The jerk shrimp were literally the size of the shrimp that in shrimp fried rice at the Chinese resturant seriously the jerk dinner I mean you can't really go wrong with that. I did call to complain about the super small shrimp and they tell me they are always size. So I pay 1699 + tax for 6 shrimps.  End of story if you want some jerk go to Hyde Park jerk Uncle Joe's way better food way better customer service

28.description: Very slow dining experience. We waited an hour with only water. At 2pm on a Saturday the place was half full and no one had food on their table. It's as though they wait for the chickens to lay eggs, hatch, kill and defeather before you can even smell food being cooked. I would not return here, which saddens me because I really wanted to support a neighborhood Black business.

45.description: I love Uncle Joe's jerk salmon. It melts in your mouth. However be prepared to wait a while for your food. That's the only draw back. It's best to call in your order because if you don't, you may need to bring something to keep you occupied, during the wait.

33.description: The wait was not as long as I expected. You receive a generous amount of food & it's pretty good. Will definitely return & check out the other locations!

43.description: Ok wanted to go out this evening for some Jamaican food so we decided since uncle joes on king drive has seating we would go there great right .Ok so we get there to see there was a live band oh great right ? Well no wrong there wasn't a great band there and the music was so loud that I couldn't think not to mention the service was absolutely horrible and they were out of everything as well. I will have  to say that  this restaurant is a true understanding of you get what you pay for! Thanks and until the next review I say Bon appetite !

2.description: Don't ever eat here. Not because of the food because the food is absolutely wonderful. Not because of the live music on the weekends, because it's something different to enjoy during your meal.Avoid this place at all costs of your hunger because the staff is horrible and the customer service is non existent. Ive tried to hard to support this place off its food alone, because the food is just uniquely islandish in its core creation.I can't support bad service though, no matter how incredibly delicious the wings are so just save yourself the hassle and stay away

18.description: I love Jamacian food and had a good time at this place about a month ago, but as of yesterday night June 25, 2015, I would not put any stars if I could. DO NOT EAT AT THIS RESTAURANT!As I ate my meal and had a conversation with my aunt i couldn't help but see a mouse. It came out into the floor...it was walking in an slow unusual way and then scurried back under a Booth. We lost our appetite and told the waiter. A Mouse!!!!! This means there are more because mice live in groups, which means they drop feces everywhere....So the manager comes out 30 minutes later and she told me...YES WE HAVE A MICE INFESTATION PROBLEM. We have had an exterminator come every Monday to deal with it.... OMG she is aware and still serving food and not closings the doors until it's under control. This is DISGUSTING, UNSANITARY, UNACCEPTABLE and putting people at RISK for ILLNESS.IF YOU CANNOT RUN A RESTAURANT UP TO CODE THEN YOU SHOULD BE SHUT DOWN.

41.description: Food was ok. Service and friendliness of the staff sucked monumental proportions. We were a table of 6 and got there when the restaurant was almost empty. The host asked how many in our party and seemed bothered when we said 6. Waited 10-15 minutes for them to merge some tables together. Every single member of my party tried to order a dish from the menu but kept being told,  we don't have that or that it would take very long to make. We settled with food we really didn't want. They brought 3 members of our parties food out then we waited almost 10 minutes for the rest of our parties food,  including feeding an 8 year old last when all she was having was beef patties and ordered first. Rice was soaked in too much gravy.  Kept swatting little gnats from our food.  Asked to use the restroom and had to wait for an employee to unlock with a key. The scowl she had on her face made my 8 year old even ask what was her problem. No toilet tissue in bathroom or paper towels to dry hands. I drove over an hour to dine there, would never again.

52.description: I used to love Uncle Joe's not sure what happened. Service is super slow. Chicken was not fully cooked. Plantains had been previously cooked then microwaved. The decor is nice. If they improve on these few areas I think it would be great. Just okay.

50.description: For them to b known for their jerk chicken they never ever have jerk wings when I go here but i tried their jerk and its nothing to rave about it was pretty tasteless and might I add undercooked the reason y I continue to go back is because of the oxtails they r finger licking mmm mmm good I also tried the jerk chicken salad it was not that bad but who wants to keep pulling bones out of their mouth every time they take a bite not me I really think they should pay more attention to that I should not have bones and gristle in my salad no thank you I'll pass

4.description: I ordered takeout so my review reflects that. I ordered the 1/2 jerk chicken (dark) with sides of macaroni and cheese and cabbage. The chicken was great. It was juicy and the jerk seasoning was not overbearing. The cabbage was great. The cabbage was not greasy and was seasoned just right. On the other hand, the macaroni and cheese was gross. It was evident it was prepared at least a day or two ago and was reheated. The consistency of the cheese was clunky and the pasta was soggy. I was left with one side to eat with my chicken. The bread that comes long with the meal was OK and very soft. There was jerk sauce in a small container that came with the meal as well. The sauce was tangy, but went well with the chicken. I would return but will not order macaroni again from this place.

6.description: My cousin is in town and she loves jerk. So disappointed. I will never come here again. We changed the order on the sides 3 different times because they were out. We have been sitting over an hour and no food. We were told a shift change was in progress and that was the hold up. Unless the entire kitchen staff had a walk out this should not effect us.  We were served on paper plates, our waters never got refilled.  I will comment on the food once I get it..... Like I said in not coming back

22.description: I love this uncle joes !!! Great music , fast service & live music on the weekends . I also go with my favorite.... half chicken with rice & peas & sweet potatoes .... It's delicious . My favorite waiter is Von he's the best !! Anywho I recommended this spot to anyone in the Chicagoland area that's craving authentic Jamaican food , you WONT be disappointed ! I just wish they had a bar Lol !

15.description: I love the food at this establishment but terrible service when placing phone orders. You expect speedy service when you have called in an order however you will be mistaken. This place took 50 minutes to make my order and it was just chicken. The dining room was not packed either so I do not understand why the service was slllloooooowwww!

57.description: Uncle Joe's is one of my favorite places to eat in the city. Their Escovitch Snapper is amazing. The staff is a bit off and sometimes there is no manager on duty but the food makes up for the flaws in the way the business is ran. I go to Uncle Joe's for great food not service.

20.description: Food is good, service is atrocious. I've been at this restaurant now for 1hr and I still don't have my food. My drink just came???? Yet another great restaurant run poorly. This place has so much potential. The band on Friday is good too. Don't go unless management takes it upon themselves to maintain a decent level of service.MM

36.description: Will never dine in or order to go from here again!!!!!!!. Customer service is horrible, attitudes stink horribly and Ms. Trimmuel is one of the worst managers I've ever encountered! She yelled at me over the phone, defended her staff and not the customer,  didn't return my refund to my cc and had the audacity to challenge my story and basically told me, I was lying about what happened. Her character was a huge representation of why some people shouldn't be business owners or even involved in customer service!  The customer is always right until proven not. I truly hope my money is back on my cc by Monday because if not, there will be consequences.

14.description: OMG!!! From the manager, (blond locs) very impersonal, rude, unconcerned, to the ladies taking the orders. I went there on a Tuesday, order was wrong, went back Wednesday for coworkers, order was incorrect once again... Shame on me for going back a third time, but I made sure that I called, expressed what was happening with my orders. I wanted a salmon wrap... No salmon, I wanted a jerk chicken wrap, not at this location, ok, how about some jerk wings, sorry but no wings!! just a mess. I asked to speak to the manager, I was told by Danielle that the manager does not take calls, and will not come to the phone. Really??? I was livid, had to drive back to complain about my order. I can't, I just can't, it's really ridiculous that such a beautiful establishment, has poor service, poor food, and no intent to improve.

1.description: Don't accept credit cards and didn't say anything until I picked up the order. Super slow service. Won't be back.

9.description: The rib tips never have any meat on its bones. I have ordered them twice. The chicken wings and hot links are great.

12.description: Great to have another spot for food! The chicken was just ok. Parking on this street is not good, so you may have to walk 1/2 block once you have parked to get to the location.

21.description: This is the same Honey 1 that was  at 2241 North Western. They have closed that location. The staff was pretty friendly and helpful. It's pick up only and located right off of 43rd and Cottage Grove. I have been wanting tips so that's what I got. The rib tips are tender with a sauce that has a slight kick to it. I purchased a mini tip which comes with fries  for less than $6. That's what's up!

16.description: I ordered the hot link and a half slab of ribs. The hot link was extremely hot, a bit too hot for my taste. The ribs tasted like they had been parboiled, something I truly hate. These did not appear to be ribs that had been slow smoked, like true bb que.The only good thing is that they are fairly close to where I live. If I go again, I will try something different. But, I doubt that they will become my "go-to"  place for bb que.I just was not very impressed.

17.description: Really happy Honey 1 relocated to the South Side - a shorter drive for me to some of the best ribs in the city.  I'm afraid Lem's is losing my business...On a recent trip, had their ribs (very meaty), rib tips (my personal favorite), pulled pork and brisket.  The brisket was very flavorful but a bit on the dry side, so definitely needed the extra sauce.  Their regular sauce has a tangy kick to it, and the spicy is HOT.Note that the new location has no seating at all (just a walk up window) and (for now, at least) they only accept cash.

10.description: Honey 1 BBQ is finally open!!! I heard a lot of about the Humboldt Park location prior to the new location opening in Bronzeville. After reading about it in the Chicago Reader recently I couldn't wait to try it. Now that I've finally eaten there I'd say it was worth the wait.My mom happened to be visiting me so I sent her to Honey 1 for us. She ordered the rib tip/hot link combo while I opted for the smaller order of the hot link sandwich. My mom said she told the gentleman that she wanted the food mild but I'm not sure that's what we got as it was VERY hot. I'm talking nose running, eyes running, guzzling down water hot. IF that's Honey 1s version of 'mild' then I shutter to even imagine what the actual 'hot' version tastes like. My mom thought her food was entirely too hot and didn't enjoy it as much as she might have had it not too be spicy. First impression, the portion I got of links and fries was small. Just one link and a very small amount of fries. I didn't see the receipt but I'm guessing I got the lunch portion of the link sandwich. The order was small but very filling. I wasn't hungry after I hate it and didn't wish I'd ordered more food. I still think they are a bit stingy on the fries though. The other thing I didn't like was that the fries were separated from the links and bbq sauce. And there wasn't enough bbq sauce to coat or dip the fries in so I had to use ketchup. I like ketchup but eating it when the fries should be smothered in bbq sauce is sinful. I saw on the menu that you have to pay extra for additional bbq sauce. That will be a must the next time around. Overall though the food was good. I enjoyed it and would definitely go back and recommend it.My mom agreed even though the food was a bit too spicy for her. Since she ordered the combo she got a much larger portion than I did and had enough leftovers to save for the next day. She liked the link as well but said she wasn't blown away by it. She said the rib tips were much better but would have like a larger portion of fries as well. There was much more bbq sauce on her order than mine. Her meal also came with two pieces of white bread.The bill came to about $15 for the two orders. My mom said the young gentleman was really nice (named Robert) and she joked that she should have asked him if he was single! LOL She went on and on about how cute he was and how he had beautiful eyes. :)  Hey, I suppose being easy on the eyes doesn't hurt a business!! Just one more reason for me to stop in and try something different the next time I'm craving bbq.IMHO, it takes courage to close a thriving business on the north side and move it south. I believe the business will do well here in the area. It's been awhile since us south siders have had some good bbq in the area since Leon's closed in Englewood.

5.description: They have very good rib tips I have not tried anything else but the tips and sauce are very good. It is my new favorite place to go for BBQ I will try the ribs the next time that I go,

11.description: This is the same Honey 1 that was  at 2241 North Western. They have closed that location. The staff was pretty friendly and helpful. It's pick up only and located right off of 43rd and Cottage Grove. I have been wanting tips so that's what I got. The rib tips are tender with a sauce that has a slight kick to it. I purchased a mini tip which comes with fries  for less than $6. That's what's up!

3.description: I ask if tips were tender cashier said yes, i said that what you're suppose to say. He said no they are, i get home, i had to chew, chew and chew this batch was not tender u couldn't even bite the gristle..sauce was ok i might give another chance they were fast and place is clean.

0.description: love this place the tips are always on point.  be aware that it is cash only and carryout.

20.description: This is great South Side of Chicago style barbecue (ribs, tips, links), along with nice smoked chicken and great chicken wings. It's great to have Honey 1 on the South Side!  This is food prepared with care and love.  If you live on the near South Side and don't want to go down to Lem's, Honey 1 is a great alternative.The mini tips/links combo is a great deal. The tips are slim cut and very meaty, with great smoke and rub flavor (maybe just a touch too salty?).  The links are appropriately coarse ground and chewy--def not a hot dog or breakfast sausage.  The sauce is great--tangy and spicy, not too sweet.  The chicken wings are meaty, tender, juicy, with a nicely seasoned breading that is not too greasy.

19.description: My first visit to this bbq place, the rib tips were excellent, tender, I love chewing on the gristle, the sauce was like it was cooked in, yummy,the only thing I wish would change is they would accept debit or credit.

2.description: Tips not enough for your money.

18.description: Excellent real BBQ, affordable.  Had the ribs, tips, links, and wings.  All great.

13.description: i havn't visited this bbq place yet,however, i will this wknd if feb 20,2016. i saw it advertised on channel 7 news yesterday (02/19/16)  as one of chicagos' best slow cooked bbq houses and the food that was shown looked delicious and fresh so i can't wait to upgrade my review to 5 stars-providing the food looks and taste like what was shown on tv. so until i bite down on those ribs and chicken, this lady in waiting is giving three stars based on what i saw on tv that made my mouth water just by vision- yum! the owner appears wholesome & good spirited and he did mention on tv that his "hot" is "hot" so this is food for thought. see you soon honey 1 bbq.

4.description: Good BBQ I had a small rib tip & link combo. And ordered 8 wings for a friend. Meaty & tasty. They only accept cash but there is an ATM machine inside

6.description: Great food. Great service.  Support small business

15.description: This is great South Side of Chicago style barbecue (ribs, tips, links), along with nice smoked chicken and great chicken wings. It's great to have Honey 1 on the South Side!  This is food prepared with care and love.  If you live on the near South Side and don't want to go down to Lem's, Honey 1 is a great alternative.The mini tips/links combo is a great deal. The tips are slim cut and very meaty, with great smoke and rub flavor (maybe just a touch too salty?).  The links are appropriately coarse ground and chewy--def not a hot dog or breakfast sausage.  The sauce is great--tangy and spicy, not too sweet.  The chicken wings are meaty, tender, juicy, with a nicely seasoned breading that is not too greasy.

7.description: They were what I think of when I want "Chicago Barbecue". Aquarium Smoker, Zesty, Plentiful rib tips with white bread. basic cafeteria style seating in a no nonsense style that helps the customer perceive the value. Food here is better that Fat Willy's (I like Fat Willy's...A LOT, but $30 for a full slab dinner is downright offensive) at about 25% less the cost. Alas, the north side was not ready to support true south side Barbeque, so Honey-1 went to Hyde Park. I guess the Lincoln/Logan border prefers to overpay for their BBQ.I will see you less Honey-1, but I will see you again and again.

8.description: I ordered rib tips with potato salad and extra sauce.  The fries that came with the tips were delicious and soaked in bbq which is the Chicago way that I love.  The potato salad was good too, but the tips were a bit overcooked. Lots of tough meat. Also the sauce was hot even though I didn't request hot sauce. Usually mild is the default.

14.description: The website says they take credit/debit cards. So I call in my order and drive all the way to the south side cause I'm craving ribs. I get to the window and there is this big ass sign that says CASH ONLY! WTF!! Did I not just read on your website you take visa/MasterCard? So I proceed to the window and I ask the guy, this is cash only? And he looks at me like I'm the fool and turns his head to the sign while saying yes. So I turn around and leave because I was beyond shitty. If you have a website to go with your business keep it updated. That's just business 101. I called once I got to my car to cancel my order and tell them that their website says visa/MasterCard accepted and he apologized. Don't apologize have your webmaster update your website to reflect the current business practices. Thanks to their CASH ONLY rule I found Uncle J's and their ribs were deelish and that's where I'll be going back to when I have a craving for ribs. Because they take debit cards.

1.description: Excellent service done by Sydney and other professional staff, very down to earth, great music, new chairs, my service was excellent, I got eyebrows waxed, eyelashes, spa pedicure, and gel nails with a great design. Love this place because its convenient for me. Love the weekly special that they offer. It's Saturday but my favorite day to relax and feel comfortable. Special thanks to Sydney for always making my feel very comfortable.

0.description: This place has been my to-go place for the longest since i've moved down south. They're busy but theyre definitely worth the wait. I usually get my eyelashes done by Sydney because she take cares of me so well. Thank you Sydney!!

1.description: I actually like this place a lot, they have a nice selection of women's sneakers and tees. Most places really don't look out for the female market. Sugar Hill has cute things. I was impressed with their selection of Jordans and kicks that weren't a general release.

2.description: The guys that own this place are nice and helpful.  I don't really know much about shoes, but they helped my fiance find a great pair.  I myself am not crazy about sneakers, but everyone else seems to love the wild colors they have.  They have some cute women's Tshirts, along with the men's T-shirts.

0.description: I got some great shoes from this trendy shoe and clothing boutique!

56.description: H-Dogs is a welcome addition to the Bronzeville neighborhood increasing the areas' dining options.  There's lots of choices - all good: beef hot dogs, veggie dogs, duck sausage, smoked andoullie sausage, turkey burgers, moroccan chicken, and portabella mushroom sandwiches.  All the fries are tasty especially the truffle and the sweet potato. There's also gelato, rootbeer floats and really good lemonade. Chef Cliff Rome, a brother who has worked with food stars Wolfgang Puck and Mario Batali, puts a gourmet spin on fast food that's affordable at 47th & King. Everything I've tried is delicious.  There's also seating inside and you can park on the street.

29.description: I've only ordered the Nick n Nate Burger from H-Dogs with truffled fries, oh yes one day I got adventurous and ordered the special it was a Blue Cheese burger with fries and their lemonade for $6!  What a deal.  The burgers are just the right size to avoid making you feel like a stuffed pig, well prepared and all come with fries, so for .50 more you can bump the fries up to truffled fries.  The place is clean, the service is friendly I hope they are successful because every time I visit it is deader than a door nail.  For the price and the quality I don't think they can be beat.  Over on 53rd Street you have 5 Guys who are uber expensive with oversized burgers that don't include fries... H-Dogs is the deal!  I'd give more stars if I had tried some of the other things on the menu... hopefully I will update at a later time.  Check them out!

42.description: I am a regular here. If I'm not here at least once a week, I'm not living right. My absolute fave is the H-Dog. Delicious all beefy goodness, topped with finger licking turkey chili and the perfect amount of cheddar cheesiness! Mmmmmm...too bad they're closed in Sundays. Sweet potato fries are always fabulous. I've tried their regular and truffle fries; sweet potato are the best. I've also tried the Nick & Nate. Much too heavy for me but if you have a ravenous appetite, go for it! The London & Lake Sliders are also thick but very juicy for turkey burgers if you're not feeling beef.The staff is almost always extremely welcoming. Cute interior and plenty of free street parking.

23.description: Good hot dogs. Prompt service. Clean, comfortable space. Free wi-fi. Right in the heart of Bronzeville.

47.description: Didn't have high  expectations. Spotted the hotdog place and thought it might just be a hole in the wall. But I was curious. The place looking a bit too clean for a typical hotdog joint. Hmm, I thought. Must be new.Expectations...exceeded through the roof!This is more than just a new hotdog place...I found  high end hotdogs on MLK drive!It's a gourmet  hotdog place(who woulda thunk!  No more stereotyping the south side for me! Also no more traveling all the way to the northside for gourmet hotdogs)  but I had a hankering for grilled cheese. It was the best grilled cheese I've had thus far...ANYWHERE in this city.  I will travel to the 630 or even the 815 for some grilled cheese. Little did I know that Hdogs was just around the corner.(ok, not really, but close enough to Hyde Park!) My boyfriend Jed had the German dog which he says is very very tasty and truffle fries. I tried his trufffle fries. They were just ok to me, ...but the sweet potato fries I had? Again, the best I have had in the city.Being so close to the University of Chicago, I have no idea why this place isn't swarming with college students. Listen up U of C students...leave the Reg for a few minutes and get your selves over here! I will definately be back to order the hotdogs that they are known for. You've got a fan in me H-Dogs.I'll try not to be seduced by your grilled cheese/pesto sandwich so I can try every dog on the menu!

8.description: Love this restaurant! I love that everything is fixed fresh. I love that it is in Bronzeville. I love that it is black owned. And it's reasonably priced.

31.description: Exceeded my expectations. I had a cheeseburger with truffle fries & a Snapple for about 8 bucks. The burger was nicely charred with fresh toppings. The truffle fries were made to order. The service was friendly too. Definitely worth a try if you're in the area.

34.description: I was dining in at this restaurant, I asked for a cup of water . I was told it cost 0.39. I have not been back since.

16.description: This place has the BEST Turducken hot dogg I have eaten.  Yes it was the only turducken dog I've ever eaten, but it's so yummy. The Turducken Cobb Dog is grilled turducken sausage with lettuce, tomato, chopped turkey bacon & bleu cheese dressing--- and in three, 3 syllable words it is --- Wonderful, Heavenly, Happiness!

13.description: Was so happy and relieved to see a hot dog stand down the street from the crib. Don't really like to venture into Bridgeport accept for extreme hot dog cravings. You def filled a void in Bronzeville. I'll admit, it took me a minute to try yall. I noticed there was never a crowd in here. Now I see why...Chicago Dog- Unlike any Chicago dog that I've ever tasted in that- its nasty! The hot dog itself seems to be low sodium? Its been char grilled and then placed in a paper bag to sweat the char off before serving? Notice the question marks because I'm that puzzled. I just don't understand the wrinkled appearance and soggy texture, so pardon me, I'm trying to make sense of it all...H Dog- Totally my fault. I missed the part in the description where it explains that its made with *turkey chilli. I hate turkey products when cooked a certain way. The turkey in this chilli happened to be cooked the way that I hate. The chilli itself also lacks flavor and is too watery to be placed atop of a hot dog, so the bun disintegrates into a gloppy mess. Bronzeville Belly Buster- The burger seems frozen. It seemed like a patty you could get at any Jewel or Save A Lot, which would have been fine if it had any flavor. Just an over sized unappetizing burger.Truffle fries- Despite our 30 minute wait in a completely empty restaurant on a Friday night- for hotdogs and a burger, we still managed to get cold, stale, bitter tasting fries. I live literally 1 minute away. There is no way my fries should have been ice cold. The fries tasted like they had been cooked hours before. They were so hard. The truffle oil used does not seem to be of quality. The Customer Service was exceptional, had to add a star for that. The people working here actually want to work and are so patient and accommodating. If only the food was on par with the service.Will never go back again.

11.description: Awesome chargrilled polish sausage. I got it with grilled onions, sauerkraut, mustard, and peppers--amazing. Better than Portillos where I normally get it. I am also from California, so high probability I don't know what I'm talking about. Whoopsy?Minus one star for lackluster service. Girl at the front didn't want to be bothered with. I feel bad for her because working at fast food joints suck, but...

39.description: Love that the dawgs are grilled. And that I can get truffle oil on my fries. And that it appears to be a thriving business in a neighborhood that lacks that kind of thing. Good food. Efficient staff. Big old dining area. Give it a try.

37.description: This might be the greatest hidden gem in all of Chicago. I came to Jokes and Notes one night to perform and stopped here for dinner. I was amazed at how delicious everything was. There are healthy options as well and the Turkey Burger on wheat is amazing. Not to mention the incredible staff. They go out of there way to be friendly, accommodating and are pros with their cooking. I once came a few minutes after 7pm and they were closed and they let me in and cooked me a turkey burger. Another time I had only waited in line for a few minutes and they gave me a lemonade for the wait. This place is amazing and if you live in Chicago you need to stop here to eat!

0.description: I had a turkey burger, garden stlye. It was a good size for the price and fresh. The garden style came with provolone, mushrooms, and other veggies, which was a plus. The girl at the counter was nice and the lemon sorbet ice cream was tasty. The atmospher was comfortable enough, so i didn't mind the wait too much. Although, I wasn't in a rush either. I do plan on returning to try some of their other items.

38.description: This place is fantastic! The staff is very professional and the food is second to none. Chef Cliff Rome has succeeded in creating an extremely diverse menu with affordable, gourmet entrees at a very reasonable price.  It's great to have an establishment like this in Bronzeville, and I hope its success inspires other unique businesses to invest in the community.

51.description: I am so happy H-Dogs has come to Bronzeville.  I consider myself a "foodie" and my tastes extend far beyond the fast food offerings that are available in Bronzeville  (mostly, soul food,  fried fish and chicken, and chinese).  Which means that if I want something quick and good, I generally have to leave my neighborhood and head to the northside.  Well, not anymore.  H-Dog is an inviting place with a super friendly staff and  a unique and creative menu.  Thus far, I've only tried the salmon burger (which is delicious!) but I will definitely be back to try several other items on the menu.  Thanks for coming to Bronzeville, H-Dogs!  We've been waiting for you!   And I have to agree that coupling H- Dogs and Shawn Michelle's ice cream would make yours the perfect marriage!Update:  the Turducken Cobb Dog was somewhat underwhelming (it tasted like a regular Turkey polish) and needs a bigger bun and more toppings.  Nonetheless,  I still plan to go back often!

27.description: It's a cool addition to the Bronzeville Area. I ordered the Turducken Cobb Dog which was pretty tasty. I like how you can add Truffle Fries for little to nothing. Friendly Staff as well.

32.description: I had the pleasure of experiencing H-Dogs ~2 weeks ago and it was absolutely the best! The turkey burger was well-seasoned, juicy and cooked to perfection. The staff was patient, provided excellent customer service, and even helped me navigate the menu with a few recommendations. I was fortunate to meet the owner and was even more impressed with his commitment to the community. I'm a new resident to Bronzeville and I'm proud to say that I'll be a regular at H-Dogs!

54.description: Being there for only Day 2, they're doing a great job, I had the Nick & Nate which was pretty good. I've never had a bad meal from Cliff and his staff in his past and current endeavors with Romes Joy Catering. They're doing things right with fresh gourmet food, affordable prices and in the perfect location. I look forward to having the Salmon burger next time with hopes of them adding one of those burgers with the molten cheddar in the middle like they do in Minnesota from Burger Paradise on the Travel Channel as well as a Bleu Cheese Burger.His staff were very friendly, especially the young lady who gave me my food. It is my hope that they will keep that consistency because many restaurants have excellent service when they're first opening but get lazy later. The ice cream was good, I had a butter pecan float, 1st ordered of it's kind; it was great. I had the most gorgeous woman serve me at the cash register. She made me forget what kind of ice cream I wanted and she explained it twice. I'll go back just for her, a smile and a great attitude goes a long way.To table this, it's a great "hamburger joint" with affordable prices in a great area with great people paired with phenomenal food. There is an overwhelming number of "boutique" burger spots all over Chicagoland especially downtown, but they lack in quality and 9/10 you'll pay almost $17 just for a regular burger, fries, and shake...(Smashburger, M Burger, Beauty Bar, Fatburger)One Suggestion: Add Shawn Michelle's Ice Cream, dynamic duo!

48.description: The food here is really good and the customer service was great as well! There isn't a kid's menu which made it a little tough, I got the sliders for my son, but we can't frequent because that's the only small portion they had and I eat too much to share a burger with him. They also don't have condiments set out which is kind of a pain when it looks like you're cutting people in line or have to grab someone's attention who's busy to get more ketchup/napkins/mustard. Other than that it's a great restaurant, friendly staff and VERY clean. Definitely worth trying.

44.description: I am happy to have this place in the neighborhood.... It is a great alternative option to the greasy grills or harolds. The food is good, fresh and different. I really enjoyed the gourmet grilled cheese and all their hot dogs are great too. Also their salmon burger is really tasty.

24.description: I've been here 3 times now. The food is good, but my mind was not blown when I tasted it. The prices are very affordable, the service is quick, and the staff is friendly.

7.description: Everything looks SOOO good.Pros:everything you're supposed to put in your mouthfreshly prepared everythingvegetarian optionsCons:no baby changing stationH-Dogs is a large space on the northeast corner of 47th & Martin Luther King Drive with what seems to be free street parking on the service road in front. Yay!Menu items are atypical of a hot dog stand: truffle fries, lamb sausage, salmon burgers, sorbet. H-Dogs is definitely here to raise the bar. What was so impressive is that none of the food has that heavy, greasy, feel. You can eat to your heart's content with no regrets. Bring your wallet and prepare for happiness.Healthy Hound:A veggie dog that comes awfully close to regular hot dog, meaning you can fool some people. Otherwise, great taste.Greektown Dog:Fantastic! So incredibly good, would order again.Turducken Cobb:Amazing. Everything you want in an indulgent dog.Fried okra:So light. Breading is a complement to the okra, not a distraction. I would get more.Sweet potato fries:Crispy, to the point of being dry. But it's intentional. So fries are not burnt or lacking flavor, they are non-greasy, easy on the appetite. You don't leave feeling like you're going to waddle. Did they offer you cinnamon and almond toppings? You say "Yes please!" or you can go jump in the lake.Regular fries:Non-fatty, coarse salt, freshly fried. Mmmm.Watermelon sorbet:smells like real watermelon, very light.Lemon sorbet:Very tart, reminds you of summer.

49.description: Had my first dog (well, brat) here today. My first impression was simple - this place is amazing. Like an earlier reviewer, it took me an awkward minute or two to actually make my lunch choice. While it appears somewhat short at first glance, the menu is expansive and covers far more than you would expect from even a gourmet hot dog place. Think Hot Doug's minus the ridiculous hours and lines.I feel a little crazy giving a hot dog place five stars but there are very few restaurants I have lunch at and spend that same afternoon plotting out what I am going to get there the next day.I strongly recommend a visit - and this review will be updated as I have tried enough menu items to provide some decision guidance. And in case I forget to re-open this review, I can vouch for the German Shepard and fries. Legit.

40.description: The menu is very vegetarian friendly. We got a Health Hound, the Grilled Portabello Mushroom sandwich, and the veggie chili. The chili was spiced just right, which means pretty spicy by normal standards. The place was spacious and well-airconditioned, though it was odd that there was nowhere to get a fork or glass of water for yourself. A nice walk down King Drive if you're coming from from Hyde Park. The rootbeer float was made from vanilla ice cream and a can of soda, much better than soft-serve and fountain soda.

53.description: Yes, I'm a fan! Because of all the choices it took me a LONG time to decide what to get. I went in thinking I wanted a regular Chicago Dog but saw the menu and got distracted. Well, after much contemplation, I ordered the Greek Town Dog - a lamb sausage w/onions and tomatoes with Greek Yogurt Cucumber sauce.  It was DELISH! Made me think GYROS!  I could only eat half the dog and half the fries.**I agree with Matthew, add Shawn Michelle's Ice Cream!

30.description: Duck Sausage - FIYA!!!!!! A well put together sausage that was excellent. Perfect blend of meat, casing had just the right amount of snap and the toppings were on point!The customer service was a couple of steps above fast food but a couple of steps below gourmet. A gentleman in the restaurant put it best "I hope they realize that we are paying $3.25 not for the $0.99 hot dog but to see if the service is worth the extra $2.25" The staff was very responsive and courteous but need to improve in anticipating the customer's need. I chose to eat in and had to ask for Ketchup instead of it being offered in the beginning. I would like for them to pay more attention to the dine in customers to make it a true "gourmet" experience.

46.description: Tasty. Salmon Burger is the best. Need more seafood / fish options (i.e. gourmet fish nuggets.....just a suggestion). Cliff makes a killer Pizza. When you add this to the menu this place will be off the hook. Cupcakes to go with the great gelato please.....

1.description: This review is only for their chicago style hot dog.I am an avid fan of the chicago style and theirs is okay but has a lot of potential.The major problem I have with it is the bun, everyone knows the classic chicago style bun is a poppy seen bun, generally from the company S. Rosen's. Theirs is a plain bun that is very airy and doesn't hold up well to the large amounts of ingredients or the liquids from those (pickle, relish, and tomato mainly).They did a great job cooking the dog itself and it had a little char to it which was tasty and the other ingredients were all tasty but I thought the relish was just okay and I didn't get any celery salt to my knowledge.The fries that come with it were also a little undercooked in my opinion (I like them darkened a bit and with some crunch/not soggy).The place itself was nice and clean and the service was pretty fast and very friendly.

55.description: Ok, this review could easily have been a two star or a four star review, I guess my final opinion on H-Dogs is TBD.I'm going to qualify the following by noting that today was H-Dogs' Grand Opening, so they are bound to be a few errors here and there. It took them a couple of tries to get our order correct but it's their first day, fair enough.My wife really enjoyed the salmon sandwich and sweet potato fries she ordered. (I enjoyed the sweet potato fries as well and I'm not usually a fan) I couldn't make up my mind, they have so many choices, and I am looking forward to trying all of them in the near future. I finally decided on an Italian beef and some cheese fries. Not the best I've had but not the worst either. Like I said, it's day one so I almost feel likes its unfair to judge them on this experience, I will update my review after trying them again. The menu looks amazing and as another reviewer stated, they are a welcomed addition to the neighborhood!

9.description: H-Dogs gets an automatic one point deduction for the wait time. I get that everything is freshly prepared but 15 minutes is ridiculous. The time stamped on my receipt was 12:47. I didn't receive my food until 1:13. As I said,  utterly ridiculous. One of the employees did apologize for the delay but still... #wowI visited H-Dogs one time years ago when they first opened. I ordered a hot dog and remember being underwhelmed. The bun was hard and the dog just wasn't good. Thus the reason I hadn't returned until now, some 2-3 years later.Well, after all of that I must say that H-Dogs was worth the wait. It definitely wasn't the mediocre food that I recall having back in the day. I got a Nick & Nate burger (regular burger w/tomato, lettuce, mustard, ketchup, onion, and pickles) The burger was delicious! It was a generous size and very tasty. It came with a small amount of fries that were hot, fresh and yummy. At first I thought the portion size could have been larger but halfway during the meal I was full. Turns out the amount of fries was perfect.I'm sorry that I didn't give H-Dogs a another try long before now. I can't wait to go back and try something else on the menu.Five dollars for a burger and fries (no drink) isn't bad. You'd pay the same at McD's or White Castle for food much less filling.

26.description: I was looking for something quick to eat in Bronzeville, and being a resident, I had frequented most of the eateries around 47th and King Drive. My son suggested H-Dog and I'm glad he did! He had the Turkey Burger, and I had a polish and a  cheeseburger, it was all great. The food was hot, even after my son walked a block to bring it home. Great fries as well. I would recommend it for a quick reasonably priced meal, with a diverse menu that accommodates vegetarians.

25.description: This place is really close to my home so I decided to try it. I had the H-dog with fries and it was very good! Fast service, friendly and professional staff. It will definitely be my new hot dog spot!

12.description: Again, called in 15 minutes ahead of time and still have to wait another 20 minutes when I arrive. If you order ahead and there is a single order in front of you you're guaranteed to wait an additional 20 minutes when you arrive no matter how far ahead you call in. Again FAR below expectations.

21.description: Food is very good! I'm a huge fan of the veggie & turkey chili. The only thing I dislike is the hours!

17.description: Checking out local south side food. These guys can grill a dog!!  Polish, h-dog, and Chicago are tasty!! Worth the stop.

10.description: EVERYTIME I go I have a different experience.. The food is always good. But they could be a lot less selfish with the fries.. They messed up my order a couple times and let me forget my drinks the only reason i frequent is because I work near it and it's tasty.. But over all they have room for improvement.

5.description: Such great service. Food is excellent. The hot dogs I had today didn't feel heavy and were very tasty. I didn't feel guilty about eating the 3 different hot dogs today plus sweet potato fries with toasted almonds and cinnamon. I will definitely try to make my way out there as often as possible.

3.description: Awful service and mediocre food. There were only three others in the place and we waited over 25 mins to get our food because the woman worker was talking to her friend at the side. Here is a picture I took of the empty restaurant 22 mins in. Also, she forgot our order because she didn't write it down and then forgot to include our side of fries.

35.description: I like this place. They have consistently good food, its always clean, and the staff is nice. I normally get the salmon burger or the nick and nate with truffle fries and its very moderately priced for the quality of the food. They close pretty early tho.

19.description: Good hot dogs. Prompt service. Clean, comfortable space. Free wi-fi. Right in the heart of Bronzeville.

28.description: I love love this place. This is the first time I have given a business five stars. It is a fast food restaurant and if you really just want something lite and different than McDonalds this is the place to go. It's definitely vegetarian friendly and comes with enough food in one meal to satisfy your taste buds. My fav choice is the veggie chili. For $12 including gelato I was a happy eater.

45.description: We've been eating at this place periodically since it has opened. First of all it is so nice to have a clean, good restaurant around the corner! AND it is so cheap! Every time I call in an order I have to confirm the sandwiches/hot dogs include fries. I can't say I've tried many things. I am HOOKED on "The Bird." Like, I have dreams about, will find myself randomly thinking of it in the middle of a long day. It is chicken sandwich with curried onions, cilantro and spicy mayo. Onions and Cilantro are basically two of my favorite flavors. It is like party in your mouth.

33.description: I love the gourmet sausages at H-Dogs! The Lamb Sausage is by far my favorite. The staff is really nice. The restaurant itself is very clean and cute. My only problem is the fries. They are not on the same level as the sausages they serve. If they could upgrade their fries, this place would be unbelievable.

43.description: I love supporting local, independently owned businesses and its even better when I don't have to lower my standards to do so.  H Dogs gets everything right: delicious, gourmet yet approachable/kid friendly menu, clean nice looking kitchen/dining area, friendly helpful service, and reasonable prices.  I love the thoughtful touches like great music playing in the background and a magazine rack to browse while you wait for your food.This will be my family's new got-o spot for burgers and dogs.

2.description: Chicago is looking for the successor to Hot Dougs, and not only is H-Dogs a candidate, I think it's even better, because they make the single best salmon sandwich I have had anywhere! In fact, when I go back, I'll just skip right past their excellent dogs, and get me another one. It was a perfectly grilled salmon filet with crisp greens, red onions, and a zesty horseradish infused dressing, all on a wheat bun.I also sampled the Greek, vegetarian and French dogs. The Greek was essentially a gyro, with lamb, tomatoes, onions and a their version of "tzatzki" sauce. The Healthy Hound is a vegetarian dog that's a bit more in the style of a Chicago dog, but without the pickle, and with roasted peppers. The French was the richest dog I tried, duck sausage smothered in caramelized onions.All the dogs were good, but I kept going back to that salmon burger!Everything comes with excellent French fries, served crisp and piping hot. The inclusion of fries makes the pricing of the dogs and burgers much more attractive.There's also a rich chili, available in both vegetarian and turkey versions. I got this to go, and it was great reheated later.H-Dogs is definitely worth the trip south, and it's pretty convenient to get there on Lake Shore, so I'll certainly be back... for more salmon burgers!

18.description: I love love this place. This is the first time I have given a business five stars. It is a fast food restaurant and if you really just want something lite and different than McDonalds this is the place to go. It's definitely vegetarian friendly and comes with enough food in one meal to satisfy your taste buds. My fav choice is the veggie chili. For $12 including gelato I was a happy eater.

41.description: I figured out what the H means - Happy.I've lived in the neighborhood for 10 years and it's great to finally see a few new welcoming and independently owned restaurants opening up!  H-Dogs definitely is a welcome addition to the 47th Street community. Sweet Potato or Truffle Fries.Encased meats and bacteria do not mix well. This place is clean, pleasant and family friendly. Exactly what you want in a hot dog joint.When they are ready, I hope H-Dogs expand their menu because it would be great to get a Southside version of Hot Doug's.  Tourists and Northsiders need to know what they're missing by not venturing beyond the loop.

52.description: OK I am reviewing their Vegetarian/vegan fare. We went there two times once I had the Dana Delight, a vegan burger, minus the pesto-mayo and it was real good. The second time I tried the Healthy hound minus the cucumbers (they give me gas). It was really good for vegan food, now why did I take a star off? Because my wife who had their "meat fare" said it was just OK. Also their fries are good, we got the truffle and regular fries, but the truffle fries tasted just slightly different, like a wisp, or just a hint of truffle, too subtle to spend $1 extra on!  But I will be going back.  Ohh, they also have IBC root beer, another plus. Easy parking in the afternoon on either 47th or King Dr.

50.description: been twice and thought they were DELICIOUS!!! I had the Chicago Dog (Good, standard chicago dog, but I actually liked this one more than other places that I've had.. just tasted fresher, to me).. and then The FRENCHIE!! i LOVED..can I say LOVED this! A  hotdog made from duck? already a winner.. but then the sweetened caramelized onions.. man! sooo good! Also had the turducken dog and it was really good, too. Sister got The Bird (Moroccan chicken sandwich) and she said it was really good. I only tried a tiny sliver of the chicken, and it was veryy tender and juicy, but I can't judge it off of that little piece. I'll definitely be back and will definitely recommend. Hope they stick around

4.description: I love their Bellybuster Burger, Nachos and Chicago Dogs! The lemonade is aight!! I didn't care for the Italian Beef. I love the gelato!!
