Today, I came back to use an expired groupon and the hubby wanted to come. The food was delicious. We both had fried chicken and waffle, I had a side of eggs and Jon had a side of Mac n Cheese. It was so good. They have redeemed themselves. I am giving them four stars today because the wait is still a little bit to long once you are seated. We waited about 15 minutes to sit down and then waited about another 10 or so before the waitress took our order. The service was better. I hope they continue to keep up the good work.

36.description: Good just that "Good".If I was more into fried foods I would probably give this place 4.5The set up is average and it's a nice place to refer out of towners to.The waffles are extremely tasty and flavorful. The waffles are nice and thin but again very flavorful. I've always opted for the "Kesha" which contains two catfish filets fried to perfection alongside a waffle and a side of grits or potatoes.I'm not really a fan of the grits here as they are not smooth enough for me but did I mention THE WAFFLE is GOOD LoL.All three of my stars are based on the waffle, no wait I will also say the location it's so close to the expressway and McCormick place in the historical Bronzeville neighborhood. There is a lot of history in this area this place is a great addition to the area.

14.description: My order was $26.06, and for one person that's outrageously expensive, but the reviews made the place sound outstanding, so I gave it a shot. They got my order completely wrong. Served collard greens instead of rice and gravy, and yams instead of Mac and cheese. Now I'm stuck with a meal I don't want to eat. I should be issued at the very least a partial refund or a new meal.

0.description: Closed... Had good food at one time but always horrible service

1.description: What happened to customer service? This place used to be so wonderful - they delivered my mom's medication without missing a beat every month (even in the winter!). Are there new delivery drivers? New staff in the pharmacy? Without explanation we had a significant balance due because no one told us there were (all of the sudden) copays on some of her medication. Fine - I paid it via phone. Now you would think every month when I called for the delivery I would be able to pay the balance somehow my payment wasn't processed for this month and I was told they would not leave her medication unless it was paid immediately. Okay... Here's cash... Oh, you don't have change? Of course not. Well, the pharmacy office was closed so the driver finally agreed to let me pay via phone the next day but he also gave me a nasty earful as well. She needs her medication to live so forgive me for bothering to ask if I could pay the next day and keep the medicine. Why the attitude and nasty remarks?? Needless to say I will happily go to another pharmacy for our needs and leave this place behind.

2.description: I was referred to Roger Pharmacy by my doctor.  As I am currently uninsured, I was told that this pharmacy would probably be able to fill the anti-malaria prescription that I needed for my volunteer trip to Haiti at a reasonable cost. The customer service at Roger Pharmacy is top-notch. The staff was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Although I did not get the opportunity to meet Roger, he still somehow knew that I was going to Haiti and called me upon my return to check on me and to see how my trip was. If you want personalized service and a staff that truly cares about their clientele, then I would highly suggest that you go to Roger Pharmacy for all of your prescription needs!

0.description: Great people to do business with!

3.description: Always on point!!!!  The food is always fresh...never had a problem. Best location to us!

1.description: Although the food was very good, the wings were small and I ordered 30 wings but when I got home and started serving them up, there were only 24 wings. I called and they told me if I come back they would give me ten. I told them I couldn't come back that night because it was already late and I didn't have a ride. The lady said whenever I came back they would give it to me and as she was about to say goodbye I asked "don't you need my name?" She says oh ok what's your name. I gave her my name and asked for the managers name so I could ask for him when I came back. She told me to ask for Steve or Anon. Needless to say when I came back two days later they had no clue what I was talking about. I will never go back to this location.

2.description: I am visiting from Las Vegas but I was born and raised in Chicago. Felt good to stop in and grab a large meal for my family of catfish and chicken. The best part of my visit was watching how the staff handled a rude customer. Staff stayed professional dealing with a customer that complained and changed her order over and over and over. Couldn't get the employees name but she was good!

9.description: The fries here are amazingly good!! And you get way more fries in a large than any other Shark's, where the fries are just meh, I've been to. There aren't many places where I can eat the fries without sauce, here, I wouldn't dare mask the taste of these fries with sauce!

10.description: Great chicken Wings! Always on point

4.description: Decided to try this location based on the reviews and the size of the crowd of people waiting on their food.  Well looks are deceiving.  We ordered wings and everyone in the house tried them.  The hubby and I thought they were just "ok" and our young adult sons thought they were fine.  I personally was not impressed to go back to this location for chicken, and will just pay the extra to get fresh hot tasty chicken from my favorite Harolds.

6.description: Great Sharks,right down the street from me,fast made to order food,good jumbo shrimp and tilapia

12.description: Im supposed to be on a diet.....but I can't resist their chicken wings. I don't like fish (at all) but it  always SMELLS so delicious. Anyway, back to their wings...they use some type of lemon pepper seasoning and it's enough to keep me coming back everytime I come over to the south side to visit my grandmother. Make sure you call your order in because they do make your food to order so this may take a little while. The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is that I have had to tell some of their "clientele"  to get to the back of the line on a few occasions...but I guess that's not their fault right?

5.description: 1st time I actually went into a Sharks chain and actually enjoyed it so much that I had to go back a 2nd time!!! My food was nice and hot cooked to my desired request. The service was friendly and fast. The catfish & chicken combo was so delicious i recommend that to everyone. I enjoyed this location and I'll be eating her again.

13.description: I really like this particular Shark's Fish. The catfish is delicious and in ample serving size. I go here quite often and never had a complaint. Good food, good service, great portions and superb parking. If you want fried catfish dinners.... this is the place.  Make sure you call in your order.  Its faster that way.

11.description: This is probably the best sharks location that I have ever been to. They keep going up on the price, though, and that's not cool. The battered fries are really good.

8.description: This is probably the best sharks location I have been to. My food is always hot and fresh and I never have to wait too long.

0.description: These guys are excellent. The food is fresh and the atmosphere is better than any other Sharks I've seen. They put money into the business and you can see why with the rush during lunch.

7.description: Love this location. Always fresh made to order.

0.description: This pharmacy is tucked away on the 2nd floor of a medical facility and is probably the best kept secret. If you are someone who uses maintenance pills for blood pressure, diabetes etc, i highly recommend using them. They will fill your refills and delivery to your home for free. They are beyond fair with me. I now bring my entire family to this pharmacy and have transferred all my prescriptions to this pharmacy.  They get 4 stars because sometimes I have a hard time understanding what the pharmacist is saying.

1.description: so it seems like they opened up this place after closing down the old uncle johns? I think that's what I read on one of the articles on the wall while I was waiting for my food.. anyways..  this is a small pick up only restaurant.. and when I say small.. I mean like it only fit 1 line of like probably 6 ppl in there lol.. the place is also very easy to miss if you are not paying attention.. I passed it twice haha..i ordered the link and tip combo along with the 6 wing special (2 free wings)the wings was pretty good.. nice and crispy.. not too smallthe ribs and link was eh.. there was quite a few chewy pieces.. the links was over cooked and a little dry.. also wasn't a big fan of their bbq sauce...

9.description: I had a craving for ribs the other day and I looked on yelp to help me find a good spot. I started out at another south side place but when I got to the restaurant the sign said it was cash only which is not what is on their website. So needless to say I was pissed. I drove past another spot and they didn't take credit cards either so I jumped on yelp and Uncle J's came up.  I called to see if they took credit cards and she said yes but they don't let you call in your order. Since I was already on that side of town and was still craving ribs I drove over. The person taking my order at the window was very friendly and I ordered a half slab and 4 wings. They have a menu on the wall with combo numbers...50 or 60 something combos. Which I would say take the time to read because I only went about 20 down and ordered my wings and ribs separately but if I would have gone to number 46 I would have seen that order as a combo and saved 3 dollars.  oh well! So I placed my order and since the place is about the size of my hallway I went to my car to wait. About 15 mins later my order was ready. I dug into it when I got home and it was worth my drive over to the south side. The BBQ sauce was a little spicy but the ribs were deelish!!! Very meaty! The chicken wings were good...basic wings you would get at a rib joint. Nothing spectacular but good; I would do the combo again. The meatiness of the ribs has me wanting to try the rib tips next time. All in all definitely worth my trip and definitely going back when I have my next craving for ribs.

12.description: Good bbq, nice staff, good prices. The portions are large, but the sauce is a bit unusual. Though, not in a negative way. I like the sauce because I keep coming back.

21.description: Tender, but not fall-off-the-bone tender. HOWEVER, you get A LOT of meat for a good price, the sauce is great, and I ate these a day that I was sick with a throat ache and they no joke made me feel so much better.

16.description: Had a craving for ribs late one night. Someone recommended Uncle's J to me - one of few rib places we found that was open late and took credit cards. Great service and the rib tips were delicious. I love their sauce.

17.description: IT'S The SAUCE. It's so thick and rich. I Had the tips/hot links/and an extra order of fries. I've since been back just to get the fries, like I said IT'S THE SAUCE:) The tips were tender but not too tender and the hot link was seasoned well. I will definitely be going back.

10.description: I would've given it one star but the fries were really good.  There were a few tender tips in my order but for the most part the meat was DRYYYYYYYY!!! No amount of sauce could help them.  I was so disappointed!!! Uncle Johns was my spot and when I found out they were in the same family, I hoped for the best... Uhhh not so much!

5.description: True Chicago style bbq. Rib tips are very tender with slight hickory taste.  Sauce is very good, but be careful about the hot bbq sauce. It's really hot. Place is a get it and go. You won't be disappointed.

11.description: Living across the street is dangerous as I am always tempted by the delicious smoky goodness wafting through my windows. I have never had an issue with service, I'm always greeted with a smile. I generally place my order them run across to pick up a craft brew to go along with my meal. When I come back, it's hot and ready.  I've only had the tips, chicken wings and pork links but they are soooo good. The flavor of the tips is wonderful, they are tender and the links are always smoked and spicy. Mixed sauce is preferred because the hot by itself has strong vinegar aftertaste for me. For $13 I get about 2 lbs of tips 2 huge links, fries, slaw and two slices of bread. Totally enough for two but you will need extra bread for all that spicy sausage! Ask to bag the fries separate because they get greasy and dont get enough sauce under all the meat.  Standing room only so no place to sit and wait but they accept plastic so I'm happy. In only wish the hours were more consistent.

3.description: Believe it or not, I think good BBQ spots can be hard to come by. So, of course we wanted to have a little bit of everything on the menu to decide if this was a keeper or not. While they're known for their hot links, I think a true PitMaster's test is proven within their ribs and rib tips. We settled on the jumbo tips ($14.50), the wing special (8/$6.50) and later discovered it was a better deal to go with the jumbo tip and link special ($15.00). We went with the mixed sauce, which was supposed to be a little hot, yet, still sweet. Boy were we wrong, that stuff was SOOO hot, we could barely eat our food! The rib tips were nice and tender and the wings where your average wings. The hot links were pretty good, but again, they were hot as heck! The only issue we encountered was with our decision to change to the combo jumbo tip & link. It was $15 vs. the $14.50, we paid for just the Jumbo Tip. So, we should have paid the difference ($. 50) plus taxes (10.25%). However, they charged us another $1.09, which was a $. 60 tax on a  $.50 item. Who does that? When we questioned it, they didn't understand the problem. LOL, I'll still go back.  Extra info:This is a family owned business. The PitMaster worked at Uncle Johns BBQ for years! He's known for his hot links. His daughter opened this place to high light his links!

0.description: Ribs and chicken are good! The hot is too hot for me so I stick to the mild. Why go to Harold's when you can hit up this spot?Street parking. Takes a minute to get your food but it's worth it. $7.10 for 8 wings and fries called the #14 $6.50 special

20.description: I've missed the original Uncle John's Bar B Q at 69th and Calumet since it closed down last November.  The new Uncle John's at 83rd and Cottage Grove is more expensive, not as friendly, with food that seems more mass-produced.  Although someone else moved into 69th & Calumet with the old Uncle John's sign, his food is even worse (not fully cooked).  I'm so glad that the real deal essentially moved to 47th St. The current menu is the same as at the original Uncle Johns, and prices haven't gone up, making this some of the least expensive and still best barbecue.  I tried chicken wings, rib tips and the famous hot links today, (all with mixed hot/mild sauce)  and cant think of anything to complain about.  The nice lady behind the counter even recognized me from the old place.  This is where I'll steer friends looking for the best barbecue on the south side.

19.description: I wanted to find an alternative to my regular BBQ spot in my neighborhood and I ran across Uncle J's on 47th Vincennes. The food was plentiful. I ordered a slab of ribs and small order of hot links. The ribs were good and we had enough meat to eat for two days, the same with the hot links. The links were hot but I could've used more sauce. I would recommend Uncle J's to my friends and neighbors. Oh yeah, their service is quick. The cook told me 5-6 minutes and it was 5-6 minutes, unlike other bbq joints in Bronzeville that can take up to 45-60 minutes for a simple order. Take out only hole in the wall, but a good hole in the wall.

2.description: I'm on the north side and don't like the taste of smoker oven bbq, I have to go to the south side for the real thing. I go to Uncle J's for the properly smoked meat and the fantastic sauce.

18.description: Tender, but not fall-off-the-bone tender. HOWEVER, you get A LOT of meat for a good price, the sauce is great, and I ate these a day that I was sick with a throat ache and they no joke made me feel so much better.

13.description: First time In Chicago a few weeks ago and the food was incredible. Service was prompt and overall friendly. Great ambiance and some of the best flavor I've found in my travels.

4.description: They can be a little inconsistent at times, not as good as the original Uncle John's, but where they're on, they're on! My go to for rib tips and hot links. Beware, the hot sauce is really hot.

6.description: Rib tips are to die for. Get extra sauce.

15.description: UPDATE! In my last review I stated I went to Uncle J's to sample the bbq before placing a huge order for a family gathering, When I originally talked to the mgr/owner he stated I could pay for the order the day before and pick it up the day I needed it. Unfortunately I was unable to go by the day before so I called the day of  around 1pm. and the mgr would not come to the phone to talk to me so he allowed this teenage girl to take my order. She gave me the total and I informed her I will come pick up at 530pm. When I arrived at 535pm my order was not ready and I had 10 hungry family member at my home waiting for food. I was furious! Not only was I angry at the point that I was told my order would be ready but I was also furious that the manger refused to come and address his customer. When he finally waddled his fat butt out of the back he began to argue with me and tell me I need to pay ahead of time and it would be an hour before he could have my order ready. Not only was he rude but when I looked in the smoker where was NO FOOD! I assume he was going to have to cook my order. Anyone who has ever bbq'd knows it will take more than an hour to do so. I stormed out and went to UNCLE JOHNS ON 83RD. When I got to 83rd I was met with a smile and with compassion when I told her my story and that I have 10 family members waiting. She simple said "give me 15 minutes" in around 30 minutes I walked out with tons of food and I was very happy! Uncle Johns on 83rd was glad to accept my 120.00 and I was more than delighted to give it to them. UNCLE JOHN'S ON 83RD AND COTTAGE SAVED THE DAY!I will never return to Uncle J's on 47th and will tell everyone I know NEVER to spend their money there. I foresee this dump closing soon!

7.description: Very friendly folks. Based on the reviews, I had the rib tips. It was 7:30 pm. The portion size was huge. But the meat was dried out. I was so looking forward to it. 1 star perhaps I should have gotten there early.  Also had the the wings. I definitely would go back for them. I should have gotten the 6 wings for $6.50 get 2 free. 3 stars. The links looked fabulous.

8.description: i had a taste for ribs so I went to Lems, not my favorite but the only place I knew.  As it turnedout they were closed, so I decided to drive over to 47th street and stop at the first rib place i found.  It turned out to be Uncle J's and I got lucky.  Lems is history.

14.description: Doesn't get any better than this in the City of Chicago!! Rib tip/link Combo.....Slap Yo Mama, finger lickin', break out inna dance....Damn Delicious!!!!!    Waiting for my husband to bring it home right now, gratefully, only about a 10-15 minute drive from our Hyde Park, South Shore Dr, condo........   Lucky us!!!!!

3.description: Aisha did a great job.  Her prices are lower than market.  I was skeptical at first, but after I saw the finished product I couldn't be happier.  Shop was small, but it was a shop- messy but not dirty.  Also she forgot to tell me there was free parking in the back after I fed the meter 2x.  Very happy with my hair and the price.  I plan on coming back!  Plus- get to watch Nigerian movies while she fixes your hair.  Side note: My braids are tight, but it didn't hurt very much while she was doing it, and I am tender headed.  Hurts a little post braiding, but I'm sure it will loosen up.

1.description: First let me just say that I LOVE my braids.  They look amazing and they only hurt a wee bit because I have a lot of hair and they're heavy.  Aisha is also very very sweet, and I really like her.HOWEVER, my experience was awful, and I probably should have left when her stylist (sister?), Jamelah, was over 30 minutes late.  My appointment was for 10am, I took the train and walked in the door by 10:01 (I was in the building at 9:58, but I waited for the elevator and then got a little lost, because I counted wrong haha).  I have been sick all week, so I just sat down and quietly waited for Jamelah to arrive.  Aisha said that she told her 9:30, and she spoke with her twice on the phone while we waited.  Each time Jamelah said that she was almost there.By the time Jamelah arrived, I was feeling drained and nauseous, so I put my music on and went to sleep while she got started.  I'm not a talkative person, but with me feeling the urge to puke every time I opened my mouth, I was especially silent.  The only time we spoke was when she told me she was going to get her coffee, or if either of us had to go to the restroom.  She did not take a lunch break, which I appreciated, because I knew this would take forever.I'm not sure why the other two customers got 2 braiders on their hair, and I just had Jamelah, but she was pretty fast, and as I said before, I really like my braids.  It wasn't until she finally finished braiding that everything really started to go downhill.  While she braids quickly, she stops A LOT to talk with her hands.  By this time it was 5pm, and I was beyond ready to go home (I'd thrown up, and my head was on fire).  I very calmly (and almost inaudibly) asked, "can you please hurry?  I'm so tired."  To which she forcibly replied "I'm going as fast as I can!  I'm almost done!" Which she was- so you can imagine why the constant stops to tell her story were driving me crazy.  I responded, "yes, I just meant can you stop talking with your hands?" And she lost her mind.She went off on me saying that I am rude and I can't talk to her that way.  That she knows what kind of person I am and I think I'm better than her.  I reminded her that I'm a paying customer, and it was unprofessional to talk to me like that, and she said "I get paid salary so I don't care if you pay or not," so I asked Aisha if that meant I didn't have to pay.  That's when Aisha started trying to shut her up.  She said a lot more ugly things, meanwhile, all I'm saying is "oooook....."  I told her she was being paranoid about American's and she said "I don't have to take your shit."  When she cursed at me I jumped up and said, "you're crazy.  I want to go home."  All that was left was the clean up and the hot water dip, all of which I can do on my own, and I was not going to sit there and be verbally abused by this woman.Aisha grabbed my arm and her and Jamelah exchanged some words in their language, and she tried to calm me down to stay.  Aisha ended up finishing my hair, and I only paid the amount that was owed- no tip.  I'm surprised she made me pay full price after that attack, but whatever.  Aisha also texted me last night apologizing for Jamelah who apparently has anger management issues.I finally left a little after 6pm, so it took over 7 hours.  If you don't care about your experience and just want braids, then definitely try them.  Just don't let Jamelah do them :)  There's several other braiding places in the same building, though, so I'd try one of them first lol.

2.description: Went here about a month ago and my braids are still holding up nicely. The lady that did my hair was very neat and the braids were done tightly and it did not feel like they were yanking out my hair. Also, I appreciated that my braided did not comb through my hair with a fine tooth comb. Cons: salon was small and parking was limited- I would definitely suggest coming in as early as possible to get a parking spot in the back. Also, their was a random name on the door so I had to call to make sure I was in the right place. I would definitely return in the future.

5.description: Aisha is a very nice person;  in fact she has braided my two daughters hair as well as my hair. In total we have visited her shop over 8x. I made my oldest daughter appointment for 5/14/14, we discussed the time, style, and price ($140). When we made it to her shop she changed the price to $160 because she stated my daughter hair is thick. I was super confused... so I left, I couldn't believe what happened.  I don't really know why she changed the price but she just lost 3 loyal customers!!!!

6.description: Had individual braids done here in late April. Overall, I'm pleased with the result and would return again. Tip for anyone considering this place -- bring a picture of the hairstyle you want! I did this and credit my good result here to that.A few blips that happened here that I was okay with, but others may not be:1. The sign on the door here says "Jeanne's African Hair Braiding" or something like that. It was confusing.2. I called for an appointment in advance, but the hair braider showed up 30 mins late (because of parking issues, she told me).3. The salon itself is on the smaller side. Not the worst I've seen, but don't expect glamour here. I like to think of it as efficient.I was pleased with the work they did on my individual braids here. They provided the extensions at no extra cost and my individual braids have held up well over the last 2 months. (Based on other reviews, I'd only come here for individual braids and stay away if you want Senegalese twists.) Plus, I was able to watch Nigerian movies for the entire time, which I always enjoy doing.Would recommend -- just remember to bring pictures of the style you want.

7.description: The owner Aisha is very friendly. I agree with the other post that the place is small and messy, but I did not go for the ambience. Aisha did my micro braids the first time I went to her. Though a couple came out around the edges, I was happy with the results. I went back two months later for a crochet. The price was $120, which I thought was steep for crochet. Her assistant did my hair. She used the glue to secure the knot you make after you crochet the strand in. I never seen anyone do this before. I had been getting my crochet on/ off for 5 years. I questioned it and she seemed offended. The girl took a long time, almost 5 hours. Though it looked pretty, the glue made it hard. She also kept sticking me in the scalp and pulling my braided hair with the crochet device. We'll nevertheless, when I went to take my hair down, the glue had gotten into my hair and I had to cut some of my hair out trying to get the strands out. I sent a text to Aisha about the problem and she told me to come in, but fortunately I  had an appointment with someone else the next day. I asked her was there an easy way to get this out. She offered for me to come in and she would help, but no other suggestions. I would say if you go make sure Aisha does your hair. As for me, I won't be back.

8.description: I got senegelese twists at Aisha's shop, which look really good and were priced reasonably. I had two women on my head and they still took 6 hours to finish. I got a little annoyed because one of the women talked the whole time I was there, either on the phone or to the other twister and kept stopping every 2 minutes to gesture her story with her hands. Aisha seemed really nice, but she started on my head and left after 10 minutes and didn't return until I was almost done. My scalp has been itching for the last 2 weeks and I am not sure why...I may be allergic to the hair that the use. Overall they did a good job, I just wish it would have been faster.

0.description: I woke up on September 13 and NEEDED to get my hair done...decidedly in braids. My usual hair stylist was not available and so I did a yelp search for places close to home and found this little gem. I stopped by and let Aisha see the length of my hair. I got a quote that was totally reasonable for why I wanted. They were able to get me in the next morning. Took a total of 7hrs for medium size individual braids and hair was included.We started on time for the most part- maybe 15 minutes late and took very few breaks. Aisha started on my head and another woman joined and took over. Everyone was super friendly which I appreciate. I am also tender headed and they did a good job. No one pulled my edges too tightly which was also a plus. It's now been a month and my hair still looks great, like I just got it done.

4.description: Don't do it. Once again I learned my lesson about being cheap and trying to save a few dollars. Never again

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Extensions, Kids' Hair

3.description: I simply love this place. The food is delicious and the delivery is speedy. I have ordered the the turkey nacho supreme from here 2 days in a row and each time didn't disappoint. My mom loves there melts. I will definitely be ordering from here again. The pound cakes are also Devine!!!!

1.description: I ordered several meals for delivery to my job. First, lunch was delivered 30 minutes pass the expected time. Second, a colleague did not like her turkey chopped steak. I hated my nacho supreme. I could not tell it was nachos because I could not taste the cheese sauce. Plus the chips were soggy. To add insult to injury, no utensils and no napkins. The only coworker who enjoyed her meal was the one who ordered the chicken wings.  I am going to X this place off my restaurant list.

2.description: We used to love this restaurant until our recent visit on Feb 3rd. We ordered 2 5 piece Wing dinners and requested the sauce on both chicken and the French fries. When we got home, one order didn't have any sauce on it and the other did. Additionally, the fries on both order were stale and hard. Since we live a little bit away, I figured I would call and speak with a manager and share what happened. Well, when I called, the person who claimed to be the owner told me I had to be mistaken because their fries are hand cut and cooked regularly. I shared that was not the case with our order and he began to fuss at me and tell me pretty much oh well because he knows his food is cooked fresh. To add insult to injury he literally tried to out talk me and offered no resolution to my messed up orders. I was extremely disappointed with the way he handle our call and advised I would write this review and share with my friends and family my experience. He hung up in my face.

9.description: Last night, my husband and I ordered $46.00 worth of food. My Chicken Parmesan Dinner was garbage. At first glance, it looked like I was getting ready to dive into a wonderful meal. NOT THE CASE! I had a pound of overcooked, mushy spaghetti with not nearly enough sauce to mix throughout. The chicken was underneath the sauce so that I was unable to see that it was both BURNT AND OVERCOOKED! I could not enjoy my food and they were too far and an INCONVENIENCE for me to waste the gas taking it back which is WHY WE PAID TO HAVE THE MEAL DELIVERED TO BEGIN WITH. The salad was fresh and I enjoyed the creamy garlic dressing. Whomever prepared the food KNEW they were covering up burnt, dried out chicken with sauce on top. Very little mozzarella cheese and just a whole bunch of mushy spaghetti not worth feeding to a dog. EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED. Based on this experience, I neither recommend nor will I ever order from them again. I DON'T TRUST THEIR QUALITY STANDARDS, not on my dime or time!

10.description: Good take out/delivery place. Lots of good food to choose from here. The Fried Chicken Dinner and the Perch are my favorites. They also have good burgers too.

4.description: I absolutely love their Turkey Burgers! Honestly I order from here 2-3 times a week and the delivery is super fast!! Everyone is so polite and have always been since they were located on 31st!!!

6.description: The food here is excellent. They have fast delivery and are very professional when going in to pick up. This is not a place to dine in either, which plays into the name "xpress." I personally believe this is one of the best fast food places to come for non-red meat eating folks in Chicago and definitely on the southside. Their menu has multiple specializations and dishes in turkey, chicken, and seafood (They have beef and other red meat too). This is a place for everyone. No matter your diet, you are guaranteed an excellent meal for a LOW price! My favorite is the gourmet turkey burger. It is exquisite and fulfilling (So the gourmet turkey burger is like $4.80 plus tax for the burger and fries). I hope in 2015, they remove the "Rib House" signage. I know that can serve as a barrier for folks passing by (It took someone to tell me to try their offerings). This place is awesome, I have told friends and co-workers about their wonderful menu. Try it out!

12.description: The food is great and the people who work there are extremely friendly. I go there at least once a week. I highly recommend their burger. The fries are excellent. Good prices to top it all off!

5.description: Turkey Tacos are great but serving chili (with beans!) over breaded chicken breast, Parmesan cheese and spaghetti does not a Chicken Parmigiana make!

13.description: They used to be in walking distance from my apartment and now they're on Pershing and Michigan. I don't have a car so it's not as convenient to get to.  The food is still good -- they even took holiday orders for turdurken (google it) and chitterlings.

11.description: They have the best grilled chicken salad ever !!

8.description: Very fast service when you call in your order.  Variety of offerings however I've only had the turkey burger, salads and cake...of course

0.description: The Rib Tip Dinner earned Shore's Xpress an extra star. They were so tender and juicy and so many I have left overs for dinner this evening. The Fries were good and the saucy was oh so tangy. This meal has totally satisfied my BBQ craving for a couple of months. LOVED IT!!!

7.description: Best keep secret in town! The grilled chicken is simply superb! I add it to my Greek salad for a nice treat.

3.description: Do NOT recommend, especially Eric. Extremely ghetto and unprofessional. I don't have experience with others, but he is extremely lazy and unwilling to accommodate working professionals. I called and made an appointment for the same day. Spoke to Eric and was told he had availability to do my hair that day no later then 5 pm. Mind you, this is a weekday, and I work, but I left work super early so I could get there by 5. I arrive, tell them I'm there for Eric, and am told to sit down. I sit in the waiting area and wait for about 10 mins before Eric saunters over, with HIS hair wet and in a towel, and informs me that he has taken his last appointment for the day. I reminded him that I spoke to him that day and he told me he'd do my hair, but he proceeded to deny even having that conversation with me. I don't know if he was under the influence of something, or just lazy and unprofessional, but I will never patronize this shop ever again!

1.description: I'm a new comer but so far i can say about lockology shop it's looks very clean and improvising.  I can tell by reviewing some of the reviews that they have a group of skilled professional workers and a excellent place to do business at.I never been to lockology shop yet but I hope that my experience at lockology shop is as good as it appears too be.  thankyou.

0.description: I was able to call early on a Saturday morning and get serviced that same day which was good for a Saturday.The owner, Lenny seems to care a great deal about customer satisfaction and I really appreciated that

2.description: I won't bad mouth Locology but the best stylist has left. Ansah Ofei has relocated to "Real Rootz Chicago" located at 500 E. 47th Street. If you want to follow his lead, the number is 773-587-4697.

5.description: I stand by my earlier review in terms of quality, but don't bother going on a Sat.  Just don't.  Unless you like wasting time because it's overbooked.

6.description: My normal stylist was booked and after reading the great reviews...I was sold.  I arrived at my 9AM appointment and was greeted. I then sat down to wait for my appointment to begin... and wait I did.  A half hour went by, then an hour, and then an hour and a half.  During this time frame, I was never approached by any of the stylists in regards to whom I was waiting on.By the two hour mark, I approached one of the stylists (that was free) and asked which of the stylists had me in their book.  The stylist, who was there all along,  was located and I was told that he simply "forgot".  As consolation, the free stylist offered to take over my appointment.  I agreed and 5 hours later, I was out of the salon.I appreciate that the free stylist offered to take over my appointment.  However, the events that led up to the moment left a bad first impression.

7.description: Let me just begin by saying I'm pretty applaud that I AM NOT the first to review this spot. However, I guest sleepers miss the train or whatever analogy you choose to use in this case. Whatever! I begin going to this spot  about a month ago to partake in a very serious transformation: Afro to locks. Yeah, I know...whatever. Of course, anyone who's been natural with an Afro for 4yrs will be a little reluctant to go through with this. But, I must say, I appreciate the professionalism that is this "lock factory" on the corner of 43rd & State. My technician of choice? Mike, who calls himself amazing, I must vouch for him. My initial twist were EXTREMELY nice, and FULL. He also laid them perfectly to frame my face and not make my head appear to be larger than it is (you definitely see the picture. I CANNOT wear a fedora).  Quality of Work: Definitely stellar. After 2 weeks, I think my hair looks a mess , yet,  while on the train, I'm still getting compliments on how neat and shiny they are. Technique, although I have no clue if this is normal, is very precise. You don't see one person doing it one way, and the man next to him doing it another. You can be sure that when you go to Lockology, you're getting something that you need for your tresses....CONSISTENCY. In my opinion, Consistency breeds loyalty. Cleanliness of Shop: I'm not sure, but I honestly don't think I can feel more at home in this piece. How this spot is decorated is the aspiration for my living room. It's NEVER dirty, the art work is superb and I truly need one of those mirrors somewhere in my house. Overall, I'm glad that I was directed to this spot by some random person that is my cousin, although she doesn't go here...IDIOT! I feel like I've told Mike how much I'm in love with him, if I haven't, I'm telling you my fellow yelppers, I'm totally in love with Mike. Now, if I can just convince him to move in with me to have his skill at my beck and call.

8.description: today will be my second time at lockology....i love the professional but yet home like vibe....mike aka money mike does my hair...he does a great job....but dont take my word go to lockology for yourself and ask for mike tell him tasia. sent u

9.description: I enjoyed my experience at Lockology. I went in on a Saturday morning and was in and out in 2 1/2 hours.  The place was a little dusty but so is my house so I will not hold it against them. Overall it was OK.

10.description: I called Lockology Salon and let them know of my frustrations and asked for prices and I was told to come in for a consultation. I drove there and met with Lenny the owner. He looked at my hair and told me it would be $95 for my services. I have my hair lock-stitched, so it is more than the palm roll. I agreed thinking he was going to do my hair. He introduced me to Zaki and told me she would be doing my hair the next time I came in. Zaki and I went over the price and my appointment for the next time. She seemed very professional and genuine.When I came in for my first appointment 4 weeks later, I thought Zaki really did a fantastic job on my hair.The next time I came in, which was 8 weeks later, Zaki charged me $135 dollars. It went up to $125 for the service and $10 for the style. At no point did she contact me and tell me she went up on her prices. It is very unclear at this place if the stylist are independent or they work on their own. I was given a price and she just went up on me. There is no price list, there is no website that you can refer to look at prices. It seems as though someone can just go up because they feel like it. Anyway, I paid her $135 for the service, I should have said something about the price hike at the time but I didn't. I felt she did a really good job and I honestly didn't mind paying her that much even though she was extremely unprofessional and went up on the price like that.The next time I came in, 8 weeks later, Zaki charged me $145 for the same exact service she had provided the previous two times. This time she added another $10 for prunning, which she had done previous with no extra charge. I had spoken to Zaki about my experiences with other stylist and the horrible service. She told me she worked at Amazon salon before and how they would nickel and dime people on any little extra thing. She told me she just charged a flat rate for her services. Which proved to be untrue. Anyway, once again I paid her $145 after the service was over. This time not only did I get charged more, but I waited over an hour before she even started on me, so by the time she finished I had somewhere I needed to be. I paid and rushed out. The next day I called Zaki because I was furious at her continuous price hike. I went down the line and asked her why is it that every time I come in she charges me a different price? She really had no answer for me. She did say that she does a good job on my hair and at the price Lenny charges, she felt she should charge more because she does a neater job and uses products. I'm thinking to myself "shouldn't you and Lenny have worked that out before I came for my consultation?" Shouldn't you do a good job anyway. I couldn't believe what I was hearing. The price I was given was $95 and this is the price you agreed to do it at in the beginning. She told me how she went up on her prices and she never notified me by email, phone call, or text. Zaki is extremely unprofessional. She does a fabulous job on your hair, I'll admit that. She really does a good job, but she treats it like a hustle instead of a profession. It's about getting over on you for that extra $10 or $20 dollars. I was tipping Zaki, I was even in the process of referring other business to her and she was just very shady. I have clients in my business and I would never treat people like that. Anyway, I expressed to her how I felt about her shady business practices, I was professional with her in expressing that. But I had not planned on going back. A week later she called and apologized for everything and stated that she would do my hair for $95, even though she felt she was worth more. We went through what would be included in the service. She told me general maintenance, wash, prunning. I thought it was great that she did call and apologize, so I agreed to come back.The last and final time, I get there for my appointment and I wait for 45 minutes. She had not gotten to the shop. I live pretty much in Evanston and she lives in the neighborhood and I have to wait 45 minutes.......but ok, I think this is the $95 service :). She did my hair quicker than she had ever done it before. I think I was out of there in less than 2 hours. I would usually be in there for close to four. It was clear she was not excited to do my hair. She finished, looked me in the face and told me she prunned my hair, when she didn't. I knew I would never come back. I wrote her an email and let her know how unprofessional she was and if she didn't want to do my hair for $95, she shouldn't have offered.I can only speak for my experience here. There truly needs to be a price list or a website to refer to. It's very unclear whether stylist are independent or work for the salon. My experience with Zaki was very inconsistent.

4.description: I haven't been here in a while and I have only visited the salon one time over a year ago.  The young lady who serviced me was very nice; however, I have definitely decided not to go there anymore.  Mainly because of the gook that was used in my hair.  At the time I still had twists that were transitioning to locs.  The gook added a lot of build up in my hair and was a task to get out.  It was then I learned that all of that product use is not necessary.  She told me to come in every two weeks to get them done.  That was a red flag for me.  I understand it is a business, but that much manipulation and tugging at the scalp is not good for the hair.  Secondly, paying you every two weeks for maintenance seems out of this world.  Many people enjoy the place and that is great for them.  I have also seen some very thick, long and healthy looking locs come from out of there.  It is not for me though.

12.description: Even though the atmosphere is lovely, the customer service is horrible.  I asked for plain Ciroc they were out of it , when I accepted Absolut thru ran out of that for my by the time I ordered my second drink!  The wait staff is slow and the DJ was late!  I can pass on Swagger!

3.description: I wish I could give this place 0 stars, but I gave them 1 for the decor. It is nicely decorated and has a beautiful patio but everything else about it sucks. 1.) Security ruined my good time. We watched a group of women dance in too little clothes, get tossed in the air, and all sorts of rachetness but when my BFF decides to 2 step with her boyfriend on his birthday security says dancing is not allowed. Prior to that it took an hour for our entire party to get in the place where we paid for two tables  (tables are just when you order bottle service) and we were told they wouldn't be let in until a third bottle was ordered. The bottle service isn't worth it and didn't make me feel VIP with dirty glasses. Not to mention people were sitting at our reserved tables when we arrived and the employees acted as if they were scared to ask them to move so we did it ourselves.  2.) The food sucks and the things they offer that are ok to eat are never in stock. By the time you get your food its cold. I've been to plenty of bars in chicago that have great food I don't know what swagger's excuse is. Oh and they always run out of cups which makes the wait for another drink take longer. 3.) The waitresses suck. You can hear them complain about what people they don't want to serve because they use your appearance to judge whether or not you will tip well or not. They don't check on you and you have to look for them. My waitress knew the birthday boy but that didn't make her give any better service.NEVER EVER EVER EVER APPLY FOR A JOB AT THIS PLACE!!!Every fucking two weeks I get to hear employees of this place say oh i wonder if I'm going to get paid on time. Most recently there was no paycheck on payday. The manager sucks and tells the employees he knows nothing about it and doesn't care. Meanwhile no one contacts the employees to say hey I'm sorry your check is late and will be here on this day at this time. Oh and they're so broke they finally give up checks on a Saturday night when banks are closed and won't be open until Monday morning. "cash your check on tuesday" Well its tuesday and the check bounced! But why would an employee expect professionalism from a place like this? I had so much hope for a new bar on the southside, but I hope this place closes down. Clearly someone needs to go learn how to run a business before ruining another potentially god place to go.

1.description: This place definitely has swag!My friend had a birthday celebration here this past Saturday night and we had a good time. The place is really smooth with its look and has different levels/corridors as well as an outside patio area. The door guys were cool and willing to help you if you got lost. The only complaint I have is that they had one person manning the bar which made for long drink waits.Its good that my beloved south side once again has another nice, swanky spot that young professionals can come to and enjoy. My hope is that they do not fall to the same fate as the old Negro League on 43rd by letting the some of the locals run the value of the place down by coming in and fucking up and bringng confrontation. I can definitely see myself doing the damn thang here this summer!

2.description: If I could rate a negative star I would! This business is the epiphany of unprofessionalism. The management is unresponsive, the turnover is overwhelming, and the security is not fitting for this establishment and location.

9.description: I really didn't want to give this place two stars, but they gave me no choice.  I was here in June after traveling to Chicago for business and pleasure.  I have always deemed Chicago as my second favorite city having spent two summers here and also finding my way to the windy city once or twice a year for the last decade.  I have friends that live on the south side so I'm not "new" to the neighborhood. I remember when Blu 47 was at its prime.Well enough preamble. On to Swagger.  Another friend who has been in Chicago on a project this year, a friend who lives in the neighborhood near Swagger and I decided to check it out after attending a Crown Royal event.  My Chicago friend told us that she had been once and that it  seemed to be a nice new venue to add to her local haunts.  Upon going in, we liked the decor.  The set up was cozy and the multiple rooms were cool.  It felt like you were in someone's house.  It wasn't filled with wall to wall people, but with an NBA finals game on there were few seats available.  We finally went into a room that was like a "living room" with chairs and tables and chairs lining the wall.My issues with Swagger primarily had to do with service (or lack of service). The waitress who seemed to be working the entire room by herself also looked like she was younger than Olympic gold medalist Gabby Douglas. I don't know if it was her first service job, if she is family to the owners or what the deal was, but we waited almost 20 minutes before, after calling her attention, we had any opportunity to order anything.  Even then she wanted us to wait.  My one friend just wanted an order of fries.  That order of fries took almost 30 minutes to come out. Meanwhile, as I said, the place wasn't packed.  A woman at a neighboring table advised us to either flag down another waitress to order drinks or go to the bar.  I went to the bar.  There was one bartender working so I had to wait a bit for a drink.  I came back with the drink and my friend still didn't have her fries.  By the time the fries came for my friend...they were somewhat cold and she delivered them without ketchup or a napkin.  She never came to check on us and my friend scavenged her own ketchup from other tables (one bottle was empty).  In the end my friend had to track the server down again as she never brought a bill.  She and another worker looked confused as she told them she wouldn't be paying for cold fries that took 30 minutes to come out, without ketchup or a napkin.Service has to be tops in a new establishment or people won't come back. As nice as this place is from a layout perspective (the patio looked really cool) I can see it being closed or the clientele going downhill quick if the standards and staff promptness/attentiveness don't change.  The only way I'd be pressed to give this place another chance is if my friend who lives in the neighborhood says the service has improved.  Based on her updates from other friends and colleagues it still seems like the establishment has not found its customer service swagger.

10.description: I was there this Saturday for a birthday party and it was very nice. I'm not a big going out drinker type of  person because most places are too small or to rowdy. However this place was none of the above. Very nice place! The name fits the lounge. Lots of flat screen tvs, bout three bars but only two was open and that bartender was very slow, and seemed enexperienced. The bar ran out of liquor but the staff was very nice. If this place wants to be successful they need to invest in training their bartender. Lots of disappointed customers. The lounge was free to get in but I feel they lost a lot of money that night because of the lack of fast/fully stock bar service. Again with all this being said it was overall a very nice sports bar, trendy, romantic type of spot. My Husband and I feel we're going to make this place one of our date nite spots.

13.description: NIIIICCCCCEEEE!!!  That outdoor space is THE BUSINESS!  I will be hanging over at Swagger this summer.  Beautiful inside space as well.  Very surprising for a Southside location.  I didn't have food but the drinks were affordable and pretty potent.  I was pleasantly surprised.  Let's just hope the spot will stay nice and safe....

16.description: My boyfriend and I stopped by Swagger last night after driving past it and seeing its lights on.  Can I say that this place has ALL of the bells and whistles of a top of the line lounge.  I don't even think my description would do the place justice!  But it has a full service kitchen, a bar both upstairs and on the first floor, two outdoor padded seating areas with colorful lighting, an outdoor stage for performances, an outdoor fountain, a TON of flat screen tvs, dining area, a room for jazz performances, a Playstation section, beautifully decorated his and hers restrooms on both floors, lounge rooms on both floors, plenty of security on hand, and a friendly, accomodating wait staff.  We met with Kara and she gaves the complete tour.  I have been screaming about solid businesses and nightlife coming to Bronzeville for a while and Swagger has surely helped to fill the gap.  They are currently open on Thursdays through Sundays and stay open as late as 2AM.  As the word gets out, they plan to add more days to be open during the week.  The menu consists mostly of bar food, and the menu is light, but it's still a great selection and the lounge plans to expand the options as popularity grows.   Oh, and there is also plenty of free parking, so that is always a plus!  OH...what a breath of fresh air for Bronzeville and the south side of Chicago!  Please support this business soon!

6.description: This area is not Bronzeville, not by a long shot. Saying so is like peeing in my lemonade and telling me it's sugar. I. Ain't. Buying. It. Just saying. Other than that its a great place to hang out without leaving the neighborhood and while it seems to attract all sorts of ages, crowds and types, it has built quite a following, and I can't knock them for that. It's sleek decor, with hardwood floors, decent drinks and supported by the community. Combined with the fact that it is in Englewood, and adds to the community, it gets kudos from me.

15.description: Just visited for the first time last night with my hubby to watch the basketball finals.  The decor is beautiful.  It was our lucky day as they were bbq-ing outside so they had some additonal items not on the menu (rib tips = yummy!)  The crowd was nice and the drinks were pretty good.  The price was fair, as I work downtown and have paid more for similar drinks.  The owners did a nice job of putting this place together.  Very non-descript on the outside but Awesome on the inside.  Will definitely tell friends AND come back!  We were actually talking about having an anniversary party here (if we can find out who the correct person to talk to is).  VERY NICE!!!

0.description: Went there for the first time a month ago. Great spot!! Loved it!! I live in the area and see it's happening every Friday and Saturday night.The only compliment I have is about the food. They were out of half of the items on the menu (we where there on a Sunday). My friend said her food was good though. Like Andre W said, hopefully it doesn't have the same fate as the Negro League Cafe.

5.description: This place has only been open for 7 weeks and I need to revisit this review in a few months to see how things progress.  That being said it is quite impressive.  The downstairs consists of a bar with 6 flat screen tv's and a kitchen that puts out decent bar food.  The drinks were around $8 and the only drink I had was the SOS martini which is similar to a lemon drop but was good.  Friends had beer but the selection was limited.  The decor is very sleek....brick walls, hardwood floors.  To the south of the bar is a dining room with a raised dance floor and a DJ booth from which some rocking music was blasting.  What makes this place spectacular is the outdoor patio with several seating areas, a fountain, a fire pit and another enclosed seating area with a fireplace.  Cozy, intimate, romantic and well laid out it would be dynamite for a private event.  There is a room called the "Red Room" with about 4-5 tv's all with PlayStations which leads one to believe the intended demographic is 25-35 and that would be smart, although a lot of my friends were there and having a ball.There is another bar upstairs, equally as slick and elegant that was reserved for a private part.  State of the art sound system, contemporary well equipped rest rooms and super clean!  The menu is simple... Chicken fingers, fries, burgers, pasta, etc. and service was pleasant and prompt.  The outdoor patio was not equipped to serve alcohol, I guess that is coming.  Hope it catches on, although parking may become an issue in a residential area.

11.description: swagger is nice however there bartenders are amateurs, i stopped by here a few times in the summer but never went in, there was always something not quite right going on. I was here for a birthday party. they had two bars but the less crowded one didn't have all the liquor to make a long island, you must do better swagger. The place was pretty, the dj was wack and when they started talkn about if you were born in the 90's make some noise I knew that it was time for me to go. I will try it again maybe on the weekend, hopefully the crowd is different and the out door space looks really nice, the private room where the party was also had a nice feel.

8.description: Had the chance to go to swagger this weekend (Saturday, early evening), and it was really nice. very nicely decorated with good lighting (I'm big on lighting...hate places that are too dark). I love the fact that there's an upbeat restaurant/lounge on the south side. when I went, it was pretty empty, so I'm hoping they're able to get their marketing up and the community supports it. I don't drink alcohol, but alcohol didnt seem to be the overwhelming focus here. There was a bar, along with lots of tables for the restaurant area, plenty of flat screens with espn, an upstairs area with more booths/seating and an area for special events.They mentioned that they've completely changed staff/management in the past 3 weeks, so can't speak to how it was before. But yesterday, everyone I encountered was nice and friendly. Food was good ( wings, mozzarella sticks, fries) but basic sports bar menu. They also mentioned that they'll be adding a full menu soon, so I'll look forward to seeing what else they have to offer.The doorman also gave us a rundown on their specials..but I've forgotten most of them. only remember Monday Night Football with $.25 wings. So if folks are looking for a place in on the south side to catch the game or catch up with friends, seems like a good spot to do so. I'll definitely continue to patronize.4 stars for now - only been once and it was a good experience.

4.description: this place... *sigh*it definitely has potential. after first reading other reviews, I expected something a little different than what I experienced.first, there's 3 bars, great, but only 1 bartender at each. super slow service.I only wanted a white wine, my only option was chardonnay and it was AWFUL!they offered those small bottles that come in a 4 pack, and the bartender had the nerve to just give me the bottle...with a straw. No.I stood there before giving him my money until he completed the service; getting a cup (they don't have wine glasses), and pouring the wine into it. the people... *deep sigh*I don't want to go into detail - but I will say, I saw shoeless biddies with white socks on the dance floor. this is not the crowd I was expecting.on a good note, the food (typical bar food) was good. but then to negate that note, the service, again, was horrible. the girl who took my order didn't actually give me the food (even though I was sitting directly in front of the kitchen). I walked up to the counter and grabbed it myself, I was ready to go. just the wings and fries, very flavorful and yummy. food was hot and ready to devour. I won't be back to this place after 11, I'll try visiting around 8-9 to observe the atmosphere then.

14.description: This place could have swagg if they step up their service game.  I love the tone of the place, the concept is on point but the "hired help" is missing the bulls eye.  The service was slow from the bar to the food and the staff don't seem vested.  But I would give this place another chance cause I was impressed with the place , they had parking and the fact that the owners went out on a limb with this place and it can work if they get the service in order.  E for effort!

7.description: This place is so awesome!  I would have never thought to find it on 51st and Prairie.  The outdoor patio areas, yes plural...areaS..lol, are amazing!  They really transformed that corner into an oasis that makes you feel like you're not even in Bronzeville.  The south side needed a place like this.  I went lastnight (Friday Night) and it was a very 30-40 year old progressive crowd, business professionals dressed nicely.  No baggie jean-gym-shoe-looks.  They actually turned some men away that were in gym shoes.  There is so many rooms/areas indoor and outdoors that although it doesn't look large from the outside, it is quite the space!  I would recommend adding another few bars if they can.  By it being licensed as a restaurant, they are not allowed a bar outside, vip areas, or bottle service the traditional bar/club way, but Im sure they will find some ways around the bottle service..although I didn't really see anyone with bottle service.  Twista even showed up with a few people, and I'm not even sure if he had bottle service. If you are looking for a nice but dope spot to have a party or a "dinner party"  (its a restaurant) this place is surely worth checking out, although I didnt try the food, but will probably go again tonite, and definitely try the food then.  I hope in the months to come, its just as nice.  The people were really chill and mingly, not too much dancing, more mingling, and drinking than anything.  But there are certainly enough places for one to dance, no one seemed to want to, and they are not allowed to play music outside, but you can surely hear it coming from the inside.  There was at least 3 fire places/pits on the property, multiple Miami style circular seating areas etc, even a water feature.  There's also televisions in the bathrooms!  I cant even think of everything, but I will say, I am considering having my husbands annual all white party here for his birthday.  They also have security for the parking lot! Best of all NO COVER charge, and FREE parking! Check this place out!
